Job Description:
We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our Team as we continue to blaze the trail in the exciting future of eCommerce. ONYX is among the fastest growing tech companies in New Jersey, focused on creating custom infrastructure and unique user experience for niche marketplaces.

As a Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in process improvement & project management. You will support the process excellence team for project deliverable's, assist in reporting efforts & partner with the business to identify and own process improvement efforts. Successful performance in the role is measured by the quality, impact, and delivery speed of this work.

What you will be doing -
Analyze complex data, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to support operations that will result in year over year revenue and conversion rate growth
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.
Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
Performing requirements analysis.
Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.
Allocating resources and maintaining cost efficiency.
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Performing user acceptance testing.
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.
Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and the various business units.
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.
What we are looking for
Bachelors Degree in Business
Strong analytical skills
Strong experience with Office 365 - Specifically Power Automate & Microsoft Teams
Excellent project management and organizational skills
Strong sense of individual accountability and follow-through
Extremely organized with strong time-management skills
Why ONYX?

Our culture is fast paced and ambitious- we like to move ten times as fast others believe to be possible. Our team is talented, passionate, and driven with outstanding skillsets. We work within a collaborative, casual, modern environment with awesome perks!

Diversity and Inclusion:

Our people are our greatest asset. We are committed to an inclusive environment that attracts, engages and retains the best possible talent. Our diversity of experiences, backgrounds, locations, viewpoints and ideas is what makes us a great place to work!

Overview


Everyone wants to work with people they respect. Even better if you can work with a company you respect. We have both at The David J. Joseph Company, and a 135+ year track record on operating an ethical business with a positive work culture. It may sound cliché, but it’s true. We’re a big, global company that still feels small.

Working at the David J. Joseph Company is unique. We offer employment in diverse settings such as traditional corporate headquarters, dynamic sales locations, and scrap recycling facilities. This workplace diversity gives our employees the variety they crave and the exposure to a global business. A career at The David J. Joseph Company is ideal for self-starters seeking to make an impact on our company and their careers.

The David J. Joseph Company (DJJ), founded in 1885, is a world leader in scrap metal recycling & trading. With over 80+ locations, the Joseph Company is headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio and is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Nucor Corporation (NUE) a Fortune 200 Company.

Responsibilities
Performs solution design, development, testing, debugging and maintenance for one or more of the following enterprise data team areas of responsibility:
Enterprise data modeling
ETL systems
BI semantic layers
Dashboards and reports
Ad-hoc data analysis
Participates in requirements gathering, design sessions, fact-finding and prototyping activities to drive business adoption of data products.
Documents detailed solution specifications, data mappings, test cases and maintenance routines.
Works collaboratively with other team members to evolve best practices and team standards for data visualization, data modeling, or data integration.
Develops and maintains knowledge of customer’s business by learning through a mix of project work, partnering with business users, and seeking out learning opportunities.
Participates, along with other team members, in a support rotation, handling system triage and resolving user-facing tickets.
Delivers solutions that are optimized for performance and proactively tunes and refactors existing solutions.
Develops and refines new and existing data products to ensure data quality and single source of truth.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Business-related discipline is preferred. Equivalent combination of experience and education will be considered.
Minimum 2 – 5 years related experience including working knowledge of relational databases, data warehouse environments, and SQL.
Minimum 2 – 5 years related experience with business intelligence, data integration or data analytics tools and languages (for example: MicroStrategy, PowerBI, Tableau, MDX, multidimensional or tabular cubes; ETL development; R, Python).
Preferred experience utilizing source control systems to perform development tasks (git or TFS).
Preferred experience developing cloud-based data solutions (Azure, SnowFlake, RedShift, etc.)
Demonstrates working knowledge, practical skills and the ability to perform work under moderate supervision.
Must be detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple assignments effectively.
Requires effective communication skills to convey status, ideas and concepts in a team environment.
Requires professional demeanor with a high degree of flexibility, responsiveness and self-direction.
Benefits


We offer a competitive compensation and benefit package including paid training, bonus program, medical, dental, vision, life and disability coverage, vacation, paid holidays, a 401(k) plan with match, tuition reimbursement and other great benefits.

Rewards

JOB SUMMARY

Responsible for providing analysis and execution oversight of the performance of the Contact Center for the Payments business segment. Key leader and influencer that will be primarily accountable for defining key initiatives as product owner, overseeing performance and forecasting, and managing impacts to the segment. This role acts as a high level orchestrator and author of inter-related projects combined with business as usual impacts to ensure the segment is performing superbly. This role is accountable for measuring impact of changes, quickly identifying issues, gaps, or risks, and proposing solutions and reporting on progress. This leader needs to be a strong, independent influencer and motivator that is able to partner across the organization and Enterprise.

KEY DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES

Performance Analysis: Serves as primary analyst on Contact Center performance in the Payments segment, actively monitoring, forecasting and recommending immediate action if performance is out of bounds. Responsible for defining processes, data, and success criteria to actively keep operational performance in line with daily goals. Quickly identify issues, root cause and identify and communicate recommendations to drive resolution. Measures impact and business value of initiatives. 40%
Leadership: Provides leadership, guidance and execution oversight for the ChecksCX transition and other payments initiatives ensuring they complete on time and budget, and meet measurable business goals. Identify, document and manage initiatives partnering with Contact Center and Enterprise teams. Provide thought leadership and insight on the health of the initiatives. Interpret, evaluate and interrelate data to recommend options to meet requirements and business goals. 25%
Subject Matter Expertise: Serves as recognized thought leader in the organization with the ability to leverage or define oversight methodologies but also demonstrate flexibility in approach. Work daily with stakeholders to elicit and document requirements, epics, story maps, features and detailed user stories for initiatives. Product oversight for systems which affect segment performance. 25%
Communication: Provides formal and informal performance and oversight updates and guidance to Contact Center Executives, Chief Operating Officer and functional areas. Partner with Contact Center and Enterprise team to align with pilots, business or technology changes; define measurement plan; analyze results and report out on changes. Work with functional areas to define and track dependencies for initiatives. Actively monitors customer and client reports post implementation in order to provide feedback to the contact centers leadership on process and company change initiatives. 10%

EDUCATION

Bachelor's Degree (Required)

EXPERIENCE

3-5 years relevant work experience with minimum of 2-3 years of business analysis and performance management experience required.
Product ownership experience highly desired.
Experience with Continuous Improvement, Kaizen LEAN, Process Management or Six Sigma required.
Contact Center or Channel Performance Management desired.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES

A proven ability to learn new products, develop functional knowledge, and apply new skills in a high paced environment.
Ownership mindset with the ability to influence teams to accomplish goals.
Excellent collaboration, organizational, time management, presentation and writing skills; ability to delivery clear, direct and effective communication (written and oral) for public consumption.
Demonstrated skill running effective meetings and getting buy-in and participation from all levels.
Ability to effectively and efficiently manage multiple projects.
Seeks feedback and continually evaluates processes and procedures to foster culture of continuous improvement.

COMMUNICATION AND CONTACTS
This individual has contact with Harland Clarke employees at various levels of the organization.

DECISION MAKING
Makes decisions regarding product initiatives regarding schedule and cost performance, issue impact, problem resolutions, prioritization and action. Performs product performance analysis and determines performance recommendations.

Job Description:
Overview:
Do you enjoy working with other people and finding solutions when everyone else only sees problems?
Are you compelled to initiate action and remain proactive in getting things done?
Do you take pride in the work you accomplish?
Does success motivate you to want to do more and be better?
Can you handle multiple projects at the same time and smile?

If you can answer yes to these questions Idaho Central Credit Union is ready for you to join our team!

As a Business Analyst, your primary function is to analyze and manage our organization's projects, procedures and design solutions to help the organization operate more efficiently and effectively. You will identify new opportunities and processes to meet Credit Union growth and strategic goals.

Responsibilities:
Work directly with business lines throughout the organization to assist in determining business requirements, make recommendations for appropriate solutions and develop new process to achieve improved efficiency. This may require use of alternative data collection methods, data organization, data analysis, custom reporting, cost analysis and advanced spreadsheet design.
System configuration and maintenance activities of multiple systems.
Coordinate and collaborate with Credit Union team members and 3rd party vendors to implement solutions to satisfy business needs while maintaining a vision (road map) for future needs.
Prepare business case proposals and develop thorough project plans including project scope, schedule, resources, budget and risks.
Partner with business units throughout the organization to understand workflows, processes, data collection, reporting needs and other technical issues associated with application software. Develop and implement process improvement recommendations to satisfy business unit functions and goals.
Mapping and documenting interfaces between systems.
Manage multiple projects concurrently in a fast paced environment.
Ensuring that budgets are adhered to and deadlines are met.
Lead implementation of a new systems including data migration.
Planning and working flexibly to meet deadlines.
Vendor Management
Write technical policies, procedures and documentation for systems/applications/Products implemented including user guides, troubleshooting guides, etc.
Keeping up to date with technical and industry developments.
Other duties and projects as assigned.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Business (or related field) required. 2+ years’ experience in Information Technology, Project Management or Financial Industry related fields required. Strong analytical, organizational, oral, written, communication skills and willingness to work occasionally outside of normal business hours. Ability to prioritize, meets deadlines, and manages changing priorities with limited direction. Ability to maintain the confidentiality of the Credit Union and member records at all times.

High level of professionalism. Make recommendations to meet the goals and objectives of the Credit Union functions, procedures, and policies. Must have strong analytical, problem solving, and root cause analysis skills. Logical, process-oriented thinker with a natural sense of urgency. Good interpersonal and client-handling skills with the ability to manage expectations and explain technical details. Must be willing to comply with the Bank Secrecy Act and USA Patriot Act as implemented by Idaho Central Credit Union.

Perform tasks requiring manual dexterity (processing paperwork, filing, stapling, sorting, collating, typing, etc.) Sit for extended periods of time. Lift 20-40 pounds of office supplies (copy paper, computer paper, mail, etc). Repetitive motion using wrists, hands, and fingers. Reach keyboards. Ability to operate basic office machines (calculator, computer, telephone, copy machine, fax machine, etc).

(Keywords: IT, IS, Information Technology, data, program, computers)

Must be eligible for membership at Idaho Central Credit Union to obtain employment.

Overview:

SCCI is seeking several successful candidates to provide Configuration Management support to a Rapid Acquisition Weapon System Program. Each will be responsible for providing configuration management support across all functional areas based on program requirements. This position will be located in Dahlgren, Va.

Responsibilities include:

Provide support across all five functional areas of configuration management.
Collaborate with project teams to ensure rigorous tracking of hardware and software versioning.
Actively work with personnel across the organization to foster collaboration, maintain data integrity, and assist to define necessary solution improvements if needed.
Provide board support across multiple diverse configuration control boards.
Rapidly build a solid foundation of technical knowledge.
Develop and maintain configuration baselines as assigned.
Compile software builds.
Create Version Description Documents (VDD).
Develop and revise process documents in support of configuration process management.
Maintain effective customer relationships.

Required Skills and Experience:

Must be a U.S. Citizen and be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Security Clearance.
A Bachelor of Science (BS) degree from an accredited college or university in an engineering, scientific, or technical discipline or five (5) years of direct hands-on configuration management experience with a major weapon system application
Five (5) years of full-time professional experience working in Configuration Management (CM) including two years of full-time experience in Configuration Management of modern (within the last 10 years), large-scale computer systems.
Demonstrated comprehensive knowledge of principles, methods, and techniques used in configuration management support.
One (1) year of which must demonstrate proficiency in the utilization of the Microsoft Office suite
Demonstrated familiarity with the C/C++ Software Language, Linux Software
Demonstrated knowledge of the formal change control processes including Class I changes, Class II changes and Change Control Board (CCB).

Mavis Discount Tire – Financial Analyst*
Put your career into high gear with Mavis Discount Tire! We're looking for a full-time Financial Analyst to join Team Mavis at our Operations Support Center in Millwood, New York. About the Position of Financial Analyst*
As a member of the Analytics Department, the Financial Analyst will support the VP of Planning & Analysis develop and present actionable insights through the rigorous analysis of varied data sources
Requirements & Qualifications*
• 2-3 years of experience in data analytics

• Highly advanced Excel skills required

• Advanced financial modeling and forecasting experience

• Experience with processing and communicating data & business insights

• Familiarity with data visualization platforms such as Tableau a plus

• Experience with SQL databases a plus

• Excellent written presentation skills

• Strong ownership and demonstrated project management skills

• Strong verbal and written skills
Duties & Responsibilities*
The analyst will assist the VP of Planning & Analysis in developing and presenting actionable insights to various audiences within the organization. Audiences may include Executive team, Inventory, Operations and Human Resources. The Analyst will be responsible for compiling data from disparate data repositories, and then organizing, evaluating and using data visualization tools to present the data for the purpose of providing actionable insights with a quantifiable impact on profitability. The Financial Analyst will also be instrumental in the preparation of financial models for annual budgets, tracking the business performance relative to model assumptions, and determining the source of variances.

We provide our team members with competitive weekly pay, a good working environment and an excellent combination of additional benefits like health and dental insurance, a 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match, paid vacations, paid personal and sick time, paid holidays, on-the-job training, and opportunities for career growth and advancement.

About Guaranteed Rate:

Guaranteed Rate is the 5th largest retail mortgage lender in the U.S. By offering industry-leading tools, low-rate mortgages and unparalleled customer service, we’ve become the Home Purchase Experts®. At Guaranteed Rate, we think big—pushing beyond what most people believe is possible. Our goal is to make sure every customer has a great experience. Headquartered in Chicago with 5,000+ employees in 300+ offices across the U.S. and licensed in all 50 states, we’ve helped thousands of homeowners with more than $37 billion in home purchase loans and refinances in just the past year alone.

Responsibilities:

Tableau Developer with an expertise to create visualizations that provide business insights for our global customers.

Expertise in SQL, can independently mine data to translate Business data needs into creative visualizations.

Trusted to work independently with stakeholders at all levels

Excellent communication skills to be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions and to build specification for the data sets that answer those questions.

Company Overview

At Delaware Life Insurance Company, we’re focused on what matters: creating insurance products that perform, delivering a seamless customer experience with honesty and efficiency, and being great to work with every time. Delaware Life is a member of Group One Thousand One (Group1001), an ecosystem of businesses making insurance more useful, intuitive and accessible for everyone. We’ve made it our mission to deliver pure value to our customers.

Job Summary

Business Process Analyst role is responsible for supporting the annuity business line which includes Delaware Life’s legacy block and new product sales. The Business Process Analyst proactively communicates and collaborates with business units across the organization to support their business priorities and deliver efficiencies. This includes a broad scope of responsibilities including working with our Third-Party Administrator (TPA), supporting new product releases, analyzing regulatory changes, suspense reconciliation, procedure review/writing, production support initiatives and implementation of contract and application updates.

As a member of the Operations Team, this role will partner with other Business Process Analyst’s to drive change and improvements. The position will actively interface with business intermediaries to understand and meet their needs.

Main Accountabilities
Provide support to business areas, investigating operational related problems/inquiries, and recommending and implementing solutions.

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst
Department: Information Technology
Reports to: IT Manager

SUMMARY:

The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for eliciting the business requirements of the customer to assist in determining new product offerings, product changes, workflow enhancements, and solutions to business problems. He/she is responsible for requirements development and requirements management in accordance with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) best practices. This individual will act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams, and support teams. The Business Systems Analyst must have the ability to plan, develop, and execute project plans to ensure timely delivery of solutions and must have knowledge and experience in industry best practices.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (includes, but not limited to):
Capture business requirements and provide quality documentation of detailed user requirements for the design and development of software applications.
Convert business requirement to technical requirements and translate them to use cases or user stories.
Ensure requirements are traceable for the testing team and understandable for development teams.
Design wire frames, graphics, and screen mock-ups.
Participate in usability evaluations and understanding of user-centered design.
Work with both the business and the technical sides to ensure the requirements are understood and executable.
Plan, arrange, and control meetings, workshops and relations with user staff during system investigations and throughout subsequent development work.
Perform systems testing and quality assurance activities to ensure that technology solutions deliver quality products.
Develop project plans, and manage and prioritize tasks to keep project on track.
Act as the primary interface to the business and other technical teams. Guide and coach the business stakeholders through the requirements gathering process.
Facilitate workshops required to understand and outcome, detailed requirements, and solution behavior.
Provide clarification and act as a point of reference for business requirement inquiries by solution design and project delivery teams.
Perform other business analysis duties as required.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration or equivalent experience.
• Minimum five (5) years of experience working in a business analysis capacity, preferably in software development.
• Minimum four (4) years of project management experience including development of project plans, and managing deliverables.
• High competency in requirement management methodologies with a strong emphasis on customer service both internal and external.
• Strong understanding of technical and functional requirements practices and solutions.
• Experience and working knowledge of working of Agile, Waterfall, and other software development methodologies.
• Working knowledge of business analysis principles and methodologies.
• Proven ability to work cross-functionally to capture requirements and resolve issues.
• Excellent organizational skills with an ability to work simultaneously on a number of assignments when required.
• Demonstrated ability to work independently and effectively with minimal supervision.
• Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
• Proactive and results-driven orientation.
• High degree of professionalism and strong work ethic.
• Excellent oral and written communications skills; tactful and effective customer communications.
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
Agile development methodology
Scrum master certification
Guidewire InsuranceNow (SurePower)
PMP certification

About the Company: *
Darn Tough Vermont® is an American manufacturer of premium, all weather outdoor and lifestyle socks for every activity and every day – all of which carry the industry’s only unconditional lifetime guarantee. Our product is distinguished from industry competitors by 100 percent USA manufacturing; exceptional comfort, durability and fit; True-Seamless™ technology; and an exclusive blend of either ultra-fine, premium Merino wool or Coolmax®/Thermolite®. Located in the Green Mountains of Vermont, our culture is unique, fun and focused on growth and our brand is passionate, entertaining and engaging.
Overview: *
We’re looking for a Digital Analyst to join the growing eCommerce Team. As a Digital Analyst, you will help the team analyze, track, and optimize performance of DarnTough.com, as well as cross-channel eCommerce marketing campaigns. We’re looking for a highly analytical individual with effective communication skills that is highly capable of sharing findings and recommendations across internal teams to provide the insights and requirements needed to continue to improve our digital experiences.

The Digital Analyst, will provide measurement plans, actionable insights and reports that help drive conversions across the eCommerce channel.
Responsibilities: *
Design, develop, and launch new reports and dashboards for business needs and performance to deliver weekly, monthly, and quarterly for the leadership team.

Organizational Overview

As an Associate with SS&C Health, you will be a part of an organization that promotes better health outcomes for consumers through clinical and technological innovations. We accomplish this by leveraging the robust technology foundation and powerful analytic resources that are the core of SS&C, with industry leading clinical expertise, and strategic pharmacy and healthcare solutions. You will join a team that is redefining the value of pharmacy in healthcare through the integration of advanced analytics, clinical insights, and transformative digital capabilities.

Role Overview

Rebate Administration Analysts carry out and oversee the implementation of new or existing SS&C Health customers on SS&C rebate administration system. They identify and evaluate customers rebate setup and reporting requirements; they recommend, develop, and implement solutions to meet those requirements. Rebate Administration Analysts evaluate and construct alternative solutions for customers whose business requirements create setup challenges within SS&C rebate system. For customers whose prescription claims are processed outside of SS&C, they work closely with the customers technical groups to interpret and translate claim file formats. They continually seek out process improvement opportunities and have full awareness of process controls. They are a resource to customers for complex questions or issues pertaining to SS&C rebate system and tools, rebate calculations and payments, and industry inter-related issues.

Responsibilities

Makes recommendations for system enhancements and changes
Perform functional testing of the system as modifications are made
Identify anomalies in calculated rebate amounts, perform root cause analysis, and correct system setups
Provide training for customers on the rebate administration system, system enhancements, web interfaces, and other systems tools
Train and mentor rebate administration analysts on the rebate administration process and systems
Demonstrate a thorough understanding of SS&C rebate administration system
Be the point of contact for escalation for researching complex system issues and payment discrepancies

Qualifications

Minimal:

Bachelor's degree and 3 years of work related experience, or Master's degree and 1 year of work related experience or 5 years equivalent work related experience
2 years’ experience supporting the software development life cycle and project development methodologies or 2 years applicable industry-related work

Optimal:

Post-secondary education in a business or computer-related field of study
4 years’ experience supporting the software development life cycle and/or industry-related experience
Lean Six Sigma training with process improvement aptitude
Previous experience in customer service preferred
Ability to problem-solve and work independently or in teams
Experience with MS Excel and Access, Project Plans, and MSFT SQL are highly valued

Location:

Kansas City Missouri

JOB TITLE: Applications Analyst
DEPARTMENT: Enterprise Applications
STATUS: Exempt
JOB CODE: 4326


GENERAL DESCRIPTION:

This position is concerned with providing assistance to various business units with the design, development and implementation of various system projects of a highly complex nature. Works closely with credit union personnel and business partners to identify and maximize opportunities to use technology to improve products, services and/or business processes. Primarily, a solid experience with the credit union’s enterprise applications, such as Account Processing and Loan Origination Systems and working knowledge of the credit union’s products and services are required.


TASKS, DUTIES, FUNCTIONS:
Monitor environment to ensure effective performance.
Proactively identify, research and troubleshoot member related and or system integrity issues.
Open cases with vendors to clearly and completely document issues, consistently follow-up with vendor until the issue is resolved.
Manage the precise and timely communication of these issues and their resolution across the organization.
Create and update Tickets, maintaining excellent notes and status information to demonstrate issues are being worked.
Manage and participate in the testing of fixes in various environments prior to production deployment.
Participate in on-call support rotation.
Act as Tier 3 support for enterprise wide system related issues, serving as the liaison between vendor business partners and the IT Help Desk to provide resolution to complex or significant system matters.
Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with other departments and third-party service providers needed to manage and improve enterprise applications channels.
Review, analyze, and create detailed documentation of business unit needs, including workflow, technical program functions, and steps required to implement business processes of a highly technical nature.
Consults with credit union personnel to determine business, functional and detailed technical requirements for specified applications. Coordinate the development of all approved business and functional specifications.
Maintain a thorough understanding of state and federal laws and regulations related to credit union compliance including bank secrecy and anti-money laundering laws appropriate to the position.
Review use cases and other highly technical documents to ensure business requirements are adequately reflected in technical planning documents. Work directly with appropriate credit union personnel to understand project concept, objectives, approaches and technical specifications.
Define, develop and implement quality assurance practices and procedures, end user test plans and other technical QA assessments.
Manage small scale projects related to those systems within the scope of this role’s responsibilities. Create project plans and coordinate tasks and deliverables from business areas and vendors.
Work with business units to conduct system application testing to meet project timelines as well as ensure that all tests are conducted and documented according the standards agreed upon by the business unit.
Coordinate implementation of software installs and updates for those systems within the scope of this role’s responsibilities.
Ensure final signoff to release system application into production has been completed.
Provide post-implementation support for new initiatives, upgrades and projects.
Ensure continuing operational quality by documenting technical bug fixes and enhancements, assigning tasks to developers, testing and releasing updates.
Proactively assist with the identification of training and development requirements.
Manage Application Administration for all Enterprise Application software solutions.
Maintain vendor relationships and perform other duties, as assigned.

PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASKS:
Effective oral and written communication skills required to interact with credit union staff and management, and complete technical analysis.
Must possess sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate an on-line computer terminal and other standard office equipment, such as financial calculators, personal computer, facsimile machine and telephone.
Makes sound decisions in the absence of detailed instructions.
Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines; may be required to work extended hours to complete tasks.
Proven ability to develop, document and maintain operational policies and procedures, including the designing and documenting detailed technical process flows, and the development of operational performance and quality metric standards and reports.

ORGANIZATIONAL CONTACTS & RELATIONSHIPS:
INTERNAL: All levels of staff and management.
EXTERNAL: Vendors, suppliers, government agencies, other industry associations and peers at other financial institutions.

QUALIFICATIONS:
EDUCATION: Minimum two-year degree in Information Technology, Project Management or Business Administration required. Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Management or related field preferred. Equivalent work experience may be considered in lieu of a 2 year degree.
EXPERIENCE: Four years or more experience in financial services, including technical business analysis, product development and process improvement experience.
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:
Knowledge of commonly used financial industry concepts, practices and guidelines.
Knowledge of existing credit union products, services and overall operational guidelines, especially as it relates to various delivery channels.
Excellent oral communication, presentation and technical writing skills.
Strong research, technical analysis, planning and organizational skills.
Ability to use logical reasoning when interpreting facts.
Experience with large, medium and small systems, as well as the ability to learn new systems quickly.
Ability to analyze and document complex technical business processes.
Ability to make objective observations, examinations, evaluations and recommendations.
Ability to execute projects and direct team members to implement system upgrades and enhancements.
Strong PC skills.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Prolonged sitting throughout the workday with occasional mobility required.
Corrected vision within the normal range.
Hearing within normal range. A device to enhance hearing will be provided if needed.
Ability to lift 20 lbs. as may be required.
Occasional movements throughout the department daily to interact with staff, accomplish tasks, etc.
Occasional travel may be required locally, statewide, and throughout the United States to attend seminars and vendor group meetings. Overnight travel and evening schedules included.
Occasionally required to change work hours including working on weekends to accomplish tasks.
Occasionally required to work long hours to accomplish tasks.

LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS:

None

LogicSource Overview

LogicSource is an innovative leader in sourcing and procurement services, we help companies increase profits through better buying. LogicSource® is owned and operated by an experienced group of global business veterans who came together under the common goal to radically change the way sourcing and procurement works. We’ve reinvented sourcing and procurement with an execution-based, fully transparent business model that ensures clients don’t spend a dime until they see results.

Our people gain exposure to projects and clients spanning a broad set of categories across multiple industries. Opportunities for getting involved, whether working across functions or learning a new category abound.

Our business model reflects our culture – radically different and rife with opportunity to make a difference. Our professionals enjoy the intellectual stimulation, challenge and satisfaction that only a sophisticated organization, coupled with relevant and meaningful business challenges to solve, can afford.

Position Summary:

We have an immediate opening for a full-time Software Business Analyst in our Norwalk, CT headquarters. You will be a key member of our OneMarket Technology team, reporting to the Chief Technology Officer. This role will be responsible for creating and managing software business and functional requirements for our OneMarket technology products. This is a highly visible client-facing role that requires excellent communication, interpersonal and organization skills.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Conduct requirements-gathering sessions with end users to capture use cases, business process and technology requirements
Document and analyze current processes
Design and document future state processes and resulting software feature/functionality
Create user interface mockups
Maintain documentation repository
Serve as liaison between business, client and technology teams
Maintain granular knowledge of OneMarket technology products, workflows and existing client implementations
The ideal candidate possesses the following qualifications:
4+ years experience as web application software business analyst
Demonstrated ability to create technical and project documentation including functional specifications, use cases, process diagrams
User interface wireframing
Superior organizational skills
Excellent verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Proficient with Office 365, Visio, Lucidchart, Balsamiq, GitHub or equivalent
Experience with Requirements Management software a plus
4 year undergraduate degree
Travel

Minimal Travel up to 25%

Other Duties

This Position Description is not an exhaustive list of the duties and responsibilities, and the employee is expected to perform other duties as necessary and assigned. The duties and responsibilities of this position may be modified at any time to meet changing business needs.

A snapshot of what you would do:

The Business Analyst is responsible for determining information requirements for software development projects. Defines, translates and documents user requirements for development and client implementation projects according to established standards and best practices. The Business Analyst will manage development projects with rapid timelines and evolving requirements. This includes participating in all phases of the application development life cycle with emphasis on project planning, requirements gathering and definition, driving resolution of requirements, design, testing and coordinating tasks involving dependencies on cross-functional teams. The Business Analyst will coordinate activities across business and functional areas and communicate effectively across the organization. The Business Analyst will possess a strong attention to detail, excellent relationship management skills, and the ability to effectively facilitate work sessions with technical architects and business sponsors. The Business Analyst will define project scope, vision; perform requirements analysis and documentation, and assist with project estimation, planning, and resource allocation.

Specific Responsibilities:
Requirements gathering and validation: Ensuring scope of work is clearly defined and signoff is done by key stakeholders
Systems Development: Translate business requirements documents into functional/technical specifications; conduct gap analysis and estimate resources required to execute system configurations for clients
Apply effective communication and collaboration skills within Project team to perform qualitative/quantitative risk analysis and identify critical success factors and contingency steps to mitigate risks associated with client projects
Task management: Identify and manage critical path activities. Coordinate with resources and leverage work through other analysts to provide technical response to client change orders or production defects
Develop and review test plans for QA analysts through all testing phases - ensuring client use cases and impact areas are represented in the scope and strategy for testing
Execute test plans when required to meet project timelines
Primary point of contact for support of internal FirstStrike Commercial application.
Coordinates user review and approval at all stages of system development and delivery.
Manage system implementation, tracking the timing of deliverables, and developing conversion and migration plans for moving from existing systems to enhance or more effective new systems.
Identifies opportunities to utilize existing, enhanced or new technologies or business methods to streamline work processes and improve business margins within individual business units.
Maintains awareness of systems, products and expertise available both within APEX and elsewhere to use in addressing business unit needs.
Develops and maintains a functional expertise in the various APEX businesses and anticipates business and system needs based upon changing industry conditions.
Coordinate implementation projects through their complete lifecycle including publishing complete timelines, managing dependencies, and tracking milestones. Provide weekly/daily status on issues, milestones, and timelines.
Understand the impact of scope changes and adjust project plans and communication accordingly. Report issues and risks with recommended mitigating actions.
Manage shifting timelines and priorities while maintaining project scope.
Work closely with developers, managers, and executives to ensure the release of high quality products.
Work with users and information system development staff to determine data storage and access requirements.
Responsible for the overall security of systems they will be administering including protecting client data and reporting situations which may provide unintentional elevated access. The employee will regularly review corporate policies and will enforce the policies documented in the Apex Corporate Security Standards.
Required Experience:
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Technical Communication, Business or equivalent preferred.
4+ yrs. Experience as a Business Analyst applying the tools and techniques of business analysis and project management to balance competing project objectives and produce quality deliverables with minimum rework.
About Us:

APEX Analytix is the leading provider of trusted supplier data; supplier portal software; controls, audit and analytics software; and AP recovery audit services. We protect over $5 trillion in spend and prevent or recover over $3 billion in overpayments annually, and our client portals actively support over 3 million suppliers. Our software and audit services are built on our SmartVM® database of over 20 million supplier records with contacts, scored for accuracy and age, based on integration with over 650 external data sources and over 10 million communications with suppliers each year. APEX Archimedes™, an advanced cognitive technology and innovation system, supported by IBM Watson®, is integrated into APEX Analytix software and services to harness the power of the future through smarter recoveries, controls, analytics, working capital and supplier data. We serve over 250 Fortune 500/Forbes Global 2000 clients around the world and are fluent in languages covering 98 percent of global trade.

Our Culture:

At APEX Analytix, our culture drives everything! We live our culture of performance, respect, candor and fun—in that order. Performance is measured by delivering value to our clients, generating goodwill, trust and partnership. Sincere respect for each other, our diverse backgrounds and our well-being are our cornerstones. We value open and honest relationships with each other, our clients and our communities. And, life is too short to not have fun! We look for team players who possess the qualities of being humble, hungry and smart. We recruit candidates who will strive for accountability in performance and career growth, serving our clients in long-term respectful relationships, and working in a diverse and caring environment.

The Perks:

We owe our growing success to our team of bright, passionate, and innovative individuals. We truly value our associates and strive to provide the highest quality benefits program, offering competitive compensation packages with tailored bonus plans and generous benefits. Our benefits include health and insurance plans (medical, dental, optical, life insurance, disability insurance, FSA, HSA employee assistance program, supplemental insurance options and pre-paid legal), a generous paid time off plan, 401k plan, flexible work schedules, wellness programs (company fitness and weight loss challenges, financial wellness software tool, and gym membership stipend), associate and customer referral bonus programs, and paid community hours. And here at APEX Analytix, you won’t get lost in the shuffle. Our focus on internal training, growth and development results in annually filling over a quarter of our open positions with internal promotions! With resources such as a strong Mentor Program, Internal Training Portal, plus Education, Tuition, and Certification Assistance, we provide tools for our associates to grow and develop. If you are looking for a place to shine, come join the team!

Ambry Genetics Corporation is a CAP-accredited and CLIA-licensed molecular genetics laboratory based in Aliso Viejo, California. We are a genetics-based healthcare company that is dedicated to open scientific exchange so we can work together to understand and treat all human disease faster.

General Summary: *

Works with management to understand and solve various business process needs in order to meet department goals and for planning and analysis of projects.

Acts as a project manager for assigned projects. Works with team to develop and present the business case, obtains project approval and regularly provides project tracking/reporting to the business owners. Maintains team focus on project or process developments, ensuring successful execution and resolution on assigned deliverables. Manages timelines in accordance with the project or process schedules.

Knowledge at a level normally acquired through the completion of a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, Process Management or related field of study. Additional focus in Accounting or Finance is preferred.
Four years in an increasing contributory role in business process analysis or project management within an accounting department or financial function.
Experience with working in an Agile project structure and Scrum framework is highly desired, as well as experience working with internal stakeholders and project execution (ability to analyze /evaluate/teach and mentor).
Thorough understanding of the IT environment. Understanding of the operating area's business and how IT contributes to the delivery of those products and services.
Excellent analytical skills to assess business process and determine appropriate solutions. Knowledge of SDLC and Six Sigma or TQM is desirable. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus but not required.
Advanced knowledge of Excel, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), and SharePoint are highly preferred. Experience with systems implementation functional specification writing, and technical aspects of customized development strongly preferred.

Job Title: Experienced Tax CPA and Business Consultant
Job Description:
Experienced Tax CPA and Business Consultant

Position type: FT with remote from home flexibility
Salary: DOE
Sector: Public Accounting
Location: Auburn, WA

Are you passionate about helping business owners and individuals reach their goals? Are you interested in mentoring others and helping people become more successful? Do you enjoy community support and involvement? Are you looking for a long-term opportunity to help shape the future of an established local accounting Firm? If so, then read on…..
Description *
This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced tax professional with a growth mindset who wants to make a positive impact with Firm clients and collaborate with team members. We are a full-service

Auburn CPA firm seeking an energetic and seasoned tax professional with a leadership presence to manage client tax and consulting projects as well as review and strategize challenging tax returns and issues. We have approximately 14 professionals who serve a diverse group of clients in South King County,

Washington, Alaska, and many other states. We care about our employees and the community in which we are a part of and strive to create an environment where team members feel rewarded and proud. Our clients appreciate our service and look to us for value-added services, especially during these turbulent times.

This position is ideal for someone who is interested in client contact and project management. It involves complex tax matters, including multi-state tax analysis, entity structuring and a modest amount of foreign tax research. This position also includes mentoring, being a resource to others and assisting staff in professional development. In addition to managing client services, this position offers leadership opportunities, practice development aspects and will serve as the primary engagement manager with budgetary responsibilities for billing, realization, and collections. We have a concentration in the construction/real estate industry as well as several clients in the professional service sectors.
Position Qualifications *
Licensed CPA with 7 or more years’ experience in public accounting looking for a new opportunity.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are necessary, in addition to strong analytical and organizational skills. Prior experience is required in reviewing business and individual income tax returns as well as consulting with clients directly. We are looking for a professional experienced with individual, pass-through, corporate and estate taxation; as well as experience in (or the willingness to learn and take on) multi-state operations, state and local tax, and international tax matters. The ability to analyze transactions and develop tax structure and planning suggestions is key to this position, along with the ability to research and document tax positions and represent the clients before the IRS and DOR. Being proficient with tax research and projection software is helpful for this position. Experience with paperless technology is essential.

For more information please visit our website at www.fb-cpa.com. Please send resumes to lisa@fb- cpa.com. We are excited to see what you have to offer!

Job Title: General Construction Business Manager (5 years experience required)
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY*
We are looking for a results-driven, and detail-oriented Construction Industry Experienced General Management Professional with full understanding of Financials and financial forecasting. The right candidate will have an instinctive ability to recognize, retain, and respect the talent within the organization, and help guide employees to reach their full potential through support and mentorship.

This dedicated leader will develop and maintain control of all business operations and will be an experienced and efficient leader with excellent people skills, business acumen, and an exemplary work ethic.

The ideal individual will also be a strategic planner with the essential ability to specify, strategize, and define opportunities.
ABOUT US*
OLO Builders is a premiere new home construction company that currently has 3 locations in northern Utah. We have highly qualified and experienced teams who construct semi production new homes.

Our construction business is growing! Our crews provide exceptional work for our customers, and our growth is now at a point at which we feel further leadership is a necessity. We are looking for a seasoned and motivated general corporate construction manager who has the drive and vision to lead this segment of our company forward and continue to drive scalable growth.

This position will be responsible for all planning, profitability, people management, process improvements, customer relations, and safety considerations for the total construction team. We are seeking a person with the ability to develop and implement processes and procedures that will fuel continued growth within our current construction niche as well as having the ability to visualize additional areas of growth.

This is a senior position within the company, and the qualified person will have a seat at the executive team table. As such, this position is designed to report directly to the CEO of the company.
\*\*THIS POSITION MANAGES THREE HOMEBUILDING TEAMS: TWO IN LOGAN AND ONE IN NORTH OGDEN*
\*\*No relocation assistance *
This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: *
Driven – Will strive to exceed goals
Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous
People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects
Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture
High stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environment
MINIMUM JOB QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS*
Requirements*
Must have recent experience working for a General Contractor in the last 5 years
Proven results as an Integrator, Operations/Business Leadership Management or similar role
Experience building high performing teams, including the ability to recognize and cultivate rising talent required
Experience managing multiple teams and locations
Adept at transitioning seamlessly from a strategic level vision to day-to-day tactical operations required
Working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics required
A demonstrated execution mindset and a record of success holding people accountable required
Understanding of and ability to create healthy organizational culture required
Excellent interpersonal communication skills required
The candidate should have a bachelor’s degree in accounting or business administration, or equivalent business experience and 10+ years of progressively responsible experience for a large‐scale commercial builder and/or developer.
Varied experiences and responsibilities in Operations, Finance, and Human Resources
Education/Experience Required: *
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience required.
Proven experience in construction management, managing multiple crews across geographies.
New Home Construction experience not required, but strongly preferred.
Able to use basic technology to improve processes (e.g. BuilderTrend, Office, etc.).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Project management experience and skill set required.
Organized, flexible disposition.
Attentive to detail.
Ability to influence change.
Resources strongly preferred*
Advanced degree, MBA or similar, a plus
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*
Oversee daily general business operations and adjusts as necessary, ensuring the organization is consistently “rowing” together in the same direction
With the COO, executes the business plan, achieving or exceeding established P&L objectives
Collaborates with and stays on the same page with the Visionary, at all times.
Filters and translates the Visionary’s ideas into functional plans for the company
Develops comprehensive goals for performance and growth strategies
Effectively resolve issues - must be comfortable with conflict, addressing issues, and solving problems in a practical and healthy manner
Assists with identifying areas of opportunities for capital improvements across the organization, including opportunities to improve revenue, increase margin, reduce cost, and increase profitability throughout the organization all while improving efficiency
Attract, retain, and develop a high-performing team
Lead, manage and hold direct reports accountable for achieving agreed-upon commitments
Cultivate and manage healthy relationships with strategic partners and vendors
Consistently demonstrates a passion for values alignment, focus, simplicity, and clarity across the organization
REQUIRED SKILLS*
· *Analytical Skills: *Must be good at planning for large-scale, multi-step projects.

· *Decision Making*: Must be comfortable managing many decisions, such as picking long term subcontractors, vendors, parts, tools, and more.

· *Management Skills*: Must lead the construction teams and keep them motivated and focused on the job. Must hold teams accountable for their work performance. Must have experience managing multiple teams.

· *Communication: *Good writing and speaking skills are needed for communicating with employees, high level clients and subcontractors, and must be in control of material procurement, inventory and construction client satisfaction.

· *Technical Skills: *Must be an expert in construction methodologies, read blueprints and understand other technical aspects of construction. Petroleum construction site and/or management experience is a definite plus, but consideration will be given to all applicants.

· *Time-Management: *Deadlines are crucial. Making sure that everything is on time and moving smoothly is a critical part of the job.

· *Business Acumen: *Must understand business operational practices, P&L, margins, and job costing to insure budget adherence.

· *Goal Oriented: *Plan for and implement group goals to successfully achieve department targets.

Job Type: Full-time

Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or other industry-related field required; MBA preferred.
At least 9 years of industry-related experience including 7 years in upper management required.
Planning, Product Development, Supply Chain & Manufacturing: 10 years (Preferred)

Senior Operations Analyst
Corporate Headquarters
12575 Uline Drive, Pleasant Prairie, WI 53158

As an essential business, we supply companies and organizations with the products they need to serve customers and keep operations running. The health and safety of Uline employees continue to be our top priority, and we have implemented numerous changes to our normal operating policies in response to COVID-19.

With Uline’s continued growth, we need a team that ensures we stay true to our company motto of Speed, Passion and Operational Excellence. Our Executive Operations team keeps us on track by conducting internal operational audits, analyzing company performance and reporting findings and recommendations to Uline’s President.

Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace. All new hires must complete a pre-employment drug screening.

Position Responsibilities
Act as an internal consultant on the executive operations team that regularly interacts with and advises the C-Suite, including the company president.
Analyze company-wide operations, including performance and productivity data, error rates and their root causes.
Interpret results autonomously using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining.
Strategically analyze reports across all departments to identify gaps or opportunities that drive business improvement.
Conduct current state analysis and get to root problems across various departments and Uline locations.
Design, develop, implement and maintain business solutions and recommendations to improve performance.
Execute process improvement projects that promote improved operating models and lead others to adopt changes.
Maintain and publish standard reports for executive operations.
Provide leadership to junior analysts.

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree.
5+ years of strategy, analysis and / or consulting experience.
Experience in data mining and analysis a must.
Experience in a distribution, supply chain or warehouse environment a strong plus.
Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and Access.

Benefits
Complete insurance coverage that includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts and wellness programs.
401(k) with 5% employer match.
Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Scholarship program for children of employees.

Employee Perks
On-site café with executive chefs and seasonal dinner-to-go options.
First-class fitness center with complimentary personal trainers.
Over four miles of beautifully maintained walking trails.
Numerous employee appreciation events throughout the year.
Professional development classes and monthly in-house speakers.

About Uline

Uline is the leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials to businesses throughout North America. We're a family-owned company whose incredible service, huge inventory and quality products fuel our ongoing expansion and growth. We offer same-day shipping on over 37,500 products in our 812-page catalog and on our state-of-the-art e-commerce website.

Each resume submitted gets individually reviewed by our team and retained for 24 months in case a great opportunity opens for you to join our Uline family.

Job Title: IT Business Systems Analyst; SO's, Inventory, & Distribution Management
Job Description:
IT Business Systems Analyst for Sales Orders, Inventory, and Distribution Management *
1st Shift: 7am- 5pm*
Location: Spring Grove, IL*
Company History: *
Scot Forge is a 127 year-old, 100% employee-owned company that manufactures custom open die and rolled ring forgings.* At Scot Forge, we help our customers succeed in their most critical initiatives with forged solutions for everything from the world's physical infrastructure, energy and transportation to manufacturing, mining, and our national defense. From the wheels of NASA's Curiosity Mars Rover, to mission critical components for nuclear submarines, to large hydraulic cylinders for the largest mining trucks on the planet, Scot Forge creates the precision forged metal parts used in demanding applications all over the world.
Benefits of Employee Owners: *
We have grown to become a leader in the open-die forging industry by rewarding our most valuable resource... the employee-owners. Below includes a sample of our benefits:
Employee Stock Ownership Plan
Incentive bonus
Medical/ Vision/ Dental
Prescription Drug Plan & FSA
401K
Paid vacation and holidays
Short and Long Term Disability
Tuition Reimbursement
Company sponsored life insurance & events
Investment in personal career development and learning
Position Summary: *
The IT Business Systems Analyst for Sales Orders, Inventory, and Distribution Management will be primarily responsible for system selections, implementations, and change management of ever increasingly dependent systems. The dedicated IT BSA will be responsible for the functional workflows of:
*Sales orders *
*Credit *
*Inventory control *
*Item master design and management *
*Warehousing*
*Outside purchasing *
*Manufacture cost accounting *
*Billing *
Essential Responsibilities: *
Lead the scooping and design of the movement of multiple inventory systems of record into one inventory system of record
Separating sales orders into products and services, prepayment for sales, long term customer agreements and implementing future requirements for stocking inventory
Creating a transition from a work order-based routing and costing to an item master and standards-based costing approach in order to manage communication to the shop and support compliance needs
Learn and apply deep functional understanding of sales order processes and inventory management
Lead the scoping and design of the movement to an item master-based approach for ordering, planning, and manufacturing
Serve as a trusted business partner to deliver thought leadership concepts and overall designs that eliminate local optimization where possible
Identify and deliver to user requirements while implementing change management to serve those requirements
Provide the business owners the information required for them to make educated decisions regarding system changes in the areas of sales order management, distribution processes and inventory management. This includes defining overall scope, work effort, weighing the risk to change, the time to change, and the benefits gained by the change
Staying on top of technology trends and matching those trends to our customer’s needs
Document the processes with our business owners while learning the sales order, inventory, and manufacturing end of our business
Experience Required: *
*Business, Inventory Management, Distribution, Sales or Manufacturing experience (3-5 years) *
Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work with various types of people in our culture
Strong “customer first” mentality
Keeping an open mind to what our front end system should be in the future
Have a skillset, mindset, toolset approach. Skillset- meaning building technical knowledge and experience to advance us to the future. Mindset- a willingness to engage constructively with our business owners. Toolset- designing and developing strong applications for our business owners.
Display a continuous improvement mindset by always looking for global, broad-based changes rather than focusing on spot solutions
Seek knowledge from trusted business advisors both inside and outside the company to improve personal effectiveness
Leverage intellectual horsepower and creativity to devise innovative solutions
Exhibit internal drive to personally grow into a long-term larger role with management responsibilities
Education and years of experience*
*Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Information Technology, Engineering or Related Field with emphasis in Mathematics, Science or Business *
Strong ERP experience in Sales, Manufacturing, Distribution and/or Financials (5-7 years) (JDE ERP experience preferred)
Working Conditions/Physical Requirements: *
Typical office environment setting
Collaborative fun environment where teammates work together
Additional Requirements: *
Must be authorized to work anywhere in the U.S. without sponsorship.
Must be able to pass a hair sample drug test.
Must be able to work on-site at our facility in Spring Grove, IL on a full-time basis

Ygrene is seeking a Business and Financial Analyst to join our corporate team. This individual will be responsible for improving Ygrenes business and financial intelligence, including pricing, revenue and cost analytics. In addition, this position will support capital markets and securitization data analysis.

Business and Financial Analyst Duties and Responsibilities:

Pricing Grids, Policy and Administration (20%)
Maintain official pricing grids for residential and commercial PACE assets across all jurisdictions.
Document and maintain official pricing policies and procedures
Coordinate with IT team and Ops team to ensure pricing is properly reflected in our pricing engine.
Host and run the bi-weekly pricing meeting. Create standard reports for distribution to the committee prior to the meeting to facilitate a better outcome.
Pricing, Revenue and Cost Analysis (50%)
Create and maintain R-PACE and C-PACE transaction pricing model that demonstrates sensitivity of pricing and cost variables to revenue and profit.
Identify product-level improvements in terms of features, structure and terms that relate to improving the companys revenue and gross profit margins.
Analyze product-level adjustments proposed by the finance, sales, marketing and/or operations team using breakeven, marginal cost analysis and fully burdened cost analysis.
Create and maintain direct, variable and fixed product cost data to support analytical models.
Monitor competitor pricing trends and related information.
Analyze master transaction records (blotter and asset management system) to assess variability and inconsistent data relative to pricing and customer segmentation data.
Reconcile blotter data to official pricing and revenue grid, including rate buy-down numbers.
Capital Markets and Fixed-Income Analytics (20%)
Analyze hedging strategies and recommend/execute hedging approaches. Create and maintain hedge cost analysis.
Oversee cost of capital calculations across all facets of our capitalization, including costs of various warehouse facilities and secondary market costs and profit.
Analyze prepayment rates and delinquencies to provide recommendations to improve profitability.
Maintain U.S. Treasury and Swap interest rate database for reporting and analysis purposes.
Other Analysis & Reporting: 10%
Create management and board reports related to revenue and cost analytics.
Assist with ad hoc monthly analysis and reporting as required.
Business and Financial Analyst Skills and Experience:
This position requires a combination of education and experience equivalent to a Masters degree in finance or related field; and 4 years of experience in financial analysis or related field.
Renewable energy, energy efficiency and/or PACE financing knowledge.
Ability to work independently and problem solve.
Ability to work in a dynamic and rapid growth environment.
Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and across departments to create a results-driven, team-oriented environment.
Strong knowledge of corporate finance, fixed-income finance and all facets of bond analytics.
Strong mathematical skills.
Working knowledge of forecasting and budgeting.
Advanced organizational and analytical skills.

S3, Inc. is a woman owned small business founded in 1991, headquartered in Huntsville, AL, that provides technical, programmatic, and logistics services to US Department of Defense, other US Government Agencies, and Partner Nation militaries, co-located with Government requirements. S3 has a wholly owned subsidiary, KBFS, that provides aviation pilot training, heavy lift, aircraft maintenance, and related aircraft services to Government and commercial requirements IAW multiple FAA certifications.

S3 Inc. is seeking a Stryker Analyst to support our on-going projects at Ft. Benning, GA.

Position Description: The Analyst conducts capabilities assessment to identify gaps and develop integrated Doctrine, Organization, Training, materiel, Leadership and Education, Personnel, Facilities, and Policy (DOTMLPF-P) requirements to resolve or mitigate those gaps. Supports the JCIDS Capability Based Assessment (CBA) by providing the identification of needs combining joint concepts with analysis and is responsible for the management of operational architectures. Also participates in Integrated Capability Development Teams (ICDT) to develop the necessary products associated with the JCIDS analysis and documentation phases and assesses concepts to identify gaps in required capabilities and conducts capability gap assessments for the future force. Coordinates and works closely with the various maneuver TRADOC Capability Managers (TCM), Directorate of Training and Doctrine (DOTD), the branch schools and propensity offices to fully understand capability gaps and DOTMPF-P implications of proposed materiel solutions. Provides the M-CDID increased depth (quantity) and breadth (skills) to allow efficient and effective performance of required tasks and development of written products directed by JCIDS.

Experience/Skills Required: Eight (8) years of experience performing capability development tasks (must have a working knowledge JCIDS and its processes); performing capability gap and DOTMLPF-P analysis; developing writing, assembling, and staffing capability requirements documents, Operational Mode Summary/Mission Profile, and Basis of Issue Guidance. Other required experience includes Capability Based Assessment and Material Solutions Analysis, develop Critical Operational Issues and Criteria (COIC) and Doctrinal and Organizational Plan (D&OP). Should also have practical experience in the operation, employment, or sustainment of Stryker Combat Vehicles operations and employment. Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows and Office tools; minimum of two years' experience in Capability Developments or Defense acquisition

Education Required: Bachelor’s degree; an additional eight years of experience may be substituted for the degree.

Security Clearance Required: A ctive SECRET

Certifications/Licenses: Defense Acquisition University (DAU) Mandatory Certifications.

Other: n/a

Do you have an interest in solving crimes? The BSA Risk Analyst position will assist in all aspects of Sterling National Bank’s BSA/AML Risk Program, specifically as it relates to the Bank’s Risk, Compliance, Operations, and Specialty Lines of Business within the BSA Risk Group. The BSA Risk Group is part of the Security BSA Department and is responsible for reviewing and assessing the regulatory, financial, reputational and security risks to the Bank.

The Risk Analyst provides day-to-day support and assistance relative to BSA/AML and Sanctions (including OFAC) responsibilities to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and helping to mitigate risk as necessary. These responsibilities include reviewing escalations of high-risk clients; conducting periodic/EDD reviews; and reviewing potential instances of suspicious activity and financial crimes related investigations across a diverse range of disciplines including BSA/AML, Sanctions (including OFAC), fraud, cybercrime and security. The position requires the individual to exercise independent, sound judgment and high quality standards in risk analysis. Additionally, the BSA Risk Analyst is required to remain current and proactive with industry related trends and best practices, and exhibit ethical behavior and integrity in everyday business conduct.
The BSA Risk Analyst has independent responsibility and demonstrates compliance knowledge in handling escalations of high-risk clients, periodic/EDD reviews, and potential instances of suspicious activity and financial crimes related investigations across a wide range of disciplines including; BSA/AML, Sanctions (including OFAC), fraud, cybercrime and security.
Provide support and assistance of critical BSA/AML/CIP/OFAC compliance responsibilities to the BSA Risk Group to ensure compliance with BSA regulatory requirements. The position requires the individual to exercise independent sound judgment, and high quality standards while conducting BSA/AML reviews and investigations.
Ensure adherence to the Bank’s investigative/EDD protocols and regulatory reporting(including SARs).
Interact with senior management, lines of business, legal, audit and risk departments.
Creates and conducts BSA/AML and Sanctions (including OFAC) awareness trainings and presentations as necessary.
Remain current and proactive with related industry trends and best practices.
Perform the day-to-day activities ensuring that the processes are in accordance with current Bank practices, procedures and regulatory requirements.
Who We Want
At least 3 years of compliance experience working in a large financial institution preferred.
Candidates with advanced degrees (Associates, Bachelor’s, and/or Master’s) preferred, yet a High School diploma or GED is required. Candidates with some combination of coursework and experience, or else extensive related professional experience, are eligible for consideration
Understanding of regulatory concepts including, but not limited to, the Bank Secrecy Act, Office of Foreign Assets Control sanctions, and the USA PATRIOT Act.
Excellent analytical, oral and written communication skills; has experience in building relationships and communicating with varied audiences and stakeholders across multiple business lines.
An independent decision maker, able to make time-sensitive assessments and to discuss complex risk analysis and regulatory issues with senior management.
Ability to lead an investigation or project; proven ability to formulate and execute an investigation or project.
At Sterling National Bank, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure this we seek talented, qualified people for all of our career opportunities, regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under federal, state and/or local laws.
