Job Title: Senior Healthcare Data Analyst - Contract Modeling Exp A Plus!
Job Description:
About Fallon Health
Founded in 1977, Fallon Health is a leading health care services organization that supports the diverse and changing needs of those we serve. In addition to offering innovative health insurance solutions and a variety of Medicaid and Medicare products, we excel in creating unique health care programs and services that provide coordinated, integrated care for seniors and individuals with complex health needs. Fallon has consistently ranked among the nation’s top health plans, and is accredited by the National Committee for Quality Assurance for its HMO, Medicare Advantage and Medicaid products. For more information, visit fallonhealth.org.
Brief Summary of Purpose: The Medical Economics Senior Analyst will partner with the Manager, Medical Economics as a subject matter expert in data and analysis, demonstrating an in-depth understanding of financial, clinical, and other business data. The position works directly with operational leadership in the design and development of analytical capabilities, reports, and dashboards needed for short and long-term decision-making to achieve success in managing care. This individual provides complex ad hoc analysis and reporting as directed by management to include the evaluation of financial, operational, clinical and general business programs and processes. The Senior Analyst is responsible for data quality and data integrity as they relate to reporting and analytical activities.

Analysis, Decision Support and Business Intelligence
Provide actionable analyses and reports that help monitor performance and drive decision making to reduce total medical expense and utilization
Assist in designing initiatives to impact cost drivers, including measurement and monitoring of initiatives. Identify the cost drivers, quantify variances, formulate and propose strategies and communicate the outcomes to customer, business owners and senior management
Evaluate the impact of current vs. proposed financial arrangements with providers; compare payment terms against Medicare and Medicaid reimbursement methodologies
Perform cost and utilization trend analyses at the provider, PHO, employer or other group variation.
Measure actual performance against benchmarks or targets
Provide advanced analytical and reporting support to customers on various projects
Leads or assists in process improvement and special projects
Regulatory & Clinical Model Design and Support
Provide support for regulatory reporting; analyze specifications to develop accurate responses or summaries for timely submissions
Provide analytical support for clinical initiatives including development, evaluation and ROI analyses
Evaluate the effectiveness of clinical initiatives in improving patient outcomes and reducing health care costs
Ad-Hoc Support
Provide support for ad-hoc (i.e. one time) requests that require clinical, financial, regulatory, pharmacy and operational analysis and reporting.
Prepare reports and supporting analysis for internal and external customers focused on reducing costs and utilization and enhancing healthcare system efficiency.
Act as a resource for other members of the department on business issues.
As a subject matter expert, train and guide other associates in the department in data understanding and analytical processes.

Education
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance or Public Health required
Experience
Minimum of 5 years of financial or analytical experience. Healthcare experience highly preferred.
Experience with data analysis, interpretation and reporting of clinical and financial data
Experience with Microsoft Excel, ACCESS, SSMS or SQL
Ability to design, evaluate and interpret complex data sets
Knowledge of managed care and health care claims
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Join SADA as a Business Operations Analyst!

Your Mission

As a Business Operations Analyst at SADA, you will play a key role in our rapidly growing business, to measure, define and optimize our business processes. You will work closely with all levels of management and the IT team to support the development and implementation of technology solutions that make SADA's operations more efficient and transparent. You are passionate about data analysis and visualization, modelling complex problems and delivering creative solutions.

Primary Duties Include:
Lead end-to-end business process review and develop best in class business processes for our diverse base of user groups. Create and maintain business process modelling documentation in our new BPM tool. Work cross functionally to define and establish standardized work instructions and operating procedures.
Develop subject matter expertise and act as the systems admin for our BPM tool.
Support the deployment of improvements into our operational practices and continually refine core business processes.
Take the lead in eliciting, identifying, and evaluating business and system requirements for our portfolio of business applications. Describe and document business scenarios and processes in language understandable to both technical and domain stakeholders.
Own the requirements through their full lifecycle. Ensure that requirements are: clearly documented, reviewed and approved by the business community, managed and updated under change control, and developed, tested and implemented to meet the true business needs.
Understand and negotiate the needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders.
Facilitate and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders.
Proactively monitor, identify and resolve ongoing day-to-day business and operational issues. Monitor and track supporting processes to ensure business reporting accuracy.
Provide timely, accurate and efficient administration and maintenance of operational data. Identify and address operational, financial, and technological risks.
Pathway to Success

#BeOneStepAhead: At SADA we are in the business of change. We are focused on leading-edge technology that is ever-evolving. We embrace change enthusiastically and encourage adaptability. You have your finger on the pulse of our teams' needs and take pride in helping them solve their day-to-day problems. Your success comes from your enthusiasm, insight, and positive impact. You will be given direct feedback quarterly with respect to the scope and quality of your contributions

Your success starts by positively impacting the direction of a fast-growing practice with vision and passion. You will be measured bi-yearly by the breadth, magnitude, and quality of your contributions, your ability to estimate accurately, customer feedback at the close of projects, how well you collaborate with your peers, and the consultative polish you bring to customer interactions.

Expectations

Training - Ongoing with first-week orientation at HQ followed by a 90-day onboarding schedule. Details of the timeline can be shared.

Job Requirements

Required Credentials:
Bachelor's degree and/or formal Business Analysis training
3 years related professional experience required
Required Qualifications:
Demonstrated fluency in business process modelling and documentation.
Experience documenting requirements using flow charts, sequence diagrams and process workflows.
Strong experience gathering requirements, eliciting feedback, and developing use cases and requirements documents.
Knowledge of data visualization libraries and tools, data conversion and interface design
Accountability, dependability, and consistency
Excellent written and verbal and communications skills
Passion for learn emerging technologies and embracing continuous professional development
Strong problem solving skills
Strong sense of ownership
About SADA

Values: We built our core values on themes that internally compel us to deliver our best to our partners, our customers and to each other. Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to SADA's values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer.
Make them rave
Be data-driven
Be one step ahead
Be a change agent
Do the right thing
Work with the best: SADA has been the largest partner in North America for GCP since 2016 and has been named the 2019 and 2018 Google Cloud Global Partner of the Year. SADA has also been awarded Best Place to Work by Inc. as well as LA Business Journal!

Benefits: Unlimited PTO, competitive and attractive compensation, performance-based bonuses, paid holidays, rich medical, dental, vision plans, life, short and long-term disability insurance, 401K with match, professional development reimbursement program as well as Google Certified training programs.

Business Performance: SADA has been named to the INC 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies list for 12 years in a row garnering Honoree status. CRN has also named SADA on the Top 500 Global Solutions Providers for the past 5 years. The overall culture continues to evolve with engineering at its core: 3200+ projects completed, 3000+ customers served, 10K+ workloads and 25M+ users migrated to the cloud.

BASIC PURPOSE: Provides strategic consulting support to determine business requirements to address the needs of members, internal staff, and regulators and translates these requirements into functional and system specifications.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Consults with business unit leaders to identify and communicate how information technology solutions can add value.
Liaison between business units and Information Technology departments; collects, analyzes, reviews, documents and communicates business needs and requirements. Translates business needs into functional and system specifications.
Analyzes business unit operations to understand its strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate and/or streamline processes. Works with business units to define user requirements and writes functional specifications needed for new systems and modifications to existing systems. Understands the regulatory and compliance requirements imposed on the Bank and ensures needs are addressed in the business requirements definition.
Translates conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.
Understands technical problems and solutions in relation to the current, as well as the future business environment, and uses this knowledge to suggest plans to integrate new and existing processes.
Collaborates with the software architects to ensure the Bank’s systems architectural landscape aligns with business needs and objectives.
Researches, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements gathering processes. Recommends and develops strategies for enhancing or further leveraging the requirements-gathering processes.
Manages small to medium projects to include all project management functions and provides regular updates to manager.
Assists managers with project coordination on larger projects to include but not limited to: project status reports, project statistics, change management and project plan tracking and other project documentation as needed.
Works with the business unit to conceptualize the post implementation operational environment to understand how the delivered solution will integrate with or change operational procedures.
OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES
Works with software vendors on application-related activities and coordinate user training on new system.
Assists the Quality Assurance staff in the development of test cases and test plans to ensure all requirements are met and the software functions correctly.
Participates in the planning, coordination, and management of cross-departmental user acceptance testing efforts.
Assists managers in tracking and analyzing application issues reported by business partners and recommends business solutions to reduce the number of issues.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES
Understanding of Bank financial operations and data (i.e., expertise in credit and collateral management, mortgages and investments management, commercial loan underwriting, derivative and accounting operations, asset/liability management, safekeeping, cash management services and/or affordable housing programs).
Understanding of information systems, business processes, the key drivers and measures of the success of the business, and the short and long term direction of the business and technology.
Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills and the ability to exercise independent judgment.
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills Highly self-motivated and directed
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Experience working with federal level regulations is a plus
OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES

This description provides general information necessary to depict the essential and non-essential functions of the job and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the required work that may be inherent in the job.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of eight years experience in business and technical requirements analysis, or the equivalent combination of education and experience. A Master’s degree is preferred.
We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

ERP Business Systems Analyst

Position Summary

Come work with a group of dedicated, ambitious engineers and builders who are the industry’s best. As our ERP Business Systems Analyst at Helix Electric, you will be trusted with managing our ERP and other critical business applications. This position will be responsible for configurations, integrations and end user training. The ideal candidate will be self-driven, able to quickly learn new product features and identify how those could enhance our business processes. They will also support all efforts towards new, innovative solutions. Join Team Helix to empower people and power projects.

Helix Electric was founded in 1985 and is now one of the nation’s largest and most successful electrical contracting companies. Our commitment to empowering people and powering projects is realized by our exceptional team of dedicated and highly skilled experts working together and never settling for good enough. We are proud of the team-oriented and employee-empowered business approach that defines our unique character. We are looking for passionate, reliable and ambitious talent to join our growing Helix family.

Job Responsibilities
Help maintain our current setup and configuration, patch requirements, and implement the latest technologies for our ERP system that runs on the Oracle technology stack.
Manage company security needs around user accounts, report access, and data handling.
Ensure efficient operations by providing daily support, training users, writing reference materials, and creating training videos.
Support the effort to integrate data from each of our business systems (Cloud and On Premise) for advanced reporting and analytical needs.
Partner with external consultants to effectively manage specialized development tasks and software support.
Work with our developers to design and launch new applications and upgrades to our existing applications on Azure and SharePoint Online.
Qualifications, Education, and Experience Requirements
Bachelor degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.
5 – 7 years supporting business applications using Oracle technologies. (CMiC ERP and the construction industry preferred).
5 – 7 years supporting an Oracle ERP system and the modules for payroll, HR, accounting, purchasing, document management, workflow, project management, and mobile apps.
Experience leading an upgrade or migration to a new ERP system preferred.
Knowledge of PL/SQL, Oracle Discoverer, T-SQL, Report Writer, and or Crystal Reports.
Knowledge of Oracle SQL developer and or Toad software.
Knowledge of Oracle Database 11g, Weblogic Server 11g and 12c
Knowledge of XML Publisher, Jaspersoft iReports and Jasperserver is a major plus.
Experience following the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology.
Helix Electric is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to diversity in our workforce. Responsible for effectively leading efforts to implement and support information technology solutions for business critical processes. The Business Systems Analyst acts as a liaison for the Information Technology team with both internal and external business partners. The position will work within the business to define business requirements, facilitate discussion and agreement on process design amongst stakeholders, develop business processes, validate business processes against the system(s) and conduct feasibility assessments of process and technologies within the Microsoft D365 implementation project. The Business Systems Analyst will be the“subject matter expert” both from a business perspective and a system / process functionality perspective for all D365 Operations Modules (order-to-cash, procure-to-pay, inventory and warehouse management).

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Oversee the development of specifications related to changes in the business functions or new functionality.
Review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solutions.
Participate in the definition, implementation and distribution of operating procedures.
Hold design review sessions with cross-functional team members to review requirements.
Coordinate and execute user acceptance testing sessions.
Provide in-depth knowledge of the Microsoft Dynamics application and evaluate operations processes against the standard Microsoft Dynamics functionality.
Conduct acceptance testing and training to the users to successfully use and maintain the Microsoft Dynamics application.
Gather important data necessary for troubleshooting.
Obtain sign off of functional specification(s) from all cross functional project team members.
Develop functional specifications and system design specifications for project engagements.
Interact with the Business community and IT resources to identify required changes.
Perform systems analyst activities and make recommendations in areas that require a high level of technical competency.
Review all user documentation and monitor testing.
Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on, escalated and resolved in a timely manner.
Assist in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.
Manage resources in accordance with project schedules.
Consistently deliver high-quality services.
QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform the job successfully, an individual should have the following credentials:
Bachelor’s Degree in related area
5+ years experience supporting IT projects and applications, preferably Operations/Logistics applications
3+ years experience working with Dynamics D365 in a Technical Business Analyst role
Significant experience drafting, developing and implementing core business processes
Ability to draft operations reports to satisfy the data and analytical needs across all Operations functions
Familiar with principles of application programming, database and system design
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to coordinate and work effectively with business stakeholders and other specialists
Ability to demonstrate strong leadership and to manage and resolve conflict
Strong organizational skills, written and verbal skills, ability to understand and explain issues to colleagues and users from both a technical and a business functional point of view
Must have strong problem solving skills and be capable of breaking down complex problems to identify and resolve root causes; this applies to both technical issues and process issues
Facilitates effective team interaction
Experience with implementing and/or supporting Microsoft D365
Experience with Microsoft D365 Operations modules
Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio
Ability to work at a detailed level while maintaining an overall project perspective
Ability to travel

Job Title: CDD/EDD/KYC Compliance Analyst (KC MO area applicants ONLY)
Job Description:
About Us*
Dama Financial is a financial technology startup focused on partnering with banks to serve business customers around the country. Given the nature of our partnership model, the settlement function is critical to the success of our business. With that in mind, we are looking for a BSA/AML Compliance Analyst with the experience and energy necessary to help build a BSA/AML/OFAC function that can scale and support the rapid growth of our business.
Seeking Kansas City and Surrounding Area Candidates for this position.*
Relocation assistance is not offered.*
Duties & Responsibilities*
The CDD/EDD/KYC Compliance Analyst assists in the day to day onboarding account process. This position within the Corporate Risk Management team will report to Chief Risk Officer at Dama Financial. This role involves reviewing Know Your Customer (KYC) documentation and conducting customer due diligence (CDD) and Customer Identification Program (CIP) during onboarding and on a risk-based frequency for existing Customers. Provides subject matter expertise to Risk Management Team and enablement partners to ensure documentation meets regulatory requirements. Individuals in this role must possess strong time management skills and be able to balance a variety of competing tasks. Attention to detail, strong writing skills and the ability to work in a sensitive, deadline-driven environment are a must
Duties of the position will include, but are not limited to: *
Understanding of prospective, new or existing partners relationship with applicant including AML/BSA and risks associated with provided products and service.
Receiving and completing requests for of prospective, new, and existing applicants.
Conducting research using open source information, and multiple internal systems to complete CIP/CDD/EDD reviews.
Ensuring all applicants, their beneficial owners, and account controllers undergo screening when appropriate, Adverse Media searches, that the dispositions of false-positives are documented and possible matches are escalated appropriately
Assessing the risk and proposing mitigations or controls based on the body of evidence collected
Concluding the CIP/CDD/EDD review with clear written communication and documenting evidence in the system of records.
Reviewing applicant contracts and assessing, CIP/CDD/EDD questionnaires, and risk appetite to ensure compliance with AML/BSA and regulatory requirements.
Advise C.O.R.E Team regarding US client onboarding, customer due diligence and enhanced due diligence standards and requirements.
Complete CIP/CCD/EDD reviews in a timely and efficient manner. Suggest process enhancements and/or research tools to increase efficiency and/or accuracy.
Providing recommendations on modifications required to CIP/CDD/EDD questionnaires, and Standard Operating Procedures based on changes in the AML/BSA regulatory environment
Promote a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and practices.
Recommend enhancements for marketing materials for products and services to ensure compliance requirements are considered or included;
Review and contribute to compliance training materials for staff, as needed;
Participate in meetings with co-workers, individually or in a group, to identify gaps within current practices and regulatory requirements and then rectify the process to assure regulatory compliance;
Review and make recommendations for policies and procedures to meet current regulatory expectations or and assist in making updates as regulatory changes occur;
Monitor new and any proposed laws and regulations in a timely manner and establish compliance obligations to allow Dama to effectively meet these requirements;
Review and understand consumer complaints received by the organization so accurate and compliant responses are communicated to consumers;
Conduct research and data gathering for the completion of compliance requirements for new products & services; and
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge & Skills*
_*Minimum*_
Working knowledge of compliance regulations governing Bank Secrecy Act & Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML), Patriot Act (CIP), Treasury Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), FFIEC advisory guidelines regarding Know Your Customer (KYC), Customer Due Diligence (CDD), Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) and other areas to include consumer banking, credit card, prepaid card, and third-party risk management.
Ability to develop and maintain rapport with co-workers to effectively obtain and communicate compliance information.
Identify and assess regulatory compliance risks and develop appropriate strategies to mitigate risk.
Effectively detect patterns and conditions through observing processes.
Organized with ability to maintain a complex annual review calendar.
Ability to work independently.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and computer proficiency.
_*Preferred*_
3+ years of experience or equivalent in audit program development, internal control consulting, or risk management utilizing.
CAMS or relative certification various automated tools and techniques.
Experience within credit card industry.
Exhibit superior time management skills (measured by deadlines and quality of progress and projects completed).
Advanced decision-making aptitude.
Demonstrates ability to deal with and meet tight deadlines with limited resources.
Demonstrates ability to manage multiple projects.
Requirements*
_*Minimum*_

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration (w/

strong emphasis in Accounting or Finance).

• 2+ years of BSA Analyst with BSA/AML/OFAC experience within a bank setting.
Target Competencies*
• Achievement Orientation

• Communication/Interpersonal Skills

• Demonstrates Integrity

• Initiative

• Internal Partnering

• Problem Solving

• Teamwork and Cooperation

• Business and Industry Acumen

• Technology Proficiency

• Project Management

• Leadership/Management
Work Environment*
Ability to handle highly confidential and sensitive information; possess skills to work independently or in a group setting; Flexible personality, as needs change depending on needs of the organization; can Influence a large span of relationships and levels; general business office environment.
Due to the nature of financial systems, you will be required to pass a background check.*
Benefits*
Healthcare
401K
Seeking Kansas City and Surrounding Area Candidates for this position.*
Relocation assistance is not offered.*
Send resumes *

Job Title: Digital Business Analyst | Digital Design and Customer Experience | Beacon Health System
Job Description:
Are you ready to be a key member of the Beacon Experience and Digital Design team that helps revolutionize the healthcare customer experience? Beacon Health System is transforming and is looking for people skilled in the consumer and digital space to support our vision of making healthcare more convenient, connected, and coordinated.

Healthcare customers are paying a higher share of healthcare costs, and they want to manage their health the same way they manage the rest of their life. If you want to make the world a better place and change healthcare for the positive, consider joining the transformation team at Beacon.

We are seeking an experienced candidate who sees things from the customer point of view, is flexible and creative, has solved difficult problems, brings cross-functional teams together and thrives in an agile environment. The candidate will help design, create, and deliver solutions to meet the customer where they are, including web and mobile.

As a key member of the Beacon Experience and Digital Design team the candidate works closely with IT, Marketing, Innovation, Customer Experience, Web Team, and other associates throughout the organization. You will support Beacon's vision of making healthcare more convenient, connected, and coordinated in order to give patients, customers, associates, and physicians easy access to information and solutions.

We are seeking a minimum four years of progressively more responsible experience with building business cases, introducing new technologies, redesigning customer and associate experiences, leading enterprise-wide initiatives, and working on agile cross-functional teams.

JOB SUMMARY
Reports to a Manager/Director of Beacon Experience and Digital Design. For all Beacon Health System hospitals and other entities, support customer experience design, digital experience and integration, and customer engagement.
MISSION & VISION
Mission: To enhance the physical, mental and emotional well-being of the communities we serve as the community’s provider of outstanding quality, superior value and comprehensive health care services.

Vision: Our vision is to achieve:
Innovative health care and well-being services of the highest quality at the greatest value
Easy access and convenience
Outstanding patient experiences
Ongoing education involving physicians, patients and the community
JOB SPECIFICATIONS
Education and Experience
The knowledge, skills and abilities as indicated below are normally acquired through the successful completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Public Health, or a healthcare related field. Master’s Degree preferred. Must have strong project leadership skills. A minimum of four years of progressively more responsible experience with business cases, introducing new technologies, redesigning customer and associate experiences, leading enterprise-wide initiatives, and working on agile cross-functional teams.
Knowledge & Skills
Demonstrates well-developed leadership skills and the creativity necessary to organize, develop and provide administrative leadership for project and program effectiveness.
Demonstrates expert administrative operational knowledge, leadership and positive conflict resolution.
Requires business development or complex business project management experience.
Requires the ability to navigate and work in an agile, dynamic, fast paced and often changing high growth environment.
Requires the high-level analytical skills necessary to plan, control and direct activities and resources related to planning, scheduling and to evaluate program goals, objectives and outcomes.
Requires critical thinking, decision making, negotiation, creativity, and problem-solving skills and consensus-building skills.
Must be detail and process oriented.
Demonstrates the communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact effectively.
Requires well-developed public speaking skills.
Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills as reflected by the ability to build relationships and successfully interact tactfully and effectively with colleagues at all levels of the organization and with external constituencies and elicit cooperation and support.
Working Conditions
Works in an office environment.
May be required to travel to off-site locations.
Physical Demands
Requires the physical ability and stamina to perform the essential functions of the position.

Location: Beacon Health System · Digital Design-Customer Experi
Schedule: Full-time, Day, 8:00am - 5:00pm; Monday - Friday

GreenState Credit Union

File Analyst/Funding Specialist

US-IA-North Liberty

Job ID: 2020-2505
Type: Regular Full-Time
# of Openings: 1
Category: Mortgage
GreenState Credit Union

Overview

Is accountable for the accuracy and completeness of all mortgage loan documentation, file maintenance and funding of all mortgage loans following closing. Provides support to Final Title Specialist with the overflow of final title documents.

Pay range for this hourly position is $18.28 - $27.42, with a progressive benefits package.

Responsibilities

Performs essential duties and responsibilities in the following areas which may include, but are not limited to those listed and are subject to change.

Adheres to the Credit Union's core values and Service Standards in carrying out GreenState's mission and vision.
Demonstrates a positive member service (internal and external) focus at all times. Consistent usage of the members name during contact and always thanking them for their business.
Demonstrates teamwork in all interactions with coworkers and in the completion of all duties and responsibilities.
Plays a vital role in enriching the community by participating in community service organizations and/or Credit Union sponsored events on an annual basis.
Ensures confidentiality of member information.
Assigns all new files to each market’s closers on a daily basis and ensures each closer will be closing the same average number of closings. Monitors the closers vacation days and assigns files appropriately.
Issues all checks and posts general ledger entries related to the mortgage transaction. Funds all refinance loans after rescission period ends and issues all checks at that time.
Controls all member transactions on the core system related to the mortgage transaction (i.e. loan payoff, deposits, and withdrawals).
Ensures all wire requests related to the mortgage transaction are valid requests and are not fraudulent.
Controls the accuracy and completeness of mortgage loan data entry on core system for piggyback second mortgages. Updates addresses on the core system as needed.
Controls the accuracy and completeness of mortgage loan data entry on core system for all 1st mortgage construction loans. Accurately advances the 1st draw on the construction loan. Updates addresses on the core system as needed.
Oversees and maintains the accuracy of general ledger and check balancing associated with the funding on the mortgage files. Responsible for researching any offages and any outstanding checks or requests from vendors requesting payment.
Organizes file to be sent to post closing department in a timely manner to ensure prompt delivery to secondary market investors and to ensure mortgages are recorded in a timely manner.
Interacts with various lending teams to ensure all necessary documents are included in the file to be sent to secondary market including any conditions required by AUS or underwriter.
Assumes an “audit” function for files prior to shipping the file to the secondary market. Ensures all necessary documents are complete and included in all files before completing the file as required by UICCU underwriter.
Follows up with lending teams, borrowers, or vendors on any missing or inaccurate documentation in mortgage file.
Verifies the accuracy of the sellers’ SSN for year-end reporting.
Verifies accuracy of Warranty Deed, Ground Water Hazard Statement, Declaration of Value, all mortgages and any additional documents that are to be recorded.
Registers all secondary market loans with MERS in a timely manner to ensure accuracy of lien position and to prevent delays in the loans being purchased.
Assists with submitting orders with attorneys to ensure prompt delivery of Title Opinion/Guaranty/Policy/Insurance after closing.
Assists with maintaining all post-closing abstracting and title guaranty documents that are saved in the loan origination system (currently Encompass).
Assists with ordering final title policies through Iowa Title Guaranty directly with Iowa Finance Authority, when applicable.
Assists with verifying accuracy and sending all final trailing documentation to secondary market investors after Title Guaranty/Policy/Insurance is received or for the completion of in-house mortgage loans.
Assists with mailing owner's title policies/insurance and/or deeds to borrowers, when applicable.
Assists with mailing abstracts to members or sending abstracts for storage as they are received by UICCU with Final Title Opinion/Policy/Insurance.
Provides support to track abstract storage and receipts.
Provides support to maintaining overall organization of pending and completed final title work to ensure prompt receipt and delivery.
Provides support to final title policies/insurance tracking report in loan origination system.
Provides support to organization of all mortgage files with pending final title work and work with the respective examining attorney to cure outstanding liens.
Assists in year-end verification of HMDA reporting and 1098/1099 statements.
Assists in all other necessary mortgage duties and projects when needed.
Adheres to all state, federal and credit union regulations, policies and guidelines.

Qualifications

Reports to work punctually, works all scheduled hours, and works overtime as necessitated by business demand.
Interpersonal skills to represent the Credit Union in a positive way during staff and member contact.
Interpersonal skills necessary to gather data from a number of sources and to represent positively the Credit Union during such contacts.
Ability to provide quality service to members by phone or in person.
Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers.
Ability to prioritize assignments and organize work efficiently, to handle large volumes of details.
Ability to operate related computer applications, an on-line terminal and other standard office equipment such as a calculator and typewriter.
Extreme accuracy and attention to detail required.
Lending policies and Real Estate knowledge is preferred.
High school diploma or equivalent (i.e. GED.) with one year of similar or related work experience, or a post-secondary degree in Business, Mathematical Science, or other related field.
Must be bondable.

Reporting Relationship
Reports to the Mortgage Loan Sales and Support Officer.

Supervisory Responsibilities
This position is not responsible for the supervision of other employees.

Equal Opportunity Employment Statement
GreenState Credit Union is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Computer Programmer* *- Systems Analyst*
Company Profile*
Located in the heart of Central Minnesota, Virnig Manufacturing has been designing and producing skid steer loader attachments since 1989. From engineering and cutting raw materials to machining, welding and painting the finished product, all steps of the manufacturing process are done in-house. Today, the family-owned and operated business has grown into a premium attachment manufacturer supplying North America and beyond. By integrating the latest manufacturing technologies and using top-of-the-line materials, Virnig has distinguished themselves as a cut above the rest in the manufacturing industry.
Position Summary*
The computer programmer will assist all departments in retrieving data from various sources and organizing it for the end-users needs. This position will work with all departments to create, maintain and adjust custom programs that interact with the company’s ERP system and other data sources to support internal processes and efficiency. The individual in this position will have ownership in the functional support of the company’s ERP system to ensure that it is being utilized to its fullest potential.
Responsibilities*
Designs and participates in the development, testing, and implementation of computer application systems; consults with current and proposed systems users on the feasibility of proposed systems and changes; analyzes ongoing computerization needs; identifies design alternatives; estimates cost and timing of systems modifications and new systems development; proposes computer-based solutions.
Monitors and corrects problems with computer applications identified by users; develops and implements solutions to the problems.
Writes technical specifications for system and program design; writes user operating procedures for new and revised computer applications; and confers with departmental staff, vendors, and technical support personnel regarding changes in operating procedures and systems design to ensure applications meet user needs.
Modifies, enhances, or adds modules to existing applications; adapts purchased software to hardware used by department and to departmental requirements; provides project and technical supervision of outside vendors assisting in application development and maintenance tasks.
Designs procedures for testing new and revised software; conducts tests to evaluate conformance to specifications and to identify and correct problems.
Stay current on updates and changes in purchased software and advise management of necessary and advisory updates.
Have a leading role in finding alternate software systems and advising management of the need to change with a documented justification, leading the implementation of any approved changes.
Support the company's ERP system working with the software developer on any issues that arise.
Conducts formal and on-the-job training for system users in the capabilities and use of computer applications.
Other duties as assigned.
Skills*
*Creative and Original Thinking* — Developing, designing, or creating new applications, ideas, or relationships.
*Gathering Information* — Observing, receiving, and otherwise obtaining information from all relevant sources.
*Organizing, Planning, and Prioritizing Work* — Ability to multi-task and work on a number of projects at one time while keeping deadlines at the forefront.
*Active Listening* — Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Requirements*
Formal education in computer programming is preferred but not required.
Minimum of 3 years of computer programming experience or equivalent.
Understanding of computer programming needs as they pertain to a manufacturing environment.
Familiarity with the functions of an ERP/MRP system.
Knowledge of web programming preferred.
Ability to code in multiple languages including, but not limited to, C++,C#, Java, HTML and Python.
Ability to use database management software including, but not limited to, Actian PSQL (Pervasive), Microsoft Access, Microsoft SQL Server, MongoDB, MySQL and Teradata.
Knowledge of and experience using modern data analytics platforms such as Tableau and Crystal Reports.
Experience setting using Microsoft 365 solutions SharePoint, OneDrive and Teams preferred.
Strong customer service skills to support end users and collaboratively develop solutions.
Strong ability to work on a team across multiple projects with competing priorities.
Ability to integrate internal systems with outside agency applications.
Benefits*
Family owned and operated with a team-oriented culture. Success is achieved by working together.
Paid time off
Health insurance
Dental insurance
Life and Disability Insurance
401(k) including employer match
Salary dependent on experience and capabilities

Warfare System Certification Analyst

International Systems Management Corp. (ISM) is seeking a qualified individual for a full-time position to execute the Naval Warfare Systems Certification Policy (NWSCP) and support the development and deployment of warfare systems throughout the life cycle of approximately 150 U.S. Navy Surface Ships in accordance with Warfare Systems Certification Standard Operating Policy (SOP) Revision “B”. This includes providing annual support for the assessment of warfare systems in approximately 75 Navy Surface Ships through approximately 135 Warfare Systems Certification (WSCERT) Events (Warfare Systems Installation Authorizations-WSIA and Warfare Systems Certification Decisions-WSCD) in order to provide COMUSFLTFORCOM and COMPACFLT with Warfare Systems Certification Plans, early assessments of risk and characterization of maturity and readiness to support Risk Assessments for ships in new construction after sail-away and post shakedown availabilities and certification decisions to support the subject ship(s) throughout deployment.

The Warfare System Certification Analyst will be responsible for supporting USN in certification efforts. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: maintenance of WSCERT Master Events Schedule; development of WSCERT Certification events, meeting agendas and reports; development of metrics briefings and item tracking reports; development of panel briefing, naval messages and executive summary briefings for WSCERT events; developing and providing technical inputs to WSIA warfare systems baseline configuration issues; and developing and providing panel briefings, meeting summary briefings and information binders for WSIA and WSCD events.

Required experience:
Experience with Navy Ships or Strike Group Combat and Warfare Systems
Ability to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of experience
Ability to express complex concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing
Highly motivated individual capable of working independently and/or in teams with the ability to multi-task, prioritize, and meet deadlines.
Active Secret Clearance
Desired experience:
Familiarity with certification of Navy Warfare Systems and USN Combat System
Familiarity with TCD Waiver Request and Ship Change Documentation
Familiarity with maintaining and accessing Objective Quality Evidence checklist
Familiarity with building folders and mining data in SharePoint
The applicant must have the following minimum experience or qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent Navy or DoD experience (Technical Discipline preferred)
Active DoD security clearance
2 to 5 years of professional experience
Proficient with Microsoft Office Products including Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Possess strong communication skills (oral and written) and ability to work independently
The ideal candidate is dynamic and proactive in meeting customer needs and has the ability to prioritize tasks and coordinate activities across numerous organizations. The position will be located in Washington, DC and will require travel approximately less than 20% of the time.

ISM is a growing small business providing exceptional technical and program management services to the Department of Defense (DoD). Summary:

Cambridge Savings Bank’s Business Analyst (BA) provides deliverables across the entire life cycle of a variety of strategic initiatives. The BA analyzes problems/opportunities and identifies creative solutions for business challenges. This role drives stakeholder involvement typically from inception. S/he will work with project requestors on business cases, including a rigorous benefits and ROI analysis, through implementation. S/he is responsible for documenting business workflow, system, and process requirements, and devising appropriate validation mechanisms and test cases to facilitate successful project delivery.

The BA works very closely with our Project Management Director, Project Managers, Technical Trainer, and other key stakeholders and will have significant interactions with the Executive Team, Department Heads and other Senior Managers.

Key Result Areas:
Build partnerships and serve as the liaison with internal departments on projects to identify, understand, and deliver desired solutions and value to the organization
Support business sponsors/requestors in establishing business cases, benefits, and ROI metrics for project proposals
Provide project support to the Project Managers and business process owners including the following:
Document requirements and workflow diagrams with a focus on business process improvements and operational controls
Assist with addressing change management requirements
Manage all aspects of end-to-end testing (such as the testing plan, test cases, test scripts, testing execution, etc.) providing regular testing status updates indicating progress, known risks and items for escalation to management
Serve in a Project Manager capacity when cross-coverage is required
Drive continuous process and procedural improvement focusing on tools, templates and system changes which may be implemented Bank-wide
Identify data use cases by collaborating with the business line and data team to understand business objectives and problems and determine how data can help solve them
Interpret, evaluate, and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections to facilitate decision making
Ability to understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes related to project work
Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting in support of business cases and project outcomes
Align key partners on measurement and monitoring processes – identify and drive how trends will be interpreted and what actions will result from various potential outcomes
Provide support on various ad-hoc and special projects as assigned by the PMO Director and conduct insightful ad-hoc analyses ongoing
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree required; MBA preferred
4-5 years of business analytics, writing business requirements for projects, and user acceptance testing, preferably in Banking and/or financial institutions; or at professional services firms that focus on the financial services industry
Experience within Commercial Lending, Retail Banking, and/or online banking areas preferred
Familiarity with Lean and similar process improvement techniques
Experience with project portfolio management software such as Planview, Eclipse, and Innotas, and project management software such as MS Project, Wrike and Projectplace, and communications software such as Survey Monkey and Webex is desirable
Proven analytical experience with the ability to identify themes and trends from various data sources
Ability to synthesize analysis into stories and visuals for an executive audience
Experience working with senior level decision makers
Strong communication/interpersonal skills
CBAP (through IIBA) or PBA (through PMI) certification(s) is preferred
Advanced knowledge of MS Office applications with emphasis on MS Word, MS Outlook, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, and MS Visio

Onboard P&P restaurants by executing scripting provided by the Restaurant Engineering Ops team. Understand scope of this data that is being leveraged from the Universal Listing Database (ULD).

Accountable for tracking, analysis, and reporting of onboard + launch utilizing tableau or other data visualization tools.
Create, facilitate and measure results of queries to understand reasoning behind unexpected behavior/ results and partner with Rest. Engineering to optimize.
Continuously communicate business analysis and business insights to senior leadership.
Adhere to current state SLAs while improving turnaround time from initial creation to going live.

1+ years of experience in an analytical role

Advanced Microsoft Excel
Experienced analytical skills with an ability to dive deep, summarize, and communicate important data.

Resp & Qualifications

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Under the general supervision, the incumbent’s accountabilities may include, but are not limited to, the following:
Investigate and analyze feasibility of low to moderately complex enhancements, automations and processes. Analyze, define and interpret business needs and issues by gathering, analyzing, documenting and validating the Business area(s) and user(s) technical (functional/non-functional) requirements. Participates in the creation of complex PRD (Project Requirements Document) which includes defining Business, User, functional and non-functional requirements needed for approval by Business and for use by Design, Development and Testing teams. Participates in creation of Requirements Management Plan (RMP) for complex projects and may create RMP for less complex projects, to define, organize and schedule requirements management and development activities. Participates in requirements analysis and verification sessions for complex projects and may lead requirements analysis and verification sessions for less complex projects. Participates in the tracking and management of open issues and assists in planning for resolution for complex projects. Maintain communications with technical counterparts to adopt best practices and ensure integration of specific application architecture into overall enterprise technology strategy.
Lead testing efforts by defining, developing and implementing practices and procedures for complete end user test plans. Ensures all user acceptance tests are conducted and documented according to standards. Identifies and documents system deficiencies and recommends solutions. Responsible for overall success of user acceptance testing, including results verification and release. Coordinates groups of end users who test, evaluate and validate new functions and applications and identify issues in software or services. Ensures continuing operational quality by documenting fixes and enhancements. Providing guidance and training to application end users. Provides ongoing assistance to software developers and testers to resolve defects during the testing process. Participates in the management of the sequencing of releases to meet business needs for less complex enhancements, automations and implementations. May lead sequencing of releases for less complex enhancements, automations and implementations.
Troubleshoot systems problems identify cause of problems, work with appropriate group to correct problem. Develop solutions that for low to moderately complex technical and/or business issues. Proactively identifies opportunities and enhancements. Leads development sessions and design reviews in order to ensure design meets user requirements.
Participates in the exploration of alternative business solutions for moderately complex processes, programs or applications, and may lead exploration of alternative business solutions for less complex processes, programs or applications to crate, maintain and enhance business value. Works closely with system analysts to help create Proof Of Concepts (POCs) and alternative.
Reviews, edits, analyze and create detailed documentation of business systems and user needs. Responsible for writing all documentation in clear and well organized manner. Develops key project deliverables including requirements specifications, use cases, system test cases, training and documentation and user manuals for projects of for low to moderately complex. Supports the production of Requirements Traceability Matrixes (RTM) and RTM gap analysis reports for complex enhancements, automations and implementations. May produce RTM and RTM gap analysis reports for less complex enhancements, automations and implementations.
Use project management techniques to establish roles and responsibilities, monitor project and request status and workload, and ensure deliverables of high quality, effectiveness and timeliness. Manages assigned enhancements, automations and implementations from concept through implementation. Creates, develops and maintains project schedules for key deliverables by developing project plan, monitoring milestone completion and coordinating project progress. May lead for less complex enhancements, automations and implementations.

Required: This position requires a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Business or relevant work experience in business analysis, systems analysis and/or testing background and 3-6 years of direct Business Analyst experience.

• Experience in business process analysis, Work flow, task analysis, User acceptance testing and requirements analysis.
• Proven ability to elicit, document, analyze and verify requirements.
• Strong experience with testing concepts.
• Technical writing experience and training experience.
• Prior experience leading business/technology enhancements, automations and implementations.

• Experience in accurately modeling requirements using at least one if not more of the following: Functional Decomposition, Data Flow Diagrams, User Context Diagrams, Activity Diagrams, Decision Needs, Workflow modeling, Use Cases, Use Case Model Survey and Use Case Specification, Process Modeling, Prototyping
• Experience in coaching and mentoring other associates as well as leading small teams of junior analysts.

Required Abilities/Skills:
• Use industry standard requirements gathering and modeling techniques to understand and communicate the needs of the product’s users
• Relevant business and systems subject matter expertise.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
• Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to build consensus and agreement and bring resolution to contentious issues and entrenched interests.
• Ability to lead problem-solving discussions.
• Attention to detail and excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Advanced written and verbal communication skills.
• Excellent organizational skills and ability to set priorities and handle multiple projects concurrently. Proven Project Management skills.
• High level of analytical and problem solving skills
• Extensive PC skills including Microsoft office software such as Word, Power Point, MS Project, Visio, and Excel.
• Experience with Requirements Traceability Matrixes (RTM) and RTM gap analysis.

Preferred:

CMG Financial is looking for a highly motivated, organized, and self-driven Business Analyst to join our growing digital transformation team. We’re looking for someone who is passionate about fintech, integrating systems, emerging technologies, and customer service; is an excellent communicator; and can balance the multiple demands of a fast-growing company.

The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for a full range of activities from leading small to mid-size projects to assisting on larger more complex projects related to internal IT, Marketing, and BI departments; building a coalition of internal resources to achieve objectives; defining and managing the quality of deliverables; and managing communications, project plans, escalation, and change control.. The focus of this position is to work closely with the business units to gain in-depth understanding of the business strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates.

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for reviewing assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES, including, but not limited to, the following:
Demonstrate up-to-date expertise in Information Systems and apply this to the development, execution and improvement of action plans by providing advice and guidance to others in the application of information and best practices
Assess business process and system inefficiencies
Define project scope, goals, and deliverables that support internal business goals
Communicate project status to internal stakeholders and leadership in a clear and concise manner
Measure project performance using appropriate metrics
Identify, create and facilitate process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level; focusing on quality improvement and data management; ensuring data is reliable and valid; developing process improvements or re-engineering and recommending elimination; integrating new systems and processes with existing ones; and partnering with internal and external customers to ensure systems provided meet the long-term business strategies
Understanding and using APIs for various systems
Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors/subcontractors
Research, assess, compare, and prepare RFP requirements for potential vendor partners
Collaborate closely with developers to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during QA process
Provide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilities
Facilitate steering committee meetings, project planning meetings, & recurring team meetings
Support system conversions, upgrades, enhancements
Serve as a liaison between Operations and IT to assist or gather business requirements needed for system modifications, enhancement and implementations
Understand and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders
Ability to analyze and synthesize business requirements, including recognizing patterns and conceptualizing processes
Identify ways to increase adoption and customer satisfaction
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE
BS/BA degree; technology-related preferred
MS preferred
5+ years of application systems development and implementation
3+ years of experience required in leading software projects and leveraging agile practices
Must have experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the business
Ability to easily motivate and inspire team members, peers, stakeholders, and executives
Strong project management, ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at any given point, strong relationship building skills & communication skills

For over 25 years, CMG Financial has delivered the personal service of a local lender while leveraging the resources of a national brand. CMG Financial has earned 2000+ Zillow reviews praising their reliable preapprovals, ease of transaction, on-time closings, transparency, and communication throughout the mortgage process.

Throughout the mortgage industry, CMG Financial is known for its innovation of products and continued investment in technology. Job Title: Business Systems Analyst
Department: Information Technology
Reports to: IT Manager
FLSA Status: Full Time
Date: May 21, 2020
Requisition#: 20-0010
SUMMARY:

The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for eliciting the business requirements of the customer to assist in determining new product offerings, product changes, workflow enhancements, and solutions to business problems. He/she is responsible for requirements development and requirements management in accordance with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) best practices. This individual will act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams, and support teams. The Business Systems Analyst must have the ability to plan, develop, and execute project plans to ensure timely delivery of solutions and must have knowledge and experience in industry best practices.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (includes, but not limited to):
Capture business requirements and provide quality documentation of detailed user requirements for the design and development of software applications.
Convert business requirement to technical requirements and translate them to use cases or user stories.
Ensure requirements are traceable for the testing team and understandable for development teams.
Design wire frames, graphics, and screen mock-ups.
Participate in usability evaluations and understanding of user-centered design.
Work with both the business and the technical sides to ensure the requirements are understood and executable.
Plan, arrange, and control meetings, workshops and relations with user staff during system investigations and throughout subsequent development work.
Perform systems testing and quality assurance activities to ensure that technology solutions deliver quality products.
Develop project plans, and manage and prioritize tasks to keep project on track.
Act as the primary interface to the business and other technical teams. Guide and coach the business stakeholders through the requirements gathering process.
Facilitate workshops required to understand and outcome, detailed requirements, and solution behavior.
Provide clarification and act as a point of reference for business requirement inquiries by solution design and project delivery teams.
Perform other business analysis duties as required.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration or equivalent experience.
• Minimum five (5) years of experience working in a business analysis capacity, preferably in software development.
• Minimum four (4) years of project management experience including development of project plans, and managing deliverables.
• High competency in requirement management methodologies with a strong emphasis on customer service both internal and external.
• Strong understanding of technical and functional requirements practices and solutions.
• Experience and working knowledge of working of Agile, Waterfall, and other software development methodologies.
• Working knowledge of business analysis principles and methodologies.
• Proven ability to work cross-functionally to capture requirements and resolve issues.
• Excellent organizational skills with an ability to work simultaneously on a number of assignments when required.
• Demonstrated ability to work independently and effectively with minimal supervision.
• Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
• Proactive and results-driven orientation.
• High degree of professionalism and strong work ethic.
• Excellent oral and written communications skills; tactful and effective customer communications.
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
Agile development methodology
Scrum master certification
Guidewire InsuranceNow (SurePower)
PMP certification
TO APPLY

Please send a resume to hr@clements.com; include “Business Systems Analyst” in the subject line of the email.

TACG is a driven Alaskan Native 8(a) professional consulting firm that focuses on employee growth in collaboration with client delivery. Our portfolio ranges from support work with Health and Human Services to highly skilled Defense consulting. We have recently been awarded as one of INC.5000's fastest growing companies, and received multiple best places to work awards. How can you help shape TACG?

Position Summary:
TACG is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to identify, research, and model current and future state business processes to support definition of functional, business, and information/data requirements. The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for the development, documentation and delivery of customized functional requirements documentation and supporting data requirements, specifically around the Foreign Military Sales processes. In this role, you will be a part of an agile process team working with various stakeholders, to build detailed supply chain/logistics As-Is process views to better understand the current business environment to support identification of potential transformation opportunities. The Senior Business Analyst will document this information, analysis, findings, and recommendations using various technical reports including business process models.

Responsibilities:
Meet with management, decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and systems goals, and identify and resolve systems issues.
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in operating systems across the organization.
Work on enhancement requests, gather business requirements, prepare functional requirement and design documents.
Ensure compatibility and interoperability of proposed systems.
Create systems integration models, specifications, flow diagrams, and charts to provide direction to analysts and developers
Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.
Develop test plans as necessary.
Assist users in testing of patch application, proposed fixes, and enhancements.
Provide orientation and training to end users for modified and new systems.
Prepare and/or update process and procedures documents.
Coordinate support and work with vendors on systems issues related to customized or COTS solutions (potentially Oracle)
Review and analyze existing supply chain management/logistics As-Is and To-Be process models, enterprise architecture artifacts and other program documentation
Facilitate Subject Matter Expert (SME) interviews / workshops for business process re-engineering by developing and documenting current state supply chain management business processes while identifying gaps in current As-Is process flows.
Research applicable law, regulation, and policy related to the execution and compliance of business processes.
Develop and document process model / business architecture content and artifacts consistent with generally accepted modeling standards.
Perform peer reviews of process modeling and enterprise architecture artifacts.
Prepare written and/or briefed reports to support the activities performed.
Required Knowledge, Skills and Experience:
Strong analytical and research capabilities.
Strong presentation development and delivery and relationship building skills at all levels, including working, managerial and executive.
Expert knowledge of Microsoft Visio 2010.
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite.
10 years of broad/diverse background and experience in business process improvement/re-engineering, business process modeling, requirements analysis, and/or enterprise architecture.
Must have at least 5-8 years DoD experience and worked in a numerous AF PMOs; understands documentation required from FMO to successfully implement a new system.
In-depth experience around FMS processes, procedures and IT systems.
Education & Certification Requirements:
Four year degree in IT, logistics, business or management.
Preferred Skills:
Department of Defense or Air Force supply chain management / logistics functional knowledge.
Experience in Air Force Security Assistance Cooperation (AFSAC) Directorate / Foreign Military Sales (FMS) processes and procedures.
Experience in Air Force / FMS functional areas of supply chain/logistics, financial management, or acquisition.
Hands on ERP implementation experience as a Subject Matter Expert or Systems Implementer.

Through its administration of the $10 billion Universal Service Fund (USF) programs on behalf of the FCC, USAC works to promote the availability of quality services at just, reasonable and affordable rates and to increase access to advanced telecommunications services throughout the nation. Specifically, the USF programs provide funding for the expansion of telecommunications and broadband access to rural communities and health care facilities, schools and libraries across the country, and low income households. Through program administration, auditing, and outreach, USAC works with contributors, service providers, and program beneficiaries to achieve the program goals articulated by the FCC for each of these programs.
The FCC has reformed the USF to support further investment in and access to evolving broadband infrastructure, making the programs a primary vehicle to support this critical national priority. USAC, as the administrator of the USF, plays a critical role in supporting the ambitious vision to ensure that all citizens in the United States have access to high-speed broadband. The organization has approximately 500 employees with an operating budget of more than $200 million. USAC works in close partnership with the FCC and other federal and state partners to support the achievement of the USF program goals.
USAC administers the USF programs—High Cost, Lifeline, Rural Health Care, and Schools and Libraries. USAC strives to provide efficient, responsible stewardship of the programs, a key national asset in making important telecommunications and Internet services available to consumers, health care providers, schools, and libraries throughout the United States. The program divisions are supported by additional USAC personnel in Finance, General Counsel, Information Systems, Internal Audit, the Enterprise Program Management Office and Human Resources. Consistent with FCC rules, USAC does not make policy for or interpret unclear provisions of statutes or the FCC’s rules.
Universal service is paid for by contributions from telecommunications carriers, including wireline and wireless companies, and interconnected Voice over Internet Protocol providers, including cable companies that provide voice service, based on an assessment of their interstate and international end- user revenues. These contributions are most typically passed through to consumers through a universal service fee line item on their telephone bills.
Additional information on USF programs can be found at: http://www.usac.org/about/about/who-we-are/default.aspx
USAC offers a comprehensive benefits package, ongoing professional development opportunities, including vacation and sick leave.
USAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Only principals will be accepted. No agencies please.
To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume, click the “Apply For This Job Online” button.
USAC employees are passionate about our mission. Our work contributes to the success of all Americans. We’ve worked together to build a culture that is collaborative, ambitious, outcome-oriented, and feedback-focused.

Summary

We are searching for a skilled Data Analyst for our data team who can convert complex production data into database tables structured to meet the needs of our business analysts. The end goal is to construct tables and reports which will be used by business analysts to promote data driven decisions to maximize revenue in an ever-growing subscription business. A strong understanding of relational databases is required as well as the ability to manipulate multiple data sources into clean, accurate, and actionable tables which lay the foundation for dashboards that drive our company’s KPI’s.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Works heavily in our SQL database, manipulating data from its raw format into new tables. Will help structure the formatted data such that business analysts can visualize this information to derive key business insights. Large emphasis on data pre-processing.
Strong analytical skills with ability to analyze and project sales, subscriber, and engagement data. Performs competitive analysis, reviews industry information for current trends and opportunities. Works closely with analytics teams to develop comprehensive analytical reports to enable data-driven decisions to increase engagement and conversions of target customer segments.
Strong ability to determine how raw data needs to be structured in order to produce high-level aggregated reports in specific layouts.
Automates and updates tables on a daily basis via scripts (python, R, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with ability to analyze and interpret data
Works closely with the Director of Revenue on pressing needs and current projects
Transform complex data sets into easy-to-use metrics in a data visualization platform (Tableau, Excel, Google Sheets, other visualization tools)
Ad hoc reporting in SQL as needed
Performs other duties as assigned by management
Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Strong analytical and critical thinking mindset
Highly proficient in SQL and complex queries (Joining multiple tables, CTE’s, subqueries, CASES, derived fields)
In-depth understanding of Microsoft Office, especially Excel and Google Office Suite. Can quickly manipulate data in Excel and build summaries of datasets. (Pivot tables, functions, charts, other aggregation methods, etc)
Written and oral communication skills, creativity, and attention to detail are a must
Works well as part of a team
Quick learner and takes initiative, self driven
Displays confidence and learns quickly, open to feedback and direction
Can provide examples of past work in transforming complex raw data via SQL into tables easily analyzed and interpreted by the end user.
Works well under pressure
Ability to bridge business objectives to technical specifications


Education and/or Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, MIS, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field
3 years of relevant experience preferred
Language Skills

Ability to effectively and accurately present information to customers, coworkers, and managers.

Reasoning Ability

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

At PEMCO it’s all about people, starting with our customers. We’re a mutual insurance company owned by our Northwest policyholders and protecting their dreams since 1949. We believe in listening to our customers and showing that we understand them in ways that others don’t.

As a Senior Business Systems Analyst at PEMCO, you’ll be responsible for providing consultation to business unit managers to determine technical solutions to business problems, by conducting operational and organization studies on business units. The position applies a thorough knowledge of a business unit and knowledge of systems technology to identify and design improvements for computer-based systems.

At PEMCO you’ll enjoy the benefits of a smaller company – sharing ideas, learning and seeing the impact of your work – while competing with the big guys and enjoying positive work-life balance. We’re a company of 500+ relationship-focused, community-minded people, serving our policyholders from our office in South Lake Union. Come join us!

Manage stories in a sprint to ensure a continuous workflow to developers and quality assurance team members; perform complex analysis using data and present data analysis results using robust presentation and/or dashboarding
Meet with a variety of business leaders to identify and document business requirements and understand business impacts of implementing new technology platforms and application upgrades
Negotiate agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business units and the technical staff from initial requirements to final implementation
