Sr. Reporting Analyst - Onsite

Full Time, FTE: 1;
Administration Center
Fairfield, CA
This is an onsite role in Fairfield California.
Individuals in the Enterprise Information Management (EIM) Senior Reporting Analyst role will work onsite at our corporate office in Fairfield, California identifying business intelligence (BI), reporting, and analytics needs. They work closely with business users and IT teams to turn data into actionable information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. It is essential that EIM Senior Reporting Analysts build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issues. They provide information that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to users, preferably in a self-service format. EIM Senior Reporting Analysts educate and train business users to use the data as an analytical tool.
EIM Senior Reporting Analysts work with business users to determine business requirements and establish priorities. This includes working with stakeholders to identify and document the transactional systems; create and maintain core definitional information through, master data management (MDM), data quality management, and information governance functions; and define, build, and manage analytics environments through the building of data models, data marts, and the use of BI tools. This individual is accountable for facilitating information gathering, documentation and presentation of findings to all levels of management, and will be considered a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the information contained within the Enterprise Information Management team as appropriate.
EIM Senior Reporting Analysts understand how data is turned into information and knowledge and how that knowledge supports and enables key business processes. They must have an understanding of the business environment and an interest in going beyond the obvious, delving into the source, the definition, philosophy, and foundational roots of a data element in order to create actionable information. The individual in this role must demonstrate a proficiency level sufficient to apply competencies effectively in the following domains: Business Intelligence; Analytics and Reporting, ETL Processes, Enterprise Data Warehousing, Information Quality; Master Data Management and Information Governance. They must work well within a team environment.



JOB SPECIFICATIONS
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in healthcare administration, business administration, information systems, computer science, or related field.
Master’s degree preferred.

Licensure:
None required.

Experience:
Minimum of one year of healthcare experience in a reporting analyst role.
Five (5) to seven (7) years of experience with business intelligence, relational databases, data mining, analytics and report writing.
Three (3) years of experience with master data management, data quality, and data governance functions.
In-depth knowledge of one or more healthcare business functional areas.

Skills:
Experience with understanding business requirements and collaborating in finding technical solutions.
Experience creating ad-hoc reports and analyses and writing SQL queries.
Ability to extract data from databases and data warehouses for reporting and to facilitate sharing between multiple data systems.
Proficient in the use of query and reporting analysis tools. Business Objects: WebI, Universe Designer, Central Management Console a plus.
Experience with Cerner Reporting tools including Discern Analytics (DA, DA2), CCL, and Explorer.
Experience with Tableau or QlikView a plus.
Ability to standardize data collection by developing methods for database design and validation reports.
Proficient in writing requirements and other technical documents, functional specifications and preparing business process flows.
Ability to communicate effectively with both business partners and IT professionals. Strong ability to explain advanced data concepts to database architects, non-technical end users, and senior executives.
Ability to apply analysis and creative thinking when solving problems.
Ability to multitask, meet deadlines, prioritize requests, and work independently.
Familiar with systems development life cycle (SDLC), change management and agile methodology.
Ability to foster and support a culture of innovation and excellence in the Enterprise Information Management group.

Interpersonal Skills:
The NorthBay Way is a set of value-based behaviors that are to be consistently demonstrated and role modeled by all employees that work at NorthBay Healthcare.The NorthBay way principles consist of Caring, Communication, Collaboration, and Competence.
Able to communicate in an effective and professional manner with co-workers, vendors, associates and other departments.
Able to control tense situations to remain focused on the problem at hand.

Please review the following job description:
Provide the highest level of systems analysis design and support for interfacing business and computer application systems, including integration with databases and data warehouses. Develop or modify procedures to solve complex business problems considering client needs, computer equipment capacity/limitations, operation time and form of desired results. Lead projects with moderate budgets.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

1. Lead analysis effort to gather, formulate, define and design solutions to complex business problems.

2. Analyze requirements, plan and design applications by using techniques such as structured analysis, data modeling and information engineering.

8. Maintain an expert knowledge of testing documentation and execution skills.

9. Coordinate the installation of application enhancements/releases of net new applications of low complexity.

10. Expand or modify applications to serve new purposes or improve work flow.

11. Assess the usefulness of pre-developed application packages and adapt them to a user environment.

12. Maintain an expert business and operations knowledge of direct and associated clients in order to add value in analyzing complex and highly integrated projects.

2, Ten years of experience or equivalent proficiency in application analysis and design.

3. Experience with SQL, PL/SQL.

4. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

5. Ability to work independently or as a member of a team.

6. Ability to direct and train other team associates.

7. Demonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications, such as Microsoft Office software products.

8. Ability to travel, occasionally overnight.

Informatica

Scrum

Agile

About the Position

This position plays a key role in the delivery of services to WatchGuard’s customer base. You are a front-line intrusion analyst for small and midsize businesses, spending your days engaging with customers on their WatchGuard infections, adding intelligence to our platform, and writing/speaking about what you find.

Daily - you will review intelligence reports, triage alerts generated by WatchGuard, engage and support customers based upon these infections, and draft up blog posts on your findings. If you have a website or blog with samples of previous work, please include it in your application!

Position Responsibilities
Analyzing alerts generated by WatchGuard products such as phishing attacks or malware infections
Reviewing threat intelligence from both customers and public sources on the internet
Assessing attack trends and their significance for our customers
Writing articles and blogs to describe attacks, how to respond to them, and how to take preventative action
Communicating with users of WatchGuard products to help them manage risks and attacks
Other duties and projects assigned
Skills and Qualifications
Strong communication skills, particularly written
Ability to translate technical concepts into concise language that is understandable by laymen readers
A solid understanding of network protocols and their use in malware
A talent for identifying, documenting, and describing attacks and trends in the security field
A desire to share your knowledge and education effectively
Ability to communicate in another language a major plus, but not required
Experience
Bachelor’s degree in cybersecurity, networking, or another technical field preferred
Experience with Wireshark, Virus Total, Any.Run, IDA Pro, OllyDbg is a plus
Why Work for WatchGuard?

At WatchGuard we create smart security, simply done. We’re a leader in building cyber security hardware, wireless, and cloud solutions that protect small and midsize businesses, and distributed enterprises worldwide. Our award-winning network security solutions provide layered, enterprise-grade protection that is easy to deploy and manage. Whether you are an industry veteran, or at the beginning of your career, now is an amazing time to work in the security industry, and there’s never been a better time to be at WatchGuard.

We love solving the industry’s toughest challenges, and our innovation keeps our customers ahead of increasingly sophisticated hackers, which has fueled record revenues. We’re heavily reinvesting in the company, and driving rapid acceleration across all aspects of our business. As a result, our employee base has nearly doubled in the last three years, organically and through acquisition.

Our company culture places intense focus on our customers and employees. From the newest employee to our CEO, you'll find that each person at WatchGuard embodies our core values: accountability, passion for success, community building, and maintaining a customer focus in all things.

WatchGuard Technologies is privately backed by equity firms Vector Capital and Francisco Partners, and has headquarters in Seattle, Washington, with offices throughout North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, and Latin America

Financial Analyst

What you can tell your friends when they ask you what you do?

App Annie is looking for a talented Financial Analyst to support the financial planning and analysis team. You will work with multiple executive stakeholders to define and deliver insightful metrics, analyses, forecasts, and operational finance support. The successful candidate will possess a self-starter attitude with keen strategic thinking plus analytical abilities with strong communication and project management skills; wants to work, support and thrive in a key position that has an excellent career path within an enterprise SaaS business.

How will you be doing this?

Business Partnering & Corporate Finance
Assisting in the development and maintenance of a long-range strategic and financial plan used by the company to measure performance in key business areas
Providing financial analysis, business modeling and decision support to senior executives and business leaders with recommendations to solve business issues and improve the strategic, operational, and financial model of the business
Preparing budgets and forecasts, internal management reporting and dashboards, and ad-hoc financial analysis
Supporting our Sales Operations team in calculating quarterly commissions
Designing and implementing scalable FP&A and financial processes that support the needs of a rapidly growing business to build efficiencies
Developing and reporting weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual P&Ls - Coordination, consolidation, reporting, and analysis of the total company P&L within Adaptive Insights financial planning tool
Developing department-level budgets and reporting variance analysis to company leaders
Preparing monthly corporate close packages and quarterly board materials and assisting in reviewing financials
What will you bring to the team?
Organized, detail-oriented, and able to multi-task with limited supervision
A well-rounded top performer, combination of analytical and communication skills, execution-oriented and attention to timelines
Superior analytical and modeling skills, Strong proficiency in Excel
Experience with Xactly a plus
BS/BA in Business, Economics, Finance or Accounting preferred
2+ years of corporate finance, accounting, or sales compensation experience, preferably in a high tech environment
Ability to present complex financial analysis in a clear and compelling message
Energy and creativity are key characteristics that describe you and the projects you lead. You make it happen. Boom!
You're an app fanatic, positively curious and a technology enthusiast.
What do we offer?
Competitive compensation.
All the tech tools you need to succeed: a new smartphone and Mac laptop.
A 401(K) plan to help you plan for your future.
Great health, dental and vision insurance packages to fit your needs to ensure you're happy and healthy.
A yearly fitness stipend that will keep you up and moving.
Commuter benefits that make getting to and from work a breeze.
Employee referral bonuses so you'll get the opportunity to work with friends (and get some extra cash in your pocket!).
Why choose App Annie?

App Annie is the industry's most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. The company created the mobile app data market and has been fueling world-class, mobile-first businesses since 2010. App Annie's mission is to power B2C companies' mobile transformation and enable clients to deliver winning consumer experiences. More than 1,000 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the gold standard to revolutionize their mobile business. The company is headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide.

Sr. IT Business Analyst, Supply Chain

West Hills, CA

HELP US BRING THE GIFT OF HEALTH TO LIFE.

Working at Pharmavite is an experience like no other. With a focus on complete nutrition for all, each endeavor is urgent and every day counts. You'll have the opportunity to work on the #1 selling national vitamin and supplement brand, Nature Made, as well as an exciting portfolio of other products that are shaping the future of the healthy living industry. Consumer-driven innovation, high quality products and a promising portfolio, all driven by a team with a shared sense of purpose -- that's Pharmavite. Join us to bring the gift of health to life.

The Sr. IT Business Analyst, Supply Chain will be a strategic advisor that drives engagement across the organization to implement, maintain and maximize the value of IT technology investments. Working collaboratively with the business partners to understand their needs and with other IT partners to define, develop and deliver cost effective and efficient solutions. The Sr. IT Business Analyst, Supply Chain reports to Sr. Manager, Enterprise Solutions.

At Pharmavite, every employee has a stake in bringing the gift of health to life. We never shy away from disruptive innovation and tough challenges, because we're making real nutrition accessible to consumers everywhere in new and different ways. And because we know every nutriment we make matters, we have to make sure each one is just right before we make it ready for use. With this great responsibility comes the satisfaction that your contribution makes a real and significant difference.

Critical contributions this role is counted on to deliver include:
Build strong working relationships to facilitate cross functional collaboration.
Transform requirements into technical solutions that add value while maintaining current systems.
Execute priorities to align with strategies.
Maintain good functional and technical change management practices.
The ideal candidate will be recognized as a key contributor to the Supply Chain Planning and IT teams as well as the larger Operations organization. You are people, process and systems oriented and love identifying and delivering quality solutions that drive business transformation, while executing and maintaining the highest standards for technical solutions & support. You also enjoy working with and motivating others to success -- regardless of reporting lines and are comfortable operating with any staff/management level in the organization.

You'll be most successful in this role if you have:
A demonstrated deep understanding of Supply Chain Planning processes & technology with a track record of successfully delivering technical solutions to meet business requirements.
The ability to foster collaboration by building strong relationships and seamlessly working cross functionally on solutions that transform and add value.
A proven ability to act as both a functional and technical consultant to provide independent perspective with courage to challenge partners to think outside the box and drive appropriate solutions.
Project Management expertise with a delivery mindset.
The ability to prioritize the roadmap based on strategy and value while defining & executing actionable plans.
It's an exciting time in Pharmavite's history. After 45 years of leading the healthy living industry with award-winning vitamins and supplements, the company has experienced great success and has gained the trust of consumers, healthcare professionals, and retailers alike. But there's more growth ahead of us than behind us, and for our employees this translates into opportunity. Our rapidly changing business enables employees to take on new challenges and transform Pharmavite for the future.

In order to take on these challenges, you'll need to have:
Supply Chain Planning functional Subject Matter Expertise.
Functional & technical subject matter expertise in Oracle ASCP, Demantra and JD Edwards.
Strong business process analysis & facilitation skills.
Systems analysis, design, testing, training, change control & implementation expertise.
Proven systems support & troubleshooting.
7 years' experience as an Information Technology Business Solutions Analyst involved directly with supporting the business teams.
OUR OFFER:

Here, career paths aren't predefined and bureaucratic limitations don't exist -- you have the opportunity to grow, learn from industry pioneers, and develop the way you want to. Pharmavite is investing more in the development of our team -- to help us deliver on our purpose and help you achieve your career aspirations. Our environment is geared to fuel curiosity, encourage experimentation, and generate learning as this is the way we develop ourselves and our organization.

Pharmavite is committed to meeting the needs of our employees and their families with a Total Rewards package that's as comprehensive as the vitamins and supplements we deliver to consumers. With competitive compensation programs and standout benefits, we provide employees with optimal health and well-being -- as well as peace of mind. These rewards -- plus our new recognition program -- ensure employees feel supported both at work and home.

Join Us:

Visit Pharmavite.com/careers to learn more about our mission and discover an opportunity that's right for you. Health and wellness begins with us.

Pharmavite is an equal employment and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to their protected veteran or disabled status, or any protected status. We do not discriminate in employment based on race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other basis covered by applicable law. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

The Information Technology (IT) department for the San Manuel Band of Mission Indians (the Tribe) provides and supports a leading edge technology infrastructure to the organization in support of ever changing technological advances in the Gaming industry and the Tribes business enterprises. The ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is key to the success of the IT staff to meet the demands of this technically proficient and high demand department.
Reporting to the IT Business Finance Manager, the IT Financial Analyst will work closely with internal customers and the Information Technology department in understanding and interpreting financial data. This position is a key role in the maintenance, interpreting and documenting of all technology financial information for the overall purpose of meeting departmental and organizational objectives.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

1. Perform financial analysis to support short term and long range strategic plans and operating budgets.

2. Assist with IT month-end closing activities to include, reporting on all IT financial expenses, invoice accruals and research, prepaid expenses, capitalization and depreciation of Technology assets.

3. Perform detailed analysis including budget vs. actual, return on investment, cost and time estimates, build vs. buy, and monitor business issues that may impact the bottom line.

4. Work as a liaison with other departments to review and analyze financial impacts, prepare project implementation justifications, help prepare documentation for the financial approval process, and support the annual budgeting process.

5. Collaborate with IT Business Finance Team to review contractual financial obligations and ensure accuracy and meet organizational objectives and budgets.

6. Review department financials and utilize reporting software to prepare reporting packages; analyze, interpret and make recommendations to IT Management.

7. Create ad-hoc reports to help improve financial data analysis and reporting; month-end, quarterly and year to date.

8. Collaborate internally with IT Project Management Office to maintain accurate financial reports of IT project budgets.

9. Understand and help others understand how the departments finances impact other departmental operational procedures, developments and ultimately the organizations financials.

10.Attend key meetings and other special projects and perform other duties as assigned. Keep financial data secure, and document activity and procedures for future reference.

Education/Experience/Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field required from an accredited university.
Minimum of three (3) years of experience within the Information Technology Industry.
Three (3) years prior experience as a Financial Analyst or other types of analytical work such as auditor, business analyst, or project management.
Equivalent combination of education and progressive, relevant and direct experience may be considered in lieu of educational requirement.
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Familiarity with statistical and/or visualization tools (Tableau, SAS, etc.).
Experience with financial analysis, auditing and reporting.
Strong technical verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to create a positive and professional business relationship with internal and external clients as well as third-party service/product providers.
San Manuel Band of Mission Indians and San Manuel Casino will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 11990.

As one of the largest private employers in the Inland Empire, San Manuel deeply cares about the future, growth and well-being of its employees. Join our team today!

Boardwalk Pipelines, LP primarily provides transportation and storage of natural gas and liquids for our customers. Additional information about the Partnership can be found online at www.bwpipelines.com.

We are currently looking for a Sr. Analyst, SCADA Development & Support for our Houston, TX or Owensboro, KY office.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

*Responsible for the monitoring, maintenance, development, and support of a mission critical, high availability IT monitoring and control system (SCADA)

*Enhance and maintain all primary and peripheral systems that make up the Gas Control/Liquid Control SCADA environment

*Design, develop, deploy and support applications to meet the needs of primary and secondary internal customers

*Design and oversee the implementation of vendor and 3rd party supplied system enhancements/products to the mission critical system infrastructure

*Collaborate with applicable parties to configure, deploy, and troubleshoot remote devices and systems of varying types and complexity using all available resources in compliance with all applicable regulatory requirements

*Employ application development, SQL query and real-time database tools to interact with all SCADA/Gas and/or Liquid Control databases

*Create, modify and deploy the dynamic graphical data displays used by Gas/Liquid Control to monitor and control pipeline operations; coordinate and interface with Gas/Liquid Control to determine primary needs and objectives

*Develop and deploy all required interfaces and data sharing mechanisms with downstream systems - for example Gas/Liquid Management applications

*Ensure SCADA system integrity and maximize operational reliability and system availability; conduct evaluations and tuning of real-time control system operations

*Collaborate with Security, Systems and Database Administration staff to maximize the effectiveness of enhancement and maintenance efforts

*Develop and maintain reporting portfolio to meet regulatory and business requirements

*Provide 24x7 On-Call support for all critical systems

REQUIRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE:

*7 years’ experience in systems development, analysis, and support of large-scale SCADA environments

*5 years’ experience in report and display development

*Application development experience in a real-time operating environment

*Working knowledge of field devices, communications, architecture, data acquisition strategies, protocols, networks, control room management, alarm management and security

*Working technical knowledge of programming languages and database technologies

*Experience in IT or technical project management

*Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

*Ability to build relationships with IT and not-IT Personnel

*Highly self-motivated, self-directed and attentive to detail

*Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Computer Engineering, or related field

PREFERRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE:

*Familiarity with Honeywell PKS/Oasys DNA SCADA system deployments

*Familiarity with industry best practices in the SCADA / process control environment

*Knowledge of current software development tools and technologies in support of the SCADA environment

Summary of Position:

This position is contingent upon award - The Offensive Cyberspace Operations (OCO) Analyst position requires an understanding of security related system controls and an understanding of the various Government security policies including NIST SP 800-53A and DoD 8570.

Essential Job Functions: (not limited to duties as described – performs related duties as requested)
Plan, prepare, and execute action officer and senior-level conferences, meetings, workshops, and reviews in support of ongoing programs/projects related to CDID Cyber roles and responsibilities for developing capabilities for a joint network-enabled force. Present CM Cyber positions at conferences, boards, committees, panels, working groups, reviews and other forums as deemed appropriate.
Prepares written reports and analyses. Maintains military and analytical currency through continued formal and informal education. Remains cognizant of new developments and problems which impact DOD capabilities. Pursues professional development through continued education, business contacts, military literature and reports, and professional seminars, meetings, and briefings. Prepares memoranda, technical reports, and briefings embodying the results of group and individual work for presentation to CCOE senior bodies and top-level decision-makers.
Conduct research and analysis in support of capability requirements development.
Analyzes approved concepts and doctrine for the purpose of developing DOD OCO related universal tasks and determining OCO capability gaps.
Conducts research and analysis across multiple sources in order to establish the foundation for required OCO capability and architecture development, identify capability gaps, and generate DOTMLPF-P solutions such as doctrine (principles and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) development, organizational design changes, training initiatives, materiel solutions, leadership and education requirements, personnel solutions, and facilities renovation and design.
Develop network architectures and illustrate security measures.
Provide comprehensive expertise in offensive cyberspace operations, research and analysis, as well as, capability requirements development; integrate offensive cyberspace operations with electronical warfare, signals intelligence, and information operations.
Provide comprehensive expertise in offensive cyberspace operations, research and analysis, as well as, capability requirements development.
Produces concepts of operation, operational mode summaries/mission profiles, basis of issue guidance, and system training plans for systems within his/her area of focus.
Coordinates architecture product support for his/her related systems and works with the architect to develop appropriate operational views, capability views, architecture views, and system views.
Level of Supervision:
Must be able to function independently.
Provide supervision, overview, and general use training to all organization members and key leaders upon request.
Education & Experience: (or equivalent)
Candidate should possess technical, operational, and policy expertise in OCO (with focus on offensive infrastructure, tailored and close access, OCO tools development, and target analysis and development).
Possess a minimum of three (3) years of experience in conducting defensive cyberspace operations in support of USCYBERCOM, INSCOM, Army Cyber Command or NSA cyberspace operations.
Two (2) years of experience with force modernization efforts such as capability development, materiel development, requirements determination/development, and/or force development is preferred but not required.
Possess, a bachelor’s degree or higher. Degree will have a focus in computer science, information technology, information systems management or computer programing.
In lieu of aforementioned computer science related bachelor’s degree, a bachelor’s degree of any kind along with seven years’ experience in DCO.
License & Certifications:
Must be certified in one or more IAT Level III certifications (CISA, GSE, SCNA GCIH, CISSP).
Additionally, must possess at least one of the following certifications:
Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)

Offensive Security Certified Professional (OCSP)

Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills

Able to take proactive measures to prevent problems rather than reactive by nature

The Oracle System Analyst will be the main IT point of contact for the Arrow Global Services division for any enhancement requests, project work or production support involving Oracle EBS. This person will be the bridge between the business and the Oracle development/support teams using their analysis and knowledge of the business to communicate system requirements.

Primary IT point of contact for sales operations and engineering teams. Liaison with manufacturing and warehouse management teams.
Act as a liaison and escalation point for production support issues. Track production support metrics and trending
Lead bi-weekly calls to review open tickets with the business and development team. Troubleshoot recurring issues and assist with driving root cause determination
Lead process changes related to on-going enhancement processes and production support for efficiencies and customer satisfaction
Understand end-to-end business processes and the key integration points, work cross-functionally across different business processes, and understand challenges faced by business teams

5+ years working with Oracle ERP Modules (Supply Chain, Order Management, BOM, Logistics, Procurement, Planning and Manufacturing)
4 year Bachelors Degree

Excellent written and analytical skills
Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities
Must be self-motivated and organized. Ability to act independently under general guidance

Influence other teams without direct responsibility

We Make a Difference

As one of the top behavioral health EHR providers in the country, Qualifacts Systems, Inc. has been changing the health care industry since our founding in 2000. A 5-time honoree on the Inc. 5000 list, we have an entrepreneurial spirit born from our start-up roots, and an amazing team of down-to-earth people who are empowered to be successful in their jobs every day.

Collaboration with industry leaders and mentors is a routine part of what we do, with the focus of making a meaningful impact in peoples lives. Our people get the best from themselves and their peers in an open and supportive environment. Join us and Make a Difference!

Like other companies, we offer competitive salaries, comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans, a robust PTO plan, 401(k) plan with matching, and other goodies that are essential for downtown Nashville, such as free parking and Starbucks coffee. From lunch and learn sessions to on-site training to volunteer days, we provide opportunities to learn and to grow, and to Make a Difference in the community.

About the Position

Were looking for a talented Financial Analyst to join our high performing finance team to manage financial matters pertaining to the Information Technology department. The Financial Planning and Analysis Analyst will assist the IT leadership team in maximizing cost efficiencies by managing key costs and by supporting finance process. In addition to involvement in close, forecasting, and budgeting, this role will update executive reporting on how company resources are deployed to our strategic projects.

This new role to the finance team will report to the Director of FP&A.

Primary Responsibilities

Assist in preparing detailed annual budget and forecast with focus on key cost components such as hardware, software licenses and maintenance, and labor. Perform monthly variance to budget analysis.
Manage key expenses in the IT organization by tracking the staffing plan and navigating IT team members through vendor purchases.
Create and manage project budgets for strategic IT and product development projects. Perform monthly variance analysis for use in executive presentations.
Collaborate with accounting to manage adherence to labor capitalization policy and support monthly labor capitalization entry.
Other ad-hoc analysis and assignments as dictated by the needs of the finance team and the IT organization.

Qualifications
Bachelors degree, preferably in Finance; or equivalent work experience
Two plus years of related finance experience with emphasis in FP&A
Excellent Microsoft Excel and Power Point skills required, MS Access experience a plus
Quick learner and sharp attention to detail, very organized
Self motivated, strong work ethic, and reliable
Ability to work to work flexible hours during peak times, good time-management skills
Solid team player, helping out wherever needed
Preferred Qualifications
4+ years of FP&A work experience in support of an IT team.
Experience with Tableau (or similar BI tools)
SaaS Industry Experience
Operations under COVID-19

The onset of COVID-19 caused Qualifacts to adjust timelines on ambitious growth plans for 2020, but with careful management of resources we have not had to furlough or lay off staff. The company remains on a sound financial footing, and continues to pursue aggressive growth in all markets as opportunities present themselves.

In March we quickly transitioned to a 100% work-from-home stance in response to the threat from COVID-19. While Metro Nashville remains in Phases One or Two of its Reopening Roadmap plan, we will continue to work from home.

When Nashville moves into Phase Three, we will launch our own plan to slowly return to the office. This will begin with the voluntary return of a small number of employees. Eventually we will have everyone in the office up to 50% capacity on any day on a staggered schedule. At all phases, we will have in place appropriate social distancing measures, a policy for the use of masks and gloves, and enhanced cleaning procedures. As the threat to public health from COVID-19 declines, we will evaluate our return to normal workplace operations.

Hiring and Onboarding Practices

Currently all interviews are being conducted by phone or videoconference, with related communications taking place via email or phone. New Hire Orientation and other onboarding processes also are handled via email, videoconference and the use of online forms. New hires receive Qualifacts-issued laptops and other equipment for work in advance of onboarding, with virtual phone and videoconferencing software preloaded and ready for use.
Qualifacts provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We believe in providing employees with a work environment free of unlawful discrimination and harassment. In addition to federal law requirements, Qualifacts complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Job Title: SR. Enterprise Information Analytics and Reporting Analyst
Job Description:
SUMMARY DESCRIPTION OF POSITION:
The Sr. Enterprise Information Design Analyst will work across diverse ministry areas of Content Development,
Ministry Development, Donor Development, Human Resources, Technology, Finance, and Global Outreach to
implement the enterprise data and analytics strategy. The individual will work with the manager of EIM to drive
a common set of information governance principles, processes & tools to improve data integrity, quality,
governance, availability, and usability. The Individual will also work with the CRU Engineering team to design and
load the data warehouse. Managing information as an asset is critical to support operational excellence through
the integration of business systems and enabling CRM capabilities.

The responsibilities of the individual include the development and use of data systems, discover efficient ways to
organize, store and analyze data with attention to security and confidentiality, and fully grasp the complexity of
data management. This role is responsible for overseeing the implementation and governance of data
management goals, standards, best practices, processes, and technologies. This role will participate in the
planning, strategy, and governance of enterprise data and information management for FL. This position will
participate in the data management initiatives and provide guidance for the use of data and content as well as
representation of data stewards/owners. The SEIDA serves as a liaison between different teams within FL, and
between FL and its stakeholders with reference to EIM. The goal is to ensure proper governance and standards are
applied and championed to promote data quality, reduce administrative burden, ensure timely and secure access
to data, maintain interoperability across our systems, and leverage actionable insights from our data systems to
support our ministry goals and objectives.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
● Assist and speak into the data strategy development, data governance, and data management in
addition to the availability, usability, integrity, retention, and security of the information/data
employed throughout the organization.
● Participate in the Data Governance and Data Quality capabilities, and implementation of the
Enterprise Information Management strategy. This includes the defining of Business
Rules/Definitions and providing Control on how data is to be used enterprise-wide.
● Provide regular updates to EIM manager on progress, business impact in economic terms, and

FAMILYLIFE – a subsidiary of Cru
Job Description
potential issues.
● Maintain cradle-to-grave understanding of data inputs, processes, outputs and Data Flows.
● Architect and document data models, normalize data from various sources.
● Design and Document the ETL process that will be coded by CRU Data Engineers
● Build data visualizations and dashboard reports
● Strong knowledge of SQL and R code and Python
● Understanding of API Protocols and API use within the ETL process.
● Assist in the creation of business cases, including requirements and ROI for EIM projects
requiring funding.
● Provide guidance on what enterprise data is required to support business needs and can speak
to the funding required for enterprise data projects and programs.
● Educates the business and technical community with respect to data governance, its benefits
and how it will be phased in.
● Responsible for implementing the data strategy using metrics and key performance indicators
for his or her assigned ministry areas.
● Participates in the implementation of solutions to improve data quality, business intelligence
and reporting across FL.
● Collaborates in developing recommendations around policies, standards and framework for
data governance.
● Collaborates with partners across the ministry in developing and maintaining the data
governance and data quality structures ensuring we are meeting ministry needs while balancing
quality, risk and cost.
● Engages with the industry to learn about best practices, gain insightful competitive and
regulatory intelligence to help in building excellence in our governance and quality initiatives.
● Displays a balanced, cross-functional perspective, liaising with the business to improve
efficiency, effectiveness and productivity. This included addressing information and data literacy
to ensure the accuracy of the information provided to decision makers.
● Helps carry out FL’s vision, mission, and objectives by supporting the maturing of FL’s ability to
become data driven in its execution of the great commission.
● Actively and intentionally grow in his / her Christian faith.
● Maintain a positive witness for Christ.
● Share what God is teaching him or her.
● Consistently attend and participate in team / ministry devotional times.

Perform related duties or special projects as assigned

This job has no supervisory responsibilities

Job Summary:

This position is responsible for analyzing actual cost versus SAP standard cost variances. Analysis to include but not limited to, yield, labor, packaging and overhead costs. Communicates results directly with Operations Management. The accounting operations analyst will also assist in the development and the maintenance of SAP master product costing data through working directly with Operations Management and R & D staff. This position will also work closely with the business to develop and maintain performance indicators to track process and operational improvements. Such performance measurements might also include business growth,new products/customers/markets penetration, or revenue contributors from these new areas. There will also be an opportunity to evaluate capital investments using financial modeling techniques.

Essential Functions, Duties & Responsibilities:
Analyze actual versus SAP standard performance variances and help maintain subsequent reports.
Assist in the development, set-Up and maintenance of SAP routings (Labor).
Assist in the development, set-up and maintenance of SAP scrap factors (Yields).
Create ad-hoc costing scenarios for the purpose of cost impact evaluations of new materials or processes.
Coordinate the progression of releasing new materials in SAP
Perform work on the activity based costing (ABC) models for the Mount Olive Plant.
Assist with the facilitation of the annual budget process, monthly and quarterly reforecasts, and work with business leaders to determine necessary forecast adjustments and budget needs.
Prepare financial and business-related templates as well as analyze and research in such areas as financial and expense performance, rate of return, depreciation, etc.
Compile and prepare reports, graphs and charts of data developed.
Assist with special financial and business-related studies and collaborate with other departments in preparing analyses.
Analyze and investigate P&L and variance between plan/forecast and expected results.
Issue identification and problem resolution to ensure attainment of commitments and objectives.
Prepare various ad hoc analysis and projects to assist with the management of the business.
Develop various models and reports to enable operational tracking and improvement including driving and reporting on cost saving initiatives.
Evaluate and implement systems and processes, including budgeting, planning, reporting, analytical tools.
Perform inventory control related duties and fixed asset validation.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Product Costing knowledge preferred.
SAP system or other ERP systems knowledge preferred.
Knowledge of processing flow in protein industry, a plus.
Strong organizational skills required.
Ability to communicate at levels of the organization.
Self -driven with ability to multi-task and work with minimal supervision in a deadline-oriented environment.
Highly skilled in the use of computer software (e.g., Microsoft Office, AS400, SAP).
Education & Experience:
4 year (Bachelor) degree in Accounting or related field strongly preferred.
2-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in the poultry or protein industry strongly preferred.

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst - Madison - IT Shared Services
Job Description:
The Technical Business Analyst acts as an intermediary between IT project teams and business partners to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed. The Technical Business Analyst functions as the stakeholders’ advocate by providing objective evidence that system and application requirements are met.

Maintains on-going relationships with business partners to drive satisfaction with IT.
Works to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs through dialogue with business partners.
Clearly articulates and documents business requirements.
Translates business requirements into functional requirements utilizing a structured process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing change).
Maintains project requirements according to requirements management plan.
Supports applications and solutions delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate requirements and validate proposed solutions.
Reviews product design documentation to ensure that requirements are correct, unambiguous, and verifiable.
Assists in generating use cases/user stories to ensure that all functional requirements are captured.
Assesses the risks of various solutions.
Recommends solutions based on cost vs benefit analysis.
Develops and executes test plans.
Plans and supports user acceptance testing and user training.
Creates documentation to describe program evaluation, testing, correction, and objective evidence of meeting requirements.
Provides Level 3 systems and applications support.
Participates in system and data triage as necessary.
Monitors program performance after implementation to prevent reoccurrence of program operating problems and ensure efficiency of operation.
Proactively provides process improvement recommendations within a quickly evolving company.
Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues.
Work with outside vendors to deliver solutions.
Conducts compatibility tests with vendor and non-vendor-provided programs.
Apply strong analytical skills, prioritization skills, business intuition, and organizational ability.
Use excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to operate in a cross cultural and complex matrix environment, and ability to build consensus across functions.
Adaptable, open to change and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.
Apply capability for decision making in complex scenarios and for holding one-self and others accountable to those decisions.
Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.
Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures.
Regular and reliable attendance.
Ability to work nights and/or weekends.
Ability to work normal schedule of Monday through Friday during normal business hours.
Ability to lift up to 10 pounds for approximately 5% of a typical working day.
Ability to work in front of a computer screen and/or perform typing for approximately 90% of a typical working day.
Ability to comply with any applicable personal protective equipment requirements.
Ability to travel approximately 5% of working time.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science/MIS, Science, Healthcare-Related Science; or high school degree/general education diploma and 4 years of relevant experience in lieu of Bachelor's degree.
2+ years of professional work experience interfacing with customers directly and problem solving.
1+ year experience in a hands-on technical role supporting systems development, systems implementation, quality assurance, or similar experience.
Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship.
Demonstrated ability to perform the Essential Duties of the position with or without accommodation.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working as business analyst, quality analyst, or product owner on technology development projects.
Experience working under SDLC or other software-specific project management process.
Experience working with laboratory order cycle management, revenue cycle management, or healthcare engagement and communication systems.
Fast and enthusiastic learner.
Proficiency in development or implementation of Digital Workplace (intranet, collaboration, document management, project management, etc.) driven processes.

Sr. Analyst, SCADA Development & Support

KY-Owensboro Office GSP, 610 West 2nd Street, Owensboro, Kentucky, United States of America; TX-Houston Office GSP, 9 Greenway Plaza, Suite 2800, Houston, Texas, United States of America
Req #577

Wednesday, July 15, 2020

Boardwalk Pipelines, LP primarily provides transportation and storage of natural gas and liquids for our customers. Additional information about the Partnership can be found online at www.bwpipelines.com.

We are currently looking for a Sr. Analyst, SCADA Development & Support for our Houston, TX or Owensboro, KY office.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

*Responsible for the monitoring, maintenance, development, and support of a mission critical, high availability IT monitoring and control system (SCADA)

*Enhance and maintain all primary and peripheral systems that make up the Gas Control/Liquid Control SCADA environment

*Design, develop, deploy and support applications to meet the needs of primary and secondary internal customers

*Design and oversee the implementation of vendor and 3rd party supplied system enhancements/products to the mission critical system infrastructure

*Collaborate with applicable parties to configure, deploy, and troubleshoot remote devices and systems of varying types and complexity using all available resources in compliance with all applicable regulatory requirements

*Employ application development, SQL query and real-time database tools to interact with all SCADA/Gas and/or Liquid Control databases

*Create, modify and deploy the dynamic graphical data displays used by Gas/Liquid Control to monitor and control pipeline operations; coordinate and interface with Gas/Liquid Control to determine primary needs and objectives

*Develop and deploy all required interfaces and data sharing mechanisms with downstream systems - for example Gas/Liquid Management applications

*Ensure SCADA system integrity and maximize operational reliability and system availability; conduct evaluations and tuning of real-time control system operations

*Collaborate with Security, Systems and Database Administration staff to maximize the effectiveness of enhancement and maintenance efforts

*Develop and maintain reporting portfolio to meet regulatory and business requirements

*Provide 24x7 On-Call support for all critical systems

REQUIRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE:

*7 years’ experience in systems development, analysis, and support of large-scale SCADA environments

*5 years’ experience in report and display development

*Application development experience in a real-time operating environment

*Working knowledge of field devices, communications, architecture, data acquisition strategies, protocols, networks, control room management, alarm management and security

*Working technical knowledge of programming languages and database technologies

*Experience in IT or technical project management

*Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

*Ability to build relationships with IT and not-IT Personnel

*Highly self-motivated, self-directed and attentive to detail

*Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Computer Engineering, or related field

PREFERRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE:

*Familiarity with Honeywell PKS/Oasys DNA SCADA system deployments

*Familiarity with industry best practices in the SCADA / process control environment

*Knowledge of current software development tools and technologies in support of the SCADA environment

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

We Make a Difference

As one of the top behavioral health EHR providers in the country, Qualifacts Systems, Inc. has been changing the health care industry since our founding in 2000. Collaboration with industry leaders and mentors is a routine part of what we do, with the focus of making a meaningful impact in peoples lives. Our people get the best from themselves and their peers in an open and supportive environment. Join us and Make a Difference!

Like other companies, we offer competitive salaries, comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans, a robust PTO plan, 401(k) plan with matching, and other goodies that are essential for downtown Nashville, such as free parking and Starbucks coffee. About the Position

Were looking for a talented Financial Analyst to join our high performing finance team to manage financial matters pertaining to the Information Technology department. The Financial Planning and Analysis Analyst will assist the IT leadership team in maximizing cost efficiencies by managing key costs and by supporting finance process. In addition to involvement in close, forecasting, and budgeting, this role will update executive reporting on how company resources are deployed to our strategic projects.

This new role to the finance team will report to the Director of FP&A.

Primary Responsibilities

Assist in preparing detailed annual budget and forecast with focus on key cost components such as hardware, software licenses and maintenance, and labor. Perform monthly variance to budget analysis.
Manage key expenses in the IT organization by tracking the staffing plan and navigating IT team members through vendor purchases.
Create and manage project budgets for strategic IT and product development projects. Perform monthly variance analysis for use in executive presentations.
Collaborate with accounting to manage adherence to labor capitalization policy and support monthly labor capitalization entry.
Other ad-hoc analysis and assignments as dictated by the needs of the finance team and the IT organization.

Qualifications
Bachelors degree, preferably in Finance; or equivalent work experience
Two plus years of related finance experience with emphasis in FP&A
Excellent Microsoft Excel and Power Point skills required, MS Access experience a plus
Quick learner and sharp attention to detail, very organized
Self motivated, strong work ethic, and reliable
Ability to work to work flexible hours during peak times, good time-management skills
Solid team player, helping out wherever needed
Preferred Qualifications
4+ years of FP&A work experience in support of an IT team.
Experience with Tableau (or similar BI tools)
SaaS Industry Experience
Operations under COVID-19

The onset of COVID-19 caused Qualifacts to adjust timelines on ambitious growth plans for 2020, but with careful management of resources we have not had to furlough or lay off staff. The company remains on a sound financial footing, and continues to pursue aggressive growth in all markets as opportunities present themselves.

In March we quickly transitioned to a 100% work-from-home stance in response to the threat from COVID-19. While Metro Nashville remains in Phases One or Two of its Reopening Roadmap plan, we will continue to work from home.

When Nashville moves into Phase Three, we will launch our own plan to slowly return to the office. This will begin with the voluntary return of a small number of employees. Eventually we will have everyone in the office up to 50% capacity on any day on a staggered schedule. At all phases, we will have in place appropriate social distancing measures, a policy for the use of masks and gloves, and enhanced cleaning procedures. As the threat to public health from COVID-19 declines, we will evaluate our return to normal workplace operations.

Hiring and Onboarding Practices

Currently all interviews are being conducted by phone or videoconference, with related communications taking place via email or phone. New Hire Orientation and other onboarding processes also are handled via email, videoconference and the use of online forms. New hires receive Qualifacts-issued laptops and other equipment for work in advance of onboarding, with virtual phone and videoconferencing software preloaded and ready for use.

This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Job Summary:

This position is responsible for analyzing actual cost versus SAP standard cost variances. Analysis to include but not limited to, yield, labor, packaging and overhead costs. Communicates results directly with Operations Management. The accounting operations analyst will also assist in the development and the maintenance of SAP master product costing data through working directly with Operations Management and R & D staff. This position will also work closely with the business to develop and maintain performance indicators to track process and operational improvements. Such performance measurements might also include business growth,new products/customers/markets penetration, or revenue contributors from these new areas. There will also be an opportunity to evaluate capital investments using financial modeling techniques.

Essential Functions, Duties & Responsibilities:
Analyze actual versus SAP standard performance variances and help maintain subsequent reports.
Assist in the development, set-Up and maintenance of SAP routings (Labor).
Assist in the development, set-up and maintenance of SAP scrap factors (Yields).
Create ad-hoc costing scenarios for the purpose of cost impact evaluations of new materials or processes.
Coordinate the progression of releasing new materials in SAP
Perform work on the activity based costing (ABC) models for the Mount Olive Plant.
Assist with the facilitation of the annual budget process, monthly and quarterly reforecasts, and work with business leaders to determine necessary forecast adjustments and budget needs.
Prepare financial and business-related templates as well as analyze and research in such areas as financial and expense performance, rate of return, depreciation, etc.
Compile and prepare reports, graphs and charts of data developed.
Assist with special financial and business-related studies and collaborate with other departments in preparing analyses.
Analyze and investigate P&L and variance between plan/forecast and expected results.
Issue identification and problem resolution to ensure attainment of commitments and objectives.
Prepare various ad hoc analysis and projects to assist with the management of the business.
Develop various models and reports to enable operational tracking and improvement including driving and reporting on cost saving initiatives.
Evaluate and implement systems and processes, including budgeting, planning, reporting, analytical tools.
Perform inventory control related duties and fixed asset validation.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Product Costing knowledge preferred.
SAP system or other ERP systems knowledge preferred.
Knowledge of processing flow in protein industry, a plus.
Strong organizational skills required.
Ability to communicate at levels of the organization.
Self -driven with ability to multi-task and work with minimal supervision in a deadline-oriented environment.
Highly skilled in the use of computer software (e.g., Microsoft Office, AS400, SAP).

2-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in the poultry or protein industry strongly preferred.

Our Culture:


Stoneridge Software began with an idea: How can Microsoft implementations be done better? After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. As a Microsoft Gold Partner, weve developed a proven process for project delivery and a laser focus on long-term support to empower our clients success. We know how to work hard but we also know how important it is to balance work with family and the rest of our lives. Stoneridge Software has cultivated an atmosphere of trust, community, and support that includes a flexible working environment, unlimited vacation, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and even beer on-tap. These initiatives, and many more have resulted in numerous Best Work Place awards and happy team members. We focus on allowing our team members to be authentically themselves whether thats creative, serious or nerdy. Does this sound like a team you would like to be a part of?

What we are Looking for:


Stoneridge Software seeks a highly motivated, assertive and client centric Senior Project Manager/Organizational Change Management Consultant to join our growing team to lead & contribute to Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM implementations. This is a unique and blended role with a Project Management focus while also using their passion for people, culture, and thoughtful communications to guide organizations through their transformation strategies.

The Senior Project Manager/OCM Consultant is responsible for making the most efficient use of resources on the implementation, defining and managing quality of deliverables, managing communications, project plans, budget, escalation process, and change control. In addition, this person will design, develop, implement, and manage enterprise wide solutions that will drive changes to organizational units, roles, responsibilities, user adoption, documentation, and processes. The role is aimed at instilling new behaviors, positive attitudes, and strategic staffing to transform the people and the culture at each client organization. This person will work closely with the Stoneridge Software project teams as well as our clients to conduct introductory workshops on Why Do Organizations Need Change Management including impact on project success, managing employee resistance to change, increasing people dependent ROIs and building competencies for change into the organization.

A Day in the Life:
Lead and manage successful delivery of Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM projects
Project planning and execution, issue and risk management, stakeholder management, and developing and delivering effective communication
Lead the development of a formalized and actionable Change Management offering for all projects
Consult with Executive Stakeholders on projects to coach them on providing sponsorship and leadership for business transformations
Customize the Change Management offering to meet individual client and project needs and develop reports to monitor results and demonstrate value
Provide excellent service and build ongoing relationships with clients
Work in partnership with business counterparts on the client side to guide and provide a framework for communication, training, and successful project delivery
Work with our sales team to identify and cultivate opportunities and provide direction during the sales cycle
Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support our client's business goals
Understand client's resource capabilities and constraints, and adjust the project plan accordingly
Work in partnership with Stoneridge Delivery Team consultants to develop meaningful train-the-trainer content and knowledge transfer on projects to ensure our clients have the best transition experience possible
Develop and deliver project activities including scheduling, resourcing, backlog management, and proposal development
Manage team activities and project dependencies to ensure on time project deliverables
Organize and facilitate steering committee meetings, project planning meetings, and recurring team meetings
Lead and ensure the delivery team is practicing the Stoneridge Software implementation methodology including continuous improvement activities
Manage issues and escalations on projects
Plan and schedule consultants' work and negotiating resolution to resourcing conflicts
Work collaboratively with project teams and clients, including traveling to their locations
Set aside time for self-development by attending training or self-learning on key subjects
Preferred Qualifications
Proven experience leading at least two (2) successful full lifecycle Dynamics ERP Implementations (AX 2012, D365)
Great leadership and communication skills

We have been delivering industry-leading solutions for the payments, financial and telecommunications industries since 1990. We are the preferred supplier of networking, integrated data and voice services to many leading organizations in the global payments and financial communities, as well as a provider of extensive telecommunications network solutions to service providers.

We are a privately held company with a healthy balance sheet, secure assets and a loyal customer base that includes some of the largest global blue-chip companies in the world. Many of the world’s leading companies continue to count on us as their primary provider of a range of networking and communication services, enabling them to expand regionally, nationally and globally. We provide services to customers in over 60 countries throughout the world.

We manage some of the largest real-time community networks in the world, enabling industry participants to simply and securely interact and transact with other businesses, to access the data and applications they need, over managed and secure communications platforms. Our existing footprint supports millions of connections and provide access to critical databases. Our network securely blends private and public networking to enable customers to utilize a single connection for "one-to-many" and "many-to-many"connections over a global platform.

Since our launch we have helped our customers and communities of interest, requiring secure and reliable communications solutions, to evolve from legacy to leading-edge technologies. Today the company provides a full range of services from dedicated connections to managed IP network solutions, providing local support and global reach to medium and large enterprises and service providers.

The Slot Performance Analyst will provide insights and report on findings via data visualizations and stories derived from various sources related to project and initiative activities for the Slot Department. By exploring market trends, competitors, players, the Performance Analyst will help to foster a data driven environment through the creation of models and analysis that drive revenue, profit and rated slot play. This individual will coordinate with internal operations, external agencies and slot vendors to collect and retrieve data required for research projects.

Under the direction of the Slot Performance Manager, the Performance Analyst is responsible for creating and curating decision based reporting utilizing slot and player related data. The Performance Analyst will execute ad-hoc and recurring reports to inform on the efficacy of slot projects and to aid in the discovery of additional revenue generating opportunities as well as quantify anticipated benefits for prioritization.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Applies knowledge of gaming machines, gaming systems, slot accounting systems, and slot performance systems to provide procedures, analysis, reports and recommendations to Slot Management.
Build business intelligence, reports and dashboards using a combination of software such as Microsoft Excel, Tableau, SAS Enterprise Guide and VizExplorer that include customer behavior or trends based on slot and player data.
Conduct market research for determining what product is leading the industry, understanding customer needs, and analyzing competitors.
Generate reports that analyze customers, product, and project activities using charts, graphs, explanatory text and developed ROI formats.
Assists in the development of capital expenditure plans for slot product and components using ROI formats.
Regularly monitors and reports on the cost of acquisition of slot product and components.
Provides in-depth analytical reporting on slot financials on a recurring basis.
Creates advanced predictive models to measure expected effects of slot changes.
Provides current gaming information after careful vendor research of gaming components and systems of potential vendors and evaluates proposals.
Presents reports in meetings with staff and management.
Sets benchmarks for departmental goals/initiatives and measures efficacy via data reporting.
Perform special studies as assigned, including preparation of written and/or verbal reports.
Oversee all department presentation materials, including but not limited to, final reports, PowerPoint presentations, and all electronic presentation deliverables.
Perform other duties as assigned to support the efficient operation of the department.
Education/Experience/Qualifications
Bachelors degree required, Masters Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Business, Finance, Mathematics, or related field preferred.
One (1) year experience in slot operations, including machine set-up, evaluation and reporting, or equivalent financial analysis experience preferred.
Experience with data visualization, reporting & dash boarding tools such as SAS visual Analytics or Tableau preferred.
Experience with scripting languages like SAS, Python or SQL preferred.
Must be able to work in fast paced, high performance environment with tight deadlines.
Requires ability to think critically and independently, while at the same time the ability to know when to ask for help; requires excellent common sense.
Ability to self-manage project based upon defined timelines and variable outcomes required.
Ability to complete projects that require long hours prepping presentation materials from not just a content, but even making them dynamic perspective.
Equivalent combination of education and progressive, relevant and direct experience may be considered in lieu of minimum educational/experience requirements indicated above.
Certificates/Licenses/Registrations

San Manuel Band of Mission Indians and San Manuel Casino will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. Stoneridge Software has cultivated an atmosphere of trust, community, and support that includes a flexible working environment, unlimited vacation, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and even beer on-tap. What we are Looking for:

Stoneridge Software is looking for a passionate steward of data to lead, develop and test ERP data migrations that will meet client business demands for meaningful up to date data sets. Represent subject matter expertise in business process, solution design, best practices, and technologies

Position:
Sr. QA Automation Analyst
Job Description:


We currently have an opportunity for an enthusiastic, experienced Senior QA Automation Analyst to join our ECS Global Intelligent Automation (IA) team. This role will leverage their techno-functional knowledge and skills to help Test Automation COE design the testing automation framework & architecture, oversee the execution of the strategy and implementation of scalable IT QA automation solutions across Arrows technical landscape.

The individual in this role will be responsible for defining and promoting an automation testing mindset across IT and includes responsibilities such as planning, developing, and directing quality assurance automation testing policies, programs, and initiatives. Evaluates and monitors automated testing tools, methodologies, and to ensure effective testing and identification of defects.

Additionally, this individual will act as a relationship manager across senior IT leadership and other IT development teams to facilitate discussions and help prioritize the automation testing project queue, coordinate across all business groups and deliver projects and initiatives within the automation COE roadmap. This includes working with the business and technology areas to understand and drive requirements for IT delivery in a fast-paced environment.

In this role, you will become part of the ECS Global Intelligence Automation team reporting into the Director of Global ECS BI & Automation.

What You'll Be Doing
Partner with cross-functional Test automation COE IT leaders to generate ideas/opportunities to drive the strategic roadmap for the IT QA Automation function to ensure the highest standards of performance are consistently delivered by IT teams.
Lead definition of Testing Automation framework and implementation of IT testing automation standards, methodologies, and processes to be executed across technology releases. Drive implementation and continuous refinement of automation testing processes, environments, models, and tools to move towards continuous delivery (CI/CD) approach.
Develop strategy, build a business case, obtain executive approval for, and lead the execution of Strategic Automation Roadmap and Performance testing framework for the IT Quality Assurance function.
Lead design sessions with product owners/stakeholders across the organization to deliver innovative solutions through research, leadership, and mentoring.
Provides effective organizational leadership and collaboration as a part of the COE leadership Group. Maintains effective relationships with IT Management and Business leadership as well as external sourcing vendors to ensure that all IT processes are maintained and enhanced in support of the mission and goals
Ensuring projects meet service level expectations and are delivered on time and budget by holding contributors accountable for delivering on project milestones and deliverables.
Ensure root cause analysis and feedback of findings to identify underlying processes and reporting issues within IT quality processes and solutions. Based on quantitative insights developed per above, lead the development of recommended remediation actions or initiatives to drive improvements in technology quality performance levels.
What We Are Looking For
4-year degree from an accredited college/university in Information Systems or related field or equivalent related experience
At least 7-8 years of experience in IT development & Software quality practices including hands-on coding experience of Unit /Integration /System /Regression / Performance tests and test execution in an automation framework.
At least 5 years of leading/managing experience in leading a large, complex I.T. environment.
Must have experience in Production issue management and Quality Assurance disciplines, standards, processes, and workflow.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to articulate complex concepts diverse audiences speak non-technical when needed
Detail-oriented; strong organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple responsibilities, deadlines and changing priorities
Ability to deal with ambiguity and organizational agility to evaluate options and make informed and timely decisions
Demonstrated interpersonal and relationship building capabilities; effectively balance team building and a results-oriented approach.
Experience with large, complex, multi-national projects and teams; working collaboratively across the business and IT stakeholders to deliver solutions through traditional and agile methods.
Ability to define, articulate, and market Testing Automation COE vision and value statements across the stakeholder community.
Full knowledge of the SDLC framework and Waterfall, Scrum, and Agile project methodologies.
Well versed in the utilization of project artifacts including architecture design, requirements decomposition, and application development deliverables.
Hands-on experience with multiple automation testing tools (like Selenium, Jenkins, QTP, Quality Center, Postman and SOAP UI), automation frameworks (Cucumber, TestNG, etc.)
Exposure to a wide variety of business subject areas (Sales, Inventory, Marketing, Financials, Accounting/GL, etc.) Oracle R12 ERP and supply chain experience is highly preferred
Experience with CI/CD and Jenkins, version control tools like Bitbucket, SVN, etc.
Java/JS, SQL proficiency with experience in constructing/deconstructing complex queries, and a good understanding of various databases (Oracle, SQL Server, etc.)
Whats In It For You

At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. Thats why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package.
Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
401k, With Matching Contributions
