The Information Technology (IT) department for the San Manuel Band of Mission Indians (the Tribe) provides and supports a leading edge technology infrastructure to the organization in support of ever changing technological advances in the Gaming industry and the Tribes business enterprises. The ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is key to the success of the IT staff to meet the demands of this technically proficient and high demand department.
Reporting to the IT Business Finance Manager, the IT Financial Analyst will work closely with internal customers and the Information Technology department in understanding and interpreting financial data. This position is a key role in the maintenance, interpreting and documenting of all technology financial information for the overall purpose of meeting departmental and organizational objectives.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

1. Perform financial analysis to support short term and long range strategic plans and operating budgets.

2. Assist with IT month-end closing activities to include, reporting on all IT financial expenses, invoice accruals and research, prepaid expenses, capitalization and depreciation of Technology assets.

3. Perform detailed analysis including budget vs. actual, return on investment, cost and time estimates, build vs. buy, and monitor business issues that may impact the bottom line.

4. Work as a liaison with other departments to review and analyze financial impacts, prepare project implementation justifications, help prepare documentation for the financial approval process, and support the annual budgeting process.

5. Collaborate with IT Business Finance Team to review contractual financial obligations and ensure accuracy and meet organizational objectives and budgets.

6. Review department financials and utilize reporting software to prepare reporting packages; analyze, interpret and make recommendations to IT Management.

7. Create ad-hoc reports to help improve financial data analysis and reporting; month-end, quarterly and year to date.

8. Collaborate internally with IT Project Management Office to maintain accurate financial reports of IT project budgets.

9. Understand and help others understand how the departments finances impact other departmental operational procedures, developments and ultimately the organizations financials.

10.Attend key meetings and other special projects and perform other duties as assigned. Keep financial data secure, and document activity and procedures for future reference.

Education/Experience/Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field required from an accredited university.
Minimum of three (3) years of experience within the Information Technology Industry.
Three (3) years prior experience as a Financial Analyst or other types of analytical work such as auditor, business analyst, or project management.
Equivalent combination of education and progressive, relevant and direct experience may be considered in lieu of educational requirement.
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Familiarity with statistical and/or visualization tools (Tableau, SAS, etc.).
Experience with financial analysis, auditing and reporting.
Strong technical verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to create a positive and professional business relationship with internal and external clients as well as third-party service/product providers.
San Manuel Band of Mission Indians and San Manuel Casino will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 11990.

As one of the largest private employers in the Inland Empire, San Manuel deeply cares about the future, growth and well-being of its employees. Join our team today!

As aSystems Analyst III atICW Group, you will function to support, maintain, implement, and improve applications and integrations for the business/enterprise in a cost effective, secure, high performing and customer centric manner. As a critical member of this team, you will also collaborate with all IT stakeholders to enable the organization to achieve business goals and objectives and constantly evaluate IT technical solutions and best practices in alignment with business/enterprise initiatives. If ITIL and critical incidents are your area of expertise, this is the team for you!

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Provides application technical support to Program Teams.
Helps define business processes as they pertain to application and integration workflow.
Troubleshoots and resolves application and integration related incidents and problems.
Formulates and presents solutions to application issues.
Remediates simple application issues and runs it through the team’s delivery cycle.
Documents incidents and problems with appropriate level of detail.
Improves the supportability and maintainability of insurance systems.
Defines the Application Inventory for the Program Team assigned.
Analyzes support pain points and provides solutions to address the commonly recurring incidents.
Organizes the design and development cycle of the team.
Advocates the inclusion of appropriate non-functional requirements in order to enhance business processes, operations, and information process flow.
Defines and manages a proactive continuous improvement effort for technical and functional improvements.
Researches tools, trends, and best practices to improve the supportability, maintainability and performance of applications.
Defines and drives release activities.
Documents the disposition of production deployments to provide accurate metrics.
Collaborates with a multiple of internal stakeholders on information systems projects.
Partners across business units with Architects, Systems Analysts and Technical Leads on the system design to provided desired functionality.
Works closely with the development team to evaluate technical design alternatives for functionality.
Facilitates design workshops and ongoing interactions with key stakeholders to determine detailed requirements.
Ensures non-functional requirements, including UX, scalability, performance, supportability and reliability are identified and considered.
Supervisory Responsibilities

This role does not have supervisory responsibilities.

Education and Skills

Bachelor's Degree from four-year college or university required with a major or emphasis in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field. Minimum 5 years of relevant technical or business work experience and/or training; or, equivalent combination of education and experience required. Minimum 4 years of related experience in information systems design and analysis required. Minimum 4 years experience in a Systems Analyst role. Minimum 1 year of relevant experience in the Insurance or Financial Industry preferred.

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations

Insurance Certifications NTH (CPCU, ARM, AIC, AINS) and domain expertise: CSM or CSPO preferred. ITIL certification required. Specialized certifications in MuleSoft and SAP systems, specifically FI, CD, ICM, and/or BP preferred.

Knowledge and Skills

Working knowledge of information systems design and analysis required. Knowledge of insurance industry preferred. Knowledge of ITIL Framework and Best Practices required. Familiarity with Application Performance and Monitoring (APM) and Profiling tools. Ability to diagram critical processes and workflows for a particular application/integration. Ability to create intermediate to advanced SQL and Splunk queries, and utilize/create simple dashboards for support purposes. Possess a strong understanding of common non-functional requirements for supportability and maintainability. Possess a strong understanding of system engineering, object-oriented design, information risk and security guidelines, and architecture standards. Possess a strong understanding of API standards for communicating and integration between applications. Possess a strong understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) framework and its corresponding artifacts as it pertains to ICW. Possess a strong understanding of the different infrastructure and application components as they relate to a particular application and/or integration for a specific Line of Business/Program team. Possess an ability and intellectual curiosity to research emerging trends and best practices aimed at improving current applications, integrations and/or processes. Possess experience in improving system processes and design with a focus on the following areas: maintainability, updatability, scalability, restorability, monitoring and logging.

The employee frequently will sit, stand, walk, and bend during working hours. Requires manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination. May be required to lift light objects. Job Summary

The Business Analyst Senior partners with Corporate PMO team members, THP business stakeholders, and vendor staff to develop and implement cost effective solutions that are in alignment with strategic goals and policies related to the Clinical Services modernization program. This is a large-scale enterprise program, utilizing highly configurable and business critical workflow systems, to deliver critical functionality to both THP as well as provider partners. The Business Analyst Senior will support all phases of projects across the program.

The Business Analyst Senior must be able to confidently interact with THP business stakeholders to provide support for key phases of the program including business requirements, testing strategy and execution, defect identification and resolution, and program status and documentation. Being a highly visible and collaborative role, the Business Analyst Senior must have strong communication skills, particularly around organizing and presenting project information to teams/management. The individual should be a strong communicator who can work independently and with all layers of the organization

Job Description

Consulting with business, technology, and program leadership, provide support for all phases of project lifecycle, including:
Requirements - Create impact summary documentation to support informed business owner decision making and prioritization, including cost/benefit analysis for implementation and project CRs
Design - Work with vendor to determine optimal implementation of requirements. Coordinate with THP technology teams on downstream/upstream impacts
Support testing strategy, including test case criteria development, test case documentation, and opportunities for test case automation
UAT - Analyze defects (root cause, trends), provide standard tools, and communicate risk UAT/Post-Deployment - Supports the prioritization of defects
UAT/Post-Deployment - Monitor defect SLAs and provide summary on how/if they are met
Support operational readiness impact assessment for existing workflows, processes, and training needs based upon new requirements/enhancements
Support project transition to Production
Project and Implementation Support
Document, track and monitor requests/problems and actions per defined processes, ensuring timely resolution and end-user satisfaction
Identify critical events, follow basic procedures to diagnose, monitor and communicate resolution
Participate in scheduling, prioritization, risk management activities and change control implementation
Collaborate on technical issues while maintaining a high level of client satisfaction through effective communication and prompt resolutions

Who You Are

You either have a strong passion or direct experience working in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry. You are curious, effective at multitasking, have strong communication skills and are detail-oriented. You are comfortable with technology and like to explore and innovate. You thrive on variety, problem-solving and getting things done. You like to dig beneath the surface and understand why and how different healthcare audiences (i.e., patients, doctors, caregivers, pharmacists, etc.) have formed their opinions or make their decisions. You have an instinctive understanding of the value and importance of healthcare consumers to our business and want to help connect the dots for our clients. You have a passion, empathy and confidence in engaging with diverse groups of people and an ability to adapt your communication style accordingly. You are eager to contribute and collaborate through quality, commitment, courtesy and teamwork. Most importantly, you work best in a collaborative work environment that is focused on excellence and customer satisfaction.

What You'll Do

In this multi-faceted role, you will cultivate and grow relationships with our healthcare clients' most important consumers by earning their trust, advocating for their needs, developing audience expertise, and creating engaging environments in which to deepen the conversation, draw people out, and make connections.
Build relationships with healthcare consumers to create a broader understanding of their thoughts, feedback, opinions and emotions for our C Space teams and our clients.
Become someone consumers get to know and trust; respond to their emails/inquiries, advocate for your community members
Represent the consumer voice internally and potentially with your clients
Develop audience expertise by highlighting trends, opinions and feedback from members that adds to client or C Space learning
Help to define and foster shared purpose and the appropriate tone among consumers in the community
Author and deliver compelling and effective member communications (e.g. acquisition, retention and ongoing outreach) and engagement activities
Track, analyze, and optimize participation and community vibrancy
Reward & recognize members; help them feel valued and appreciated
Encourage member-to-member interactions and member-generated content by facilitating conversations, collaborating with consumers, and probing discussion posts – with a focus on engaging them
Assist the team with regulatory tasks to ensure compliance with client's and healthcare regulations
Open to ad hoc travel domestically & internationally (10%)
Desired Skills and Experience
2+ years of internship/professional or related experience
Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret and act on data and information
Versatile communication skills with a comfort adapting tone and tenor to individuals and situations
Proficient at prioritizing tasks, working independently and collaborating across functional areas
Curiosity, comfortable asking questions and making connections with others
Demonstrate comfort, familiarity and aptitude with various tools and applications such as reporting, social media, Excel and email
Must be able to work under tight deadlines
Comfortable and articulate in working directly with colleagues and teammates
Knowledge of pharmaceutical/biotech industry, marketing research, online data collection or other languages is a plus
Interested? We look forward to receiving applications from people with diverse backgrounds – talented, creative people with their own voice, ideas and perspectives.

There's no such thing as a typical C Spacer. What C Spacers thrive on is a growth mindset. We're a growing, always-changing business, often reinventing ourselves to keep pace with the fast-changing world of our clients. So we're looking for people who are excited about change and who challenge the status quo. We need people who share our passion for the role customers can play in solving business problems - people who want to disrupt the way things traditionally have been done.

We're focused on building a learning culture where it's safe to experiment, take risks and do things differently. That means we need people who aren't afraid to speak up and share an alternative perspective yet are humble and self-aware enough to admit they don't know everything. Collaborators, self-starters, creative problem-solvers.

We're always challenging ourselves to be better, more human, more impactful. 20 years since launch, we still think of our business as a 'work in progress' where we're focused on getting better every day. If you share that philosophy when you think about your own personal development, we might be a good match.

About C Space

Our clients call us their customer agency.

We create rapid insight and business change, putting customers at the heart of companies and solving problems from the customer's perspective. We keep our clients relevant by building real, ongoing relationships with customers that in turn help them deliver superior experiences, launch successful products and build loyalty. Our customized approaches are tailored to specific business needs and include online insight communities, immersive storytelling, data and analytics, activation events, innovation projects and business consulting. We do this for many of the world's best-known brands – like Bose, Walmart, Jaguar Land Rover, Mars, Samsung, IKEA and more – to create "Customer Inspired Growth".

We are passionate about our people and proud of our culture. We co-created a set of values to ensure that we are delivering fantastic work, continuing to learn and developing and building a high-performance culture which creates opportunities for those who work here:
I've got this: taking responsibility, doing what we say we will
Only accept awesome: delivering high quality work that we are proud of and has impact
Show the love: celebrating successes and ensuring everyone has a voice
Do what scares you: challenging ourselves, taking risks and learning more
Tell it like it is: being honest and freeing ourselves from "office politics" and "hidden agendas"
Open up and listen: listening first and fully before we respond or react
Find what fascinates: being passionate about the world and our clients' worlds
We before me: putting the team first
Leave your mark: everyone has an opportunity drive change in our business and for our clients
To learn more, visit www.cspace.com or follow us on Twitter @CSpaceGlobal and Instagram @c_spaceglobal. C Space is a part of DDB, a division of Omnicom Group Inc.

Headquartered in Boston, C Space has offices in New York, San Francisco and London.

C Space is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at C Space without regard to race; creed; color; religion; national origin; sex; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; veteran, marital, or citizenship status; or any other status protected by law.

About Us:

NYSTEC is a non-profit technology consulting company, advising agencies, organizations, institutions, and businesses since 1996. Were independent and vendor-neutral so we have our clients best interests at heart. At NYSTEC, we know that we succeed when individuals and teams flourish personally and professionally, so our benefits and perks support this mindset. Are you ready to contribute to our engaged workforce and deliver the NYSTEC Experience?

About the Role:

As a Business Analyst in the Health Systems Transformation practice, you will collaborate with team members to conceptualize, deliver, and support our clients through today's ever-changing healthcare landscape. NYSTEC is considered a trusted program advisor, providing subject matter expertise, and connecting the dots for our clients. Over the last five years, NYSTEC has consulted on some of the largest DOH initiatives and served in various roles across a multitude of New York State and New York City healthcare technology systems.

Serving as a Business Analyst, your day-to-day role as a NYSTEC consultant will include engagement of stakeholders, elicitation and prioritization of stakeholder requirements, research and assessment of the existing technology, performing data analysis, and supporting quality assurance operations across NYC public health registries.

Key Responsibilities

Support Project Manager in defining and prioritizing project tasks.
Research and document project landscape.
Conduct stakeholder engagement sessions to identify system and policy requirements.
Analyze and prioritize requirements and identify associated risks.
Develop, execute and manage software test plan with cases.
Develop system documentation and supporting artifacts.
Perform situation quality assurance on data sets.

Business analysis experience required, including full SDLC implementation experience, requirements elicitation and landscape analysis
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Healthcare experience
Experience working on collaborative, cross-functional teams

Preferred/Desired Qualifications

Business Analysis Certification a plus (PMI or IIBA)

Education and Experience

A minimum of a Bachelor's degree with at least 3 years of related experience in Business Analysis is required. An equivalent combination of advanced education, training, and experience will be considered.

If youre an effective communicator who enjoys working in complex and collaborative environments, utilizing your critical thinking and research skills to develop solutions for clients, providing support to customers, and have the required education, experience and skills, we want to hear from you.

Job Title: Business Analysis Manager, Media Performance Insights
Job Description:
Media Performance Analytics is a high-profile team of thought leaders and problem solvers who apply rigorous analytics to help assess and steer T-Mobile's paid media spend, driving business growth through our media investments. We combine our ability to dive into the data with sharp business acumen - we understand the drivers of performance through every stage of the funnel and advise senior leadership on key media investment decisions. Are ready to unleash your intellectual curiosity to write the next chapter of the Un-carrier?

Responsibilities
We are looking for a driven and analytical team member who is passionate about delivering business value - and determining how paid media investments can best deliver that value. You will conduct fast-paced analysis of cross-channel media performance across key marketing campaigns in driving high-quality prospective customers forward in the purchase funnel in our core lines of business and resulting in incremental enterprise value. You will regularly deliver and present to executive leadership actionable, data-driven recommendations that optimize T-Mobile's marketing efficiency and deliver business performance.
Your Responsibilities
Own analysis of cross-channel paid media investments for one of our core lines of business (e.g. Consumer Postpaid, Consumer Prepaid, T-Mobile for Business)
Deliver media performance insights to line of business and operational partners for T-Mobile's key marketing campaigns, such as Un-carrier moves, demand gen offers, and brand messages
Provide strong decision support and robust recommendations to business owners based on data-driven analysis, conducting high-profile analysis and delivering data narratives across business groups
Support construction of executive level presentations and present complex analytical findings in clear, concise, and decision-impacting manner
Develop and lead positive, constructive collaborations with one or more cross-functional teams
Help to build standing visualizations (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI) for ongoing monitoring and self-service for key stakeholders
Qualifications
4-6 years of professional experience in analytics, strategy, or management consulting roles
Ability to structure ambiguous problems in a complex media portfolio and develop data-driven insights
Ability to collaborate with and influence others on business outcomes with fact-based recommendations
Ability to communicate analytical and quantitative subjects clearly across audience types (subject-matter-expert and non-technical) and levels (peers and executives)
Excellent prioritization skills, self-motivation and the capacity to work under tight deadlines
Willingness to learn and develop new analytical skills and approaches in a fast growing, dynamic business
Proficient in SQL and comfortable with efficiently querying large databases (experience with one or more media platforms is a plus)
Relevant experience preferred in one or more of: telecommunications, consumer electronics, finance, or subscription business
Education
MBA with quantitative field in undergraduate degree -or- MS/MA/PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., engineering, operations research, computing science, statistics, economics, finance), -or- equivalent experience
Marketing-related specialization/coursework is a plus
Minimum Qualifications
• At least 18 years of age.• Legally authorized to work in the United States.• High School Diploma or GED.• Pre-employment background screen.

1+ years relevant testing experience
Strong attention to detail, organization skills, and timeliness in order to meet customer expectations
Strong problem solving skills
Demonstrates effective listening, communicate, interaction, discretion, and diplomacy skills
Must possess effective verbal and written communication skills to interact with business and technical resources

Effective organization and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to aggressive project deadlines
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to establish working relationships with individuals at varying levels within the organization
General understanding of the insurance industry and organizational relationships of the company
Ability to understand and translate user needs into business specifications
Ability to understand and translate user needs into programming specifications
Working knowledge of company operating systems and processes including a working knowledge of the policy administration system
Ability to conduct investigation and research into system errors and discrepancies
Possess strong verbal and written communication skills to interact with business and technical resources
High degree of initiative, mature judgment, and discretion
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel)

Prior project management experience preferred
Prior system knowledge and understanding of system processes

We Make a Difference

As one of the top behavioral health EHR providers in the country, Qualifacts Systems, Inc. has been changing the health care industry since our founding in 2000. A 5-time honoree on the Inc. 5000 list, we have an entrepreneurial spirit born from our start-up roots, and an amazing team of down-to-earth people who are empowered to be successful in their jobs every day.

Collaboration with industry leaders and mentors is a routine part of what we do, with the focus of making a meaningful impact in peoples lives. Our people get the best from themselves and their peers in an open and supportive environment. Join us and Make a Difference!

Like other companies, we offer competitive salaries, comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans, a robust PTO plan, 401(k) plan with matching, and other goodies that are essential for downtown Nashville, such as free parking and Starbucks coffee. Qualifacts has created an atmosphere where our people can focus on whats important: empowering our behavioral healthcare partners to achieve better outcomes.

But dont get the idea that we are all work and no fun. Our environment is casual because its important to us that everyone feel comfortable being themselves. We celebrate our successes and achievements, and host relaxing get-togethers and team building events. From lunch and learn sessions to on-site training to volunteer days, we provide opportunities to learn and to grow, and to Make a Difference in the community.

About the Position

Were looking for a talented Financial Analyst to join our high performing finance team to manage financial matters pertaining to the Information Technology department. The Financial Planning and Analysis Analyst will assist the IT leadership team in maximizing cost efficiencies by managing key costs and by supporting finance process. In addition to involvement in close, forecasting, and budgeting, this role will update executive reporting on how company resources are deployed to our strategic projects.

This new role to the finance team will report to the Director of FP&A.

Primary Responsibilities

Assist in preparing detailed annual budget and forecast with focus on key cost components such as hardware, software licenses and maintenance, and labor. Perform monthly variance to budget analysis.
Manage key expenses in the IT organization by tracking the staffing plan and navigating IT team members through vendor purchases.
Create and manage project budgets for strategic IT and product development projects. Perform monthly variance analysis for use in executive presentations.
Collaborate with accounting to manage adherence to labor capitalization policy and support monthly labor capitalization entry.
Other ad-hoc analysis and assignments as dictated by the needs of the finance team and the IT organization.

Qualifications
Bachelors degree, preferably in Finance; or equivalent work experience
Two plus years of related finance experience with emphasis in FP&A
Excellent Microsoft Excel and Power Point skills required, MS Access experience a plus
Quick learner and sharp attention to detail, very organized
Self motivated, strong work ethic, and reliable
Ability to work to work flexible hours during peak times, good time-management skills
Solid team player, helping out wherever needed
Preferred Qualifications
4+ years of FP&A work experience in support of an IT team.
Experience with Tableau (or similar BI tools)
SaaS Industry Experience
Operations under COVID-19

The onset of COVID-19 caused Qualifacts to adjust timelines on ambitious growth plans for 2020, but with careful management of resources we have not had to furlough or lay off staff. The company remains on a sound financial footing, and continues to pursue aggressive growth in all markets as opportunities present themselves.

In March we quickly transitioned to a 100% work-from-home stance in response to the threat from COVID-19. While Metro Nashville remains in Phases One or Two of its Reopening Roadmap plan, we will continue to work from home.

When Nashville moves into Phase Three, we will launch our own plan to slowly return to the office. This will begin with the voluntary return of a small number of employees. Eventually we will have everyone in the office up to 50% capacity on any day on a staggered schedule. At all phases, we will have in place appropriate social distancing measures, a policy for the use of masks and gloves, and enhanced cleaning procedures. As the threat to public health from COVID-19 declines, we will evaluate our return to normal workplace operations.

Hiring and Onboarding Practices

Currently all interviews are being conducted by phone or videoconference, with related communications taking place via email or phone. New Hire Orientation and other onboarding processes also are handled via email, videoconference and the use of online forms. New hires receive Qualifacts-issued laptops and other equipment for work in advance of onboarding, with virtual phone and videoconferencing software preloaded and ready for use.
Qualifacts provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We believe in providing employees with a work environment free of unlawful discrimination and harassment. In addition to federal law requirements, Qualifacts complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Accounting Operations Analyst
Location


Raeford Processing Plant

Department


Finance

Shift

Apply Now

Job Summary:

This position is responsible for analyzing actual cost versus SAP standard cost variances. Analysis to include but not limited to, yield, labor, packaging and overhead costs. Communicates results directly with Operations Management. The accounting operations analyst will also assist in the development and the maintenance of SAP master product costing data through working directly with Operations Management and R & D staff. This position will also work closely with the business to develop and maintain performance indicators to track process and operational improvements. Such performance measurements might also include business growth,new products/customers/markets penetration, or revenue contributors from these new areas. There will also be an opportunity to evaluate capital investments using financial modeling techniques.

Essential Functions, Duties & Responsibilities:
Analyze actual versus SAP standard performance variances and help maintain subsequent reports.
Assist in the development, set-Up and maintenance of SAP routings (Labor).
Assist in the development, set-up and maintenance of SAP scrap factors (Yields).
Create ad-hoc costing scenarios for the purpose of cost impact evaluations of new materials or processes.
Coordinate the progression of releasing new materials in SAP
Perform work on the activity based costing (ABC) models for the Mount Olive Plant.
Assist with the facilitation of the annual budget process, monthly and quarterly reforecasts, and work with business leaders to determine necessary forecast adjustments and budget needs.
Prepare financial and business-related templates as well as analyze and research in such areas as financial and expense performance, rate of return, depreciation, etc.
Compile and prepare reports, graphs and charts of data developed.
Assist with special financial and business-related studies and collaborate with other departments in preparing analyses.
Analyze and investigate P&L and variance between plan/forecast and expected results.
Issue identification and problem resolution to ensure attainment of commitments and objectives.
Prepare various ad hoc analysis and projects to assist with the management of the business.
Develop various models and reports to enable operational tracking and improvement including driving and reporting on cost saving initiatives.
Evaluate and implement systems and processes, including budgeting, planning, reporting, analytical tools.
Perform inventory control related duties and fixed asset validation.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Product Costing knowledge preferred.
SAP system or other ERP systems knowledge preferred.
Knowledge of processing flow in protein industry, a plus.
Strong organizational skills required.
Ability to communicate at levels of the organization.
Self -driven with ability to multi-task and work with minimal supervision in a deadline-oriented environment.
Highly skilled in the use of computer software (e.g., Microsoft Office, AS400, SAP).
Education & Experience:
4 year (Bachelor) degree in Accounting or related field strongly preferred.
2-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in the poultry or protein industry strongly preferred.

Job Details
Job Location
Boulder - Boulder, CO
About Charlotte's Web™:

Charlotte's Web™ products are made from our world-renowned hemp genetics grown 100% in the USA. Founded by the Stanley Brothers of Colorado, Charlotte’s Web™ leads the industry in quality, safety, consistency and social responsibility to improve thousands of lives daily through the use of Charlotte's Web™. At Charlotte’s Web™, we are driven by principles that extend far beyond the bottom line. It is our goal to provide products of the highest possible quality, while contributing to the sustainability of the communities we have the privilege of serving.

Position Summary:

The Company’s sales finance group serves as the critical support partner for revenue driving departments (e.g. Sales, Ecommerce, Marketing). The team is responsible for the development and/or analysis of all strategic, financial and operational aspects of the Company’s customers and revenue generation. The Sales Finance Analyst will serve as a key member of the corporate finance team at headquarters in Boulder, Colorado. The primary responsibility is to support the Senior Director of Finance and Sales teams in providing senior management and executives with the analysis and information they need to make major operational, financial, and strategic decisions.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Manage, lead, & participate in volume and net revenue forecasting
Support Sales, Ecommerce, & Marketing in identifying key business drivers and providing actionable insights
Assist sales operations and accounting development of monthly accruals, reconciliation, and analysis
Manage buildout and reporting of profit and loss statements by customer and market segment
Perform customer profitability analysis
Perform price, mix, and variance analysis
Improve company financial status by analyzing results, monitoring variances, identifying trends, and recommending action to management
Perform ad hoc analysis as needed to support decision making
Assist in developing finance and business presentations; related supporting materials
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Basic understanding of accounting and finance principles
Strong understanding of revenue accounting principles
Excellent analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills
Strong written and oral communication skills
Strong business partnering and interpersonal skills
Strong project management skills
Ability to translate operational processes into system requirements
Ability to work well in high pressure situations to meet deadlines
Maturity to handle sensitive data responsibly
High degree of proficiency with Excel, MS Access and PowerPoint
Other Competencies Required:
Organized, flexible and easily adaptable to changing conditions
Ability to multi-task and manage numerous simultaneous priorities
Makes confident, fact-based decisions
Proactively identifies and addresses concerns to prevent surprises
Facilitates communication between team members to ensure efforts are aligned
Takes accountability for delivering on commitments; owns mistakes and uses them as opportunities for learning and development
Adept at using logic and reasoning to work through complex problems and analyze information
Approaches problems from different perspectives in order to suggest and implement solutions
Strong work ethic with a “can do” attitude
High energy, high ownership of work product and dedication to driving results
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree required, with a concentration in Finance, Accounting, or related field
MBA or other graduate degree in Finance-related field preferred
3+ years in a corporate accounting or finance role in
Demonstrated success in financial modeling and analysis
Attention to accuracy and detail required
Experience in the Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) industry, preferred
Must be able to provide proof of eligibility to work in the U.S.
Job Environment and Conditions:

Working conditions are indoors in environmentally controlled conditions. Must be available to report to Boulder, CO office.

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. Must be able to remain in a stationary position for at least 75% of the time or more. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Compensation:

$65,000.00 - $85,000

Benefits:

We offer best-in-class benefits, including:
Company-Paid Medical, Dental, and Vision
3 Weeks of Paid Vacation Your First Year
401K Match with Automatic Vesting
Up to 9 Weeks Paid Parental Leave
Self-Tailored Wellness Program
Generous Employee Discount

Merrick Bank is a top-25 credit card issuer and merchant acquirer in the VISA/MasterCard networks, and a major recreational vehicle lender.
The Bank is a Utah Financial Institution and a member of the FDIC.

At
Merrick Bank, we specialize in credit programs that assist people looking to
build or rebuild their credit. We are FDIC insured and recognized as a top-20
issuer of Visa® cards. In total, we proudly serve over 2.4 million cardholders
and have extended over $5.3 billion in credit.

Our
Mission is to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers, our
employees, and our community. We work hard to create a work environment that
empowers our associates to grow, learn, and reach their potential.

This
position is responsible for running multiple monthly processes, extracting
data, maintaining/updating analytical files and data sources, producing ad-hoc
reports and working with the new accounts analytical team. The candidate will improve current processes
through automation, streamlining, and general improvement of the process. Further this candidate will be responsible
for time-sensitive processes requiring audits that involve other departments
and will require being able to explain month to month changes in the audit
reports. This candidate will work
closely with other analysts in the group to assist them in their role through
education of data sources and providing data when needed. Previous experience with large datasets using
R, SQL, or SAS is desired, particularly updating and maintaining
databases. Previous experience with
quality assurance or business intelligence reporting is also useful –
particularly using Shiny or R.

QUALIFICATIONS:

·
Bachelor's degree in a field related to the following skill
set is required. A Master’s degree is
preferred.

·
Expertise with SQL and some familiarity with programming
(SAS being ideal) is required.

·
Knowledge of R, Python, Java script, Shiny, Html, or CSS are
desired.

·
A firm understanding of data manipulation and extraction is
necessary.

BONUS POINTS:

·
Experience with Docker, and Git would is desirable.

·
Experience working with databases is desirable. We are currently using PostgreSQL.

·
Any experience with BI tools such as Shiny (R) or Dash
(python), or writing automated reports with LaTeX is desirable.

·
Experience finding issues with data is desirable.

·
Experience in the banking industry, specifically in credit
cards is desirable.

PRIMARY DUTIES:

·
Monthly process.

·
Prospect selection process and audit.

·
Quality assurance of data processes.

·
Improving the current data environment and making it faster,
and easier to access.

·
Documenting all data and processes the department develops
and utilizes.

·
Effective written and verbal communication skills.

·
Work effectively both individually and in a collaborative
manner with a team.

·
Compliance with Laws & Regulations:

·
Responsible for complying with all of the Bank’s internal
control policies and procedures.

·
Responsible for understanding and complying with all laws
and regulations to which the Bank is subject.

·
Responsible for communicating problems in operations,
noncompliance with the code of conduct, noncompliance with laws and regulations,
policy violations, or illegal acts.

What’s in it for you:

Competitive salary (DOE)

Benefits package
Medical, Dental and Vision (plus much more)

401(k) Plan with Company
Match

Short & Long Term Disability

Group Life and AD&D
Insurance

Paid Vacation, Holidays,
and Personal Days

Employee Events,
including Employee Appreciation Day, Holiday Party, etc.

Tuition Reimbursement
Program

United States without sponsorship.

Job Title: Senior Project Manager / Change Management Consultant
Job Description:
Our Culture:


Stoneridge Software began with an idea: How can Microsoft implementations be done better? After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. As a Microsoft Gold Partner, weve developed a proven process for project delivery and a laser focus on long-term support to empower our clients success. We know how to work hard but we also know how important it is to balance work with family and the rest of our lives. Stoneridge Software has cultivated an atmosphere of trust, community, and support that includes a flexible working environment, unlimited vacation, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and even beer on-tap. These initiatives, and many more have resulted in numerous Best Work Place awards and happy team members. We focus on allowing our team members to be authentically themselves whether thats creative, serious or nerdy. Does this sound like a team you would like to be a part of?

What we are Looking for:


Stoneridge Software seeks a highly motivated, assertive and client centric Senior Project Manager/Organizational Change Management Consultant to join our growing team to lead & contribute to Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM implementations. This is a unique and blended role with a Project Management focus while also using their passion for people, culture, and thoughtful communications to guide organizations through their transformation strategies.

The Senior Project Manager/OCM Consultant is responsible for making the most efficient use of resources on the implementation, defining and managing quality of deliverables, managing communications, project plans, budget, escalation process, and change control. In addition, this person will design, develop, implement, and manage enterprise wide solutions that will drive changes to organizational units, roles, responsibilities, user adoption, documentation, and processes. The role is aimed at instilling new behaviors, positive attitudes, and strategic staffing to transform the people and the culture at each client organization. This person will work closely with the Stoneridge Software project teams as well as our clients to conduct introductory workshops on Why Do Organizations Need Change Management including impact on project success, managing employee resistance to change, increasing people dependent ROIs and building competencies for change into the organization.

A Day in the Life:
Lead and manage successful delivery of Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM projects
Project planning and execution, issue and risk management, stakeholder management, and developing and delivering effective communication
Lead the development of a formalized and actionable Change Management offering for all projects
Consult with Executive Stakeholders on projects to coach them on providing sponsorship and leadership for business transformations
Customize the Change Management offering to meet individual client and project needs and develop reports to monitor results and demonstrate value
Provide excellent service and build ongoing relationships with clients
Work in partnership with business counterparts on the client side to guide and provide a framework for communication, training, and successful project delivery
Work with our sales team to identify and cultivate opportunities and provide direction during the sales cycle
Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support our client's business goals
Understand client's resource capabilities and constraints, and adjust the project plan accordingly
Work in partnership with Stoneridge Delivery Team consultants to develop meaningful train-the-trainer content and knowledge transfer on projects to ensure our clients have the best transition experience possible
Develop and deliver project activities including scheduling, resourcing, backlog management, and proposal development
Manage team activities and project dependencies to ensure on time project deliverables
Organize and facilitate steering committee meetings, project planning meetings, and recurring team meetings
Lead and ensure the delivery team is practicing the Stoneridge Software implementation methodology including continuous improvement activities
Manage issues and escalations on projects
Plan and schedule consultants' work and negotiating resolution to resourcing conflicts
Work collaboratively with project teams and clients, including traveling to their locations
Set aside time for self-development by attending training or self-learning on key subjects
Preferred Qualifications
Proven experience leading at least two (2) successful full lifecycle Dynamics ERP Implementations (AX 2012, D365)
Great leadership and communication skills
3+ years of direct work experience in a project management capacity including all aspects of process development and project lifecycle execution
3+ years of direct work experience in change management
PMP or CAPM designation preferred
Prosci Change Management certification, the Galbraiths Star, Six Sigma, or equivalent OCM certification
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business, Computer Science or related field
Strong technical aptitude
Solid interpersonal skills, and ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships within and outside Stoneridge
Ability to work primarily independently and concurrently manage multiple projects
Ability to communicate effectively in both spoken and written English
Ability to work collaboratively for the best interests of the business and the team
Valid Driver's License required
Must be a U.S. Citizen or legal permanent resident
Stoneridge Software provides our employees with the following benefits:
Health Insurance
HSA Contribution
Medical and Dependent Care FSA
Dental and Vison Insurance
Long-Term Disability
Life Insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Unlimited Vacation

401(k) Contribution

Flexible work environment

Popcorn, beverages, and other snacks in office
Beer on tap
Stoneridge Software is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us unique.

Position Description

function as an Analyst on the Procure to Pay teams for system data clean-up, data analysis
and review, record updating, and other projects as assigned. Ensure accuracy and investigate data

- Update AUTOPay accounts online with new credit card remit information

- Obtain W-9/W-8 details for Telco Vendors Globally and work with supplier onboarding team at Accenture to update records

- Obtain Supplier Contact Details Globally, ensure existing entries are accurate and work with supplier onboarding process

Qualifications

We have been delivering industry-leading solutions for the payments, financial and telecommunications industries since 1990. We are the preferred supplier of networking, integrated data and voice services to many leading organizations in the global payments and financial communities, as well as a provider of extensive telecommunications network solutions to service providers.

We are a privately held company with a healthy balance sheet, secure assets and a loyal customer base that includes some of the largest global blue-chip companies in the world. Many of the world’s leading companies continue to count on us as their primary provider of a range of networking and communication services, enabling them to expand regionally, nationally and globally. We provide services to customers in over 60 countries throughout the world.

We manage some of the largest real-time community networks in the world, enabling industry participants to simply and securely interact and transact with other businesses, to access the data and applications they need, over managed and secure communications platforms. Our existing footprint supports millions of connections and provide access to critical databases. Our network securely blends private and public networking to enable customers to utilize a single connection for "one-to-many" and "many-to-many"connections over a global platform.

Since our launch we have helped our customers and communities of interest, requiring secure and reliable communications solutions, to evolve from legacy to leading-edge technologies. Today the company provides a full range of services from dedicated connections to managed IP network solutions, providing local support and global reach to medium and large enterprises and service providers.

Primary Responsibilities:
This position will provide experienced Project Analyst (PA) support to the AIRWorks (AWx) KC-130T and CMV-22 COMMS Kitting Project Lead (PL) and the AIRWorks (AWx) Program Executive Officer, Aviation (PEO (A)) Portfolio Manager (PM).

The PA is responsible for executing all project activities to include support and analysis, acquisition support planning, procurement contracting, creating and managing schedules/spend plans, resource management, plan of action/milestones, document and data management, and sustaining activities for the KC-130T and CMV-22 COMMS Kitting projects. The PA will be responsible for communicating with team members, customers, stakeholders and other technical competencies on a daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly basis to maintain project performance, cost, schedule sufficient to identify critical path delays and provide related mitigation strategies. The PA will also conduct Project Management Reviews consisting of C/S/P planning, documentation, tracking, reporting and associated metrics for the AIRWorks PM to adequately establish resource requirements and ensure project requirements are attained.

Tasks Performed:

The candidate will lead the effort in the planning and execution of project C/S/P to include the following:
Direct Project Execution Strategy (PES) and Proposal execution
Review Statements of Work (SOW), Performance Specifications, Request for Proposals and Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL)
Review and track contract deliverables and milestones; track and report performance to plan
Detailed file and data retrieval organizational skills that support team members need for access to large amounts of data
Provide project control in various areas including but not limited to developing Standard Work Packages (SWP), Rough Order of Magnitude (ROM), spend plans, acquisition documentation and activities, and program technical documentation
Provide project support during project reviews, Systems Engineering Technical Review (SETR), Test & Evaluation (T&E) and/or Logistics events, to include coordination, reporting status (C/S/P), and project closeout
Administer supply chain management activities, master equipment listing management activities, deliverable acceptance and rejection activities
Work with systems engineering in support of system definition, development, integration, verification methods, modeling and simulation, test and evaluation, supportability efforts, interoperability requirements across a wide range of aircraft hardware and software systems
Support the class desk activities for EDRAP inputs and routing
Draft and maintain systems requirements, schedules, resources, and technical / project performance activities
Ensure vendor provided GFE is compliant with government specifications and TAE requirements
Plan, analyze and evaluate engineering, technical and product support efforts used to
a) define total systems/subsystem requirements

b) translate requirements into design criteria

c) evaluate alternative approaches

d) develop system specifications for the systems and subsystems
Work with Government and Industry engineering, product support, manufacturing and program manager personnel, including technical experts from various DoD entities
Develop procurement packages (purchase cards, simplified acquisitions, large SBIR) and track to award, working with contract specialists
Develop documents (Statement of Work, CDRLs, etc.) for Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR)
Provide support for SETR events (SRR, PDR, CDR)
Work closely with AS9100 managers and PM to maintain document integrity and to confirm the SharePoint site is audit ready
Manage the development of organic software, ordering hardware, Cyber products (IATT/ATO), Mission Planning, etc
Oversee AIRWorks procurement and kitting for the production effort
Facilitate the use ISEE for SETR processes
Education: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university. Master's Degree from an accredited college or university.

Experience:

JOURNEYMAN: A Journeyman level person within a labor category has 3 to 10 years of experience related to the functional duties for that labor category and a BA/BS degree. A Journeyman level person typically performs all functional duties independently.

SENIOR: A Senior level person within a labor category has over 10 years of experience related to the functional duties for that labor category and a MA/MS degree. A Senior level person typically works on high-visibility or mission critical aspects of a given program and performs all functional duties independently. A Senior level person may oversee the efforts of less senior staff and/or be responsible for the efforts of all staff assigned to a specific job.

Allowable Experience/Education Substitutions: Six (6) years' additional relevant work experience may be substituted for a Bachelors Degree. Associates Degree plus four (4) years' relevant work experience may be substituted for a Bachelors Degree. Bachelors Degree plus four (4) years' additional relevant work experience may be substituted for a Masters Degree.

Other Desired Experience:

• Familiarity with NAVAIR SETR events

• Ability to communicate and adapt well in dynamic team environments

• Good organizational skills

• Strong skills in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

• Knowledge of the Financial Compendium

Security Clearance Level Required: Secret or Eligible for Secret Level Clearance

Estimated Travel: 10%

Job Title: Senior Production Analyst - Part Time - Camden, Arkansas
Job Description:
Provides support to missile systems and production programs. Conducts evaluations and makes recommendations to improve manufacturing and production programs. Coordinates and communicates directly with high level representatives of the government and prime contractors.

Formulates opinions, recommendations, and written communication of activities to summarize progress of remote sites to customers. Utilizes knowledge of factory production floor to identify issues and concerns. Participates and works as a team member on Integrated Product Teams (IPTs). Employs familiarity with all aspects of manufacturing and quality processes in a defense manufacturing facility.

Required
BS degree in related field
Minimum 9 years experience in manufacturing, reliability and/or quality position
Supplier and/or quality management systems experience
Approximately 25% travel
Must be able to obtain and maintain security clearance
Desired
Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma process improvements
Knowledge and experience in Quality Assurance and/or ASQ auditing
Experience with ISO 9001 processes and procedures
Knowledge of Environmental and/or Acceptance Testing of missile systems and/or rocket motors
Experience in production planning documentation, performing production reviews and preparing risk assessments
Necessary Competencies
Honesty, superior ethics
Interpersonal savvy, excellent communication skills
Ability to be a team player
Initiative
Positive attitude
Professionalism
Life at INTUITIVE®

Awards: INTUITIVE’s many awards showcase our success at building a professional and well-rounded culture of excellence. Awards include Best Small and Medium Companies to Work for in the U.S. in Fortune Magazine, Huntsville Best Places to Work, National Prime Contractor of the Year Award, Best for Vets in Military Times Edge Magazine, Top 50 Companies in America for Workers over 50, Torch Award for Ethics, Family Friendly Business Award, Fit Friendly Company Award, and more. Employees take great pride in these validations of our success.

Giving Back: Giving in the community includes investment of time and effort, as well as monetary action. Very thoughtful in our choices, we focus on helping children and the elderly, as we feel they are most often overlooked. This approach results in meaningful employee involvement as we volunteer at a local school, support organizations that care for the homebound, assist groups that care for homeless children and families, support veteran organizations and activities, et al. Employee feedback shares how very rewarding such activities are.

Fun: Our natural atmosphere of camaraderie and professionalism fosters our coming together to enjoy many events, the success of which is evidenced by great turn-out, lots of fun, and wonderful feedback.

Focus on Health: Very health-conscious from the top down, we incorporate many types of health-related events and activities, resulting in positive impact on health-care cost outcomes. We are a proud winner of the Fit Friendly Company Award from the American Heart Association.

Incentives: A robust focus on recognition for performance, accomplishments, and creativity is part of our attracting and retaining skilled and talented individuals, supporting our outstanding retention rates.

Continuing Education: Close attention to the development of our employees and supporting them in many avenues of continuing education are a part of our company fabric, and result in the furthering of the caliber of our capabilities as well as the satisfaction of our employees.

Do you have a passion for working with data and an endless curiosity about the trends that numbers can reveal? Are you both a creative and quantitative thinker? The Media Data Analyst will play a central role in advancing TMPs media analytics, intelligence, and strategy. Were looking for a strong team player whos keen to delve deep into large data sets, build a strong data foundation from a media trading lens, develop new measurement frameworks, articulate actionable insights, and is unafraid to challenge the status quo in their quest for data accuracy and recruitment marketing advancement.

Why Join Us?
Truly high-performing teams are hard to come by; joining us gives you an opportunity to collaborate with, learn from, and grow together with a diverse group of high achievers who listen to your ideas and support you along the way
An entrepreneurial path of progression. Hard work is recognized and individuality is embraced. Your path of progression will be designed to suit you
About this Job:

Fundamentals
Comfortable with ambiguity, and flexible to work in a fast-paced, fluid environment where formal requirements or guidelines may not always be readily available
Champion data literacy, data analytics, and data-driven marketing
Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, and apply advanced analytical methods as needed and work with large complex data sets
Mine data and analytics at the customer level to gain a better understanding of their usage behaviors, including impacts of current marketing strategies
Develop a deep understanding of existing business using data to build insights about our advertisers and sales programs
Analytics
Analyze current market, vertical, and sub-vertical performance and identify levers for driving revenue growth
Choose the proper metrics for tracking and understanding current and future experiments
Build and iterate forecast models specific to Media Science channels. Collaborate with Data Science, Product functions, and other Media Science peers to help develop a common contextual data layer to aggregate data, enable more efficient data mining, and transform data into richer insights
Create and track metrics about data pipelines and quality via dashboards. Identify quality issues, ensure they are visible to the appropriate stakeholders, and drive to resolution
Implement and analyze A/B or Multivariate Tests to provide actionable insights to the marketing team on the test data
Innovation
Develop dashboards that provide reliable insights and visualization into rider and channel performance relative to KPIs, projections, and historical performance
Find efficiencies in current processes and be an advocate for implementing and upholding best practices
Integrate new sources into existing data sets and perform new calculations, including production code to maintain, improve and optimize analysis at scale
Collaboration
Present findings to senior management to drive business and marketing decisions
Deliver consistent and accurate reporting that provides both high-level and granular POVs on DG performance on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual, and ad hoc basis. Create dashboards and compelling data visualizations that are insightful, thoughtful, engaging, and can distill complex concepts in formats that are accessible at every level of the organization
Prioritize and work well in an environment with competing demands from multiple stakeholders in Marketing
Requirements for consideration:
BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics, or equivalent experience
Minimum 2 years of analytical and database experience
Marketing analytics or consulting experience is a plus
Exceptional problem solving, critical thinking, and project management skills with the capacity and anticipation to adjust based on shifting deadlines and moving priorities
Excellent programming skills in SQL and Python. R is a plus
Proficiency with multiple analytical and database tools (e.g BigQuery, Jupyter notebooks, Presto, Tableau or alike)
Excellent data visualization skills. Experience creating dashboard reporting in DataStudio, Tableau or a similar visualization tool a plus
Speed, resourcefulness and a go-getter attitude. Moving quickly and executing to allow for continual iteration is a core qualification of our team
Willing to contribute new ideas and articulate them to a variety of stakeholders and not just execute on existing ones
Quest to deliver impact, but also invests in themselves and others. We dont get better by standing still, so you will need to consistently seek to innovate and raise the bar
A love of data - you just go get the data you need and turn it into an insightful story. You know how to convert data into decisions without getting stuck in paralysis by analysis
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We help protect our customers against life’s uncertainties. Regardless of where you work within the company, you’ll be helping provide protection and peace of mind when our customers need it most.

Whether it’s in accounting, claims, IT, investments, legal, marketing, sales, or another department, come be part of a company where you can accomplish your goals while contributing to our social mission of becoming America’s most protective insurance company.

Protective Life is looking for a Business Systems Analyst for the Annuity Systems Team. This position requires strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills, along with proper prioritization of multiple assignments, while maintaining a sense of urgency to meet individual and team deadlines and goals. Strong knowledge of annuity business and/or a strong understanding of accounting is preferred.
Success in this role requires leadership ability among peers, excellent oral and written communication skills, and effective collaboration with others, both internal and external to the team and company. The candidate should be self-motivated and show an inquisitive nature, seek improvements, and demonstrate strong accuracy and attention to detail. Other abilities include accepting responsibility and accountability for own job and performance, demonstrating independent work behaviors, and having decision-making skills to achieve desired results.
Primary Responsibilities
Diagnose and manage production defects to a successful resolution. Work with software developers within the team or across the organization to resolve problems. Test and document defect fixes and communicate resolution back to the customer. Consult with end-users concerning corrective actions as needed in a calm and professional manner.
Elicit, compose and maintain business requirements for system enhancements using interviews, group facilitation, prototyping, business process descriptions, data analysis, use cases or workflow analysis. Work with software developers to help them understand requirements. Ensure requirement documents are complete and conform to defined standards.
Create, publish, maintain and execute test plans and specific test cases for solutions based on documented requirements and systems design specifications. Review results with business to ensure test results are as expected.
Provide end-user training when appropriate.
Support conversion efforts by learning about the business being converted, performing regression testing, identifying potential impacts to existing business, and helping to develop repeatable processes for future regression testing and conversion efforts.
Utilize appropriate project tracking methodologies and database(s) to manage multiple projects through the project life cycle. Document moderately complex project phases, provide regular status updates, and assist with creating effective release/implementation plans.
Create, maintain and coordinate updates to system data elements and configurable applications, including rules, values, tables and output with little or no development resource assistance. Create and run queries to generate, validate, and analyze data from various applications
Show leadership in all aspects of the position, work well with teammates and those outside the team, be collaborative in meetings and discussions and assist teammates as needed or required.
Qualifications
Must have experience with annuity products. VUL experience preferred
Experience on wmA Vantage and LIDP’s Administrator (ADMI) systems preferred
Experience with agile project methodology preferred
High school diploma or equivalent required; relevant degree strongly preferred.
Moderate analytical and problem-solving skills; competent to work in many system analysis phases and to consider moderate business implications of applying technology to the current and future business environment
Ability to work effectively under very tight deadline pressure
Clear use of the English language in written and oral communications and the ability to interpret and communicate technical information to non-technical personnel and vice versa
Ability to act with diplomacy in resolving conflict, consulting and in acting as an agent in charge
Must be self- motivated, able to work independently and willing to self-teach and take responsibility for ongoing professional development
At Protective, we are committed to providing an inclusive culture where all employees fully contribute and thrive. We have always been a values-driven culture. Doing the right thing and serving people are part of our DNA, and we believe that valuing and embracing different backgrounds and perspectives is what makes us unique.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to being inclusive and attracting, retaining, and growing the talents of a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Job Title: Workday Benefits Senior Consultant - Technology Solutions
Job Description:
CrossCountry Consulting is a trusted business advisory firm that provides customized finance, accounting, human capital management, risk, operations and technology consulting services to leading organizations facing complex change. We partner with our clients to help them navigate pressing business challenges and achieve goals related to improving operations, minimizing risks and enabling future growth.
Our people are our most valuable asset and our individual differences are our greatest strength. Join our team where Excellence is a priority, Collaboration and teamwork are the norm, Energy is contagious, and the opportunity to make an Impact is endless.
We love to help our clients and our people succeed... and it shows! Click here to see why our employees made us #2 on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work 2020 list.

Imagine advising renowned clients across the country and implementing one of the world’s most innovative and leading cloud technologies. At CrossCountry, that’s exactly what you’ll do – you’ll take part in a quickly growing Workday practice. As a Workday Services Partner, we offer full-suite services and provide our consultants with hands-on training and certification in Workday. We believe that happy employees deliver better results, so we strive to provide our employees with a meaningful work-life balance and invest in their professional development. In fact, we recently received an Employees’ Choice Award from Glassdoor, recognizing CrossCountry as the 2nd Best Place to Work in 2020!
By joining CrossCountry you’ll be making a direct impact on our growing Workday practice, regularly taking part in:
· Advising key stakeholders through selection, transformation, implementation, and configuration of Workday. Our consultants are hands-on involved in full-scale implementation, project management, change management, requirements and design, process improvement, testing, integration enablement support, oversee supplier enablement, and best practices
· Contributing beyond client delivery, including, but not limited to recruiting, coaching, marketing, business development, practice development, operational improvement and beyond
· Implementing performance improvement and cost-reduction initiatives
Additional Responsibilities
Participate in full-cycle and phase X implementation projects within the Workday HCM product suite
Provide post-production support and enhancement services to both large multi-billion-dollar enterprises and emerging growth companies
Collaborate with team to help clients navigate the selection, transformation, implementation, and configuration of the Benefits module
When necessary, lead conversion of legacy data into Workday by scoping conversion requirements, executing data transformation activities, and supporting end user validation activities from existing legacy system to new system
Participate in the advisory, planning and implementation of Benefits applications by documenting requirements, mapping processes, gathering system data and converting data into format required for integration
Implement performance improvement and cost-reduction initiatives
Communicate effectively with clients to convey project updates and recommendations
Prioritize client’s interest and proactively listen to ensure that work exceeds their expectations
Actively foster internal relationships, share knowledge, and mentor other consultants to grow our practice
Qualifications
2+ years of recent Workday Certified experience implementing Workday Benefits
1-2 large end-to-end implementations or 3-4 small end-to-end implementations within Advanced Compensation, with demonstrated deep knowledge of Advanced Compensation configuration
Experience as a lead consultant on Workday Benefits projects
Current certification in Workday Benefits
Previous consulting experience with a Workday deployment partner
Experience deploying multiple Workday Benefits or HCM projects simultaneously a plus
Strong attention to detail with the ability to think from a “big picture” perspective
Ability to build and develop strong client relationships and drive client conversations
Strong leadership skills with the ability to foster an environment of collaboration and excellence
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training
Ability to travel on average 30% to 50% of the time (internal note: pre pandemic average 1 trip a month, 2 or 3 days)
Creativity, confidence, flexibility, and a great sense of humor
Bachelor’s degree (or higher)

Summit Technical Solutions (STS) is seeking a Strategic Planner/ Analyst to provide administrative operational support to 100th Missile Defense Brigade in support of a USASMDC/ARSTRAT contract at Peterson AFB, CO.

Primary Responsibilities
Supports day to day operations, planning, staff actions, tasking, and coordination with United States Northern Command (USNORTHCOM), United States Strategic Command (USSTRATCOM), Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and United States Army Space and Missile Defense Command/Army Strategic Forces Command (USASMDC/ARSTRAT), the Colorado, Alaska and California Army National Guard.
Provides SME-level Digital Training Management System (DTMS support to the 100th BDE and 49th BN. Tracks training for the 100th Missile Defense Brigade in DTMS, updating calendars daily, weekly and monthly.
Supports the Brigade, coordinating exercise participation, test planning, and the execution of Ballistic Missile Defense/Global Missile Defense (BMD/GMD) exercise activities.
Supports 100th BDE level participation in Tier I exercises and external evaluations as a member of the BDE Exercise Control Group.
Supports the Brigade in the development and coordination of training, training guidance, exercises, and evaluation programs. Updates monthly, bi-annual, annual training and biennial requirements in DTMS.
Monitors short and long range training, weapons qualifications, and Army Physical Fitness Test (APFT) data.
