Job Title: Quality Automation BI Analyst (Strong Data Analysis, Streaming and Validation)
Job Description:
Quality Automation BI Analyst (Strong Data Analysis, Streaming and Validation)

Position Overview

Leads and defines the Business Intelligence testing strategy/plan and executes test phases on BI implementations, quarterly releases, and a new Business Intelligence stack re-architecture. Self-starter with a data analysis and quality assurance background who can navigate complex databases and reporting along with upstream data sources to ensure data scenarios are defined and executed. Identifies gaps and efficiencies from a technical and functional perspective and defines appropriate solutions. Implements testing process that meets BI objectives while adhering to standards established across product teams.

Responsibilities:
Lead test strategy and planning for validating the Business Intelligence application, reports, regression, and ensuring data quality
Work with various teams to create, enhance and maintain the Business Intelligence set of test cases.
Maintain existing and develop new QA test automation scripts using standard languages and tools.
Build and maintain the test data and test cases that will be used for release testing and regression testing, ensuring validation is completed as early in the schedule as possible.
Lead senior level team members through the decision process and ensure stakeholder alignment.
Ensure that deliverables demonstrate efficiency, maintainability, and re-usability.
Lead the training as required for the Business Intelligence application and reporting suite. Facilitate communication between members of the project team, both technical and nontechnical, on issues and expectations.
Gather Business Intelligence requirements and perform data analysis as required to ensure product enhancements are defined and translated into user stories that can be production ready when complete.
Develop and complete special projects as assigned.
Maintain regular and predictable attendance.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Education and Experience

Required:
Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related degree, or equivalent experience
8+ years of Quality Assurance and testing of Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing and Reporting solutions
Preferred:
10+ years IT-related experience, such as Quality Assurance and testing of Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing and Reporting solutions experience
Life Insurance industry experience
Skills and Abilities

Required:
Ability to quickly translate project needs and problems into efficient test scenarios/data scenarios.
Advanced data analysis and database validation knowledge and experience
Strong background with the Agile Methodology
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to effectively work with subject matter experts as well as technical Information Technology professionals.
Ability to work both as a team member, leader and independently.
Advanced oral and written communication and presentation skills
Ability to multi-task.
Ability to work with limited supervision.
Aptitude for learning new technologies
Advanced negotiation skills with ability to obtain most favorable and cost effective solutions.
Advanced ability to set goals and handle multiple tasks, clients, and projects simultaneously; Ability to appropriately balance priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
Ability to work well within a team environment and lead department/team projects
Ability to balance detail with departmental goals/objectives
Ability to manage multiple projects or teams and set applicable goals
Advanced negotiating and persuasion skills
Ability to liaise with individuals across a wide variety of operational, functional, and technical disciplines
Technical:
Advanced experience writing SQL queries within complex database environments
Advanced experience initiating, building and maintaining comprehensive test suites and associated data
Advanced experience with Python, Docker Containers, Jenkins
Familiar with AWS tools such as Kinesis, Lambda, Aurora Postgres, Redshift
Experience with testing SSRS and Tableau
Advanced experience with SOAP UI or equivalent

The Slot Performance Analyst will provide insights and report on findings via data visualizations and stories derived from various sources related to project and initiative activities for the Slot Department. By exploring market trends, competitors, players, the Performance Analyst will help to foster a data driven environment through the creation of models and analysis that drive revenue, profit and rated slot play. This individual will coordinate with internal operations, external agencies and slot vendors to collect and retrieve data required for research projects.

Under the direction of the Slot Performance Manager, the Performance Analyst is responsible for creating and curating decision based reporting utilizing slot and player related data. The Performance Analyst will execute ad-hoc and recurring reports to inform on the efficacy of slot projects and to aid in the discovery of additional revenue generating opportunities as well as quantify anticipated benefits for prioritization.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Applies knowledge of gaming machines, gaming systems, slot accounting systems, and slot performance systems to provide procedures, analysis, reports and recommendations to Slot Management.
Build business intelligence, reports and dashboards using a combination of software such as Microsoft Excel, Tableau, SAS Enterprise Guide and VizExplorer that include customer behavior or trends based on slot and player data.
Conduct market research for determining what product is leading the industry, understanding customer needs, and analyzing competitors.
Generate reports that analyze customers, product, and project activities using charts, graphs, explanatory text and developed ROI formats.
Assists in the development of capital expenditure plans for slot product and components using ROI formats.
Regularly monitors and reports on the cost of acquisition of slot product and components.
Provides in-depth analytical reporting on slot financials on a recurring basis.
Creates advanced predictive models to measure expected effects of slot changes.
Provides current gaming information after careful vendor research of gaming components and systems of potential vendors and evaluates proposals.
Presents reports in meetings with staff and management.
Sets benchmarks for departmental goals/initiatives and measures efficacy via data reporting.
Perform special studies as assigned, including preparation of written and/or verbal reports.
Oversee all department presentation materials, including but not limited to, final reports, PowerPoint presentations, and all electronic presentation deliverables.
Perform other duties as assigned to support the efficient operation of the department.
Education/Experience/Qualifications
Bachelors degree required, Masters Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Business, Finance, Mathematics, or related field preferred.
One (1) year experience in slot operations, including machine set-up, evaluation and reporting, or equivalent financial analysis experience preferred.
Experience with data visualization, reporting & dash boarding tools such as SAS visual Analytics or Tableau preferred.
Experience with scripting languages like SAS, Python or SQL preferred.
Must be able to work in fast paced, high performance environment with tight deadlines.
Requires ability to think critically and independently, while at the same time the ability to know when to ask for help; requires excellent common sense.
Ability to self-manage project based upon defined timelines and variable outcomes required.
Ability to complete projects that require long hours prepping presentation materials from not just a content, but even making them dynamic perspective.
Equivalent combination of education and progressive, relevant and direct experience may be considered in lieu of minimum educational/experience requirements indicated above.
Certificates/Licenses/Registrations
At the discretion of the San Manuel Tribal Gaming Commission you may be required to obtain and maintain a gaming license.
San Manuel Band of Mission Indians and San Manuel Casino will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

As one of the largest private employers in the Inland Empire, San Manuel deeply cares about the future, growth and well-being of its employees. Join our team today!

You will help sales team to maximize their sales and attainment through analytics, reporting, data streams and KPIs. You will be the partner of sales managers and directors in forecasting, territory planning & management as well as their business review cadence. You are the trusted advisor of the sales management team and will make supporting recommendations on ways to improve productivity and scale of the M&A Go-To-Market Organization.

Job Overview

We are seeking a high-energy, motivated Senior Sales Operations Analyst to represent SS&C Intralinks as we continue to expand our market share as the leading virtual data room provider. SS&C Intralinks is utilized as a cloud content management tool in mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, capital raises, corporate restructuring, and other strategic transactions. Day to Day Responsibilities:
Own and execute timely, accurate, and insightful reports and analysis to field sales and sales management related to sales performance
Develop and present sales forecasts
Help sales team and sales management team prepare data for their team meetings as well as GTM/QBR meetings
Perform complex ad hoc analysis as required in support of Sales Organization
Analyze business needs, provide data and make recommendations to support sales management, field sales representatives, marketing and other business functional teams
Manage systems interfaces related to sales reporting, compensation, data processing, customer master data and territory management
Analyze issues and weakness in sales and operations process therefore can make recommendation to improve the processes to drive productivity and efficiency
Document processes and represent business group in corporate sales and marketing discussions
Assist with key sales planning activities during planning and budgeting cycle
Collaborate with Commission, Finance, IT and Business Technology and other divisions/departments to get tasks done and build cross functional relationship
Minimum Experience & Qualifications:
4+ years of sales operations experience
Sales operations experience in a software organization
Expert MS Office skills, particularly MS Excel
Experience digesting and articulating complex and accurate data to sales leaders within the organization
It would be great if you also had:
A Bachelor’s Degree
Experience using Salesforce
Experience using Tableau

Our Culture:

Stoneridge Software began with an idea: How can Microsoft implementations be done better? After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. As a Microsoft Gold Partner, weve developed a proven process for project delivery and a laser focus on long-term support to empower our clients success. We know how to work hard but we also know how important it is to balance work with family and the rest of our lives. Stoneridge Software has cultivated an atmosphere of trust, community, and support that includes a flexible working environment, unlimited vacation, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and even beer on-tap. These initiatives, and many more have resulted in numerous Best Workplace awards and happy team members. We focus on allowing our team members to be authentically themselves whether thats creative, serious or nerdy. Does this sound like a team you would like to be a part of?

What we are Looking for:

Stoneridge Software is looking for a passionate steward of data to lead, develop and test ERP data migrations that will meet client business demands for meaningful up to date data sets. We are looking for adaptable candidates with both a broad set of technology skills to be able to design and oversee these complex, iterative data projects as well as a deep technology skill set to be able to troubleshoot environments, data sets and performance issues as the project progresses. It is important, critical work that truly enables our clients to implement the best solutions for their business.

Include standards and guidelines for the effective and efficient delivery of enterprise data migration
Coordinate technical and functional requirements for data migration efforts and facilitate definition of project scope, goals and deliverables for development team supporting business needs
Represent subject matter expertise in business process, solution design, best practices, and technologies
Consult on technical environment requirements, setup and optimization as needed.
Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to document a clear set of requirements that can be interpreted by both business partners and data engineers
2-10 years of experience related to ERP data
Knowledge of data structures, hierarchies, business rule complexities
Proficient at integration and preparing, large, varied datasets for migration into an AX | D365 F&O Environment resulting in data that is congruent and reliable
Experienced in using iterative approaches that result in successful implementations
Possess a combination of business knowledge, strong problem solving skills, technical expertise and excellent written and communication skills.
Active listener who asks relevant questions to create relevant solution designs
Effective presenter able to deliver a solution in a way that makes sense for the requestor and addresses their primary needs
Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics AX and Finance & Operations
Travel Required: Incumbent is expected to meet regularly with client teams primarily in the Midwest but may be expected to travel across the country if the project requires.

Job Title: Commercial Auto Product Analyst - Remote Work from Home Opportunity
Job Description:
Overview


National Interstate is a member of Great American Insurance Group. As one of the leading commercial transportation insurers in the nation, we offer risk financing solutions in all 50 states tailored to meet the needs of a wide variety of transportation classes. Pattern Energy Group is an independent, fully integrated energy company that develops, constructs, owns and operates renewable energy projects and transmission assets across North America, Japan, and parts of Latin America. The company focuses primarily on wind, solar and transmission. The Pattern Energy Group team has a history as one of the top North American renewable energy and transmission providers in the industry. The team is dedicated to delivering the highest value for its customers, partners, financial supporters and the communities in which it works, while exhibiting a strong commitment to promoting environmental stewardship and corporate responsibility.
Pattern Energy Group operates in the United States, Canada, Japan, Netherlands and Mexico with offices in San Francisco, Houston, San Diego, New York, Amsterdam, Tokyo, and Toronto. Pattern Energy Group’s corporate headquarters is in San Francisco.

Provide a comprehensive overview of Pattern’s fleet of operating assets using key performance indicators to the Operations Management team and the Asset Management department. Additionally, provide key project management oversight for budgeting and forecasting of our operating business. Additionally, provide key oversight of our revenue performance, including the market performance of our energy management business

Performance Management
Support the group in the design, preparation and analysis of fleet performance for Operations team performance reviews, Executive Management reviews and other reporting activities.
Understand key drivers of performance variance and support the group in identifying and implementing performance improvement strategies.

Perform analysis as required to support Asset Management in performing revenue analysis and optimization.
Provide support to the organization in energy market risk management responsibilities including maintaining the market risk exposure model, reporting market risk metrics and understanding risk drivers, and supporting key compliance activities.
Project Manage the annual budget process for revenue including assisting in budget planning and logistics, incorporating inputs from SMEs (e.g. production, energy loss, market price, etc), and facilitating budget reviews.
Be primary responsible party for entering revenue budgets and forecasts into relevant corporate data systems.
Execute the reforecasting process for revenue including planning and logistics, incorporating inputs from SMEs, and facilitating reviews.

Experience/Qualifications/Education Required
Required Work Experience
Relevant project management skills and experience
Advanced computer proficiency including Microsoft product suite
Proficient in the use of Power BI and design and maintenance or reports
Experience in the financial analysis or management of energy assets
Intermediate to Advanced analytical, statistical, and financial modelling skills
Educational Requirements
A bachelor’s degree in business, finance, engineering or a related field is recommended
Additional Requirements
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Strong motivation and ability to be self-directed and work with little supervision or guidance
Strong learning skills and the ability to independently research, understand, and implement knowledge in new areas
Ability to work seamlessly across a wide range of disciplines both within and outside the group and the company to achieve project objectives
Ability to understand technical operational matters and translate them to commercial and financial analyses used for decision making
Understanding of power market operations inside and outside of organized markets

Position:
Sr. QA Automation Analyst
Job Description:


We currently have an opportunity for an enthusiastic, experienced Senior QA Automation Analyst to join our ECS Global Intelligent Automation (IA) team. This role will leverage their techno-functional knowledge and skills to help Test Automation COE design the testing automation framework & architecture, oversee the execution of the strategy and implementation of scalable IT QA automation solutions across Arrows technical landscape.

The individual in this role will be responsible for defining and promoting an automation testing mindset across IT and includes responsibilities such as planning, developing, and directing quality assurance automation testing policies, programs, and initiatives. Evaluates and monitors automated testing tools, methodologies, and to ensure effective testing and identification of defects.

Additionally, this individual will act as a relationship manager across senior IT leadership and other IT development teams to facilitate discussions and help prioritize the automation testing project queue, coordinate across all business groups and deliver projects and initiatives within the automation COE roadmap. This includes working with the business and technology areas to understand and drive requirements for IT delivery in a fast-paced environment.

In this role, you will become part of the ECS Global Intelligence Automation team reporting into the Director of Global ECS BI & Automation.

What You'll Be Doing
Partner with cross-functional Test automation COE IT leaders to generate ideas/opportunities to drive the strategic roadmap for the IT QA Automation function to ensure the highest standards of performance are consistently delivered by IT teams.
Lead definition of Testing Automation framework and implementation of IT testing automation standards, methodologies, and processes to be executed across technology releases. Drive implementation and continuous refinement of automation testing processes, environments, models, and tools to move towards continuous delivery (CI/CD) approach.
Develop strategy, build a business case, obtain executive approval for, and lead the execution of Strategic Automation Roadmap and Performance testing framework for the IT Quality Assurance function.
Lead design sessions with product owners/stakeholders across the organization to deliver innovative solutions through research, leadership, and mentoring.
Provides effective organizational leadership and collaboration as a part of the COE leadership Group. Maintains effective relationships with IT Management and Business leadership as well as external sourcing vendors to ensure that all IT processes are maintained and enhanced in support of the mission and goals
Ensuring projects meet service level expectations and are delivered on time and budget by holding contributors accountable for delivering on project milestones and deliverables.
Ensure root cause analysis and feedback of findings to identify underlying processes and reporting issues within IT quality processes and solutions. Based on quantitative insights developed per above, lead the development of recommended remediation actions or initiatives to drive improvements in technology quality performance levels.
What We Are Looking For
4-year degree from an accredited college/university in Information Systems or related field or equivalent related experience
At least 7-8 years of experience in IT development & Software quality practices including hands-on coding experience of Unit /Integration /System /Regression / Performance tests and test execution in an automation framework.
At least 5 years of leading/managing experience in leading a large, complex I.T. environment.
Must have experience in Production issue management and Quality Assurance disciplines, standards, processes, and workflow.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to articulate complex concepts diverse audiences speak non-technical when needed
Detail-oriented; strong organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple responsibilities, deadlines and changing priorities
Ability to deal with ambiguity and organizational agility to evaluate options and make informed and timely decisions
Demonstrated interpersonal and relationship building capabilities; effectively balance team building and a results-oriented approach.
Experience with large, complex, multi-national projects and teams; working collaboratively across the business and IT stakeholders to deliver solutions through traditional and agile methods.
Ability to define, articulate, and market Testing Automation COE vision and value statements across the stakeholder community.
Full knowledge of the SDLC framework and Waterfall, Scrum, and Agile project methodologies.
Well versed in the utilization of project artifacts including architecture design, requirements decomposition, and application development deliverables.
Hands-on experience with multiple automation testing tools (like Selenium, Jenkins, QTP, Quality Center, Postman and SOAP UI), automation frameworks (Cucumber, TestNG, etc.)
Exposure to a wide variety of business subject areas (Sales, Inventory, Marketing, Financials, Accounting/GL, etc.) Oracle R12 ERP and supply chain experience is highly preferred
Experience with CI/CD and Jenkins, version control tools like Bitbucket, SVN, etc.
Java/JS, SQL proficiency with experience in constructing/deconstructing complex queries, and a good understanding of various databases (Oracle, SQL Server, etc.)

We are currently seeking applicants for a Property & Investment Recovery Analyst in our Accounting & Finance Division located in Springfield, MO. This position provides management and oversight for 37,978 acres of property by performing ongoing analysis and evaluation to ensure maximum return on investment following internal, local, state, federal and legal requirements. You will provide oversight for land transactions including acquisition & sales, legal document management, maintenance of buildings and other structures, as well as coordination with various agricultural agencies, county assessor offices, and land agents. You will manage leases and work with tenants to ensure sound agricultural practices to maintain and enhance property values. Work includes coordinating with the Department of Conservation for oversight of a 10,000-acre lake including dock permitting. Responsibilities also include overseeing salvage of assets no longer required by AECI.

What does a typical day look like for you as a member of this team? You will:

· Serve as the primary resource for land owned by AECI which includes initiating and researching legal and financial transactions, lease management, managing documents, providing leadership and direction of investment recovery responsibilities and maintaining positive relationships with outside organizations regarding land and property

· Manage land records including purchase and sale transactions, warranty deeds and easements

· Manage processes for disposition of assets to optimize return on investment while utilizing recycling opportunities and assuring environmental requirements for disposal

· Oversee farming practices and approve an annual work plan developed by a committee for which you will oversee which includes members from property agents, USDA, MDC, MoCorn, MoSoy, Soil and Water Conservation, Natural Resources Conservation Service and the Department of Agriculture

· Support of hunting regulations and tenant support for following hunting regulations, as well as supporting activities related to reclamation for formerly mined property

What we are looking for:

· Demonstrated excellent planning, analysis, negotiation, organization and project management skills

· Strong relationship building skills with the ability to communicate effectively across our cooperative family, property owners, legal team, tenants of property and other utilities

· Supervisory or related experience providing oversight of other’s work is preferred

· Someone familiar with facility operations as related to an investment recovery program as well as knowledge in the field of Finance, Accounting, Budgeting and Agricultural practices

· Degree in business or agricultural field is preferred, or equivalent work experience

· At least four years of land management or accounting experience is required

Job Description:

Essential Functions and Job Responsibilities

The successful applicant will be responsible for, full project lifecycle of solutions within the VA’s premier CRM application suite based on Microsoft Dynamics 365 delivered via the Microsoft Government Community Cloud (GCC) Software as a Service (SaaS). In this capacity, you will coordinate with Information Technology staff and End Users on requested Microsoft Dynamics 365 customizations, and will review the functional and configuration requirements to design, develop, test, implement, and maintain a solution. You’ll participate in sprint activities including business process analysis, functional configuration of Dynamics 365, disciplined testing (unit, functional, regression) and reviews as a continuous process, to avoid finding issues at the end of sprint development. Co-ordinate with the customer and elicit requirements, document them as business processes as required, transform these business processes into features and capabilities, map them to D365 features and configuration. Your contributions will be vital to providing a positive, high quality user experience to our nation’s veterans.

The overall program supports the sustainment, operations, maintenance, and enhancement of the D365-based systems and their integrations with the VA’s enterprise supporting Customer Relationship Management (CRM) suite utilized by 70,000 VA employees. Previous experience working with MS Dynamics 365 / Dynamics CRM /Dynamics Customer Experience (CE) applications) is required. Experience working in support of Federal, State, or Tribal Governments, or a health care client is highly desired. The candidate will regularly interact with VA business stakeholders, VA Line of Business leadership and VA central office client stakeholders, including the Veterans Experience Office (VEO) staff, VA OIT leadership, and COR, and is expected to document and report any issues that arise. This position will be remote with limited support required in vendor facilities and/or a government site.

Duties and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the:
Learn and optimize customer-related business processes of the VA’s MS Dynamics 365 CRM application suite.
Perform business requirements elicitation and development of full-lifecycle solution development efforts which are based on Microsoft Dynamics 365 / CRM, Canvas or Model Driven frameworks
Lead the development of user stories, use cases and design artifacts to effectively convey requirements to both client stakeholders and development teams
Customize and optimize CRM applications in support of business functions
Support internal users on the use of Dynamics CRM
Assist with unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing prior to production deployment
Support system interruptions and ticket resolutions in customer required timeframes
Support to DevOps development teams test planning and execution;
Support review and risk assessment of Change Requests;
Communication of any issues, problems, or risks to leadership with recommended solutions;
Meeting attendance with program personnel and VA stakeholders and support to reporting efforts;
Preparation of ad-hoc reports and presentations for PMO and VA personnel, and;
Utilization of professional judgement, critical thinking skills and research to resolve issues affecting system performance.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in business related field, engineering, or a related scientific or technical discipline with at least 4 years of experience as a Sr. Business Analyst, Business Process Expert, or a Business Architect.
Knowledge of software development life-cycle methodologies
Experience working with Agile/SCRUM, writing user stories and following the development process through user story acceptance
Experience with Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, etc.)
Must have around 1 year of hands-on experience performing configurations and customizations on Microsoft Dynamics CRM/ D365 platform;
In-depth hands-on knowledge of the Microsoft Dynamics CRM platform.
Must be able to obtain a Position of Trust and successfully pass a thorough Government background screening process requiring the completion of detailed forms and fingerprinting
Desired Qualifications/skills:
Excellent client-facing written and oral communications skills;
D365 certifications, classes or exams;
Azure certifications, classes or exams;
ITSM experience;
Azure Dev Ops;
Previous Department of Veterans Affairs experience;
Previous experience supporting Contact Centers, and;
Active VA access including assigned CAG and PIV

Job Description

As I.T. Systems Senior Business Analyst, you will support and enhance larger and/or more complex Information Technology service line systems and initiatives in identifying project objectives, design, conversion, testing and implementation of project plans. You will also act as a liaison between business/clinical customers, vendors and Information Technology teams and may lead and guide lower level Business Analysts as needed.

Responsibilities Include:
Supports and enhances larger and more complex IT service line systems and initiatives through identification of project objectives (discovery), design, conversion, testing and implementation of project plans.
Utilizes understanding of the service line departmental operations and knowledge of the application inventory including purpose, business owner, vendor and high level functionality to support initiative completion.
Utilizes knowledge of Corporate IT direction and is able to assist customers leverage the strategy.
Interacts with business/clinical customers to understand needs and assist in collecting, documenting and analyzing business requirements. Documents and communicates clearly and timely with customers on project status and issues.
Engages appropriate health system resources and vendors to discuss and resolve challenges, technical solutions and associated cost estimates.
Meets with customers and vendors to define and resolve project issues.
Facilitates meetings with customers, clients, vendors and appropriate IT staff.
Ensures processes and systems are compliant with Health System policies, applicable laws and regulatory changes. Brings potential impact on service line operations to manager's attention.
Works with Project Manager to ensure a review and tracking process exists throughout the project life-cycle.
Leads efforts to discuss and document process workflow with the customer.
Reports on and documents outcomes, project benefits and improved processes. Recommends process improvement opportunities.
Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Business, Information Technology, Healthcare Administration or related field, required.
Minimum of five (5) years progressively responsible IT administration or technical experience, including experience leading projects, required. Thorough knowledge of IT functions, required.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, required.
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, required. Visio experience, preferred.
Knowledge of project management principles and process, preferred.
Knowledge of Project management tools (MS Project), preferred.

Job Description:

Essential Functions and Job Responsibilities

The successful applicant will be responsible for, full project lifecycle of solutions within the VA’s premier CRM application suite based on Microsoft Dynamics 365 delivered via the Microsoft Government Community Cloud (GCC) Software as a Service (SaaS). In this capacity, you will coordinate with Information Technology staff and End Users on requested Microsoft Dynamics 365 customizations, and will review the functional and configuration requirements to design, develop, test, implement, and maintain a solution. You’ll participate in sprint activities including business process analysis, functional configuration of Dynamics 365, disciplined testing (unit, functional, regression) and reviews as a continuous process, to avoid finding issues at the end of sprint development. Co-ordinate with the customer and elicit requirements, document them as business processes as required, transform these business processes into features and capabilities, map them to D365 features and configuration. Your contributions will be vital to providing a positive, high quality user experience to our nation’s veterans.

The overall program supports the sustainment, operations, maintenance, and enhancement of the D365-based systems and their integrations with the VA’s enterprise supporting Customer Relationship Management (CRM) suite utilized by 70,000 VA employees. Previous experience working with MS Dynamics 365 / Dynamics CRM /Dynamics Customer Experience (CE) applications) is required. Experience working in support of Federal, State, or Tribal Governments, or a health care client is highly desired. The candidate will regularly interact with VA business stakeholders, VA Line of Business leadership and VA central office client stakeholders, including the Veterans Experience Office (VEO) staff, VA OIT leadership, and COR, and is expected to document and report any issues that arise. This position will be remote with limited support required in vendor facilities and/or a government site.

Duties and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the:
Learn and optimize customer-related business processes of the VA’s MS Dynamics 365 CRM application suite.
Perform business requirements elicitation and development of full-lifecycle solution development efforts which are based on Microsoft Dynamics 365 / CRM, Canvas or Model Driven frameworks
Lead the development of user stories, use cases and design artifacts to effectively convey requirements to both client stakeholders and development teams
Customize and optimize CRM applications in support of business functions
Support internal users on the use of Dynamics CRM
Assist with unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing prior to production deployment
Support system interruptions and ticket resolutions in customer required timeframes
Support to DevOps development teams test planning and execution;
Support review and risk assessment of Change Requests;
Communication of any issues, problems, or risks to leadership with recommended solutions;
Meeting attendance with program personnel and VA stakeholders and support to reporting efforts;
Preparation of ad-hoc reports and presentations for PMO and VA personnel, and;
Utilization of professional judgement, critical thinking skills and research to resolve issues affecting system performance.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in business related field, engineering, or a related scientific or technical discipline with at least 4 years of experience as a Sr. Business Analyst, Business Process Expert, or a Business Architect.
Knowledge of software development life-cycle methodologies
Experience working with Agile/SCRUM, writing user stories and following the development process through user story acceptance
Experience with Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, etc.)
Must have around 1 year of hands-on experience performing configurations and customizations on Microsoft Dynamics CRM/ D365 platform;
In-depth hands-on knowledge of the Microsoft Dynamics CRM platform.
Must be able to obtain a Position of Trust and successfully pass a thorough Government background screening process requiring the completion of detailed forms and fingerprinting
Desired Qualifications/skills:
Excellent client-facing written and oral communications skills;
D365 certifications, classes or exams;
Azure certifications, classes or exams;
ITSM experience;
Azure Dev Ops;
Previous Department of Veterans Affairs experience;
Previous experience supporting Contact Centers, and;
Active VA access including assigned CAG and PIV

Property & Investment Recovery Analyst

Location:
Headquarters Address:
Springfield, MO Job Type:
Full-Time

We are currently seeking applicants for a Property & Investment Recovery Analyst in our Accounting & Finance Division located in Springfield, MO. This position provides management and oversight for 37,978 acres of property by performing ongoing analysis and evaluation to ensure maximum return on investment following internal, local, state, federal and legal requirements. You will provide oversight for land transactions including acquisition & sales, legal document management, maintenance of buildings and other structures, as well as coordination with various agricultural agencies, county assessor offices, and land agents. You will manage leases and work with tenants to ensure sound agricultural practices to maintain and enhance property values. Work includes coordinating with the Department of Conservation for oversight of a 10,000-acre lake including dock permitting. Responsibilities also include overseeing salvage of assets no longer required by AECI.

What does a typical day look like for you as a member of this team? You will:

· Serve as the primary resource for land owned by AECI which includes initiating and researching legal and financial transactions, lease management, managing documents, providing leadership and direction of investment recovery responsibilities and maintaining positive relationships with outside organizations regarding land and property

· Manage land records including purchase and sale transactions, warranty deeds and easements

· Manage processes for disposition of assets to optimize return on investment while utilizing recycling opportunities and assuring environmental requirements for disposal

· Oversee farming practices and approve an annual work plan developed by a committee for which you will oversee which includes members from property agents, USDA, MDC, MoCorn, MoSoy, Soil and Water Conservation, Natural Resources Conservation Service and the Department of Agriculture

· Support of hunting regulations and tenant support for following hunting regulations, as well as supporting activities related to reclamation for formerly mined property

What we are looking for:

· Demonstrated excellent planning, analysis, negotiation, organization and project management skills

· Strong relationship building skills with the ability to communicate effectively across our cooperative family, property owners, legal team, tenants of property and other utilities

· Supervisory or related experience providing oversight of other’s work is preferred

· Someone familiar with facility operations as related to an investment recovery program as well as knowledge in the field of Finance, Accounting, Budgeting and Agricultural practices

· Degree in business or agricultural field is preferred, or equivalent work experience

· At least four years of land management or accounting experience is required

AECI provides a competitive total compensation package including paid health care and dental premiums starting on day one with vision plans available. Basic life, short-term disability and long-term disability are paid for by AECI as well as a 401k with an employer match. Invest in yourself with our tuition reimbursement and enjoy time away with Paid Time Off (PTO) and paid holidays. Wellness incentives and employee assistance programs are also available. Come join a team where your talents are appreciated, your voice is heard, and your work has an impact!

To apply for a position, please visit www.aeci.org/careers and complete your profile. You will be able to upload additional applicant documents (i.e. resume, cover letter) and apply for a position. AECI is fully committed to the concept and practice of equal opportunity and affirmative action in all aspects of employment. Please reference the contact information above if you require assistance in filling out an application. Individuals with disabilities should request reasonable accommodations in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act prior to an appointment.

The San Manuel Band of Mission Indians (Tribe) is a self-governing nation and as such has established tribal-managed governmental units to enhance and support services on the San Manuel reservation. The San Manuel Tribal Gaming Commission (SMTGC) is the governmental unit that was created by tribal ordinance as the primary regulator of gaming activities within the Tribes jurisdiction. The SMTGC, which includes the Compliance Department, is responsible for maintaining legal and regulatory compliance, ensuring a high level of game integrity, preventing fraud, waste and abuse, and safeguarding Tribal assets, employees and patrons.

The Regulatory Analyst plays an essential function in maintaining a strong and effective regulatory environment within the San Manuel jurisdiction. The incumbent will conduct regulatory research and develop regulations consistent with applicable laws and SMTGCs long-term strategies.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

1. Research and analyze applicable laws and regulations to create timely deliverables, citing the appropriate authorities with supporting justifications.

2. Maintain the Gaming Commission Regulations to meet all applicable laws, while considering industry practices, and applying a strategic approach to regulatory compliance.

3. Produce research reports, policy statements, briefing materials, official correspondence, and presentations.

4. Provide regulatory assessments and guidance to support day-to-day regulatory issues, new initiatives, and developments.

5. Communicate regulatory changes across the organization with appropriate documentation, sharing the reasoning, addressing concerns, and furthering SMTGCs regulatory mission.

6. Track, manage, and assist with projects within the SMTGCs Compliance Department.

7. Maintain library of regulations and related communication.

8. Perform other duties as assigned to support the efficient operation of the department.

Education/Experience/Qualifications
Bachelors Degree in business administration or a related field is required.
Three (3) years of regulatory/legal research work experience is required. Paralegal experience is preferred.
Equivalent combination of education and progressive, relevant and direct experience may be considered in lieu of minimum educational/experience requirements indicated above.
Analytical thinker with the ability to evaluate theoretical proposals using legal research to construct a framework for achieving compliance.
Ability to comprehend and interpret legal or regulatory documents is required.
Strong technical writing skills with an attention to detail is required.
Demonstrates an expert level of proficiency in researching, including search strategy and syntax.
Certificates/Licenses/Registrations
At the discretion of the San Manuel Tribal Gaming Commission you may be required to obtain and maintain a gaming license.
A qualified candidate/employee must have a valid drivers license with an acceptable driving record as determined by the companys insurance carrier.
San Manuel Band of Mission Indians and San Manuel Casino will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

As one of the largest private employers in the Inland Empire, San Manuel deeply cares about the future, growth and well-being of its employees. Join our team today!

EIS is an insurance software company that enables leading insurers to innovate and operate like a tech company: fast, simple, agile. Founded in 2008, EIS provides an open, flexible platform of core systems and digital solutions allowing insurers to accelerate and scale innovation, launch products faster, deliver new revenue channels, and create experiences the world will love. We are looking for smart, dynamic and intuitive people to join our growing team of insurance technology professionals and industry experts – this particular opportunity is for an experienced Business Analyst.

About the Role

The Business Analyst facilitates business rules definition and improvement that insurance companies applies to data in order to determine optimal business outcomes. This role requires you to learn and understand the insurance domain, business processes and workflows. You will manage the requirements development process through the elicitation, analysis, specification, implementation and verification of multiple levels of requirements from an end-to-end perspective and supports the client personnel through all the project lifecycle.

The Business Analyst will implement and test business rules, coordinate and manage the integration of products or new features for clients as well as perform client training.

The outcomes of your analysis are documented into a set of decision models containing business rules in form of Excel tables executable by our Business Rules engine (proprietary OpenL Tablets) which are verified to be correct and work well with the rest of insurance suite.

The Business Analyst is responsible for business rules definition and improvement utilized by insurance companies to be applied to their data in order to determine optimal business results.

Responsibilities
Plan and hold meetings and workshops with the client, be responsible for client communication
Collect and analyze customer requirements documentation (most of the requirements are presented in Excel spreadsheets)
Consolidate information into structured view
Document and verify Rating methodology
Implement Rating rules in EIS Rater format (implementation is done using OpenL Tablets syntax in Excel spreadsheets)
Coordinate functional and user acceptance testing by defining the testing strategy, scheduling resources and tracking test performance
Assist in the development of data models mappings and integration specifications
Define Rating versioning and maintenance requirements as well as other nonfunctional requirements
Track and monitor analysis progress with status reporting
Review and coordinate customer approval and change management
Review and coordinate alignment with other insurance suite components
Plan and conduct client training
Define requirements and contribute into EIS Rater continues improvement
Requirements
Minimum of 2 years experience as a Business Analyst
The ideal candidate will have previous academic and/or professional experience in Insurance, Finance, Economics, Mathematics or similar domains
Demonstrated ability to work successfully on large IT projects using complex logic, decision making / decision modeling or business rules with minimal supervision
Previous experience in MS Excel is a big advantage
Proven analytical aptitude
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Problem solving skills evidenced by demonstrated results in past positions
Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple/detail-oriented tasks
Ability to influence at all levels of the organization
Ability to travel to client sites (minimal)

GAINSCO Auto Insurance® markets non-standard private passenger automobile products through retail agencies, in Texas, New Mexico, Arizona, Ohio, Oklahoma, Florida, Georgia, South Carolina, Tennessee, Alabama, Utah and Virginia. GAINSCO Auto Insurance® has fully integrated insurance capabilities, including marketing, underwriting, customer service and claims handling. Our operations are bilingual (English/Spanish).

Due to company growth, GAINSCO Auto Insurance has an immediate opening for a SeniorCompliance and Product Analyst. We are looking for driven individuals who want career advancement and the opportunity to make a significant impact on our leading organization.

By joining GAINSCO, you will become part of a dynamic and growing organization that has been recognized as one of the Top Workplaces in Dallas and Miami. In 2015, the GAINSCO Dallas home office was one of only 150 companies in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area to be recognized by the Dallas Morning News as a“Top Workplace 2015.” The Miami office was also recognized as one of the Top 35 Workplaces in its size category.

Our culture attracts engaged individuals who have a desire to contribute and succeed in a dynamic, exciting and growing team environment. Our culture encourages individuals to grow their skills as they build their careers. Come join us and become a champion with GAINSCO.

Job Description: The Senior Compliance and Product Analyst or Manager is responsible for projects and analysis related to compliance, new state entry and product development. He/She must identify regulatory, statutory and case law changes and determine how they will impact our business and effectively communicate the steps we must take to respond to the changes in large multi-departmental settings that include Senior Management. He/She will also use critical perspective and analysis to research, identify, and evaluate new product opportunities and modify existing procedures based on knowledge of the auto insurance marketplace, case law, statutory, and regulatory research, business metrics, and discussions with other departments.

Essential Job Requirements:
Understand compliance and how it relates to insurance.
Provide strategic direction for law changes and ensure regulatory compliance with state and federal regulations and statutes.
Ensure compliance issues are appropriately identified, evaluated, investigated and resolved.
Experience reading and/or creating a Personal Auto Policy.
Create product requirements, specification and timelines.
Must consider multiple distribution channels when modifying existing products and rules or designing new ones.
Coordinate and lead research and implementation efforts to move our pricing, underwriting and customer acquisition efforts forward, including adding new underwriting reports and rating variables to our class plan.
Create and analyze reports on business metrics.
Required behaviors for all positions:
Communicate with co-workers, management, customers, vendors, and others in a courteous and professional manner.
Conform with and abide by all Company codes, regulations, policies, values, work procedures and instructions.
Regular attendance.
Education: Bachelor’s degree, with preference given to Law, Insurance, Finance, Statistics, Math, Accounting, or a related field of study.

Experience: Two or more years’ experience as a Compliance and/or Product Analyst, preferably with personal auto insurance products. Proven problem solving and analytical skills used to make decisions regarding the Product. Experience working with Product, Marketing and Actuarial departments for new state implementation and research and development of business requirements. Experience with personal automobile policy contract language construct and other insurance documents including but not limited to the declarations page, named driver exclusions, cancellations, etc.

Skills and Abilities: Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to effectively present summary of analytical work and ideas to Senior Management, other departments and staff; Ability to gather, extract, monitor, format and understand information and express ideas effectively at all levels of the organization; strong analytical skills, problem solving, and research skills; Excellent organizational and time management skills; must be able to multi-task, prioritize, and organize; strong collaborative skills and experience working with and managing multi-functional project teams; Excellent project management skills; Excellent analytical or quantitative aptitude; strong problem solving skills; Experience with Westlaw and/or LexisNexis, SAS, SQL, or Power BI is preferred.

Job Title: Channel Partner Portal Analyst - Secureworks Sales
Job Description:
Channel Partner Portal Analyst

Secureworks (SCWX-NASDAQ) is a global leader in intelligence-driven information security solutions. We help organizations confidently pursue business goals in a digitally-connected world. Consistently recognized by industry analysts and readers’ polls, we are one of the best in the world at understanding and anticipating threat behavior. We see 250 billion events every day across 4400 clients in more than 55 countries, and our solutions work across all the layers of a client’s security environment, including 330 different vendor technologies. Join a talented, dedicated, and diverse team of researchers, analysts, engineers, consultants and business professionals who are focused 100% on protecting our clients from cyber threats. We seek out the brightest minds and empower our teams with the tools and support they need to fight the bad guys and maintain our company’s leadership in the cyber security industry.

Uniquely positioned to adapt as the industry evolves, we are also proud to be part of the Dell Technologies family. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team.

The Channel Partner Portal Analyst position is a mid-level role within the Secureworks Sales Operations Team. This individual would be a professional staff member, who is detail-oriented, works well in a team environment, is knowledgeable about the core functions of the company, easily accessible to all levels of staff and management and is client focused. The Channel Partner Portal Analyst is expected to manage multiple tasks and functions with limited supervision. They are also expected to provide input on current processes, make recommendations on improvements, and provide ongoing support for ad-hoc projects.

Role Overview

SecureWorks seeks a talented, self-directed individual to join our Global Sales Operations team to support a number of channel operations functions. The Channel Partner Portal Analyst will execute key components of the channel partner management cycle related to contract and account set up and management, communication to partners, and issue resolution.

This role will also identify process improvements to increase the administrative efficiency and revenue effectiveness of the channel programs. To accomplish this, the Channel Partner Portal Analyst will act as a liaison between Sales/Sales Management, Marketing, Finance, and Information Technology groups working closely with functional leaders and subject matter experts to document business processes, identify business requirements, project manage initiatives and drive adoption of new processes.

Responsibilities
Understand and become functional expert in all components of the Secureworks channel sales strategy and operations
Drive the ideation, development, implementation and adoption of process enhancements to improve the partner experience
Establish new partners in Secureworks business systems (Salesforce, Workday) for access to resources (ex: Training, Marketing materials, Deal Registration)
Develop process improvements for establishing new partners in Secureworks business systems, documenting and reporting upon referral payments, and executing monthly communications for the compensation cycle
Develop and deliver regular reporting and analytics for various stakeholders including SecureWorks sales leadership, Dell sales leadership, and partners themselves
Develop strong cross functional relationships with Sales, Marketing, IT, and Finance to effectively collaborate with business stakeholders
Represent Channel Sales organization on cross-functional Salesforce Circle of Excellence (COE) and drive enhancements supporting channel business processes
Channel Database Information Management
As a managed security provider, Dell SecureWorks expects its employees to understand and apply commonly known security practices and possess a working knowledge of applicable industry controls such as NIST 800-53. Employees will be expected to acknowledge their security responsibilities in writing prior to gaining access to company systems. Employees will be required to maintain a working knowledge of local security policies and execute general controls as assigned.

Requirements
5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, Sales or Systems Consultant for a mid-to-large sized sales organization
Previous experience with sales tools and technologies (Salesforce.com, etc.)
Strong capabilities in Excel and Tableau reporting platforms
Demonstrated experience analyzing current business processes and developing improvement projects that have not been specifically requested
Demonstrated experience driving requested business process improvement projects from requirements gathering to completion
Demonstrated ability to calculate and sell the ROI for a project that may not be initially understood by others
Demonstrated ability to prioritize work from multiple sources and communicate deadlines effectively
Demonstrated ability to teach yourself a new technical skill and then utilize that skill to drive efficiencies
Preferred
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Information Systems, or equivalent
5-7 years related experience within a professional services, sales, or customer support operations role
Previous working experience with Channel Sales-oriented data within a Channel Sales organization
Experience with SalesForce.com – Sales Cloud and Community Cloud
Experience with large data sets and turning them into insights

Technology Opportunity in Financial Services

Senior Information Security Analyst

Location: 20 E Thomas Road, Phoenix, AZ 85012

All qualified internal applicants, irrespective of location, will be considered for all internally posted roles at this time. Compensation range displayed in internal postings is the national average, and compensation decisions will be employee-location based.

Summary:

The Senior Information Security Analyst performs and fulfills critical security operations roles associated with the Firms commitment to timely monitoring and incident response. The selected candidate will participate as an incident responder on a team that monitors, analyzes, and responds to information security related threats such as commodity malware, policy violations, and advanced persistent threats.

Members of the SOC/CIRT are also tasked with supporting the efforts of Threat Intelligence, Risk Management, and Forensics. Additionally, the Senior Information Security Analyst participates in projects and initiatives to help design and implement information security controls in processes and systems.

The successful candidate will be a highly technical, passionate, and self-driven individual who loves to learn, solve problems, and contribute to the advancement of the team.

Why Advisor Group?
Competitive salary and annual bonus paid based on performance
Generous time off package, including paid time off, paid holidays, and paid time to volunteer in the community
Immediate access to extensive benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision coverage, basic life insurance, long and short-term disability coverage and much more
401(k) match from day one of employment
Referral bonuses if we hire your referred applicants to our open positions
An enriching and engaging career in financial services our employees overwhelmingly report that they find meaning and purpose in their day to day work
Executive leader access and interaction in all our locations due to flat structure, open office environments, town halls and speed mentoring events
Responsibilities:
Work as part of a team of Information Security professionals supporting a leading financial services institution
Triage and respond to information security incidents reported via SIEM, ticketing system, email, etc.
Perform root cause analysis, document findings and collaborate with technology/process owners to prevent future occurrences
Research, analyze and understand log sources originating from security and networking devices such as firewalls, routers, proxy, anti-virus products, and operating systems.
Automate manual processes via scripting
Perform raw data review in threat hunting efforts to identify malicious activity for which signatures/content do not exist
Assist with the development of new content and tuning/filtering of existing content for SIEM, IDS, and other security technologies
Assist management in ensuring the team is executing on core responsibilities such as working incidents through to completion, ticket queue maintenance, documentation evergreen, training requirements, etc
Work with management to define/update standard operating procedures and response plans
Support efforts of internal and external security partners and cross-functional teams during all phases of the Incident Response process.
Serve as a primary escalation point for the Security Analyst Is
Train, mentor, and oversight of the Security Analyst Is through skill proficiency assessments, brown bag presentations, etc.
Manage or contribute to projects that directly correspond to the maturity and/or capabilities of the Security Operations team.
Support design initiatives, implementation and maintenance of information security technologies
Perform other security-related duties as requested
Education & Experience Requirements:
Bachelors degree in information technology or a related field preferred. Job Description

Summary

The ideal candidate for the Associate Director of Business Manager Position would have a strong financial acumen that can translate complex client finances into deliverables and action items for the agency team. (Client Services, Production, Finance, Creative)

The candidate would also understand the scope of our client work and how they work impacts the client finances. With that knowledge, the candidate will be able to oversee the management and reporting of the client’s finances.

Assisted by a Financial Analyst, the Associate Director Business Manager partners with the department leads acting as the team’s financial strategist and reporter.

He/she is responsible for the oversite of each account’s forecasting, ensuring that all internal targets are tracked and updated based on current client trends.

Financial Responsibilities:
Client-facing lead on all financial client request; pertaining to: Budget Management and Reporting, Accruals, Invoicing, and other adhoc needs.

Needs to provide clear communication around staffing forecasts and allocations as they relate to the revenue phasing.

Partners with department leads to identify and manage true resource needs (internal and external) across the agency team

Identifies and helps resolve people/account conflicts with practical solutions
Partners with Lead Producer in contract management (client, vendor, and inter-company issues)
Promotes and contributes to Heartbeats culture and environment
Demonstrates strong, professional work ethic

Edelman Financial Engines is seeking an experienced professional to join its procurement team in Boston, MA.

This position is responsible for contributing to the procurement function to address Edelman Financial Engines procurement needs for travel and tactical operational and reporting functions in supporting the Procure-to-Pay lifecycle. The Procurement Analyst will help build a center of excellence supporting 1500+ employees nationally across multiple office locations reporting into the Head of Procurement in Boston, MA. The Procurement function is a centralized shared services function. The role requires multi-tasking and strong organizational skills to manage individual travel requests as well as departmental events and offsite functions when booking/negotiating travel contracts as well as managing travel relationships with hotels, the company’s travel agency, Ovation Travel and event planner, Wings. This position will utilize several tools including Concur, Excel, DocuSign and NetSuite to run reports, process contracts for signature, filing contracts into the Procurement Database and follow through on Purchase Order creation as well as managing active Purchase Orders across the firm. The candidate should have familiarity with the overall procurement experience including project management and spends analytics.

In addition, the role is to create and maintain strong internal relationships to understand, support and guide the business goals while providing assertive leadership in mitigating risk supporting the firm’s T&E and Procurement Policies.

Responsibilities
Manage contracts and maintain vendor relationships as related to administration, negotiation and operational issues in hotels, meetings, events/offsites, ground and other travel areas
Challenge spend behavior for measurable improvements in specific metrics, goals and objectives
Maintain Concur travel booking tool as the Administrator and run travel reporting for L1 review and compliance.
Work collaboratively with Accounts Payable Manager on T&E issues and AMEX corporate credit card program.
Responsible for the growth, advancement and performance of the Procurement Function at Edelman Financial Engines. Contribute to updates and changes in the corporate Procurement Policies and Procedures.
Proven excellence and leadership capabilities in customer service and timely response and feedback to inquires

Self-driven motivated leader with proven success in building relationships with internal and external clients. Proficient in leading the decision-making process when selecting the best solutions and vendors in driving the business forward.
Seen as an integral role and team player to the organization and proven ability to multi-task
Fosters cooperation and teamwork at all levels throughout the firm developing an environment of creativity and productivity.
Support innovation, experimentation and strategic thinking in the workplace
Build morale, foster a creative and open environment for problem solving, exchange of ideas and learning
Excellent Communicator – demonstrates excellent written communication and interpersonal skills across all levels of the organization.

Self-driven and takes ownership of the projects and tasks assigned and follows through timely to completion

REPORTS TO: Managing Director, Business Intelligence

Organization Overview:

The Jewish Federations of North America (“JFNA”) represents 146 Jewish Federations and over 300 Network communities, which raise and distribute more than $3 billion annually for social welfare, social services and educational needs. The Federation movement, collectively among the top 10 charities on the continent, protects and enhances the well-being of Jews worldwide through the values of tikkun olam (repairing the world), tzedakah (charity and social justice) and Torah (Jewish learning).

POSITION SUMMARY:

JFNA is looking for a Business Analyst to join a new Business Intelligence team. The Business Analyst will work independently and together with the Senior Business Analyst, Business Intelligence under the guidance of the Managing Director to support monthly, annual and ad hoc data collection from the Federation network, with a focus on revenue data. The Business Analyst will support internal and external stakeholders by helping to coordinate data collection and analysis; producing meaningful, accurate, and timely reporting; and recommending improvements to JFNA’s data environment and practices. The Business Analyst will work collaboratively across teams to collect business requirements, document business processes, and develop recommendations.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ensure timely collection of data from the Federation network by coordinating data collection schedule, tracking completion by Federation staff, performing quality checks, and raising concerns as required
Train and advise Federations on accurate reporting of data
Coordinate data collection efforts across JFNA program areas
Design and execute meaningful and user-friendly reports for JFNA and Federation professionals and leadership
Document business processes and key performance indicators (KPIs)
Handle Salesforce customer support requests as they come in: forgotten passwords, process confusion, data upload needs, report/dashboard creation needs, etc.
Ensure data cleanliness by running duplicate merge processes and scanning for any human or computer errors in the data. Run routine and project-based database maintenance
Partner with consultants to integrate support of JFNA processes and KPIs into strategic Salesforce platform
Identify opportunities to extend data collection to support other JFNA program needs
Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor Degree or higher
Minimum 2 years of experience in a business analyst, data analyst or business intelligence role
Comfortable with data, statistical analysis, and quantitative reporting
Strong Excel skills
Strong interpersonal communication skills; excellent oral and written communication skills
Excellent project management and organizational skills with attention to detail and commitment to follow-through
Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team
DESIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:
Business Intelligence software such as PowerBI, Tableau
Database design / management, query design
Understanding of the capabilities of Salesforce, including security controls (profiles, permission sets, public groups, queues, sharing settings), process automation tools (workflows, flows, process builder), and business application development (custom objects, custom fields, page layouts, record types, apps, tabs)
Experience working in an Agile environment
Knowledge of fundraising, experience with NFP, knowledge of Jewish communal organizations and Federations

Monday, June 8, 2020

The IMM is an independent group within ISO New England that produces interesting analysis and works to protect the markets from manipulation. This analyst will have the opportunity to work on innovative electricity producing technology projects, such as standalone battery storage, co-located storage facilities and offshore wind. The analyst will interact with developers, conduct production cost modeling analysis and evaluate offers in the energy and capacity markets for withholding.

How you will make an impact:
Develop and use financial and engineering models to estimate and evaluate a generator’s marginal cost. Create and analyze large datasets containing generator offers and fuel input data. Develop screening tools to identify tariff violations and market manipulation in the energy market.
Perform the energy market mitigation duties as prescribed in the ISO-NE Tariff, including the participation in the monitoring and mitigation on-call rotation, which includes weekends.
Create production cost models for existing resources seeking changes to reference values, and create production cost models for new resources entering the energy market for the purpose of energy market mitigation. Identify maintenance work that could have a performance impact on the resource, and account of the changes in the resource’s reference levels.
Stay up to date on cost benchmarking for various vintages of power plants (older technologies as well as new cutting edge technologies)
Forward Capacity Market:
Evaluate new generators seeking to enter the capacity market and existing capacity generators seeking to exit the capacity market in accordance with the ISO-NE Tariff in preparation for the annual Forward Capacity Auction.
Perform “due diligence” quality reviews of financial reports, project financing models, risk assessments and engineering studies associated with the development of new capacity resources and the removal of existing capacity resources from the New England Forward Capacity Market.
Assist in the development, testing and implementation of tools required to operate the IMM component of the Forward Capacity Market rules.
What we are looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Finance or related technical field preferred.
5+ years of wholesale electricity market or electric utility industry experience. The ideal candidate will have a focus in Engineering, including Production Cost and Plant Performance modeling.
Familiarity with wholesale electric and natural gas markets, as well as an understanding of opportunity costs associated with each market. Knowledge of power plant asset life cycle (build -> operation -> retire) desirable
Ability to quickly analyze data, and devise power plant buying and selling strategies, from the perspective of a profit maximizing market participant.
Ability to identify loopholes in the current electricity and/or gas market rules, and imagine how a participant could exploit the loopholes.
Demonstrate ability to work quickly, meet deadlines and work efficiently with others.
Experience with Excel, SAS, SQL or other relational database software to perform analysis on large databases (desirable)
Financial Analysis skills - understanding of discounted cash flow models and modeling techniques
Experience with risk evaluation techniques
Excellent written and oral communication skills, and ability to work in a team environment

ISO New England oversees the 24/7 operation of the power grid that covers the six-states of New England and administers the region’s $10+ billion “stock exchange” for the buying and selling of wholesale electricity. The power system is constantly evolving as new technologies emerge and energy policies evolve. There is a lot going on at our organization behind the scenes to make sure the grid continuously yields reliable electricity at competitive prices while addressing the unique challenges that come along with our industry.
