Under limited direction, uses extensive knowledge and skills obtained through education and experience to contribute to the success of the HR Product Management team and our support of HR & firm initiatives in two primary ways. First, by providing business analysis expertise to support HR systems with a primary focus on PeopleSoft HCM 9.2 Core HR & Benefits. Second, by providing project management support to the HR Technology team for small to medium sized projects.

This role will interface extensively with HR Business Partners, HR Centers of Excellence, departments outside HR and external vendors to identify, research, analyze and resolve complex issues. This role will be responsible for building innovative business and technical requirements, system configurations, and managing a variety of HR related projects that will support our evolving processes, systems and business infrastructure.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Provide business analysis support for HR systems, including analyzing and documenting business processes and translating user requirements into Business Requirements Documents (BRDs).
Participate in the planning, development, testing and deployment of system solutions with a focus on efficiency and automation.
Collaborate with IT to develop work estimates, requirements, design and implementation/deployment plans for technical solutions to business needs within approved project budgets and timelines.
Regularly communicate with all HR functions including HR Business Partner Groups, Talent Acquisition, and Total Rewards (Compensation and Benefits) to understand their objectives, identify process or technology gaps, document business requirements, and implement streamlined business processes or technology solutions.
Develop and maintain project schedules and produce project reports and documentation as needed.
Review operational procedures and methods, define, analyze and map current business processes, identify best practices, and recommend improvements.
Maintain setup and configuration to support system functionality and business requirements, documenting any changes to environments.
Manage and coordinate all UAT tasks including developing a test strategy, creating and executing test scripts, performing regression testing and approving changes for deployment and implementation in the Production environment.
Contribute to, review and approve Business Requirement Documents (BRD), Functional Design Documents (FDD), and technical solutions proposed by our IT partners that support the improvement of business processes and system functionality.
Support IT partners with Production deployments as needed during non-business hours (evenings and weekends) to perform manual configurations and user validations.
Serve as key technical resource to provide support in analysis and troubleshooting of system problems while assuming ownership of problems to resolution.
Respond to and quickly resolve escalated tier 2 issues for the PeopleSoft HCM system and other HR systems.
Participate in vendor interface and integration discussions and translate into system and data requirements to meet the business need.
Provide training to users on system functionality and capabilities as needed to ensure successful implementation of system enhancements
Support other HR Technology members with special projects as needed
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Knowledge of:
Leveraging technology in a corporate environment.
Concepts of risk management, issue tracking, change management, and business requirements gathering.
Business process analysis including creating and interpreting process maps and flowcharts.
Organizational policies and procedures.
Skill in:
Gathering and interpreting information from multiple sources and making recommendations for solutions.
Strong analytical and organizational skills.
Identifying, troubleshooting, documenting and escalating application problems.

Ability to:
Effectively communicate information and ideas through multiple channels (written, oral, formal presentation) including preparing reports, summaries, and written communications to HR management, user groups, and IT partners.
Work to deliver team goals with the greatest potential for producing positive business results.
Exercise judgment by using effective practices for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions.
Translate technical concepts to business audience and business information to a technical audience.
Work with short deadlines and effectively manage priorities.
Use data to identify opportunities and solutions to business and technical problems.
Organize, manage and track multiple detailed tasks and assignments with frequently changing priorities in a fast-paced work environment.
Work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment.

Educational/Previous Experience Requirements:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree with five (5) years or more experience required OR an equivalent combination of education, experience and training.
System Administration experience with PeopleSoft HCM or other HRIS system required. Experience with three or more of the following modules preferred: Core HR, Benefit Administration, Absence Management, Compensation, Time and Labor, ESS, or MSS.
Strong HR business process understanding required
Experience developing and writing business requirements required
Strong Excel and Data Analysis skills required.
Strong communication and collaboration skills required.
High focus on attention-to-detail required.
Maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive and personal data required.
Experience with writing/modifying SQL, or PS Query required.
Experience with Total Rewards functions (compensation and benefits) and workforce planning preferred.
Experience with Visio (or other flowcharting tool) and MS Project (or other project management tool) preferred.
Licenses/Certifications:
None required.

Primary Responsibilities:
This position will provide experienced Project Analyst (PA) support to the AIRWorks (AWx) KC-130T and CMV-22 COMMS Kitting Project Lead (PL) and the AIRWorks (AWx) Program Executive Officer, Aviation (PEO (A)) Portfolio Manager (PM).

The PA is responsible for executing all project activities to include support and analysis, acquisition support planning, procurement contracting, creating and managing schedules/spend plans, resource management, plan of action/milestones, document and data management, and sustaining activities for the KC-130T and CMV-22 COMMS Kitting projects. The PA will be responsible for communicating with team members, customers, stakeholders and other technical competencies on a daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly basis to maintain project performance, cost, schedule sufficient to identify critical path delays and provide related mitigation strategies. The PA will also conduct Project Management Reviews consisting of C/S/P planning, documentation, tracking, reporting and associated metrics for the AIRWorks PM to adequately establish resource requirements and ensure project requirements are attained.

Tasks Performed:

The candidate will lead the effort in the planning and execution of project C/S/P to include the following:
Direct Project Execution Strategy (PES) and Proposal execution
Review Statements of Work (SOW), Performance Specifications, Request for Proposals and Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL)
Review and track contract deliverables and milestones; track and report performance to plan
Detailed file and data retrieval organizational skills that support team members need for access to large amounts of data
Provide project control in various areas including but not limited to developing Standard Work Packages (SWP), Rough Order of Magnitude (ROM), spend plans, acquisition documentation and activities, and program technical documentation
Provide project support during project reviews, Systems Engineering Technical Review (SETR), Test & Evaluation (T&E) and/or Logistics events, to include coordination, reporting status (C/S/P), and project closeout
Administer supply chain management activities, master equipment listing management activities, deliverable acceptance and rejection activities
Work with systems engineering in support of system definition, development, integration, verification methods, modeling and simulation, test and evaluation, supportability efforts, interoperability requirements across a wide range of aircraft hardware and software systems
Support the class desk activities for EDRAP inputs and routing
Draft and maintain systems requirements, schedules, resources, and technical / project performance activities
Ensure vendor provided GFE is compliant with government specifications and TAE requirements
Plan, analyze and evaluate engineering, technical and product support efforts used to
a) define total systems/subsystem requirements

b) translate requirements into design criteria

c) evaluate alternative approaches

d) develop system specifications for the systems and subsystems
Work with Government and Industry engineering, product support, manufacturing and program manager personnel, including technical experts from various DoD entities
Develop procurement packages (purchase cards, simplified acquisitions, large SBIR) and track to award, working with contract specialists
Develop documents (Statement of Work, CDRLs, etc.) for Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR)
Provide support for SETR events (SRR, PDR, CDR)
Work closely with AS9100 managers and PM to maintain document integrity and to confirm the SharePoint site is audit ready
Manage the development of organic software, ordering hardware, Cyber products (IATT/ATO), Mission Planning, etc
Oversee AIRWorks procurement and kitting for the production effort
Facilitate the use ISEE for SETR processes
Education: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university. Master's Degree from an accredited college or university.

Experience:

JOURNEYMAN: A Journeyman level person within a labor category has 3 to 10 years of experience related to the functional duties for that labor category and a BA/BS degree. A Journeyman level person typically performs all functional duties independently.

SENIOR: A Senior level person within a labor category has over 10 years of experience related to the functional duties for that labor category and a MA/MS degree. A Senior level person typically works on high-visibility or mission critical aspects of a given program and performs all functional duties independently. A Senior level person may oversee the efforts of less senior staff and/or be responsible for the efforts of all staff assigned to a specific job.

Allowable Experience/Education Substitutions: Six (6) years' additional relevant work experience may be substituted for a Bachelors Degree. Associates Degree plus four (4) years' relevant work experience may be substituted for a Bachelors Degree. Bachelors Degree plus four (4) years' additional relevant work experience may be substituted for a Masters Degree.

Other Desired Experience:

• Ability to communicate and adapt well in dynamic team environments

• Good organizational skills

• Strong skills in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

• Knowledge of the Financial Compendium

About the Team

As the Senior Sales Operations Analyst, you will focus on the core market of the company – M&A Go-To-Market. In this role, you will play a crucial role in the success of the NA M&A Sales team. You will help sales team to maximize their sales and attainment through analytics, reporting, data streams and KPIs. You will be the partner of sales managers and directors in forecasting, territory planning & management as well as their business review cadence. You are the trusted advisor of the sales management team and will make supporting recommendations on ways to improve productivity and scale of the M&A Go-To-Market Organization.

Job Overview

We are seeking a high-energy, motivated Senior Sales Operations Analyst to represent SS&C Intralinks as we continue to expand our market share as the leading virtual data room provider. SS&C Intralinks is utilized as a cloud content management tool in mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, capital raises, corporate restructuring, and other strategic transactions. This is an excellent opportunity to grow a successful sales operations career with a company with proven technology and strong brand awareness.

Day to Day Responsibilities:
Own and execute timely, accurate, and insightful reports and analysis to field sales and sales management related to sales performance
Develop and present sales forecasts
Help sales team and sales management team prepare data for their team meetings as well as GTM/QBR meetings
Perform complex ad hoc analysis as required in support of Sales Organization
Analyze business needs, provide data and make recommendations to support sales management, field sales representatives, marketing and other business functional teams
Manage systems interfaces related to sales reporting, compensation, data processing, customer master data and territory management
Analyze issues and weakness in sales and operations process therefore can make recommendation to improve the processes to drive productivity and efficiency
Document processes and represent business group in corporate sales and marketing discussions
Assist with key sales planning activities during planning and budgeting cycle
Collaborate with Commission, Finance, IT and Business Technology and other divisions/departments to get tasks done and build cross functional relationship
Minimum Experience & Qualifications:
4+ years of sales operations experience
Sales operations experience in a software organization
Expert MS Office skills, particularly MS Excel
Experience digesting and articulating complex and accurate data to sales leaders within the organization
It would be great if you also had:
A Bachelor’s Degree
Experience using Salesforce
Experience using Tableau

As part of the Toyota family of companies, Toyota Industries Commercial Finance (TICF) creates extraordinary customer experiences through our Brand Promise to be the partner of choice in the commercial finance industry.

Since 1985, TICF has offered an extensive line of commercial financing programs for Toyota forklifts and Hino trucks through our network of Toyota Industrial Equipment and Hino Motor Sales dealers to their customers. Our people-focused team of professionals are constantly striving to provide always better solutions. Because of that we have experienced substantial growth and evolution. We are a new organization with a proud legacy. Are you interested in becoming part of it?

TICF Vision Statement: To be the financial services partner of choice to our dealers and customers by delivering innovative solutions that support the sustainable growth of THM, Logistics, and HMS businesses.

TICF Mission Statement: We will do this by engaging the talent and passion of people that are committed to helping to carry the load, contributing to society, and continuous improvement.

Why This Job Exists: Job Summary/Scope of Impact

The TICF Senior Business System Analyst is responsible for working closely with business partners to understand business goals to develop IT solutions. The Senior BSA will coordinate and oversee the work of other BSAs acting a mentor to junior and mid-level business analyst. As a senior-level BSA, you will be viewed as an expert on the process and best practices for conducting requirements practices.

What You'll Do: Major Accountabilities
Production/Operations Support. (25%)
Serve as a subject matter expert and provide support to end users for existing applications and audit requirements.
Ensure system standards, code and documentation is recent and maintained in a central, and secure repository
Utilize technology and process knowledge to identify process implications of technology and process changes and recommend process improvements.
Manage AMS partners' activities, ensuring adherence to Service Management, and holding the vendors accountable to service levels.
Project Delivery (50%)
Facilitate requirements gathering session, create business requirements documents and work closely with the development team to deliver a quality solution.
Create test plan/scripts and execute test scripts to ensure solution meets requirements and business goals
Create, evaluate, and present complex technical business cases, "as-is" and "to-be" business processes, "current" and "future" technology integration design recommendations to colleagues, management, business customers and vendors
Explain complex application functionality in a manner that can be understood, articulate ideas and solutions to influence others toward a desired outcome or solution; answer technical questions to support the case
Other Computer-Related Occupation Responsibilities (25%)
Some combination of the tasks below will be core part of your major accountabilities:
Understand the future direction of business and the IT impact on the business.
Utilize knowledge of key business metrics to proactively identify complex areas of improvement; determine whether improvement can be achieved through process changes or technology enhancement; negotiate solutions with the customer
Exercise discretion and independent judgment while performing your core job responsibilities, including:
Evaluate possible courses of actions and make decisions or recommendations on the courses of action that should be followed.
Interpret and Evaluate current policies and processes. Identify opportunities to improve these policies and processes. Lead initiatives to drive these changes.
Assist the organization in their Agile transformation.
Participate in recruiting and onboarding new resources.
Champion own career through self-development plans; actively soliciting coaching and feedback and participating in internal and external development opportunities.
Working Relationships, Management and Decision Expectations/Authority

Briefly describe key working relationships (internal and external), team activities, project management work and management/supervision accountabilities. Highlight decision-making expectations and authority.
You will be working closely with end-users across the business to understand their needs and goals and with technical teams to develop solutions
Ability to work with limited supervision, having significant latitude for independent judgment
Ability to effectively communicate across all levels of the organization

Experience with all aspects of the Software Development Lifecycle

Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to create and present concepts and recommendations to senior management

Our Culture:

Stoneridge Software began with an idea: How can Microsoft implementations be done better? After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. As a Microsoft Gold Partner, weve developed a proven process for project delivery and a laser focus on long-term support to empower our clients success. We know how to work hard but we also know how important it is to balance work with family and the rest of our lives. Stoneridge Software has cultivated an atmosphere of trust, community, and support that includes a flexible working environment, unlimited vacation, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and even beer on-tap. These initiatives, and many more have resulted in numerous Best Workplace awards and happy team members. We focus on allowing our team members to be authentically themselves whether thats creative, serious or nerdy. Does this sound like a team you would like to be a part of?

What we are Looking for:

Stoneridge Software is looking for a passionate steward of data to lead, develop and test ERP data migrations that will meet client business demands for meaningful up to date data sets. We are looking for adaptable candidates with both a broad set of technology skills to be able to design and oversee these complex, iterative data projects as well as a deep technology skill set to be able to troubleshoot environments, data sets and performance issues as the project progresses. It is important, critical work that truly enables our clients to implement the best solutions for their business.

The Technical/Functional Consultant is responsible for meeting with prospects and clients to understand their business data needs and to build iterative approaches to meet those needs.

A Day in the Life:
Serve as the primary client-facing technical resource to collaborate on components required to meet business objectives
Assist in development of data migration roadmap at entity-wide and business area level
Recognize and comprehend complex issues, process changes, and industry dynamics affecting the data being migrated
Include standards and guidelines for the effective and efficient delivery of enterprise data migration
Coordinate technical and functional requirements for data migration efforts and facilitate definition of project scope, goals and deliverables for development team supporting business needs
Represent subject matter expertise in business process, solution design, best practices, and technologies
Consult on technical environment requirements, setup and optimization as needed.
Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to document a clear set of requirements that can be interpreted by both business partners and data engineers
2-10 years of experience related to ERP data
Knowledge of data structures, hierarchies, business rule complexities
Proficient at integration and preparing, large, varied datasets for migration into an AX | D365 F&O Environment resulting in data that is congruent and reliable
Experienced in using iterative approaches that result in successful implementations
Possess a combination of business knowledge, strong problem solving skills, technical expertise and excellent written and communication skills.
Active listener who asks relevant questions to create relevant solution designs
Effective presenter able to deliver a solution in a way that makes sense for the requestor and addresses their primary needs
Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics AX and Finance & Operations
Travel Required: Incumbent is expected to meet regularly with client teams primarily in the Midwest but may be expected to travel across the country if the project requires.

The Company

Rodan + Fields was founded in 2000 by Stanford-trained dermatologists Dr. Katie Rodan and Dr. Kathy Fields with a passion for giving people the best skin of their lives — and the confidence that comes with it. With effective products, a unique business model and a powerful community of Independent Consultants, Rodan + Fields has disrupted the skincare category to become a leading skincare brand in North America. The company has grown its innovative line of products and expanded into Canada, Australia and Japan. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, R+F now employs 500+ people, has more than 300,000 enrolled Independent Consultants and over two million Preferred Customers.

At Rodan + Fields, you will be challenged to make an impact, inspired to do more, and rewarded for your contributions. You’ll become part of a positive, passionate movement that celebrates greatness and encourages employees to be catalysts for change. We provide a creative, vibrant workplace outfitted with all of the technology, tools and training you'll need to learn, grow and thrive! We create life-changing impact in our communities through our non-profit, Prescription for Change®, the heart of Rodan + Fields. By funding empowerment programs for students, we teach them how to use their skills to make life-changing differences in their lives and the lives of others. Join us and share your talents as we develop innovative solutions for your skin and empower entrepreneurs. In addition to working arm-in-arm with industry leaders, employees at Rodan + Fields enjoy rich benefits plans and perks.

Rodan + Fields is an equal opportunity employer that champions diversity, inclusion and equality for all. Job Summary:

It’s the magic of immersing yourself in a motion picture masterpiece, or a new track from your favorite band, or the spectacle of a live Broadway show. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.

Studio Operations is comprised of multiple disciplines related to the postproduction of our films. This includes localizing formats for global theatrical release, ensuring consistency and continuity in the voice and representation of our characters in media formats worldwide, ensuring secure delivery of films to exhibitors, retailers, and homes worldwide, converting of classic film content into digital formats, and managing of all Walt Disney Studios production and postproduction facilities (including sound stages and the Digital Studio)

Excellent written communication skills

For over 90 years, The Walt Disney Studios has been the foundation on which The Walt Disney Company was built. Feature films are released under the following banners: Disney, including Walt Disney Animation Studios and Pixar Animation Studios, Disneynature, Marvel Studios and Lucasfilm. The Disney Music Group encompasses the Walt Disney Records and Hollywood Records labels, as well as Disney Music Publishing. The Disney Theatrical Group produces and licenses live events, including Disney on Broadway, Disney On Ice and Disney Live!. Ours is a culture of innovation, inspiration and collaboration that brings together visionary artists, gifted technologists and savvy business minds to conjure up magical entertainment experiences for a global audience.

About The Walt Disney Company:


The Walt Disney Company, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading diversified international family entertainment and media enterprise with the following business segments: media networks, parks and resorts, studio entertainment, consumer products and interactive media. From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to its preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, Disney proudly continues its legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Disney’s stories, characters and experiences reach consumers and guests from every corner of the globe. With operations in more than 40 countries, our employees and cast members work together to create entertainment experiences that are both universally and locally cherished.

This position is with Walt Disney Pictures, which is part of a business segment we call The Walt Disney Studios.

Overview


National Interstate is a member of Great American Insurance Group. Pattern Energy Group is an independent, fully integrated energy company that develops, constructs, owns and operates renewable energy projects and transmission assets across North America, Japan, and parts of Latin America. The company focuses primarily on wind, solar and transmission. The Pattern Energy Group team has a history as one of the top North American renewable energy and transmission providers in the industry. The team is dedicated to delivering the highest value for its customers, partners, financial supporters and the communities in which it works, while exhibiting a strong commitment to promoting environmental stewardship and corporate responsibility.
Pattern Energy Group operates in the United States, Canada, Japan, Netherlands and Mexico with offices in San Francisco, Houston, San Diego, New York, Amsterdam, Tokyo, and Toronto. Pattern Energy Group’s corporate headquarters is in San Francisco.

JOB PURPOSE
Provide a comprehensive overview of Pattern’s fleet of operating assets using key performance indicators to the Operations Management team and the Asset Management department. Additionally, provide key project management oversight for budgeting and forecasting of our operating business. Additionally, provide key oversight of our revenue performance, including the market performance of our energy management business
Key Accountabilities
Performance Management
Support the group in the design, preparation and analysis of fleet performance for Operations team performance reviews, Executive Management reviews and other reporting activities.
Understand key drivers of performance variance and support the group in identifying and implementing performance improvement strategies.
Identify for Management key budget and forecast drivers and variances period-over-period; prepare materials as required to report on revenue performance.
Perform analysis as required to support Asset Management in performing revenue analysis and optimization.
Provide support to the organization in energy market risk management responsibilities including maintaining the market risk exposure model, reporting market risk metrics and understanding risk drivers, and supporting key compliance activities.
Project Manage the annual budget process for revenue including assisting in budget planning and logistics, incorporating inputs from SMEs (e.g. production, energy loss, market price, etc), and facilitating budget reviews.
Be primary responsible party for entering revenue budgets and forecasts into relevant corporate data systems.
Execute the reforecasting process for revenue including planning and logistics, incorporating inputs from SMEs, and facilitating reviews.

Experience/Qualifications/Education Required
Required Work Experience
Relevant project management skills and experience
Advanced computer proficiency including Microsoft product suite
Proficient in the use of Power BI and design and maintenance or reports
Experience in the financial analysis or management of energy assets
Intermediate to Advanced analytical, statistical, and financial modelling skills
Educational Requirements
A bachelor’s degree in business, finance, engineering or a related field is recommended
Additional Requirements
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Strong motivation and ability to be self-directed and work with little supervision or guidance
Strong learning skills and the ability to independently research, understand, and implement knowledge in new areas
Ability to work seamlessly across a wide range of disciplines both within and outside the group and the company to achieve project objectives
Ability to understand technical operational matters and translate them to commercial and financial analyses used for decision making
Understanding of power market operations inside and outside of organized markets

Through a commitment to operator-led product innovation, quality and compelling value, 5.11 has developed a loyal following among some of the most demanding and discerning end-users of apparel and gear.

At our Operations Center in Manteca and Development Center in Irvine, we leverage our deep relationships with Law Enforcement, Special Forces Operators and First Responders to gain unique insights. The results are products that break new ground combining ruggedness, speed, range of motion and ultimate comfort in professional duty, tactical training, adventure, women’s tactical, fitness and industrial professionals.

POSITION SUMMARY:

Responsible for effectively leading efforts to implement and support information technology solutions for business critical processes. The Business Systems Analyst acts as a liaison for the Information Technology team with both internal and external business partners. The position will work within the business to define business requirements, facilitate discussion and agreement on process design amongst stakeholders, develop business processes, validate business processes against the system(s) and conduct feasibility assessments of process and technologies within the Microsoft D365 implementation project.

The Business Systems Analyst will be the“subject matter expert” both from a business perspective and a system / process functionality perspective for all D365 Finance Modules. * Experience with Dynamics 365 or AX 2012 R3 are required.

This role will also be required to take some trips Internationally.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Oversee the development of specifications related to changes in the business functions or new functionality.
Review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solutions.
Participate in the definition, implementation and distribution of operating procedures.
Hold design review sessions with cross-functional team members to review requirements.
Coordinate and execute user acceptance testing sessions.
Provide in-depth knowledge of the Microsoft Dynamics application and evaluate financial processes against the standard Microsoft Dynamics functionality.
Conduct acceptance testing and training to Accounting and Finance Teams to successfully use and maintain the Microsoft Dynamics application.
Gather important data necessary for troubleshooting.
Obtain sign off of functional specification(s) from all cross functional project team members.
Develop functional specifications and system design specifications for project engagements.
Interact with the Business community and IT resources to identify required changes.
Perform systems analyst activities and make recommendations in areas that require a high level of technical competency.
Review all user documentation and monitor testing.
Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on, escalated and resolved in a timely manner.
Assist in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.
Manage resources in accordance with project schedules.
Consistently deliver high-quality services.
QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform the job successfully, an individual should have the following credentials:
Bachelor’s Degree in related area
5+ years experience supporting IT projects and applications, preferably Finance applications
3+ years experience working with Dynamics D365 in a Technical Business Analyst role
Significant experience drafting, developing and implementing core business processes
Ability to draft operations reports to satisfy the data and analytical needs across all Finance functions
Familiar with principles of application programming, database and system design
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to coordinate and work effectively with business stakeholders and other specialists
Ability to demonstrate strong leadership and to manage and resolve conflict
Strong organizational skills, written and verbal skills, ability to understand and explain issues to colleagues and users from both a technical and a business functional point of view
Must have strong problem solving skills and be capable of breaking down complex problems to identify and resolve root causes; this applies to both technical issues and process issues
Facilitates effective team interaction
Experience with implementing and/or supporting Microsoft D365
Experience with Microsoft D365 Finance modules
Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio
Ability to work at a detailed level while maintaining an overall project perspective
Ability to travel Internationally

Job Description:

Distributed Solutions, Inc. (DSI) is a fast growing company, seeking a highly motivated Business Analyst to support our AEON Acquisition platform that thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment including the ability to engage in open and animated peer review sessions, able to change direction quickly, and an eagerness to learn new technologies. At AZ we push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines. If you want to be part of a creative organization, with the ambition and capability to make a significant difference to patients lives then you should come and talk to us!

You'll work in Science and Enabling Units IT, in our Legal and Global Compliance team. Its an exciting time to join us, as we set out on our journey to provide the Best IT for the BioPharma Industry. Our goal is to position IT as a strategic-enabler and we do this by focusing on close business partnership, defining and executing business-aligned strategies, and finding and developing the best IT talent in the industry. You will be leading/contributing to business analysis on strategic projects that help our Legal and Global Sustainability teams protect our employees, our Intellectual Property, and the environment. You will collaborate directly with the AZ Business stakeholders who are working in those functions, our business relationship managers and the technology teams crafting and delivering our enabling technology.

We have an ITBusiness Analyst role based in Gaithersburg, MD (East Coast US), that will support our Legal and Global Sustainability capability across our offices in the US, UK and Sweden.

The incumbent should deliver tangible and measurable value to the Legal and Global Sustainability business domain areas supporting; Global Intellectual Property, Litigation, Corporate Legal, Legal Operations, Global Compliance and Investigations, Global Safety, Health and Environment, Global Sustainability and others by taking a leading role in SEUIT delivery of solutions by Programs/Projects and/or Services.

The ITBusiness Analyst is expected to perform at some Intermediate Experienced Level the following:
Business Needs Identification - Operates at a functional level in assessing and defining business need and areas for improvement. Proactively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals. Actively monitors and identifies capability gaps and proposes potential solutions through research internally and externally.
Business Analysis Planning - Selects the appropriate analysis approach to a piece of work depending on its complexity, level of risk, known assumptions, constraints and dependencies. Proficient in scoping and recommending appropriate approaches. Capable of planning and managing their own and other team members activities to meet deliverables and deadlines. Accountable for performance and quality of analytical work delivered, both their own and the work of others.
Stakeholder Analysis & Change - Effectively identifies stakeholders from all areas of the business, and actively builds and maintains relationships according to individual stakeholder needs and levels of influence. Contributes to communication plans and change management for project and stakeholders.
Requirements Analysis and Design Definition - Responsible and accountable for requirements management plans including elicitation, approvals, processes, RAID and scope impacts. Highly responsive to changing business priorities with ability to plan ahead, accounting for potential changes and corrective actions. Advanced requirements elicitation and management skill-set; including traceability, testing and validation. Leads the work with the business to identify functional and technical requirements, translating the requirements into design specifications reflecting Functional Design, User Interface Design and Business Process Design. Closely partnering with the Architecture team, ensuring the technical solution will deliver the agreed business benefits.
Business Case Definition - Shapes and defines the business case, producing detailed business justification for investment including ROI and benefits realization.
Solution Evaluation - Highly proficient in analyzing and assessing solution proposals and able to articulate supporting reasoning. i.e. assessing business readiness, maximizing value vs. spend.
Work collaboratively with:
Business Relationship Managers to develop and maintain the business relationship, support business process changes and act as point of contact for application development
Various levels of Business Stakeholders to ensure that solutions fulfil their future strategic needs and challenges
Business customers to identify business requirements and effectively communicate impact, cost and benefits of new and changed demands
Process owners to identify and devise solutions that optimize business process performance, capability and competitiveness
IT Architecture, Delivery and Support to ensure clear understanding of requirements and effective testing so that the solutions delivered to the business are efficient and effective, meeting the customer experience expectations.
Work collaboratively with or take some responsibility for:
Test Lead to define the testing approach and the components of testing to ensure traceability of requirements and effectiveness of overall solution.
Change Management/Communication Lead to ensure the Change Management and Communications plans and delivery support the Stakeholder Analysis.
This position can be either considered for internal Grade D or Grade E.

Essential Qualifications, Skills and Experience:
Formal certification in business analysis practice preferred
8+ years of professional experience as a Business Analyst preferred
Proven experience of successfully deploying business analysis tools/techniques to enable business change
Proven experience of working with complex integrated systems, using creative and strategic thinking to deliver exceptional results
Strong engagement, communication and stakeholder management skills, including excellent presentation and influencing skills
Experience of virtual collaboration to lead, shape and develop innovative solutions
Experience of working with and managing third party suppliers/vendors
Bachelors Degree required
Desirable Qualifications, Skills and Experience:
Established knowledge of or some experience of the Legal and/or Global Compliance / Sustainability domain
Practical usage of Agile Methodology
Experience of working in a global organization with complex/geographical context
Exposure to User Centered Design and Design thinking (User Experience, Prototyping, User Interface Design and Business Process Design)

What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, youll be part of a fast-growing team that helps the world become smarter and more connected. Were the worlds leading research and advisory company, achieving consistent double-digit growth by steering clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they cant find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, exceptional training and career development as well as unlimited growth opportunities. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.

Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology decisions and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three leading brandsCapterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.

What youll do

You will be responsible for managing one of our most valuable data assets and will work to improve the coverage, quality, and accessibility of web analytics data for customers within Capterra and Gartner Digital Markets. As a member of the Capterra Analytics team, you will work with Product Management, Engineering, Marketing, Data Insights, and other teams to ensure we capture the data required to accurately measure business performance, build data-driven site features, and develop innovative data products for our customers. You will be responsible for the setup, administration, and configuration of web analytics tools and will provide support and training as need to ensure decentralized access to web analytics data. You will leverage your deep knowledge of analytics tools to assist with reporting and analysis deliverables. You will partner with Google and other vendors as needed to deliver industry-leading analytics solutions. You will cover a broad and evolving set of responsibilities to accomplish your objectivesversatility, adaptability, and self-sufficiency will be critical to success.

What youll need
BA/BS from a top-tier university
Minimum of 2 years of professional work experience
Minimum of 2 years of experience with the Google Analytics 360 suite of applications
Deep experience using Google Analytics for reporting and analysis
Experience with Google analytics reporting filters, segments, custom metrics and custom dimensions
Understanding of best practices and standards for analytics tagging and tracking
Experience using browser tools to identify web analytics tagging issues
Understanding of how to implement analytics tracking across device and browser versions
Comfortable using BigQuery or relational database technology to access web analytics data
Experience with importing and exporting data from web analytics and campaign management tools
Experience with Google Tag Manager setup, configuration and integration of 3rd party tracking tags
Comfortable using Google Tag Manager for page data layer integration and event tracking
Knowledge of SQL or similar database scripting languages
Exposure to agile development environments a plus
Experience with cloud-based data storage systems a plus (Snowflake, Redshift)
Digital business or digital advertising experience a plus
Who you are
Excellent organizational and time management skills and capable of juggling multiple priorities
Strong project management skills with the ability to manage across teams to complete projects
Self-sufficient and driven to acquire the skills necessary to accomplish complex tasks
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships and effectively collaborate with partners
Comfortable working independently to achieve successful results with minimal guidance
Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to clearly present complicated analysis
Resourceful and resilient with the ability to take a creative approach to problem solving
What we offer
A collaborative, positive culture. You'll work with people who are as enthusiastic, smart and driven as you are. You'll be managed by the best too
Limitless growth and learning opportunities. We offer the excitement of a fast-paced entrepreneurial workplace and the professional growth opportunities of an established global organization
Outstanding compensation. We offer a competitive salary and generous benefits; including a robust time off allowance and great perks

Position:
Sr. QA Automation Analyst
Job Description:


We currently have an opportunity for an enthusiastic, experienced Senior QA Automation Analyst to join our ECS Global Intelligent Automation (IA) team. This role will leverage their techno-functional knowledge and skills to help Test Automation COE design the testing automation framework & architecture, oversee the execution of the strategy and implementation of scalable IT QA automation solutions across Arrows technical landscape.

The individual in this role will be responsible for defining and promoting an automation testing mindset across IT and includes responsibilities such as planning, developing, and directing quality assurance automation testing policies, programs, and initiatives. Evaluates and monitors automated testing tools, methodologies, and to ensure effective testing and identification of defects.

Additionally, this individual will act as a relationship manager across senior IT leadership and other IT development teams to facilitate discussions and help prioritize the automation testing project queue, coordinate across all business groups and deliver projects and initiatives within the automation COE roadmap. This includes working with the business and technology areas to understand and drive requirements for IT delivery in a fast-paced environment.

In this role, you will become part of the ECS Global Intelligence Automation team reporting into the Director of Global ECS BI & Automation.

What You'll Be Doing
Partner with cross-functional Test automation COE IT leaders to generate ideas/opportunities to drive the strategic roadmap for the IT QA Automation function to ensure the highest standards of performance are consistently delivered by IT teams.
Lead definition of Testing Automation framework and implementation of IT testing automation standards, methodologies, and processes to be executed across technology releases. Drive implementation and continuous refinement of automation testing processes, environments, models, and tools to move towards continuous delivery (CI/CD) approach.
Develop strategy, build a business case, obtain executive approval for, and lead the execution of Strategic Automation Roadmap and Performance testing framework for the IT Quality Assurance function.
Lead design sessions with product owners/stakeholders across the organization to deliver innovative solutions through research, leadership, and mentoring.
Provides effective organizational leadership and collaboration as a part of the COE leadership Group. Maintains effective relationships with IT Management and Business leadership as well as external sourcing vendors to ensure that all IT processes are maintained and enhanced in support of the mission and goals
Ensuring projects meet service level expectations and are delivered on time and budget by holding contributors accountable for delivering on project milestones and deliverables.
Ensure root cause analysis and feedback of findings to identify underlying processes and reporting issues within IT quality processes and solutions. Based on quantitative insights developed per above, lead the development of recommended remediation actions or initiatives to drive improvements in technology quality performance levels.
What We Are Looking For
4-year degree from an accredited college/university in Information Systems or related field or equivalent related experience
At least 7-8 years of experience in IT development & Software quality practices including hands-on coding experience of Unit /Integration /System /Regression / Performance tests and test execution in an automation framework.
At least 5 years of leading/managing experience in leading a large, complex I.T. environment.

Property & Investment Recovery Analyst

Location:
Headquarters Address:
Springfield, MO Job Type:
Full-Time

We are currently seeking applicants for a Property & Investment Recovery Analyst in our Accounting & Finance Division located in Springfield, MO. This position provides management and oversight for 37,978 acres of property by performing ongoing analysis and evaluation to ensure maximum return on investment following internal, local, state, federal and legal requirements. You will provide oversight for land transactions including acquisition & sales, legal document management, maintenance of buildings and other structures, as well as coordination with various agricultural agencies, county assessor offices, and land agents. You will manage leases and work with tenants to ensure sound agricultural practices to maintain and enhance property values. Work includes coordinating with the Department of Conservation for oversight of a 10,000-acre lake including dock permitting. Responsibilities also include overseeing salvage of assets no longer required by AECI.

What does a typical day look like for you as a member of this team? You will:

· Serve as the primary resource for land owned by AECI which includes initiating and researching legal and financial transactions, lease management, managing documents, providing leadership and direction of investment recovery responsibilities and maintaining positive relationships with outside organizations regarding land and property

· Manage land records including purchase and sale transactions, warranty deeds and easements

· Manage processes for disposition of assets to optimize return on investment while utilizing recycling opportunities and assuring environmental requirements for disposal

· Oversee farming practices and approve an annual work plan developed by a committee for which you will oversee which includes members from property agents, USDA, MDC, MoCorn, MoSoy, Soil and Water Conservation, Natural Resources Conservation Service and the Department of Agriculture

· Support of hunting regulations and tenant support for following hunting regulations, as well as supporting activities related to reclamation for formerly mined property

What we are looking for:

· Demonstrated excellent planning, analysis, negotiation, organization and project management skills

· Strong relationship building skills with the ability to communicate effectively across our cooperative family, property owners, legal team, tenants of property and other utilities

· Supervisory or related experience providing oversight of other’s work is preferred

· Someone familiar with facility operations as related to an investment recovery program as well as knowledge in the field of Finance, Accounting, Budgeting and Agricultural practices

· Degree in business or agricultural field is preferred, or equivalent work experience

· At least four years of land management or accounting experience is required

AECI provides a competitive total compensation package including paid health care and dental premiums starting on day one with vision plans available. Basic life, short-term disability and long-term disability are paid for by AECI as well as a 401k with an employer match. Invest in yourself with our tuition reimbursement and enjoy time away with Paid Time Off (PTO) and paid holidays. Wellness incentives and employee assistance programs are also available. Come join a team where your talents are appreciated, your voice is heard, and your work has an impact!

Job Description:


Leidos is a Fortune 500 company aimed at embracing and solving some of the worlds most pressing challenges. Through science and technology, Leidos makes the world safer, healthier and more efficient.

Our Civil Group offers an array of exciting career opportunities for the best IT, energy, logistics and engineering professionals.

Driven by our talented workforce, the Federal Energy, Environment and Commerce Operation builds trust through an array of energy-related IT, environmental science and engineering solutions to meet our customers needs.

Large Infrastructure

Primary Responsibilities
Perform deep dive reviews and document existing (current state) stockpile management requirements and directives identifying sources, usage, gaps, and redundancies.
Coordinate with NNSA and M&O SMEs to analyze current stockpile management processes
Develop functional decompositions and network diagrams for current requirements and directives
Document current-state stockpile management processes
Support development of a current-state interactive model to visualize and communicate requirements and directives
Analyze and evaluate (on a quantitative or qualitative basis) the effectiveness of current stockpile management processes
Develop and implement pilot efforts and use cases as needed
Develop a consolidated stockpile management demand signal and coordinates with M&Os on an implementation strategy
Coordinate with related initiatives to ensure the stockpile requirements are consistently used across Defense Programs
Develop, publish, and implement a stockpile management requirements management plan
Develop requirements engineering process and business process rules that can be applied to stockpile management
In coordination with key stakeholders, develop a future-state implementation plan for improved business processes and systems integration for stockpile management
Research and investigate new or improved business process and systems engineering practices for application to stockpile management processes.
Perform a variety of complex, programmatic and technical support services involving data analysis, process analysis, program plan and policy development, and strategy development.
Provide program management support in the preparation, coordination, evaluation, review and analysis of program execution plans and tracking, monitoring, and reporting of program-specific milestones
Provide regular updates to senior federal leadership as required
Basic Qualifications

The individual must have experience working in a classified environment and a relevant understanding of applicable policies and procedures supporting NNSA programs. The individual should be innovative, a self-starter, possess the ability to work in a highly dynamic environment, and effectively interact with a broad range of Federal and military staff and senior leadership.

Clearance:

Minimum of a currently briefed DoD TS. Preference is an active DOE-Q.

Education:

Minimum of a bachelors degree in a science, engineering or technical degree.

Experience/Qualifications:
Minimum of 12 years of related experience with 10 years in business process analysis and/or systems engineering including demonstrated experience researching and analyzing complex information with recent experience in direct support of the nuclear security enterprise (NSE)
Familiarity with business process engineering and/or systems-of-systems analysis and integration
Demonstrated background in requirements management processes and procedures
Demonstrated performance with the Microsoft Office suite with particular emphasis on word processing, presentations, and spreadsheet applications (MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and MS Excel).
Background using systems engineering tools and associated products
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated experience in developing briefings for senior and executive management required
Preferred Qualifications

Preference is for an individual with in-depth and recent experience in NNSA nuclear weapons programs, and specifically, background in stockpile management requirements, procedures, processes, and data management.

Leidos is growing! Connect with us on LinkedIn and Facebook.

We value and support the well-being and mobility of our employees with competitive benefit packages, complementary e-learning training, work-life flexibility, an exciting External Referral Program, and a diverse, inclusive and ethical work place. In fact, in 2020, Leidos was ranked as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies by the Ethisphere Institute for the third consecutive year.

Leidos is looking for a dynamic, well experienced person to perform business processes analysis and system engineering analysis as part of the Stockpile Management Initiative within the Office of Stockpile Services of the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA). In this role, the individual will be responsible for assisting the federal customer in defining the current-state of stockpile management requirements and processes and developing an integrated future-state system. This role will support defining current stockpile requirements, business processes, and change control processes, including detailed analysis of existing NNSA directives, requirements management systems and procedures, as well as M&O implementation of federal directives throughout all phases of the 6.X process.

Checkr's mission is to build a fairer future by improving understanding of the past. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $2.2B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include, Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

As the Technical Revenue Analyst, you will play a key role within the Accounting organization. Specifically, you will be a key contributor to ensuring Checkr's revenue reporting remains compliant in accordance with ASC 606. Additionally, you will be responsible for providing accurate and timely commissions calculations and reporting, maintaining Checkr's capitalized costs to obtain a contract (in accordance with ASC 340-40), as well as assisting with various other processes such as: partner revenue sharing and customer contract review. You will work closely with the Finance, Legal, Sales, Customer Success and Business Development teams by providing critical analysis, forecasting, reporting, and calculations for Checkr's revenue, commissions and revenue share processes. As a part of Checkr's accounting team, you will help to ensure Checkr provides accurate and timely financial reporting and that all accounting records are booked in accordance with GAAP. This role is entrepreneurial and cross-functional, so you must be smart & resourceful, demonstrate initiative, and be able to thrive in a collaborative and fast paced environment. You will combine your financial modeling experience with knowledge of financial reporting & accounting to become a trusted business partner throughout the revenue team and rest of the organization.

Responsibilities:
Ownership of the sales compensation, commission and channel/partner revenue share processes. Continually improving these processes and pushing automation while maintaining compliance with ASC 340-40 for accurate revenue related expense reporting.
Contract review and analysis relating to new sales and renewal deals to ensure Checkr is recognizing revenue from new & existing contracts in accordance with ASC 606.
Assist in maintaining Checkr's technical accounting documentation as well as researching and providing conclusions for new accounting positions.
Scope and manage analytical projects driven by the needs of the business such as financial analysis, revenue analysis, and other ad hoc projects.
Collaborate with Sales, Customer Success, Finance and Business Development teams, managing multiple projects at a time with an impeccable attention to detail and timelines.
Assistance in yearly financial audits along with other regulatory reporting.
What you bring:
2-4 years of Accounting, Finance or related field experience
Strong knowledge and understanding of GAAP Accounting
Knowledge and understanding of ASC 606 (Revenue Recognition) and ASC 340-40 (Cost to Obtain a Contract)
Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, etc)
Ability to manage/create complex models/calculations
Must be comfortable analyzing large data sets
Must have strong attention to detail
Ability to analyze complex contracts and parse out pertinent information
Must be able to prioritize, problem solve, take initiative, and maintain confidentiality of sensitive personnel information
Ability to collaborate cross-functionally with revenue teams and G&A functions
Experience with Salesforce, NetSuite, and Looker is a plus
Public accounting experience preferred, Big 4 audit experience is a plus
CPA required, or CPA track will be considered
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst – Agency Processing Management
Job Description:
This newly created position will bring together and interact with business groups and IT to define and improve the process to assure accurate agency management through all systems including but not limited to reporting, regulatory, compensation and compliance.
This role is responsible for defining the coordination of all projects that impact agency management processes and controls, including the Agency Data Repository System (ADR) to efficiently interact with all upstream and downstream systems. You will work with Legal, IT, Finance, Product and other business groups as appropriate.
Specifically this position will:
Lead the design and planning, for new programs (product, company, state) relating to agency management processes.
Define any business impacts and resource requirements
Collaborate with IT to develop and implement full scale project plans
Manage project scope and budget to meet goals
Manage project resource allocation across business groups
Plan and schedule project timelines and dependencies in concert with IT Project management.
Provide direction and support to project team
Monitor and report on progress of the project to all stakeholders
Manage project changes and interventions to achieve project outputs
Communicate process changes to all business groups and ensure all groups are trained on updates.
Understand and communicate all downstream system effects of new process/projects.
Required Skills and Abilities:
Critical thinking and problem solving skills, with ability to work a project end to end.
Exceptional oral and written communication skills.
Demonstrated strong work experience in project management capacity.
Knowledge of project management techniques and tools.
Proven experience in strategic planning, decision making and change management.
Knowledge of insurance company internal and backend systems/processes preferred.
Planning and organizing.
Influencing and leading.
Advanced computer skills, including proficiency with Microsoft Office suite, and vendor platforms related to job functions. SQL are a plus.
A Bachelor’s degree is required.
About the Company
The Plymouth Rock Company and its affiliated group of companies write and manage over $1.4 billion in personal and commercial auto and homeowner’s insurance throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic, where we have built an unparalleled reputation for service. We continuously invest in technology, our employees thrive in our empowering environment, and our customers are among the most loyal in the industry. The Plymouth Rock group of companies employs more than 1,800 people and is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts. Plymouth Rock Assurance Corporation holds an A.M. Best rating of “A-/Excellent”.

Who You Are

You either have a strong passion or direct experience working in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry. You are curious, effective at multitasking, have strong communication skills and are detail-oriented. You are comfortable with technology and like to explore and innovate. You thrive on variety, problem-solving and getting things done. You like to dig beneath the surface and understand why and how different healthcare audiences (i.e., patients, doctors, caregivers, pharmacists, etc.) have formed their opinions or make their decisions. You have an instinctive understanding of the value and importance of healthcare consumers to our business and want to help connect the dots for our clients. You have a passion, empathy and confidence in engaging with diverse groups of people and an ability to adapt your communication style accordingly. You are eager to contribute and collaborate through quality, commitment, courtesy and teamwork. Most importantly, you work best in a collaborative work environment that is focused on excellence and customer satisfaction.

What You'll Do

In this multi-faceted role, you will cultivate and grow relationships with our healthcare clients' most important consumers by earning their trust, advocating for their needs, developing audience expertise, and creating engaging environments in which to deepen the conversation, draw people out, and make connections.
Build relationships with healthcare consumers to create a broader understanding of their thoughts, feedback, opinions and emotions for our C Space teams and our clients.
Become someone consumers get to know and trust; respond to their emails/inquiries, advocate for your community members
Represent the consumer voice internally and potentially with your clients
Develop audience expertise by highlighting trends, opinions and feedback from members that adds to client or C Space learning
Help to define and foster shared purpose and the appropriate tone among consumers in the community
Author and deliver compelling and effective member communications (e.g. acquisition, retention and ongoing outreach) and engagement activities
Track, analyze, and optimize participation and community vibrancy
Reward & recognize members; help them feel valued and appreciated
Encourage member-to-member interactions and member-generated content by facilitating conversations, collaborating with consumers, and probing discussion posts – with a focus on engaging them
Assist the team with regulatory tasks to ensure compliance with client's and healthcare regulations
Open to ad hoc travel domestically & internationally (10%)
Desired Skills and Experience
2+ years of internship/professional or related experience
Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret and act on data and information
Versatile communication skills with a comfort adapting tone and tenor to individuals and situations
Proficient at prioritizing tasks, working independently and collaborating across functional areas
Curiosity, comfortable asking questions and making connections with others
Demonstrate comfort, familiarity and aptitude with various tools and applications such as reporting, social media, Excel and email
Must be able to work under tight deadlines
Comfortable and articulate in working directly with colleagues and teammates
Knowledge of pharmaceutical/biotech industry, marketing research, online data collection or other languages is a plus
Interested? We look forward to receiving applications from people with diverse backgrounds – talented, creative people with their own voice, ideas and perspectives.

There's no such thing as a typical C Spacer. What C Spacers thrive on is a growth mindset. We're a growing, always-changing business, often reinventing ourselves to keep pace with the fast-changing world of our clients. So we're looking for people who are excited about change and who challenge the status quo. We need people who share our passion for the role customers can play in solving business problems - people who want to disrupt the way things traditionally have been done.

We're focused on building a learning culture where it's safe to experiment, take risks and do things differently. That means we need people who aren't afraid to speak up and share an alternative perspective yet are humble and self-aware enough to admit they don't know everything. Collaborators, self-starters, creative problem-solvers.

We're always challenging ourselves to be better, more human, more impactful. 20 years since launch, we still think of our business as a 'work in progress' where we're focused on getting better every day. If you share that philosophy when you think about your own personal development, we might be a good match.

About C Space

Our clients call us their customer agency.

We create rapid insight and business change, putting customers at the heart of companies and solving problems from the customer's perspective. We keep our clients relevant by building real, ongoing relationships with customers that in turn help them deliver superior experiences, launch successful products and build loyalty. Our customized approaches are tailored to specific business needs and include online insight communities, immersive storytelling, data and analytics, activation events, innovation projects and business consulting. We do this for many of the world's best-known brands – like Bose, Walmart, Jaguar Land Rover, Mars, Samsung, IKEA and more – to create "Customer Inspired Growth".

We are passionate about our people and proud of our culture. We co-created a set of values to ensure that we are delivering fantastic work, continuing to learn and developing and building a high-performance culture which creates opportunities for those who work here:
I've got this: taking responsibility, doing what we say we will
Only accept awesome: delivering high quality work that we are proud of and has impact
Show the love: celebrating successes and ensuring everyone has a voice
Do what scares you: challenging ourselves, taking risks and learning more
Tell it like it is: being honest and freeing ourselves from "office politics" and "hidden agendas"
Open up and listen: listening first and fully before we respond or react
Find what fascinates: being passionate about the world and our clients' worlds
We before me: putting the team first
Leave your mark: everyone has an opportunity drive change in our business and for our clients
To learn more, visit www.cspace.com or follow us on Twitter @CSpaceGlobal and Instagram @c_spaceglobal. C Space is a part of DDB, a division of Omnicom Group Inc.

Headquartered in Boston, C Space has offices in New York, San Francisco and London.

C Space is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. We have been delivering industry-leading solutions for the payments, financial and telecommunications industries since 1990. We are the preferred supplier of networking, integrated data and voice services to many leading organizations in the global payments and financial communities, as well as a provider of extensive telecommunications network solutions to service providers.

We are a privately held company with a healthy balance sheet, secure assets and a loyal customer base that includes some of the largest global blue-chip companies in the world. Many of the world’s leading companies continue to count on us as their primary provider of a range of networking and communication services, enabling them to expand regionally, nationally and globally. We provide services to customers in over 60 countries throughout the world.

We manage some of the largest real-time community networks in the world, enabling industry participants to simply and securely interact and transact with other businesses, to access the data and applications they need, over managed and secure communications platforms. Our existing footprint supports millions of connections and provide access to critical databases. Our network securely blends private and public networking to enable customers to utilize a single connection for "one-to-many" and "many-to-many"connections over a global platform.

Since our launch we have helped our customers and communities of interest, requiring secure and reliable communications solutions, to evolve from legacy to leading-edge technologies. Today the company provides a full range of services from dedicated connections to managed IP network solutions, providing local support and global reach to medium and large enterprises and service providers.

Job Title: Business Analysis Manager, Media Performance Insights
Job Description:
Media Performance Analytics is a high-profile team of thought leaders and problem solvers who apply rigorous analytics to help assess and steer T-Mobile's paid media spend, driving business growth through our media investments. We combine our ability to dive into the data with sharp business acumen - we understand the drivers of performance through every stage of the funnel and advise senior leadership on key media investment decisions. Are ready to unleash your intellectual curiosity to write the next chapter of the Un-carrier?

Responsibilities
We are looking for a driven and analytical team member who is passionate about delivering business value - and determining how paid media investments can best deliver that value. You will conduct fast-paced analysis of cross-channel media performance across key marketing campaigns in driving high-quality prospective customers forward in the purchase funnel in our core lines of business and resulting in incremental enterprise value. You will regularly deliver and present to executive leadership actionable, data-driven recommendations that optimize T-Mobile's marketing efficiency and deliver business performance.
Your Responsibilities
Own analysis of cross-channel paid media investments for one of our core lines of business (e.g. Consumer Postpaid, Consumer Prepaid, T-Mobile for Business)
Deliver media performance insights to line of business and operational partners for T-Mobile's key marketing campaigns, such as Un-carrier moves, demand gen offers, and brand messages
Provide strong decision support and robust recommendations to business owners based on data-driven analysis, conducting high-profile analysis and delivering data narratives across business groups
Support construction of executive level presentations and present complex analytical findings in clear, concise, and decision-impacting manner
Develop and lead positive, constructive collaborations with one or more cross-functional teams
Help to build standing visualizations (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI) for ongoing monitoring and self-service for key stakeholders
Qualifications
4-6 years of professional experience in analytics, strategy, or management consulting roles
Ability to structure ambiguous problems in a complex media portfolio and develop data-driven insights
Ability to collaborate with and influence others on business outcomes with fact-based recommendations
Ability to communicate analytical and quantitative subjects clearly across audience types (subject-matter-expert and non-technical) and levels (peers and executives)
Excellent prioritization skills, self-motivation and the capacity to work under tight deadlines
Willingness to learn and develop new analytical skills and approaches in a fast growing, dynamic business
Proficient in SQL and comfortable with efficiently querying large databases (experience with one or more media platforms is a plus)
Relevant experience preferred in one or more of: telecommunications, consumer electronics, finance, or subscription business
Education
MBA with quantitative field in undergraduate degree -or- MS/MA/PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., engineering, operations research, computing science, statistics, economics, finance), -or- equivalent experience
Marketing-related specialization/coursework is a plus
Minimum Qualifications
• At least 18 years of age.• Legally authorized to work in the United States.• High School Diploma or GED.• Pre-employment background screen.

Company Profile
As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: "TMUS") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile.
