About the Position

Were looking for a talented Financial Analyst to join our high performing finance team to manage financial matters pertaining to the Information Technology department. The Financial Planning and Analysis Analyst will assist the IT leadership team in maximizing cost efficiencies by managing key costs and by supporting finance process. In addition to involvement in close, forecasting, and budgeting, this role will update executive reporting on how company resources are deployed to our strategic projects.

This new role to the finance team will report to the Director of FP&A.

Primary Responsibilities

Assist in preparing detailed annual budget and forecast with focus on key cost components such as hardware, software licenses and maintenance, and labor. Perform monthly variance to budget analysis.
Manage key expenses in the IT organization by tracking the staffing plan and navigating IT team members through vendor purchases.
Create and manage project budgets for strategic IT and product development projects. Perform monthly variance analysis for use in executive presentations.
Collaborate with accounting to manage adherence to labor capitalization policy and support monthly labor capitalization entry.
Other ad-hoc analysis and assignments as dictated by the needs of the finance team and the IT organization.

Qualifications
Bachelors degree, preferably in Finance; or equivalent work experience
Two plus years of related finance experience with emphasis in FP&A
Excellent Microsoft Excel and Power Point skills required, MS Access experience a plus
Quick learner and sharp attention to detail, very organized
Self motivated, strong work ethic, and reliable
Ability to work to work flexible hours during peak times, good time-management skills
Solid team player, helping out wherever needed
Preferred Qualifications
4+ years of FP&A work experience in support of an IT team.
Experience with Tableau (or similar BI tools)
SaaS Industry Experience
Operations under COVID-19

The onset of COVID-19 caused Qualifacts to adjust timelines on ambitious growth plans for 2020, but with careful management of resources we have not had to furlough or lay off staff. The company remains on a sound financial footing, and continues to pursue aggressive growth in all markets as opportunities present themselves.

In March we quickly transitioned to a 100% work-from-home stance in response to the threat from COVID-19. While Metro Nashville remains in Phases One or Two of its Reopening Roadmap plan, we will continue to work from home.

When Nashville moves into Phase Three, we will launch our own plan to slowly return to the office. This will begin with the voluntary return of a small number of employees. Eventually we will have everyone in the office up to 50% capacity on any day on a staggered schedule. At all phases, we will have in place appropriate social distancing measures, a policy for the use of masks and gloves, and enhanced cleaning procedures. As the threat to public health from COVID-19 declines, we will evaluate our return to normal workplace operations.

Hiring and Onboarding Practices

Currently all interviews are being conducted by phone or videoconference, with related communications taking place via email or phone. New Hire Orientation and other onboarding processes also are handled via email, videoconference and the use of online forms. New hires receive Qualifacts-issued laptops and other equipment for work in advance of onboarding, with virtual phone and videoconferencing software preloaded and ready for use.
Qualifacts provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We believe in providing employees with a work environment free of unlawful discrimination and harassment. In addition to federal law requirements, Qualifacts complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Proactively identifies and addresses concerns to prevent surprises
Facilitates communication between team members to ensure efforts are aligned
Takes accountability for delivering on commitments; owns mistakes and uses them as opportunities for learning and development
Adept at using logic and reasoning to work through complex problems and analyze information
Approaches problems from different perspectives in order to suggest and implement solutions
Strong work ethic with a “can do” attitude
High energy, high ownership of work product and dedication to driving results
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree required, with a concentration in Finance, Accounting, or related field
MBA or other graduate degree in Finance-related field preferred
3+ years in a corporate accounting or finance role in
Demonstrated success in financial modeling and analysis
Attention to accuracy and detail required
Experience in the Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) industry, preferred
Must be able to provide proof of eligibility to work in the U.S.
Job Environment and Conditions:

Working conditions are indoors in environmentally controlled conditions. Must be available to report to Boulder, CO office.

Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. Must be able to remain in a stationary position for at least 75% of the time or more. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Compensation:

$65,000.00 - $85,000

Benefits:

We offer best-in-class benefits, including:
Company-Paid Medical, Dental, and Vision
3 Weeks of Paid Vacation Your First Year
401K Match with Automatic Vesting

Job Title: SR. Enterprise Information Analytics and Reporting Analyst
Job Description:
SUMMARY DESCRIPTION OF POSITION:
The Sr. Enterprise Information Design Analyst will work across diverse ministry areas of Content Development,
Ministry Development, Donor Development, Human Resources, Technology, Finance, and Global Outreach to
implement the enterprise data and analytics strategy. The individual will work with the manager of EIM to drive
a common set of information governance principles, processes & tools to improve data integrity, quality,
governance, availability, and usability. The Individual will also work with the CRU Engineering team to design and
load the data warehouse. Managing information as an asset is critical to support operational excellence through
the integration of business systems and enabling CRM capabilities.

The responsibilities of the individual include the development and use of data systems, discover efficient ways to
organize, store and analyze data with attention to security and confidentiality, and fully grasp the complexity of
data management. This role is responsible for overseeing the implementation and governance of data
management goals, standards, best practices, processes, and technologies. This role will participate in the
planning, strategy, and governance of enterprise data and information management for FL. This position will
participate in the data management initiatives and provide guidance for the use of data and content as well as
representation of data stewards/owners. The SEIDA serves as a liaison between different teams within FL, and
between FL and its stakeholders with reference to EIM. The goal is to ensure proper governance and standards are
applied and championed to promote data quality, reduce administrative burden, ensure timely and secure access
to data, maintain interoperability across our systems, and leverage actionable insights from our data systems to
support our ministry goals and objectives.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
● Assist and speak into the data strategy development, data governance, and data management in
addition to the availability, usability, integrity, retention, and security of the information/data
employed throughout the organization.
● Participate in the Data Governance and Data Quality capabilities, and implementation of the
Enterprise Information Management strategy. This includes the defining of Business
Rules/Definitions and providing Control on how data is to be used enterprise-wide.
● Provide regular updates to EIM manager on progress, business impact in economic terms, and

FAMILYLIFE – a subsidiary of Cru
Job Description
potential issues.
● Maintain cradle-to-grave understanding of data inputs, processes, outputs and Data Flows.
● Architect and document data models, normalize data from various sources.
● Design and Document the ETL process that will be coded by CRU Data Engineers
● Build data visualizations and dashboard reports
● Strong knowledge of SQL and R code and Python
● Understanding of API Protocols and API use within the ETL process.
● Assist in the creation of business cases, including requirements and ROI for EIM projects
requiring funding.
● Provide guidance on what enterprise data is required to support business needs and can speak
to the funding required for enterprise data projects and programs.
● Educates the business and technical community with respect to data governance, its benefits
and how it will be phased in.
● Responsible for implementing the data strategy using metrics and key performance indicators
for his or her assigned ministry areas.
● Participates in the implementation of solutions to improve data quality, business intelligence
and reporting across FL.
● Collaborates in developing recommendations around policies, standards and framework for
data governance.
● Collaborates with partners across the ministry in developing and maintaining the data
governance and data quality structures ensuring we are meeting ministry needs while balancing
quality, risk and cost.
● Engages with the industry to learn about best practices, gain insightful competitive and
regulatory intelligence to help in building excellence in our governance and quality initiatives.
● Displays a balanced, cross-functional perspective, liaising with the business to improve
efficiency, effectiveness and productivity. This included addressing information and data literacy
to ensure the accuracy of the information provided to decision makers.
● Helps carry out FL’s vision, mission, and objectives by supporting the maturing of FL’s ability to
become data driven in its execution of the great commission.
● Actively and intentionally grow in his / her Christian faith.
● Maintain a positive witness for Christ.
● Share what God is teaching him or her.
● Consistently attend and participate in team / ministry devotional times.
OTHER FUNCTIONS (Non-essential):
Perform related duties or special projects as assigned

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
This job has no supervisory responsibilities

BUSINESS ANALYST

WHO WE ARE.
Emery Sapp & Sons, Inc. (ESS) is all about owning what we do. We're an 100% employee-owned multi-faceted contractor who thrives on delivering complex heavy civil projects by developing innovative infrastructure solutions. Since our founding in 1972, ESS has grown into a team of more than 1100 employee-owners that are experts in excavation, grading, underground utilities, bridge construction, and asphalt and concrete paving.

HOW WE OWN IT.
Being 100% employee owned is integral to our company identity. It’s the foundation of our values, our culture, and the way we serve our clients. Most importantly, being 100% employee owned means everyone who works for ESS is a part-owner of the company. ESS’ success is driven by our employee-owners, and we want them to be rewarded for that work!

Emery Sapp & Sons, Inc. is seeking a Business Analyst to join our Corporate Resources team and help further our strategy of using data to drive quality business decisions. We utilize a number of disparate business systems to run our fast-growing business and need to effectively combine data from these systems to understand our current state more broadly and derive cross-system knowledge to guide the business going forward. This position will report to the Director of Technology and will work with leaders from various parts of the business to advance our data strategy.

Key Responsibilities
Gain an understanding of the various business systems and processes that generate data to be analyzed
Establish working relationships with various business leaders to address data needs and ensure effective communication of knowledge derived from data
Play a key role in managing the governance of our data, receiving and prioritizing requests and communicating status and roadmap of data-related initiatives
Ensure data quality through both cleansing of in-flight data as well communicating opportunities for improvement and training to end users inputting data into our systems
(Daily and Monthly Responsibilities)
The primary deliverables of this role will be to:
Create and maintain operational dashboards containing key business metrics and insights
Create and maintain various tabular reports needed by different parts of the business
Audit data quality and accuracy and give feedback to various business owners to help improve quality of data input
Collaborate with IT staff to design, maintain and evolve data ingestion pipelines and data warehouse strategy
Monitor availability and performance of various dashboards and reports and provide initial point-of-contact support for these assets
Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (business, finance, computer science, etc.)
Experience creating dashboards and reports with industry-leading tools (PowerBI, Crystal Reports, Tableau, QlikView, Google DataStudio, etc.)
Proficiency with SQL
Fundamental understanding of relational database (RDBMS) concepts
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently after receiving initial direction
Preferred Qualifications
Experience designing data warehouse schemas (star, snowflake, de-normalization, etc.)
Experience with designing data ingestion and ETL pipelines
Familiarity with Open Source data technologies (PostgreSQL, Nifi, Kafka, Spark, etc.)
Familiarity with cloud-based data management (Google BigQuery, Redshift, etc.)
Ability to automate tasks via scripting and/or continuous integration tooling
Beyond competitive compensation, ESS offers its employee-owners a variety of additional perks and bonus opportunities:
Industry-leading Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
401(k) & Financial Health Education
Comprehensive Health Benefits & Insurance
Flexible Spending & Health Savings Accounts
Casual & Professional Work Environment
Paid Training & Continuing Education
Paid Overtime
Paid Time Off (PTO)
WellnESS Program
Referral Bonus Program
Apprenticeship Programs
Leadership & Training Programs

The Company does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, sex, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, marital/familial status, sexual orientation, veterans’ status, genetic information or disability or any reason prohibited by law.

ESS is a drug and alcohol free workplace. Prior to employment, a pre-employment drug test is required.

ESS requires all new employees to possess an OSHA 10 hour card. If you do not have your OSHA 10 Hour card, ESS will provide training free of charge.

Business Analyst
If you are an IT Business Analyst with experience implementing Workday/HR Systems, please read on!

We are a strong corporate organization working to digitize and build out the technology for our sister companies. We are looking for an experienced IT Business Analyst to work on multiple projects with an emphasis on implementing Workday/HR Systems. Our sister companies all have individual needs, therefore we are looking for someone with a consultative nature who can understand different and unique complex processes and procedures working with the businesses on the end to end solutions.

Some of your functions in this role:
- Working closely with the business to gather and document requirements
- Build technical documentation working with the IT teams from start to finish
- Participate in the UAT testing
- Own all the business analysis functions working in a Agile environment
- Create user documentation, training materials as well as train business users

We are looking for someone who can work in a team or independently depending on the project and sister company. Our sister companies are small and medium in size, so you must be able to adapt to working within these different environments, helping the business through quality business analysis.
What You Need for this Position
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
6+ years working as a Business Analyst, working on enterprise level projects
3+ years working on Workday(strong preference) or any other HR System implementation - REQUIRED
Must have experience with Sharepoint and O365
Experience in an Agile environment
Ability to manage multiple projects at a time with multiple business stakeholders
Strong communication skills working with all levels of business stakeholders
Demonstrated documentation skills, business requirements documentation, technical specifications, training and user documentation
What's In It for You
We offer a solid compensation package in a growing organization!

Local Candidates ONLY please.
So, if you are an IT Business Analyst with experience implementing Workday/HR Systems, please apply today!

Accounting Operations Analyst
Location


Raeford Processing Plant

Department


Finance

Shift

Apply Now

Job Summary:

This position is responsible for analyzing actual cost versus SAP standard cost variances. Analysis to include but not limited to, yield, labor, packaging and overhead costs. Communicates results directly with Operations Management. The accounting operations analyst will also assist in the development and the maintenance of SAP master product costing data through working directly with Operations Management and R & D staff. This position will also work closely with the business to develop and maintain performance indicators to track process and operational improvements. Such performance measurements might also include business growth,new products/customers/markets penetration, or revenue contributors from these new areas. There will also be an opportunity to evaluate capital investments using financial modeling techniques.

Essential Functions, Duties & Responsibilities:
Analyze actual versus SAP standard performance variances and help maintain subsequent reports.
Assist in the development, set-Up and maintenance of SAP routings (Labor).
Assist in the development, set-up and maintenance of SAP scrap factors (Yields).
Create ad-hoc costing scenarios for the purpose of cost impact evaluations of new materials or processes.
Coordinate the progression of releasing new materials in SAP
Perform work on the activity based costing (ABC) models for the Mount Olive Plant.
Assist with the facilitation of the annual budget process, monthly and quarterly reforecasts, and work with business leaders to determine necessary forecast adjustments and budget needs.
Prepare financial and business-related templates as well as analyze and research in such areas as financial and expense performance, rate of return, depreciation, etc.
Compile and prepare reports, graphs and charts of data developed.
Assist with special financial and business-related studies and collaborate with other departments in preparing analyses.
Analyze and investigate P&L and variance between plan/forecast and expected results.
Issue identification and problem resolution to ensure attainment of commitments and objectives.
Prepare various ad hoc analysis and projects to assist with the management of the business.
Develop various models and reports to enable operational tracking and improvement including driving and reporting on cost saving initiatives.
Evaluate and implement systems and processes, including budgeting, planning, reporting, analytical tools.
Perform inventory control related duties and fixed asset validation.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Product Costing knowledge preferred.
SAP system or other ERP systems knowledge preferred.
Knowledge of processing flow in protein industry, a plus.
Strong organizational skills required.
Ability to communicate at levels of the organization.
Self -driven with ability to multi-task and work with minimal supervision in a deadline-oriented environment.
Highly skilled in the use of computer software (e.g., Microsoft Office, AS400, SAP).
Education & Experience:
4 year (Bachelor) degree in Accounting or related field strongly preferred.
2-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in the poultry or protein industry strongly preferred.

Medulla LLC is seeking a Business Analyst to work in Information Technology Department. The Business Analyst will have the unique opportunity to learn & interface with all areas of our rapidly growing, by acting as a partner and thought leader to the business. Collaboration with cross-functional business units will be key to drive solutions that meet business needs and organizational strategy. As a Business Analyst, youll analyze current process & applications, provide innovative recommendations to both process & technology improvements, and be a pivotal member of the Medullas growth. In addition to business analysis, youll also have the unique opportunity to sharpen your project management skills. In short, youll be the glue between IT and the entire Medulla organization.

The successful candidate will embrace the challenge of solving critical business problems, as well as possess a strong ability to absorb and evaluate information from a variety of sources and maintain a big picture view. This is a unique opportunity to cross multiple teams, wear many hats, and see the direct impact that your analysis and thought leadership provides.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities

• Primary responsibilities of position will include, but are not limited to: documenting business requirements/user stories and test scenarios, identifying process steps, researching issues and problem solving, collecting and analyzing data, testing new services and systems, planning and conducting effective training sessions for end-users.

• Learn, understand, assess & document Business Processes, including gap analysis, business process workflow, and research & recommend new functionality and process improvements.

• Serve as a strong partner to the business in both requirements elicitation & analysis. Investigate & uncover needs that business partners may not be able to articulate on their own.

• Be solution-oriented! Work in tandem with the Engineering & Development team to identify application development needs features, user stories, and user acceptance criteria.

• Maintain a development backlog for an Agile delivery team; act as Scrum Master/Project Manager for the Engineering & Development team. Be a key contributor to the success of the delivery team

• Build strong relationships with business partners & project teams.

• Provide project management support and guidance

What Youll Need to be Successful

• Curiosity! Come ready to learn our organization, chiropractic care, and the teams we support.

• A passion to brainstorm and innovate about the ways that digital can transform experiences for both our patients, as well as our internal teams.

• Collaborative focus partnerships with teams like Sales & Marketing, HR, Clinical Operations, Finance and IT are must-haves to build and activate strategic initiatives

• A team focus we have some exciting growth planned, and we want our team members to be enthusiastic and work together to tackle some really cool projects

• Passionate about solving challenges by leveraging technology solutions

• Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills

• Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and written

• Self-directed with the ability to work with minimal supervision

• Attention to detail and proven ability to follow through

Minimum Qualifications

• 1-3 years as a Business Analyst

• Excellent problem-solving and research skills

• Attention to detail

• Strong analytical skills

• Good communication/interpersonal skills

• Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines

• Bachelors degree

• Healthcare experience is a plus, but not required

• Project Management experience is a plus

About American Axle & Manufacturing

Merrick Bank is a top-25 credit card issuer and merchant acquirer in the VISA/MasterCard networks, and a major recreational vehicle lender.
The Bank is a Utah Financial Institution and a member of the FDIC.

At
Merrick Bank, we specialize in credit programs that assist people looking to
build or rebuild their credit. We are FDIC insured and recognized as a top-20
issuer of Visa® cards. In total, we proudly serve over 2.4 million cardholders
and have extended over $5.3 billion in credit.

Our
Mission is to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers, our
employees, and our community. We work hard to create a work environment that
empowers our associates to grow, learn, and reach their potential.

This
position is responsible for running multiple monthly processes, extracting
data, maintaining/updating analytical files and data sources, producing ad-hoc
reports and working with the new accounts analytical team. The candidate will improve current processes
through automation, streamlining, and general improvement of the process. Further this candidate will be responsible
for time-sensitive processes requiring audits that involve other departments
and will require being able to explain month to month changes in the audit
reports. This candidate will work
closely with other analysts in the group to assist them in their role through
education of data sources and providing data when needed. Previous experience with large datasets using
R, SQL, or SAS is desired, particularly updating and maintaining
databases. Previous experience with
quality assurance or business intelligence reporting is also useful –
particularly using Shiny or R.

QUALIFICATIONS:

·
Bachelor's degree in a field related to the following skill
set is required. A Master’s degree is
preferred.

·
Expertise with SQL and some familiarity with programming
(SAS being ideal) is required.

·
Knowledge of R, Python, Java script, Shiny, Html, or CSS are
desired.

·
A firm understanding of data manipulation and extraction is
necessary.

BONUS POINTS:

·
Experience with Docker, and Git would is desirable.

·
Experience working with databases is desirable. We are currently using PostgreSQL.

·
Any experience with BI tools such as Shiny (R) or Dash
(python), or writing automated reports with LaTeX is desirable.

·
Experience finding issues with data is desirable.

·
Experience in the banking industry, specifically in credit
cards is desirable.

PRIMARY DUTIES:

·
Monthly process.

·
Prospect selection process and audit.

·
Quality assurance of data processes.

·
Improving the current data environment and making it faster,
and easier to access.

·
Documenting all data and processes the department develops
and utilizes.

·
Effective written and verbal communication skills.

·
Work effectively both individually and in a collaborative
manner with a team.

·
Compliance with Laws & Regulations:

·
Responsible for complying with all of the Bank’s internal
control policies and procedures.

·
Responsible for understanding and complying with all laws
and regulations to which the Bank is subject.

·
Responsible for communicating problems in operations,

THE COMPANY: BRAINJOLT (brainjoltmedia.com)

What makes us different
Fully remote since 2014, we measure what matters and prioritize RESULTS over where you work
#beatyesterday is our mantra we optimize incrementally so were always beating our own records

Titles dont matter. Results and drive do. Everyone is a chief problem solver at Brainjolt
Bureaucracy is bulls&*t. We dont like red tape. We prefer to work biased to action, led by data
We dont take ourselves too seriously, but we enjoy playing the game and being on the journey
THE OPPORTUNITY: BUSINESS ANALYST/TRADER

At the heart of it, we need someone who is a numbers monster to analyze pricing and bidding strategies to help develop, grow and support Brainjolts revenue strategy. As a Business Analyst, you will provide insights related to ad revenue KPIs and discover ways to automate the revenue reporting and data analysis process. Were keen to partner with someone who has spreadsheet/modeling skills and possibly has worked at a trading desk or in fin-tech in the past.

Specifically
Provide clean, trusted reporting and analysis about the business
Analyze pricing and bidding strategies to produce compelling models and plans that are strategic and action-biased.
Work with the team to optimize existing revenue models, auction mechanics, and create new revenue streams.
Produce detailed reports with clean, actionable data.
Provide thoughtful, deep analysis on areas of concern or question for the business and provide recommendations on the next action items.
Create and draft test plans and requirements for hand-off.
Structure and report on A/B tests to increase site monetization.
REQUIREMENTS

Have to Have
EDUCATION: Bachelors degree or equivalent experience. (Non-traditional paths welcome and encouraged!)
EXPERIENCE: 2+ years of revenue, pricing, yield experience building pricing/bid strategies.
Strong foundation in Google sheets/data modeling with experience in aggregating 1st and 3rd party data.
SQL
Knowledge of data management technologies and third-party data sources like GDS, GA, and GAM.
Desire to continually develop and discover new opportunities in the ever-changing programmatic ecosystem.
A love of working in a fast-paced environment.
A self-starter with a results + growth-driven mindset.
Nice to Have
Familiar with DSPs, SSPs, Exchanges, Ad Networks, Ad-Server (specifically GAM), Media channels like Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, SEO, Taboola, and Native.
Ability to transport data with languages like Python.
A passion for self-directed learning.
EXPECTATIONS
REPORTING: Primary responsibility around revenue, spend, and performance reporting to ensure accurate data is provided daily either through automation or manual pulling of data.
TROUBLESHOOTING: This position will require rotational on-call availability on weekends (when needed) to deliver revenue reporting, troubleshoot issues, communicate with revenue partners, and coordinate with appropriate internal stakeholders.
MITIGATE RISKS: Constantly monitor performance to eliminate any/all issues that negatively impact Brainjolts revenue and overall performance.
ORGANIZED, DATA INTEGRITY & KNOWLEDGE: Expert attention to detail, organization, and knowledge as it relates to Brainjolts revenue and performance data with a keen ability to deliver key insights and recommendations to ensure the trust is constantly maintained with all internal stakeholders.
THOUGHT LEADERSHIP: Deliver key insights to the entire Brainjolt team in an effort to educate and enhance the entire company on opportunities for optimization and overall improvement.
ANALYSIS: Actively find defensible data-based insights that inform the business.
CREATIVE: Find correlations and insights that others might not see by thinking differently. You often think about and propose solutions that are simpler and more effective.
WHY BRAINJOLT?

Brainjolt is a fun, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial environment that empowers its employees to work independently and drive results that greatly impact the business. Since early on, one of our go-to values has been Fight boredom, spread happiness. We strive to do this not just for our audience, but for our team, too. In addition to basic benefits, here are some additional ways we support your continued success and happiness:
Unlimited PTO
Healthcare Benefits*
401k with matching*
Globe Trotters (pay to travel) Program
Home Internet & mobile phone assistance
Gym membership assistance
2 tickets to a concert of your choice per year
Spotify, Netflix, & Audible subscriptions
Monthly Personal & business-related book budget
Parental Leave
This is a Telecommute/Work from Home position
*Only available to US citizens

We are looking for a Senior Credit Analyst to join our Commercial team to underwrite a wide array of credit requests and events in a manner which provide approving authorities with written recommendations that support loan risk ratings in accordance with Bank standards, practices and policies. The Senior Credit Analyst will also provide training and assistance as needed and effectively manage assigned projects and recurring reporting responsibilities.
Work independently supporting bank-wide commercial business development, retainage and management efforts through the timely production of informative and evaluative credit documents and underwriting materials.

Take an active role in evaluating critical vendor relationships with real estate appraisers and environment firms; evaluate the quality and acceptability of reports and appraisals that analyze collateral and environmental risk.
Ensure compliance with all regulations, policies, and procedures.

Strong interpersonal and writing skills

Job Title: Senior Project Manager / Change Management Consultant
Job Description:
Our Culture:


Stoneridge Software began with an idea: How can Microsoft implementations be done better? After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. As a Microsoft Gold Partner, weve developed a proven process for project delivery and a laser focus on long-term support to empower our clients success. We know how to work hard but we also know how important it is to balance work with family and the rest of our lives. Stoneridge Software has cultivated an atmosphere of trust, community, and support that includes a flexible working environment, unlimited vacation, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and even beer on-tap. These initiatives, and many more have resulted in numerous Best Work Place awards and happy team members. We focus on allowing our team members to be authentically themselves whether thats creative, serious or nerdy. Does this sound like a team you would like to be a part of?

What we are Looking for:


Stoneridge Software seeks a highly motivated, assertive and client centric Senior Project Manager/Organizational Change Management Consultant to join our growing team to lead & contribute to Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM implementations. This is a unique and blended role with a Project Management focus while also using their passion for people, culture, and thoughtful communications to guide organizations through their transformation strategies.

The Senior Project Manager/OCM Consultant is responsible for making the most efficient use of resources on the implementation, defining and managing quality of deliverables, managing communications, project plans, budget, escalation process, and change control. In addition, this person will design, develop, implement, and manage enterprise wide solutions that will drive changes to organizational units, roles, responsibilities, user adoption, documentation, and processes. The role is aimed at instilling new behaviors, positive attitudes, and strategic staffing to transform the people and the culture at each client organization. This person will work closely with the Stoneridge Software project teams as well as our clients to conduct introductory workshops on Why Do Organizations Need Change Management including impact on project success, managing employee resistance to change, increasing people dependent ROIs and building competencies for change into the organization.

A Day in the Life:
Lead and manage successful delivery of Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM projects
Project planning and execution, issue and risk management, stakeholder management, and developing and delivering effective communication
Lead the development of a formalized and actionable Change Management offering for all projects
Consult with Executive Stakeholders on projects to coach them on providing sponsorship and leadership for business transformations
Customize the Change Management offering to meet individual client and project needs and develop reports to monitor results and demonstrate value
Provide excellent service and build ongoing relationships with clients
Work in partnership with business counterparts on the client side to guide and provide a framework for communication, training, and successful project delivery
Work with our sales team to identify and cultivate opportunities and provide direction during the sales cycle
Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support our client's business goals
Understand client's resource capabilities and constraints, and adjust the project plan accordingly
Work in partnership with Stoneridge Delivery Team consultants to develop meaningful train-the-trainer content and knowledge transfer on projects to ensure our clients have the best transition experience possible
Develop and deliver project activities including scheduling, resourcing, backlog management, and proposal development
Manage team activities and project dependencies to ensure on time project deliverables
Organize and facilitate steering committee meetings, project planning meetings, and recurring team meetings
Lead and ensure the delivery team is practicing the Stoneridge Software implementation methodology including continuous improvement activities
Manage issues and escalations on projects
Plan and schedule consultants' work and negotiating resolution to resourcing conflicts
Work collaboratively with project teams and clients, including traveling to their locations
Set aside time for self-development by attending training or self-learning on key subjects
Preferred Qualifications
Proven experience leading at least two (2) successful full lifecycle Dynamics ERP Implementations (AX 2012, D365)
Great leadership and communication skills
3+ years of direct work experience in a project management capacity including all aspects of process development and project lifecycle execution
3+ years of direct work experience in change management
PMP or CAPM designation preferred
Prosci Change Management certification, the Galbraiths Star, Six Sigma, or equivalent OCM certification
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business, Computer Science or related field
Strong technical aptitude
Solid interpersonal skills, and ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships within and outside Stoneridge
Ability to work primarily independently and concurrently manage multiple projects
Ability to communicate effectively in both spoken and written English
Ability to work collaboratively for the best interests of the business and the team
Valid Driver's License required
Must be a U.S. Citizen or legal permanent resident

Job Title: Senior Project Manager / Change Management Consultant
Job Description:
Our Culture:


Stoneridge Software began with an idea: How can Microsoft implementations be done better? After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. As a Microsoft Gold Partner, weve developed a proven process for project delivery and a laser focus on long-term support to empower our clients success. We know how to work hard but we also know how important it is to balance work with family and the rest of our lives. Stoneridge Software has cultivated an atmosphere of trust, community, and support that includes a flexible working environment, unlimited vacation, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and even beer on-tap. These initiatives, and many more have resulted in numerous Best Work Place awards and happy team members. We focus on allowing our team members to be authentically themselves whether thats creative, serious or nerdy. Does this sound like a team you would like to be a part of?

What we are Looking for:


Stoneridge Software seeks a highly motivated, assertive and client centric Senior Project Manager/Organizational Change Management Consultant to join our growing team to lead & contribute to Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM implementations. This is a unique and blended role with a Project Management focus while also using their passion for people, culture, and thoughtful communications to guide organizations through their transformation strategies.

The Senior Project Manager/OCM Consultant is responsible for making the most efficient use of resources on the implementation, defining and managing quality of deliverables, managing communications, project plans, budget, escalation process, and change control. In addition, this person will design, develop, implement, and manage enterprise wide solutions that will drive changes to organizational units, roles, responsibilities, user adoption, documentation, and processes. The role is aimed at instilling new behaviors, positive attitudes, and strategic staffing to transform the people and the culture at each client organization. This person will work closely with the Stoneridge Software project teams as well as our clients to conduct introductory workshops on Why Do Organizations Need Change Management including impact on project success, managing employee resistance to change, increasing people dependent ROIs and building competencies for change into the organization.

A Day in the Life:
Lead and manage successful delivery of Dynamics 365 ERP and CRM projects
Project planning and execution, issue and risk management, stakeholder management, and developing and delivering effective communication
Lead the development of a formalized and actionable Change Management offering for all projects
Consult with Executive Stakeholders on projects to coach them on providing sponsorship and leadership for business transformations
Customize the Change Management offering to meet individual client and project needs and develop reports to monitor results and demonstrate value
Provide excellent service and build ongoing relationships with clients
Work in partnership with business counterparts on the client side to guide and provide a framework for communication, training, and successful project delivery
Work with our sales team to identify and cultivate opportunities and provide direction during the sales cycle
Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support our client's business goals
Understand client's resource capabilities and constraints, and adjust the project plan accordingly
Work in partnership with Stoneridge Delivery Team consultants to develop meaningful train-the-trainer content and knowledge transfer on projects to ensure our clients have the best transition experience possible
Develop and deliver project activities including scheduling, resourcing, backlog management, and proposal development
Manage team activities and project dependencies to ensure on time project deliverables
Organize and facilitate steering committee meetings, project planning meetings, and recurring team meetings
Lead and ensure the delivery team is practicing the Stoneridge Software implementation methodology including continuous improvement activities
Manage issues and escalations on projects
Plan and schedule consultants' work and negotiating resolution to resourcing conflicts
Work collaboratively with project teams and clients, including traveling to their locations
Set aside time for self-development by attending training or self-learning on key subjects
Preferred Qualifications
Proven experience leading at least two (2) successful full lifecycle Dynamics ERP Implementations (AX 2012, D365)
Great leadership and communication skills
3+ years of direct work experience in a project management capacity including all aspects of process development and project lifecycle execution
3+ years of direct work experience in change management
PMP or CAPM designation preferred
Prosci Change Management certification, the Galbraiths Star, Six Sigma, or equivalent OCM certification
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business, Computer Science or related field
Strong technical aptitude
Solid interpersonal skills, and ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships within and outside Stoneridge
Ability to work primarily independently and concurrently manage multiple projects
Ability to communicate effectively in both spoken and written English
Ability to work collaboratively for the best interests of the business and the team
Valid Driver's License required
Must be a U.S. Citizen or legal permanent resident

The role will partner with the Business Relationship Manager, taking responsibility to deliver high quality business cases, business process designs and ensure that proposed solutions meet established AstraZeneca quality and compliance standards and business solution needs.

Business Needs Identification Operates at a functional level in assessing and defining business need and areas for improvement. Proactively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals. Actively monitors and identifies capability gaps and proposes potential solutions through research internally and externally.

Closely partnering with the Architecture team, ensuring the technical solution will deliver the agreed business benefits.
Business Case Definition Shapes and defines the business case, producing detailed business justification for investment including ROI and benefits realization.
Solution Evaluation Highly proficient in analyzing and assessing solution proposals and able to articulate supporting reasoning. i.e. assessing business readiness, maximizing value vs. spend.
Work collaboratively with, or take responsibility for:

At AES, we raise the quality of life around the world by changing the way energy works. Everyone makes an impact every day in our small, global teams. Apply here to start an extraordinary career today.

A Financial Analyst at AES Distributed Energy is involved in both corporate and project level financing activities and works closely with equity investors and lending partners to complete complex financial transactions. The Analyst will report directly to a Manager but will ultimately support the Chief Financial Officer in all aspects of evaluating investment and development opportunities pertaining to solar energy projects and battery storage technology.
Responsibilities:

Financial Modeling
Analysts must report on key investment metrics of potential acquisition opportunities.
Internal Rate of Return, Net-Present Value, and Dividend Yield.
Due to the complexity of renewable energy financial structures, earnings calculations for solar project investments are often different than cash proceeds. These calculations require a basic understanding of partnership tax and book accounting concepts.
Analysts must be able to size investments from “tax equity investors”. These investments are specifically suited to provide the investor tax benefits that accrue from being an equity partner in a company that owns a solar project or multiple solar projects. To be considered a tax equity partner, there are specific parameters that guide investments which an analyst must be able to identify and structure. To do so requires a strong understanding of key financial concepts such as tax depreciation, capital accounts, and investment basis.
Analysts must be able to size debt investments from our lending partners. The analyst must be able to interpret various terms presented by debt providers to correctly size the debt principal and amortization schedule and will serve as the primary resource for large financial instructions during their due diligence process leading up to credit committee.
Analysts must be able to track complex interest rate hedge positions, particularly in a volatile interest rate environment. Such responsibilities include monitoring swap positions and tracking the Maximum Probable Exposure of executed derivatives. These responsibilities require a basic understanding of interest rate swaps and the ability to compare swaps against debt amortization profiles. Analysts must be able to work with the Technical Accounting team to track swaps and ensure that all swaps qualify for hedge accounting to ensure that mark-to-market losses do not flow through to the income statement.
Analysts will assist with company valuation, which is an aggregation of all the company’s holdings and investments. This requires attention to detail and an understanding of how cash flows through the organization.
Deal Execution and Transaction Management
Analysts will work closely with external parties to facilitate the accurate and timely closing of each transaction. This includes direct collaboration with investment banks, lenders, independent engineers, developers, insurers, appraisers, and consultants.
Analysts will support the negotiation of complex financial documents through analysis of various terms within many different agreements. Analysts are expected to measure the impact of proposed financial terms, run sensitivities of financial models accounting for all perceived risks, and provide language to legal agreements that accurately reflects the transaction. To do so requires a basic understanding of contract structure and a familiarity with the financial concepts present in financing agreements.
Analysts will advise on the economic results of different financial structures. Analysts must understand how cash moves between legal entities and understand the potential tax consequences that result.
Skills and Qualifications:
Prior experience working in a transaction focused role (energy experience preferred).
Demonstrated financial acumen and experience constructing and maintaining complex financial models using Microsoft Excel.
Undergraduate business degree required. Preferred focus in Finance.
Demonstrated teamwork skills; ability to work collaboratively with others to achieve objectives.
Ability to set and meet realistic deadlines.
Willingness to travel approximately 10% of working days.
Outstanding interpersonal skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Position Description

TNS has an amazing opportunity for a Project Analyst in our Procure to Pay function. Position will
function as an Analyst on the Procure to Pay teams for system data clean-up, data analysis
and review, record updating, and other projects as assigned. Ensure accuracy and investigate data
anomalies and problems with high level of detail, accuracy.

Responsibilities may include:

- Provides administrative and clerical support specifically related to supply chain and procurement department activities

- Maintains files, logs, records of invoices, purchase orders and other related documentation

- Maintains information on computer systems. Assists in expediting orders

- Responsible for tracking, and overall coordination required for circuit installations. Analyzes service requests to determine circuit requirements and priorities. Uses provisioning tools to process customer service orders and activate service

- Update AUTOPay accounts online with new credit card remit information

- Strong MS Excel skills to include formula creation and lookups

We have been delivering industry-leading solutions for the payments, financial and telecommunications industries since 1990. We are the preferred supplier of networking, integrated data and voice services to many leading organizations in the global payments and financial communities, as well as a provider of extensive telecommunications network solutions to service providers.

We are a privately held company with a healthy balance sheet, secure assets and a loyal customer base that includes some of the largest global blue-chip companies in the world. Many of the world’s leading companies continue to count on us as their primary provider of a range of networking and communication services, enabling them to expand regionally, nationally and globally. We provide services to customers in over 60 countries throughout the world.

We manage some of the largest real-time community networks in the world, enabling industry participants to simply and securely interact and transact with other businesses, to access the data and applications they need, over managed and secure communications platforms. Our existing footprint supports millions of connections and provide access to critical databases. Our network securely blends private and public networking to enable customers to utilize a single connection for "one-to-many" and "many-to-many"connections over a global platform.

Since our launch we have helped our customers and communities of interest, requiring secure and reliable communications solutions, to evolve from legacy to leading-edge technologies. Today the company provides a full range of services from dedicated connections to managed IP network solutions, providing local support and global reach to medium and large enterprises and service providers.

Revenue Operations Analyst

Who we are

DoubleVerify is a leading software platform for digital media measurement, data and analytics. DV's mission is to be the definitive source of transparency and data-driven insights into the quality and effectiveness of digital advertising for the world's largest brands, publishers and digital ad platforms. DV's technology platform provides advertisers with consistent and unbiased data and analytics that can be used to optimize the quality and return on their digital ad investments. Since 2008, DV has helped hundreds of Fortune 500 companies gain the most from their media spend by delivering best in class solutions across the digital advertising ecosystem, helping to build a better industry. Learn more at www.doubleverify.com.

What you'll do

Under the Sales Organization, the Revenue Operations Analyst will work efficiently and cross collaboratively to spearhead and ensure every new seller has the tools they need to be able to generate revenue within their first 3 months of employment at DoubleVerify. They will create and provide a continuous learning loop for each DoubleVerify salesperson so they are provided with valuable information that will enable them to increase their revenue potential and/or decrease their time to revenue generation. In this role, the Sales Operations Associate will ensure all processes rolled out across the DV organization which require a seller's cooperation are built to either make the revenue generation process more efficient or maximize the revenue potential.

Marketo Lead Generation Program for Sales
Work with Sales Operations to review, assign, and scrub the leads and contacts in Salesforce for quality
Develop documentation and assist with the training of the sales organization on our lead generation management process
Gather and organize feedback from the marketing and sales teams that will be used to further develop our lead generation program
Analyze data around our lead generation program to search for insights which can be turned into learnings and actions for its continued development with a focus on driving the most revenue per lead.
Salesforce.com Redesign for Sales
Gather and organize feedback from the global sales team that will be used in our development of new Salesforce.com processes, reports and dashboards with the aim of (1) reducing a seller's time spent in SFDC on admin related tasks (2) improving the ease at which a seller can update SFDC with relevant, valuable information and (3) ensuring each seller has a clear understanding of their own performance against their goal at any moment in time
Serve as the lead from the Sales Organization for user testing of new SFDC rollouts
Assist with the investigation, evaluation and assessment of business tools related to sales forecasting, pipeline management and business intelligence reporting
Document and supervise the creation of new internal documentation which will aid in speeding up the ramp time for a new seller
Work with Learning & Development to maintain an organizational structure for all training and onboarding collateral so it's easily accessible and up to date
Gather feedback from new sales hires about our onboarding programs to document and help analyze areas for improvement
Execute against an analytical framework for measuring the efficiency of each new seller to identify and report against success attributes which can be developed into additional programs
Sales Training & Development
Serve as the training coordinator for all new sales training programs: organizing training sessions, ensuring training materials are ready and appropriate for the audience, and serving as the first point of contact for any sales questions
Record and analyze requests from sales managers around the development of additional training materials and training programs
Serve as sales representative to provide valuable input for internal sales organization on product documentation and product training materials
Process Improvements - Assist the VP of Revenue Operations to setup, document and project manage new processes or process improvements that require development work from other departments, including Sales Operations, Product, Marketing, Client Services, etc.
Record and analyze requests from sales managers and sellers around process improvement ideas and challenges. Takes the lead in initial conversations with sellers to understand the asks and to see whether needs can be met through current process or if a development request should be put in
Who you are
1-3 years of sales operations, product/project management or sales planning experience with a background in the advertising / media industry preferred
Understanding of SaaS sales processes and experience working with sales and contracting stakeholders
Significant experience working in Salesforce CRM required
Work Ethic - willingness to go the extra mile to get things done no matter what
Adaptability - we are moving at 1,000 miles per hour so things will change fast, be ready!
Communication - you're an expert communicator, easily explaining processes with clarity through both spoken and written communication. You are naturally able to sell people on taking on new processes and adopting new ideas and people consider you to be influential.
Positivity - you have a can-do attitude and bring enthusiasm to everything you do; people are naturally drawn to you and love working with you
Attention to Detail - you appreciate things being done correctly and nothing gets past you. You check things over thoroughly before signing off
Strong experience in consolidating feedback across functional teams and documenting detailed requirements ready to hand off to technical resources
Experienced in leading training sessions, with preferred experience in providing technical or process-focused trainings
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, and Word and the Google Application Suite

Who is Cenlar?

You are.

Employee-owners have made Cenlar one of the nation’s largest mortgage subservicers. We have achieved success by empowering people with company ownership, real programs that provide avenues for advancement, and a great atmosphere that makes everyone look forward to the workday. Get your share of our success by considering the opportunity to join our team as a Loss Mitigation QAC Manager.
Job Summary:

Primarily responsible for oversight of the Back-In-The-Black (BITB) application within all business areas as well as managing client and vendor updates and system improvements regarding BITB’s involvement with Default Servicing Loss Mitigation.

Responsibilities:
Provide oversight to BITB applications throughout Default Servicing Loss Mitigation including:
Trouble shooting workflow, mapping, or posting errors and providing remediation;
Configure workflow, mapping, and posting for all users as well as defining user roles and responsibilities;
Create all workflows in accordance with Cenlar policies, lender guidelines and CFPB/OCC (Consumer Financial Protection Bureau/Office of the Comptroller of the Currency) regulations; and,
Map all workflows to current system of record (MSP) to ensure proper audit coding and notations occur.
Ensure all CFPB/OCC regulations are maintained within BITB application as well as all updates to lender guidelines and client requirements.
Coordinate with OLPM (BITB Project Manager) to ensure all letters are updated within the BITB workflow and map to our system of record correctly including:
Create a test environment prior to any letter going into production to ensure all samples and test scripts are generated accurately;
Correct any fails or defects that may occur while in test environment;
Facilitate smooth transition into production (live) mode for all letters; and
Monitor transition and correct and fails, errors or defects that may occur.
Perform BITB demonstrations for external parties, i.e., clients or vendors, as requested, providing an overview of the workflow and mapping capabilities.
Providing BITB training to all internal staff as requested; create all training materials and train in a class-setting both in person and in webinars/video conferencing.
Develop business continuity plan, ensure all process changes and updates are relayed to the affected teams.
Provide monitoring reports; report as needed to first-line-management and other interested parties (e.g. BURMs, QC, and Internal Audit).
Work with department managers to ensure BITB applications are utilized correctly; provide spot training as requested.
Perform effective root-cause analysis and follow-up on corrective actions pertaining to BITB application.
Meet internal and external project deadlines
Qualifications:
High school diploma required; Bachelor’s degree preferred. (Consumer Financial Protection Bureau/Office of the Comptroller of the Currency)
5 years’ relevant experience in BITB application, Loss Mitigation, loan processing, mortgage banking, or financial institutions
Expert knowledge of BITB
Proficiency in Black Knight MSP
Experience reviewing processes, data, or documents with a strong attention to detail
Experience interpreting and applying rules and guidelines for sound decision-making
Ability to facilitate training materials
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Excellent problem resolution and organizational skills
Flexibility to business needs, with a production- and accuracy-oriented attitude
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Word and Excel
Ability to meet strict deadlines with excellent follow up skills

DESCRIPTION

CreditNinja is a FinTech company founded in 2017 by veteran serial entrepreneurs who were part of the core team behind Enova (NYSE:ENVA), a leading publicly traded consumer financial services company. CreditNinja's mission is to provide hardworking Americans with financial solutions when unexpected expenses arise. Unlike traditional banks, CreditNinja works hard to ensure that people with less-than-perfect credit can have quick access to the money they need. Headquartered in downtown Chicago, we are a lean and innovative team seeking like-minded talent to help us disrupt the consumer finance industry.

CreditNinja is looking for a Business Analyst to join a team of analytics and machine learning experts. The hire will be responsible for conducting exploratory analysis to provide data driven insights, working with business units and senior management to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and building dashboards to monitor portfolio performance using these KPIs. The ideal candidate is a self-directed individual who is excited to think out of the box to come up with new ideas using data driven insights. The individual must be comfortable working with cross functional teams. This is an exciting and rare opportunity to join a well-capitalized startup on the ground floor and help drive our success.

Look for improvement and automation opportunities with business impact to drive maximum value from our existing data assets & tools

Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

Start-up experience

Fun, fast-paced work environment

Deliver consistent and accurate reporting that provides both high-level and granular POVs on DG performance on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual, and ad hoc basis. Create dashboards and compelling data visualizations that are insightful, thoughtful, engaging, and can distill complex concepts in formats that are accessible at every level of the organization
Prioritize and work well in an environment with competing demands from multiple stakeholders in Marketing
Requirements for consideration:
BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics, or equivalent experience
Minimum 2 years of analytical and database experience
Marketing analytics or consulting experience is a plus
Exceptional problem solving, critical thinking, and project management skills with the capacity and anticipation to adjust based on shifting deadlines and moving priorities
Excellent programming skills in SQL and Python. R is a plus
Proficiency with multiple analytical and database tools (e.g BigQuery, Jupyter notebooks, Presto, Tableau or alike)
Excellent data visualization skills. Experience creating dashboard reporting in DataStudio, Tableau or a similar visualization tool a plus
Speed, resourcefulness and a go-getter attitude. Moving quickly and executing to allow for continual iteration is a core qualification of our team
Willing to contribute new ideas and articulate them to a variety of stakeholders and not just execute on existing ones
Quest to deliver impact, but also invests in themselves and others. We dont get better by standing still, so you will need to consistently seek to innovate and raise the bar
A love of data - you just go get the data you need and turn it into an insightful story. You know how to convert data into decisions without getting stuck in paralysis by analysis
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We help protect our customers against life’s uncertainties. Regardless of where you work within the company, you’ll be helping provide protection and peace of mind when our customers need it most.

Whether it’s in accounting, claims, IT, investments, legal, marketing, sales, or another department, come be part of a company where you can accomplish your goals while contributing to our social mission of becoming America’s most protective insurance company.

Protective Life is looking for a Business Systems Analyst for the Annuity Systems Team. This position requires strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills, along with proper prioritization of multiple assignments, while maintaining a sense of urgency to meet individual and team deadlines and goals. Strong knowledge of annuity business and/or a strong understanding of accounting is preferred.
Success in this role requires leadership ability among peers, excellent oral and written communication skills, and effective collaboration with others, both internal and external to the team and company. The candidate should be self-motivated and show an inquisitive nature, seek improvements, and demonstrate strong accuracy and attention to detail. Other abilities include accepting responsibility and accountability for own job and performance, demonstrating independent work behaviors, and having decision-making skills to achieve desired results.
Primary Responsibilities
Diagnose and manage production defects to a successful resolution. Work with software developers within the team or across the organization to resolve problems. Test and document defect fixes and communicate resolution back to the customer. Consult with end-users concerning corrective actions as needed in a calm and professional manner.
Elicit, compose and maintain business requirements for system enhancements using interviews, group facilitation, prototyping, business process descriptions, data analysis, use cases or workflow analysis. Work with software developers to help them understand requirements. Ensure requirement documents are complete and conform to defined standards.
Create, publish, maintain and execute test plans and specific test cases for solutions based on documented requirements and systems design specifications. Review results with business to ensure test results are as expected.
Provide end-user training when appropriate.
Support conversion efforts by learning about the business being converted, performing regression testing, identifying potential impacts to existing business, and helping to develop repeatable processes for future regression testing and conversion efforts.
Utilize appropriate project tracking methodologies and database(s) to manage multiple projects through the project life cycle. Document moderately complex project phases, provide regular status updates, and assist with creating effective release/implementation plans.
Create, maintain and coordinate updates to system data elements and configurable applications, including rules, values, tables and output with little or no development resource assistance. Create and run queries to generate, validate, and analyze data from various applications
Show leadership in all aspects of the position, work well with teammates and those outside the team, be collaborative in meetings and discussions and assist teammates as needed or required.
Qualifications
Must have experience with annuity products. VUL experience preferred
Experience on wmA Vantage and LIDP’s Administrator (ADMI) systems preferred
Experience with agile project methodology preferred
High school diploma or equivalent required; relevant degree strongly preferred.
Moderate analytical and problem-solving skills; competent to work in many system analysis phases and to consider moderate business implications of applying technology to the current and future business environment
Ability to work effectively under very tight deadline pressure
Clear use of the English language in written and oral communications and the ability to interpret and communicate technical information to non-technical personnel and vice versa
Ability to act with diplomacy in resolving conflict, consulting and in acting as an agent in charge
Must be self- motivated, able to work independently and willing to self-teach and take responsibility for ongoing professional development
At Protective, we are committed to providing an inclusive culture where all employees fully contribute and thrive. We have always been a values-driven culture. Doing the right thing and serving people are part of our DNA, and we believe that valuing and embracing different backgrounds and perspectives is what makes us unique.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to being inclusive and attracting, retaining, and growing the talents of a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Job Title: Workday Talent & Performance Senior Consultant - Technology Solutions
Job Description:
CrossCountry Consulting is a trusted business advisory firm that provides customized finance, accounting, human capital management, risk, operations and technology consulting services to leading organizations facing complex change. We partner with our clients to help them navigate pressing business challenges and achieve goals related to improving operations, minimizing risks and enabling future growth.
Our people are our most valuable asset and our individual differences are our greatest strength. Join our team where Excellence is a priority, Collaboration and teamwork are the norm, Energy is contagious, and the opportunity to make an Impact is endless.
We love to help our clients and our people succeed... and it shows! Click here to see why our employees made us #2 on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work 2020 list.

Imagine advising renowned clients across the country and implementing one of the world’s most innovative and leading cloud technologies. At CrossCountry, that’s exactly what you’ll do – you’ll take part in a quickly growing Workday practice. As a Workday Services Partner, we offer full-suite services and provide our consultants with hands-on training and certification in Workday. We believe that happy employees deliver better results, so we strive to provide our employees with a meaningful work-life balance and invest in their professional development. In fact, we recently received an Employees’ Choice Award from Glassdoor, recognizing CrossCountry as the 2nd Best Place to Work in 2020!
By joining CrossCountry you’ll be making a direct impact on our growing Workday practice, regularly taking part in:
· Advising key stakeholders through selection, transformation, implementation, and configuration of Workday. Our consultants are hands-on involved in full-scale implementation, project management, change management, requirements and design, process improvement, testing, integration enablement support, oversee supplier enablement, and best practices
· Contributing beyond client delivery, including, but not limited to recruiting, coaching, marketing, business development, practice development, operational improvement and beyond
· Implementing performance improvement and cost-reduction initiatives
Additional Responsibilities
Participate in full-cycle and phase X implementation projects within the Workday HCM product suite
Provide post-production support, and enhancement services to both large multi-billion-dollar enterprises and emerging growth companies
Collaborate with a team to help clients navigate the selection, transformation, implementation, and configuration of the Talent & Performance module
Assist clients who wish to add Talent & Performance capabilities to their existing Workday environment
Participate in advisory, planning and implementation of the Talent & Performance module by documenting requirements, mapping processes, and implementing best-practice configuration
Help clients develop and refine a vision for talent planning, talent retention, and paying for performance
Communicate effectively with clients to convey project updates and recommendations
Prioritize client’s interest and proactively listen to ensure that work exceeds their expectations
Actively foster internal relationships, share knowledge, and mentor other consultants to grow our practice
Qualifications
2+ years of recent Workday Certified experience implementing Workday Talent
1-2 large end-to-end implementations or 3-4 small end-to-end implementations within Talent, with a demonstrated deep knowledge of Talent configuration
Experience as a lead consultant on Workday Talent projects
Current certification in Workday Talent
Previous consulting experience with a Workday deployment partner
Experience deploying multiple Workday Talent or HCM projects simultaneously a plus
Strong attention to detail with the ability to think from a “big picture” perspective
Ability to build and develop strong client relationships and drive client conversations
Strong leadership skills with the ability to foster an environment of collaboration and excellence
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training
Ability to travel on average 30% to 50% of the time
Creativity, confidence, flexibility, and a great sense of humor
Bachelor’s degree (or higher)

Summit Technical Solutions (STS) is seeking a Strategic Planner/ Analyst to provide administrative operational support to 100th Missile Defense Brigade in support of a USASMDC/ARSTRAT contract at Peterson AFB, CO.

Primary Responsibilities
Supports day to day operations, planning, staff actions, tasking, and coordination with United States Northern Command (USNORTHCOM), United States Strategic Command (USSTRATCOM), Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and United States Army Space and Missile Defense Command/Army Strategic Forces Command (USASMDC/ARSTRAT), the Colorado, Alaska and California Army National Guard.
Provides SME-level Digital Training Management System (DTMS support to the 100th BDE and 49th BN. Tracks training for the 100th Missile Defense Brigade in DTMS, updating calendars daily, weekly and monthly.
Supports the Brigade, coordinating exercise participation, test planning, and the execution of Ballistic Missile Defense/Global Missile Defense (BMD/GMD) exercise activities.
Supports 100th BDE level participation in Tier I exercises and external evaluations as a member of the BDE Exercise Control Group.
Supports the Brigade in the development and coordination of training, training guidance, exercises, and evaluation programs. Updates monthly, bi-annual, annual training and biennial requirements in DTMS.
Monitors short and long range training, weapons qualifications, and Army Physical Fitness Test (APFT) data.
Prepares and participates in bi-weekly staff call meetings and Video Teleconference (VTC) presentations.
Provides SME-level DRRS-A/NETUSR support to 100th BDE and 49th BN. Prepares the Personnel, Logistics, Training Unit Strength Report (USR) and Status Update for submission to United States Army Space and Missile Defense Command/Army Forces Strategic Command and Colorado Army National Guard State Headquarters.
Required Skills

Qualified candidates will have the following experience and qualifications:

Experience
Minimum of 10 years experience with USASMDC/ARSTRAT, USSTRATCOM (JFCC-IMD) or US Army space and missile defense operations.
Experience with missile defense related operations and briefing or training specific requirements for related missile defense mission areas.
Working knowledge of missile defense related operations, communications and BMDS systems architecture.
Familiarity with Army training and readiness doctrine.
Recent experience operating Unit Status Reporting (USR) system and Digital Training Management System (DTMS), and familiarity with related policies.
Experience conducting operational evaluations/assessments. and exercise planning.
Education
Bachelors degree in Engineering Field
Master’s degree in Space or Missile Defense Operations a strong plus.
Travel

Candidate must be able/willing to travel 30%

Other Requirements
U.S. Citizen
Active Top Secret/SCI and the ability to maintain the clearance throughout period of employment
Required Experience
