AST was founded on one simple thought, put our people and our customers first and you can never lose. We are strategic contributors, partnering with forward-thinking organizations to pursue leading-edge digital transformation, process reengineering, and technology solutions.

If you're someone with energy, drive, and creativity, this just might be the place for you!

Currently, we are looking for a talented Marketing Analyst to join our team! This is a full-time position, based out of our headquarters, in the Chicago suburbs.

What you'll do:

Drive top-of-the-funnel activity and generate leads through the following activities:
Create brand-appropriate content (draft, collaborate, proofread, and publish) including, but not limited to, case studies, data sheets, press releases, white papers, web pages, videos and social media.
Support and run campaigns in coordination with sales and technical teams.
Support event management for customer- and partner-facing events, including trade shows, seminars, and other promotional events.
Develop booklets or placemats for client presentations during the bid process, working closely with pre-sales and project teams to streamline messaging and visual representation of qualifications.
Proofread various documents (technical and promotional) to ensure they are in keeping with the overall AST voice and publication standards.
What you bring:
Ability to work closely with all levels of the organization, including remote teams and offshore, to achieve business objectives on time and within budget
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Expert organization and planning skills
Strong attention to detail
Advanced Microsoft Office skills in PPT, Word, Excel, and Publisher
Pardot (or other marketing automation tools)
Salesforce campaign management
Knowledge of Office 365 and SharePoint functions
Degree in Marketing, Communications or related
2-4 years Marketing experience
Please be able to provide samples or a portfolio of your work.
A love for what you do!
What we bring: AT AST, we know our people are the key to our success and that means having happy and healthy employees. The pros of working at AST extend well beyond your paycheck. As an employee, you will have access to ASTs Total Rewards program. We offer medical, dental, and vision benefits, with plans to suit you and your familys needs, as well as retirement, disability, and life insurance. We also offer additional benefits, such as commuter benefits, legal insurance, pet insurance, sabbatical leave, education reimbursement, parental leave, and much more.

Our Culture: At AST, people make the difference. Weve discovered over our 25 years in business, the more we invest in our talent, the greater the return. We foster a culture of trust, ownership, and innovation at every level of the organization. All doors are open and everyones ideas matter, giving our people the ability to quickly understand our customers needs and translate those needs into action. While we celebrate individual wins, we always strive for shared success. We are One AST.

Acara is looking for Business Data/Business Intelligence Analyst with our client.

Full Remote position
Part- Time 15 to 20 hours per week

You will take responsibility for maintaining and building on our business intelligence infrastructure, analyzing and reporting data at all levels of the organization, and solving data-intensive business problems. To do well in this role, you need experience as a data and/or business intelligence analyst who is comfortable querying, cleaning and presenting data from a wide variety of sources and formats, and a deep understanding of business intelligence dashboard development and deployment.
This position is responsible for collecting and assembling data, analyzing business performance, identifying and troubleshooting problems, and developing recommendations to deliver operations planning and decisions. This includes maintaining and establishing end-to-end business data solutions, from the identification of and connection to source data systems to targeted analyses and presentations of these solutions through Microsoft Power BI.
This position requires someone with the ability to interact effectively with cross-functional teams, including senior management, manufacturing/operations, supply chain/planning, and finance. The candidate must be able to suggest process improvements and strengthen communication channels with other departments.

Business Data/Business Intelligence Analyst Responsibilities:
Help the organization in an ongoing effort to transit from driving performance visibility to performance optimization
Lead efforts to standardize definitions, provide governance oversight, and to ensure quality and data integrity of the reports/dashboards
Business Intelligence subject matter expert, with the ability to present complex analytical findings in clear, concise, and easy-to-use dashboards for executive leadership across all functions
Ability to analyze existing tools, systems, databases, and software and provide solution recommendations
Ability to streamline manual data collection and reporting processes to increase data quality, eliminate redundancy/errors, and improve efficiency of communication
Manage master data, including creation, updates, user access, etc.
Provide quality assurance of all master data and its analysis/presentation
Commission and decommission datasets
Process confidential data and information
Ability to identify opportunities to build and implement new data reporting pipelines
Supporting end users with license requests, dashboard access, and training

Required Skills / Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistic
Minimum 5 years of business experience as a business data/business intelligence analyst (or similar role) developing and deploying dashboards across multiple teams and functions
Advanced Microsoft Power BI (or equivalent BI software) and supporting data query and modelling skills (SQL, Microsoft Power Query, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX), or equivalent)
Proficiency with one or more programming/scripting language (Python, R, etc.)
Expert Excel with data import, lookups, pivots, macros
Ability to mine and cleanse data from a wide variety of file formats (Excel, Text, CSV, HTML, XML)
Ability to navigate data schema and create complex table relationships/joins
Ability to leverage web/application connectors and APIs to mine data from decentralized business systems or software (such as Salesforce Objects/Reports, Google Analytics, Smartsheet, SharePoint)
Must possess strong project management and written/verbal communication skills
Proficiency with ERP systems and other manufacturing operations systems preferred

This position will provide experienced Project Analyst (PA) support to the AIRWorks (AWx) KC-130T and CMV-22 COMMS Kitting Project Lead (PL) and the AIRWorks (AWx) Program Executive Officer, Aviation (PEO (A)) Portfolio Manager (PM).

The PA is responsible for executing all project activities to include support and analysis, acquisition support planning, procurement contracting, creating and managing schedules/spend plans, resource management, plan of action/milestones, document and data management, and sustaining activities for the KC-130T and CMV-22 COMMS Kitting projects. The PA will be responsible for communicating with team members, customers, stakeholders and other technical competencies on a daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly basis to maintain project performance, cost, schedule sufficient to identify critical path delays and provide related mitigation strategies. The PA will also conduct Project Management Reviews consisting of C/S/P planning, documentation, tracking, reporting and associated metrics for the AIRWorks PM to adequately establish resource requirements and ensure project requirements are attained.

Tasks Performed:

The candidate will lead the effort in the planning and execution of project C/S/P to include the following:
Direct Project Execution Strategy (PES) and Proposal execution
Review Statements of Work (SOW), Performance Specifications, Request for Proposals and Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL)
Review and track contract deliverables and milestones; track and report performance to plan
Detailed file and data retrieval organizational skills that support team members need for access to large amounts of data
Provide project control in various areas including but not limited to developing Standard Work Packages (SWP), Rough Order of Magnitude (ROM), spend plans, acquisition documentation and activities, and program technical documentation
Provide project support during project reviews, Systems Engineering Technical Review (SETR), Test & Evaluation (T&E) and/or Logistics events, to include coordination, reporting status (C/S/P), and project closeout
Administer supply chain management activities, master equipment listing management activities, deliverable acceptance and rejection activities
Work with systems engineering in support of system definition, development, integration, verification methods, modeling and simulation, test and evaluation, supportability efforts, interoperability requirements across a wide range of aircraft hardware and software systems
Support the class desk activities for EDRAP inputs and routing
Draft and maintain systems requirements, schedules, resources, and technical / project performance activities
Ensure vendor provided GFE is compliant with government specifications and TAE requirements
Plan, analyze and evaluate engineering, technical and product support efforts used to
a) define total systems/subsystem requirements

b) translate requirements into design criteria

c) evaluate alternative approaches

d) develop system specifications for the systems and subsystems
Work with Government and Industry engineering, product support, manufacturing and program manager personnel, including technical experts from various DoD entities
Develop procurement packages (purchase cards, simplified acquisitions, large SBIR) and track to award, working with contract specialists

About OANDA:

We have come a long way since our first currency feed 23 years ago, we are an award-winning global company offering leading currency solutions for both retail and corporate clients, from a tech start-up to a global corporation. Founded in 1996, we became the first company to share exchange rate information on the internet free of charge and in 2001, we launched a trading platform that helped pioneer the development of online-based trading around the world, enabling forex and CFD investors the ability to trade the financial markets. Our vision is to transform how our clients can meet all of their currency needs with innovative and award-winning solutions. Under new ownership with significant ambitions to grow the business on the global stage, we are looking for highly motivated, passionate and analytical individuals who want to make a mark in a dynamic environment.

Our Team:
Is a cross-functional BI/Analytics team made up of data scientists, data and software architects, software engineers and business reporting analysts spanning the globe
Has ownership over data company-wide, from analytics to global business reporting, compliance reporting and other data inquiries
Manages the entire data lifecycle from extraction to visualization
Works in the Google Cloud Platform, SQL, Python, Java, C++ and are always prototyping new technologies
Role Summary:

Reporting to the Director of BI and FP&A Manager, the Senior BI Analyst, will be responsible for ensuring OANDA continues to make sound financial decisions. Your excellent ability to work with large datasets and turning data into actionable insights will provide tremendous value in supporting our senior leaders make key strategic company decisions.

As someone with strong communication and analytical skills, you will also become a trusted business advisor to various internal stakeholders (e.g., Marketing, HR, Sales, Product) by providing thoughtful analysis, reporting and data to support them in making decisions on broad scope of activities that ultimately impacts the bottom line.

You are an analyst who seeks to challenge the status quo and find creative ways to take on big picture challenges. You will apply your analytical rigor and strategic thinking when it comes to dealing with complex issues and concepts to help navigate the organization forward in a fast-paced industry. As part of both the BI and FP&A team, you will contribute to our growing company by taking on responsibilities that consist of planning, forecasting, management reporting and analytics.

Specific responsibilities (but are not limited to) the following:
Build reports and visualizations (i.e reports, graphics, dashboards that illustrates trends and insights) to effectively communicate data driven insights to users
Assist in the development of new systems, models, and processes to support the planning, reporting and forecasting activities of the businesses
Develop tools and delivery training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve dashboards and analytics by non-analytical end users
Work closely with BI/Analytics team to develop new tools in order to drive scalable analysis and insight
Document and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes
Partner with key stakeholders to drive strategy and business direction
Extract large amount of data and synthesize for easy understanding by management
Support analysis of competition from a financial and product/service perspective
Develop solutions and make recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs
Responsible for the preparation of the monthly and quarterly management reporting to internal and external stakeholders
Provide analytical support for board meetings and review meetings
Take initiatives in improving the quality and efficiency of internal reports, including enhancing financial models, dashboards and streamlining analysis and processes
Run ad hoc analysis as requested by business partners and senior leadership
Preferred qualifications:
BA/BS degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting, Economics or similar discipline with analytical bias
Proven track record with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in a related role with solid understanding of financial statements
SaaS and/or financial services industry experience preferred
Extensive knowledge of spreadsheet software (Microsoft Excel), and proficiency in SQL with experience in querying, maintaining and analyzing large datasets
Experience working with data visualization tools (Domo, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, SSRS) and building dashboards
Excellent analytical and business modeling skills and some project management experience
Strong ability to turn data into actionable insights
Excellent quantitative, written and presentation skills
Results orientated with ability to manage multiple priorities
Willingness to learn new systems and processes
OANDA Global Corporation is a diverse and global team with offices around the world. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to OANDA. We are committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone.

Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Minimum Requirements
An active TS/SCI (CI POLY a plus)
At least eight (8) years of knowledge/experience in IT, business, or economics. A Master's degree in IT, business administration, or related field are required.
Expertise in advanced functionality in Excel, or other analytic platforms are critical.
PMP not required but a plus Specific position responsibilities
Adapt functional business requirements and processes to technical solutions based on comprehensive enterprise application solution sets.Enterprise resource planning and management processes, including but not limited to: knowledge management, investment analysis, data warehousing, return on investment analysis, human resource analysis, material management and logistics, decision support, and information dissemination.
Work closely with the customer on plans and policy for future information technology development.
Facilitate and guide working groups, meetings, strategy sessions, and other efforts to create knowledge, practices, processes and organizational designs.
Evaluate databases and apply best practices of knowledge management principles.
Identify and gather data, analyze results, interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, and communicate results through ongoing reports.
Use business analytic techniques to collect, process, and analyze various data sets.
Develop knowledge and insights from large and/or unstructured data sets.
Create and maintain rich visualization through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources on a regular and/or ad-hoc basis. Perform detailed analysis to validate quality of data/metrics to resolve technical data problems. Identify causes of data error or omission make recommendations and implement resolution when approved by the government. Identify opportunities and respond to the customer's needs for business analytics of requirements database providing weekly and monthly reports to the customer that can enable decision making and analytical trends.

The Slot Performance Analyst will provide insights and report on findings via data visualizations and stories derived from various sources related to project and initiative activities for the Slot Department. By exploring market trends, competitors, players, the Performance Analyst will help to foster a data driven environment through the creation of models and analysis that drive revenue, profit and rated slot play. This individual will coordinate with internal operations, external agencies and slot vendors to collect and retrieve data required for research projects.

Under the direction of the Slot Performance Manager, the Performance Analyst is responsible for creating and curating decision based reporting utilizing slot and player related data. The Performance Analyst will execute ad-hoc and recurring reports to inform on the efficacy of slot projects and to aid in the discovery of additional revenue generating opportunities as well as quantify anticipated benefits for prioritization.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Applies knowledge of gaming machines, gaming systems, slot accounting systems, and slot performance systems to provide procedures, analysis, reports and recommendations to Slot Management.
Build business intelligence, reports and dashboards using a combination of software such as Microsoft Excel, Tableau, SAS Enterprise Guide and VizExplorer that include customer behavior or trends based on slot and player data.
Conduct market research for determining what product is leading the industry, understanding customer needs, and analyzing competitors.
Generate reports that analyze customers, product, and project activities using charts, graphs, explanatory text and developed ROI formats.
Assists in the development of capital expenditure plans for slot product and components using ROI formats.
Regularly monitors and reports on the cost of acquisition of slot product and components.
Provides in-depth analytical reporting on slot financials on a recurring basis.
Creates advanced predictive models to measure expected effects of slot changes.
Provides current gaming information after careful vendor research of gaming components and systems of potential vendors and evaluates proposals.
Presents reports in meetings with staff and management.
Sets benchmarks for departmental goals/initiatives and measures efficacy via data reporting.
Perform special studies as assigned, including preparation of written and/or verbal reports.
Oversee all department presentation materials, including but not limited to, final reports, PowerPoint presentations, and all electronic presentation deliverables.
Perform other duties as assigned to support the efficient operation of the department.
Education/Experience/Qualifications
Bachelors degree required, Masters Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Business, Finance, Mathematics, or related field preferred.
One (1) year experience in slot operations, including machine set-up, evaluation and reporting, or equivalent financial analysis experience preferred.
Experience with data visualization, reporting & dash boarding tools such as SAS visual Analytics or Tableau preferred.
Experience with scripting languages like SAS, Python or SQL preferred.
Must be able to work in fast paced, high performance environment with tight deadlines.
Requires ability to think critically and independently, while at the same time the ability to know when to ask for help; requires excellent common sense.
Ability to self-manage project based upon defined timelines and variable outcomes required.
Ability to complete projects that require long hours prepping presentation materials from not just a content, but even making them dynamic perspective.
Equivalent combination of education and progressive, relevant and direct experience may be considered in lieu of minimum educational/experience requirements indicated above.
Certificates/Licenses/Registrations
At the discretion of the San Manuel Tribal Gaming Commission you may be required to obtain and maintain a gaming license.
San Manuel Band of Mission Indians and San Manuel Casino will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

As one of the largest private employers in the Inland Empire, San Manuel deeply cares about the future, growth and well-being of its employees. Join our team today!

Our Culture:

Stoneridge Software began with an idea: How can Microsoft implementations be done better? After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. As a Microsoft Gold Partner, weve developed a proven process for project delivery and a laser focus on long-term support to empower our clients success. We know how to work hard but we also know how important it is to balance work with family and the rest of our lives. Stoneridge Software has cultivated an atmosphere of trust, community, and support that includes a flexible working environment, unlimited vacation, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and even beer on-tap. These initiatives, and many more have resulted in numerous Best Workplace awards and happy team members. We focus on allowing our team members to be authentically themselves whether thats creative, serious or nerdy. Does this sound like a team you would like to be a part of?

What we are Looking for:

Stoneridge Software is looking for a passionate steward of data to lead, develop and test ERP data migrations that will meet client business demands for meaningful up to date data sets. We are looking for adaptable candidates with both a broad set of technology skills to be able to design and oversee these complex, iterative data projects as well as a deep technology skill set to be able to troubleshoot environments, data sets and performance issues as the project progresses. It is important, critical work that truly enables our clients to implement the best solutions for their business.

The Technical/Functional Consultant is responsible for meeting with prospects and clients to understand their business data needs and to build iterative approaches to meet those needs.

A Day in the Life:
Serve as the primary client-facing technical resource to collaborate on components required to meet business objectives
Assist in development of data migration roadmap at entity-wide and business area level
Recognize and comprehend complex issues, process changes, and industry dynamics affecting the data being migrated
Include standards and guidelines for the effective and efficient delivery of enterprise data migration
Coordinate technical and functional requirements for data migration efforts and facilitate definition of project scope, goals and deliverables for development team supporting business needs
Represent subject matter expertise in business process, solution design, best practices, and technologies
Consult on technical environment requirements, setup and optimization as needed.
Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to document a clear set of requirements that can be interpreted by both business partners and data engineers
2-10 years of experience related to ERP data
Knowledge of data structures, hierarchies, business rule complexities
Proficient at integration and preparing, large, varied datasets for migration into an AX | D365 F&O Environment resulting in data that is congruent and reliable
Experienced in using iterative approaches that result in successful implementations

Collaborate with the Engineering team to develop estimates and overall implementation solution plans

The Company

Rodan + Fields was founded in 2000 by Stanford-trained dermatologists Dr. Katie Rodan and Dr. Kathy Fields with a passion for giving people the best skin of their lives — and the confidence that comes with it. With effective products, a unique business model and a powerful community of Independent Consultants, Rodan + Fields has disrupted the skincare category to become a leading skincare brand in North America. The company has grown its innovative line of products and expanded into Canada, Australia and Japan. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, R+F now employs 500+ people, has more than 300,000 enrolled Independent Consultants and over two million Preferred Customers.

At Rodan + Fields, you will be challenged to make an impact, inspired to do more, and rewarded for your contributions. We are transforming skincare, and we welcome your big ideas to fuel our ambitious growth plans! If you are looking for a life-changing career opportunity, we've got your prescription. You’ll become part of a positive, passionate movement that celebrates greatness and encourages employees to be catalysts for change. We provide a creative, vibrant workplace outfitted with all of the technology, tools and training you'll need to learn, grow and thrive! We create life-changing impact in our communities through our non-profit, Prescription for Change®, the heart of Rodan + Fields. By funding empowerment programs for students, we teach them how to use their skills to make life-changing differences in their lives and the lives of others. Join us and share your talents as we develop innovative solutions for your skin and empower entrepreneurs. In addition to working arm-in-arm with industry leaders, employees at Rodan + Fields enjoy rich benefits plans and perks.

Rodan + Fields is an equal opportunity employer that champions diversity, inclusion and equality for all. We welcome employees to be their true, authentic selves, without exception and believe individual differences add value to our team. Join our team; we know it will be a life- changing experience!

Regarding COVID-19

Our primary concern is for the health and well-being of our employees as well as candidates. We have transitioned all interviews and new hire onboarding to be conducted virtually via Zoom video conferencing.

POSITION SUMMARY:

Responsible for effectively leading efforts to implement and support information technology solutions for business critical processes. The Business Systems Analyst acts as a liaison for the Information Technology team with both internal and external business partners. The position will work within the business to define business requirements, facilitate discussion and agreement on process design amongst stakeholders, develop business processes, validate business processes against the system(s) and conduct feasibility assessments of process and technologies within the Microsoft D365 implementation project.

The Business Systems Analyst will be the“subject matter expert” both from a business perspective and a system / process functionality perspective for all D365 Finance Modules. * Experience with Dynamics 365 or AX 2012 R3 are required.

This role will also be required to take some trips Internationally.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Oversee the development of specifications related to changes in the business functions or new functionality.
Review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solutions.
Participate in the definition, implementation and distribution of operating procedures.
Hold design review sessions with cross-functional team members to review requirements.
Coordinate and execute user acceptance testing sessions.
Provide in-depth knowledge of the Microsoft Dynamics application and evaluate financial processes against the standard Microsoft Dynamics functionality.
Conduct acceptance testing and training to Accounting and Finance Teams to successfully use and maintain the Microsoft Dynamics application.
Gather important data necessary for troubleshooting.
Obtain sign off of functional specification(s) from all cross functional project team members.
Develop functional specifications and system design specifications for project engagements.
Interact with the Business community and IT resources to identify required changes.
Perform systems analyst activities and make recommendations in areas that require a high level of technical competency.
Review all user documentation and monitor testing.
Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on, escalated and resolved in a timely manner.
Assist in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.
Manage resources in accordance with project schedules.
Consistently deliver high-quality services.
QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform the job successfully, an individual should have the following credentials:
Bachelor’s Degree in related area
5+ years experience supporting IT projects and applications, preferably Finance applications
3+ years experience working with Dynamics D365 in a Technical Business Analyst role
Significant experience drafting, developing and implementing core business processes
Ability to draft operations reports to satisfy the data and analytical needs across all Finance functions
Familiar with principles of application programming, database and system design
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to coordinate and work effectively with business stakeholders and other specialists
Ability to demonstrate strong leadership and to manage and resolve conflict
Strong organizational skills, written and verbal skills, ability to understand and explain issues to colleagues and users from both a technical and a business functional point of view
Must have strong problem solving skills and be capable of breaking down complex problems to identify and resolve root causes; this applies to both technical issues and process issues
Facilitates effective team interaction
Experience with implementing and/or supporting Microsoft D365
Experience with Microsoft D365 Finance modules
Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio
Ability to work at a detailed level while maintaining an overall project perspective
Ability to travel Internationally

At AZ we push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines. If you want to be part of a creative organization, with the ambition and capability to make a significant difference to patients lives then you should come and talk to us!

You'll work in Science and Enabling Units IT, in our Legal and Global Compliance team. Its an exciting time to join us, as we set out on our journey to provide the Best IT for the BioPharma Industry. Our goal is to position IT as a strategic-enabler and we do this by focusing on close business partnership, defining and executing business-aligned strategies, and finding and developing the best IT talent in the industry. You will be leading/contributing to business analysis on strategic projects that help our Legal and Global Sustainability teams protect our employees, our Intellectual Property, and the environment. You will collaborate directly with the AZ Business stakeholders who are working in those functions, our business relationship managers and the technology teams crafting and delivering our enabling technology.

We have an ITBusiness Analyst role based in Gaithersburg, MD (East Coast US), that will support our Legal and Global Sustainability capability across our offices in the US, UK and Sweden.

The incumbent should deliver tangible and measurable value to the Legal and Global Sustainability business domain areas supporting; Global Intellectual Property, Litigation, Corporate Legal, Legal Operations, Global Compliance and Investigations, Global Safety, Health and Environment, Global Sustainability and others by taking a leading role in SEUIT delivery of solutions by Programs/Projects and/or Services.

The ITBusiness Analyst is expected to perform at some Intermediate Experienced Level the following:
Business Needs Identification - Operates at a functional level in assessing and defining business need and areas for improvement. Proactively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals. Actively monitors and identifies capability gaps and proposes potential solutions through research internally and externally.
Business Analysis Planning - Selects the appropriate analysis approach to a piece of work depending on its complexity, level of risk, known assumptions, constraints and dependencies. Proficient in scoping and recommending appropriate approaches. Capable of planning and managing their own and other team members activities to meet deliverables and deadlines. Accountable for performance and quality of analytical work delivered, both their own and the work of others.
Stakeholder Analysis & Change - Effectively identifies stakeholders from all areas of the business, and actively builds and maintains relationships according to individual stakeholder needs and levels of influence. Contributes to communication plans and change management for project and stakeholders.
Requirements Analysis and Design Definition - Responsible and accountable for requirements management plans including elicitation, approvals, processes, RAID and scope impacts. Highly responsive to changing business priorities with ability to plan ahead, accounting for potential changes and corrective actions. Advanced requirements elicitation and management skill-set; including traceability, testing and validation. Leads the work with the business to identify functional and technical requirements, translating the requirements into design specifications reflecting Functional Design, User Interface Design and Business Process Design. Closely partnering with the Architecture team, ensuring the technical solution will deliver the agreed business benefits.
Business Case Definition - Shapes and defines the business case, producing detailed business justification for investment including ROI and benefits realization.
Solution Evaluation - Highly proficient in analyzing and assessing solution proposals and able to articulate supporting reasoning. i.e. assessing business readiness, maximizing value vs. spend.
Work collaboratively with:
Business Relationship Managers to develop and maintain the business relationship, support business process changes and act as point of contact for application development
Various levels of Business Stakeholders to ensure that solutions fulfil their future strategic needs and challenges
Business customers to identify business requirements and effectively communicate impact, cost and benefits of new and changed demands
Process owners to identify and devise solutions that optimize business process performance, capability and competitiveness
IT Architecture, Delivery and Support to ensure clear understanding of requirements and effective testing so that the solutions delivered to the business are efficient and effective, meeting the customer experience expectations.
Work collaboratively with or take some responsibility for:
Test Lead to define the testing approach and the components of testing to ensure traceability of requirements and effectiveness of overall solution.
Change Management/Communication Lead to ensure the Change Management and Communications plans and delivery support the Stakeholder Analysis.
This position can be either considered for internal Grade D or Grade E.

Formal certification in business analysis practice preferred
8+ years of professional experience as a Business Analyst preferred
Proven experience of successfully deploying business analysis tools/techniques to enable business change
Proven experience of working with complex integrated systems, using creative and strategic thinking to deliver exceptional results
Strong engagement, communication and stakeholder management skills, including excellent presentation and influencing skills
Experience of virtual collaboration to lead, shape and develop innovative solutions
Experience of working with and managing third party suppliers/vendors
Bachelors Degree required
Desirable Qualifications, Skills and Experience:
Established knowledge of or some experience of the Legal and/or Global Compliance / Sustainability domain
Practical usage of Agile Methodology
Experience of working in a global organization with complex/geographical context
Exposure to User Centered Design and Design thinking (User Experience, Prototyping, User Interface Design and Business Process Design)

Overview

Klein Tools has a 160-year history of serving the hand tool needs of professional tradesmen with products that represent a standard of excellence, innovation, technology and quality in our industry. We are looking for candidates who want a career working with The Premier Brand of Hand Tools.


We are currently looking for an Senior Sales and Oeprations Specialist to be located in our Mansfield, TX Facility

Responsibilities


The Senior Sales and Operations Planning Analyst is responsible for assisting the Associate Director of Sales and Operations Planning in developing the short-term and long-term demand plans, supply plans and production plans for the business. This position will collaborate with various business units to assist in developing a robust planning process that drives aligned supply chain and production capability to improve customer satisfaction, profitability, inventory turns and working capital.

1. Support the development of advanced analytics and reporting for Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP).

2. Participate in forecast development and review processes.

3. Maintain demand, supply and capacity models and reporting.

4. Assist in reconciling demand variances and refining forecast to improve accuracy.

5. Support supply and capacity planning to balance demand projections and manufacturing capabilities.

6. Conduct capacity and scenario planning to validate analytics and assist decision making.

7. Identify and develop key reports and data required to support S&OP processes.

8. Track and report identified key productivity indicators (KPI’s) and metrics.

9. Develop ideas and initiate actions across the business’ supply chain operations to improve efficiencies, cost, waste reduction and other lean principles.

10. Develop SKUs management reporting to determine sales and product performance.

11. Collaborate with Business Management, Sales, Engineering, Supply Chain, Operations and Finance to ensure that the appropriate information is available and accurate to be reviewed through the S&OP process meetings and establish the S&OP plan-of-record.

12. Lead S&OP management reviews, prepare all data and metrics for review, identify gaps and scenarios that must be presented, and prepare escalations for executive review where appropriate.

13. Create the S&OP minutes, communicate key conclusion to stakeholders and perform follow up of the actions.

14. Perform all other duties as assigned.

Qualifications


Bachelors degree in Business, Statistics, Supply Chain or related field and five (5) years of relevant work experience in Operations and Supply Chain. Intermediate understanding of Supply Chain principles including Demand Management, DRP Planning, Master Production Planning is required. Advanced knowledge of data analysis and business modeling preferred. APICS Certification or related Supply Chain certifications highly desired.

Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.). Ability to facilitate and drive results in a demanding environment. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills.

Occasionally required to stand, walk or sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Job Title: Cybersecurity Technology Management Analyst
Location: Mclean VA 22102
Duration: Permanent

Clearance Required: Active Secret
Certification Required: IAM Level III

Roles & Responsibilities:
Responsible designing, developing, and testing all applications ensuring compliance with the applicable Information Assurance(IA) requirements and references.
Responsible for applying industry bets practices i.e. NIST RMF to ensure strong security controls are applied for highest security across the IT environment (Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability).
Responsible for providing updates to the Risk Management Framework (RMF) documents for incorporating IA-related data for the used applications. Conduct timely application security testing and apply the appropriate risk mitigation measures, followed with performing patch installation and apply STIGs.
Overlook the entire RTC system to protect and prevent unauthorized access to Government sensitive data and IT resources by designing, and developing appropriate IA controls.
Responsible for maintaining all the security artifacts and documents in mass in coordination with Information Systems Security Manager(ISSM) and DLA Cybersecurity team.
Ensure ISSE is employed using the IATF processes for software engineering and IEEE standard and other required standards.
Responsible for creating and maintaining security artifacts such as System Security Plan (SSP), Security Assessment Plan/Report (SAP/SAR), Plans of Actions and Milestones (POA&M), COOP, Contingency Plan, etc. in coordination with ISSM.
Apply automated tools to identify and remediate vulnerabilities or weaknesses in the application design/coding that could be exploited by unauthorized sources by working with other DOD agency and Vendors as required to implement these IA controls.
Responsible for vulnerability management, system Certification and Accreditation (C&A) and completion of ATOs.
Responsible for performing all IA activities ensuring strong security posture and submission of deliverables (e.g. RMD Documents, artifacts updates, IA scan results, etc.) to PM.
Required Experience:
National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) C&A experience
Five (5) years of relevant experience
Relevant certification meeting DOD 8570.01 IAM level III.

Education: Bachelor degree with emphasis in business administration and/or computer science desired or equivalent technology related experience.

Job Description:


Leidos is a Fortune 500 company aimed at embracing and solving some of the worlds most pressing challenges. Through science and technology, Leidos makes the world safer, healthier and more efficient.

Our Civil Group offers an array of exciting career opportunities for the best IT, energy, logistics and engineering professionals.

Driven by our talented workforce, the Federal Energy, Environment and Commerce Operation builds trust through an array of energy-related IT, environmental science and engineering solutions to meet our customers needs.

Key Capabilities:
Large Infrastructure
Mission Support
Digital Modernization
Command & Control
Mission Applications
Environmental Science
Nuclear Security
Engineering Services
Primary Responsibilities
Perform deep dive reviews and document existing (current state) stockpile management requirements and directives identifying sources, usage, gaps, and redundancies.
Coordinate with NNSA and M&O SMEs to analyze current stockpile management processes
Develop functional decompositions and network diagrams for current requirements and directives
Document current-state stockpile management processes
Support development of a current-state interactive model to visualize and communicate requirements and directives
Analyze and evaluate (on a quantitative or qualitative basis) the effectiveness of current stockpile management processes
Develop and implement pilot efforts and use cases as needed
Develop a consolidated stockpile management demand signal and coordinates with M&Os on an implementation strategy
Coordinate with related initiatives to ensure the stockpile requirements are consistently used across Defense Programs
Develop, publish, and implement a stockpile management requirements management plan
Develop requirements engineering process and business process rules that can be applied to stockpile management
In coordination with key stakeholders, develop a future-state implementation plan for improved business processes and systems integration for stockpile management
Research and investigate new or improved business process and systems engineering practices for application to stockpile management processes.
Perform a variety of complex, programmatic and technical support services involving data analysis, process analysis, program plan and policy development, and strategy development.

The PA will be responsible for communicating with team members, customers, stakeholders and other technical competencies on a daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly basis to maintain project performance, cost, schedule sufficient to identify critical path delays and provide related mitigation strategies. Direct Project Execution Strategy (PES) and Proposal execution

Review and track contract deliverables and milestones; track and report performance to plan
Detailed file and data retrieval organizational skills that support team members need for access to large amounts of data

Provide project support during project reviews, Systems Engineering Technical Review (SETR), Test & Evaluation (T&E) and/or Logistics events, to include coordination, reporting status (C/S/P), and project closeout
Administer supply chain management activities, master equipment listing management activities, deliverable acceptance and rejection activities
Work with systems engineering in support of system definition, development, integration, verification methods, modeling and simulation, test and evaluation, supportability efforts, interoperability requirements across a wide range of aircraft hardware and software systems
Support the class desk activities for EDRAP inputs and routing
Draft and maintain systems requirements, schedules, resources, and technical / project performance activities
Ensure vendor provided GFE is compliant with government specifications and TAE requirements
Plan, analyze and evaluate engineering, technical and product support efforts used to
a) define total systems/subsystem requirements

b) translate requirements into design criteria

c) evaluate alternative approaches

d) develop system specifications for the systems and subsystems
Work with Government and Industry engineering, product support, manufacturing and program manager personnel, including technical experts from various DoD entities
Develop procurement packages (purchase cards, simplified acquisitions, large SBIR) and track to award, working with contract specialists
Develop documents (Statement of Work, CDRLs, etc.) for Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR)
Provide support for SETR events (SRR, PDR, CDR)
Work closely with AS9100 managers and PM to maintain document integrity and to confirm the SharePoint site is audit ready

About OANDA:

We have come a long way since our first currency feed 23 years ago, we are an award-winning global company offering leading currency solutions for both retail and corporate clients, from a tech start-up to a global corporation. Founded in 1996, we became the first company to share exchange rate information on the internet free of charge and in 2001, we launched a trading platform that helped pioneer the development of online-based trading around the world, enabling forex and CFD investors the ability to trade the financial markets. Our vision is to transform how our clients can meet all of their currency needs with innovative and award-winning solutions. Under new ownership with significant ambitions to grow the business on the global stage, we are looking for highly motivated, passionate and analytical individuals who want to make a mark in a dynamic environment.

Our Team:
Is a cross-functional BI/Analytics team made up of data scientists, data and software architects, software engineers and business reporting analysts spanning the globe
Has ownership over data company-wide, from analytics to global business reporting, compliance reporting and other data inquiries
Manages the entire data lifecycle from extraction to visualization
Works in the Google Cloud Platform, SQL, Python, Java, C++ and are always prototyping new technologies
Role Summary:

Reporting to the Director of BI and FP&A Manager, the Senior BI Analyst, will be responsible for ensuring OANDA continues to make sound financial decisions. Your excellent ability to work with large datasets and turning data into actionable insights will provide tremendous value in supporting our senior leaders make key strategic company decisions.

As someone with strong communication and analytical skills, you will also become a trusted business advisor to various internal stakeholders (e.g., Marketing, HR, Sales, Product) by providing thoughtful analysis, reporting and data to support them in making decisions on broad scope of activities that ultimately impacts the bottom line.

You are an analyst who seeks to challenge the status quo and find creative ways to take on big picture challenges. You will apply your analytical rigor and strategic thinking when it comes to dealing with complex issues and concepts to help navigate the organization forward in a fast-paced industry. As part of both the BI and FP&A team, you will contribute to our growing company by taking on responsibilities that consist of planning, forecasting, management reporting and analytics.

Specific responsibilities (but are not limited to) the following:
Build reports and visualizations (i.e reports, graphics, dashboards that illustrates trends and insights) to effectively communicate data driven insights to users
Assist in the development of new systems, models, and processes to support the planning, reporting and forecasting activities of the businesses
Develop tools and delivery training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve dashboards and analytics by non-analytical end users
Work closely with BI/Analytics team to develop new tools in order to drive scalable analysis and insight
Document and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes
Partner with key stakeholders to drive strategy and business direction
Extract large amount of data and synthesize for easy understanding by management
Support analysis of competition from a financial and product/service perspective
Develop solutions and make recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs
Responsible for the preparation of the monthly and quarterly management reporting to internal and external stakeholders
Provide analytical support for board meetings and review meetings
Take initiatives in improving the quality and efficiency of internal reports, including enhancing financial models, dashboards and streamlining analysis and processes
Run ad hoc analysis as requested by business partners and senior leadership
Preferred qualifications:
BA/BS degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting, Economics or similar discipline with analytical bias
Proven track record with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in a related role with solid understanding of financial statements
SaaS and/or financial services industry experience preferred
Extensive knowledge of spreadsheet software (Microsoft Excel), and proficiency in SQL with experience in querying, maintaining and analyzing large datasets
Experience working with data visualization tools (Domo, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, SSRS) and building dashboards
Excellent analytical and business modeling skills and some project management experience
Strong ability to turn data into actionable insights
Excellent quantitative, written and presentation skills
Results orientated with ability to manage multiple priorities
Willingness to learn new systems and processes
OANDA Global Corporation is a diverse and global team with offices around the world. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to OANDA. We are committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone.

Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Minimum Requirements
An active TS/SCI (CI POLY a plus)
At least eight (8) years of knowledge/experience in IT, business, or economics. A Master's degree in IT, business administration, or related field are required.
Expertise in advanced functionality in Excel, or other analytic platforms are critical.
PMP not required but a plus Specific position responsibilities
Adapt functional business requirements and processes to technical solutions based on comprehensive enterprise application solution sets.Enterprise resource planning and management processes, including but not limited to: knowledge management, investment analysis, data warehousing, return on investment analysis, human resource analysis, material management and logistics, decision support, and information dissemination.
Work closely with the customer on plans and policy for future information technology development.
Facilitate and guide working groups, meetings, strategy sessions, and other efforts to create knowledge, practices, processes and organizational designs.
Evaluate databases and apply best practices of knowledge management principles.
Identify and gather data, analyze results, interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, and communicate results through ongoing reports.
Use business analytic techniques to collect, process, and analyze various data sets.
Develop knowledge and insights from large and/or unstructured data sets.
Create and maintain rich visualization through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources on a regular and/or ad-hoc basis. Perform detailed analysis to validate quality of data/metrics to resolve technical data problems. Identify causes of data error or omission make recommendations and implement resolution when approved by the government. The Slot Performance Analyst will provide insights and report on findings via data visualizations and stories derived from various sources related to project and initiative activities for the Slot Department. By exploring market trends, competitors, players, the Performance Analyst will help to foster a data driven environment through the creation of models and analysis that drive revenue, profit and rated slot play. This individual will coordinate with internal operations, external agencies and slot vendors to collect and retrieve data required for research projects.

Under the direction of the Slot Performance Manager, the Performance Analyst is responsible for creating and curating decision based reporting utilizing slot and player related data. The Performance Analyst will execute ad-hoc and recurring reports to inform on the efficacy of slot projects and to aid in the discovery of additional revenue generating opportunities as well as quantify anticipated benefits for prioritization.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Applies knowledge of gaming machines, gaming systems, slot accounting systems, and slot performance systems to provide procedures, analysis, reports and recommendations to Slot Management.
Build business intelligence, reports and dashboards using a combination of software such as Microsoft Excel, Tableau, SAS Enterprise Guide and VizExplorer that include customer behavior or trends based on slot and player data.
Conduct market research for determining what product is leading the industry, understanding customer needs, and analyzing competitors.
Generate reports that analyze customers, product, and project activities using charts, graphs, explanatory text and developed ROI formats.
Assists in the development of capital expenditure plans for slot product and components using ROI formats.
Regularly monitors and reports on the cost of acquisition of slot product and components.
Provides in-depth analytical reporting on slot financials on a recurring basis.
Creates advanced predictive models to measure expected effects of slot changes.
Provides current gaming information after careful vendor research of gaming components and systems of potential vendors and evaluates proposals.
Presents reports in meetings with staff and management.
Sets benchmarks for departmental goals/initiatives and measures efficacy via data reporting.
Perform special studies as assigned, including preparation of written and/or verbal reports.
Oversee all department presentation materials, including but not limited to, final reports, PowerPoint presentations, and all electronic presentation deliverables.
Perform other duties as assigned to support the efficient operation of the department.
Education/Experience/Qualifications
Bachelors degree required, Masters Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Business, Finance, Mathematics, or related field preferred.
One (1) year experience in slot operations, including machine set-up, evaluation and reporting, or equivalent financial analysis experience preferred.
Experience with data visualization, reporting & dash boarding tools such as SAS visual Analytics or Tableau preferred.
Experience with scripting languages like SAS, Python or SQL preferred.
Must be able to work in fast paced, high performance environment with tight deadlines.
Requires ability to think critically and independently, while at the same time the ability to know when to ask for help; requires excellent common sense.
Ability to self-manage project based upon defined timelines and variable outcomes required.
Ability to complete projects that require long hours prepping presentation materials from not just a content, but even making them dynamic perspective.
Equivalent combination of education and progressive, relevant and direct experience may be considered in lieu of minimum educational/experience requirements indicated above.
Certificates/Licenses/Registrations
At the discretion of the San Manuel Tribal Gaming Commission you may be required to obtain and maintain a gaming license.
San Manuel Band of Mission Indians and San Manuel Casino will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

As one of the largest private employers in the Inland Empire, San Manuel deeply cares about the future, growth and well-being of its employees. Join our team today!

Our Culture:

Stoneridge Software began with an idea: How can Microsoft implementations be done better? After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. As a Microsoft Gold Partner, weve developed a proven process for project delivery and a laser focus on long-term support to empower our clients success. We know how to work hard but we also know how important it is to balance work with family and the rest of our lives. Stoneridge Software has cultivated an atmosphere of trust, community, and support that includes a flexible working environment, unlimited vacation, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and even beer on-tap. These initiatives, and many more have resulted in numerous Best Workplace awards and happy team members. We focus on allowing our team members to be authentically themselves whether thats creative, serious or nerdy. Does this sound like a team you would like to be a part of?

What we are Looking for:

Stoneridge Software is looking for a passionate steward of data to lead, develop and test ERP data migrations that will meet client business demands for meaningful up to date data sets. We are looking for adaptable candidates with both a broad set of technology skills to be able to design and oversee these complex, iterative data projects as well as a deep technology skill set to be able to troubleshoot environments, data sets and performance issues as the project progresses. It is important, critical work that truly enables our clients to implement the best solutions for their business.

The Technical/Functional Consultant is responsible for meeting with prospects and clients to understand their business data needs and to build iterative approaches to meet those needs.

Include standards and guidelines for the effective and efficient delivery of enterprise data migration
Coordinate technical and functional requirements for data migration efforts and facilitate definition of project scope, goals and deliverables for development team supporting business needs
Represent subject matter expertise in business process, solution design, best practices, and technologies
Consult on technical environment requirements, setup and optimization as needed.

2-10 years of experience related to ERP data
Knowledge of data structures, hierarchies, business rule complexities
Proficient at integration and preparing, large, varied datasets for migration into an AX | D365 F&O Environment resulting in data that is congruent and reliable
Experienced in using iterative approaches that result in successful implementations
Possess a combination of business knowledge, strong problem solving skills, technical expertise and excellent written and communication skills.
Active listener who asks relevant questions to create relevant solution designs

The Company

Rodan + Fields was founded in 2000 by Stanford-trained dermatologists Dr. Katie Rodan and Dr. Kathy Fields with a passion for giving people the best skin of their lives — and the confidence that comes with it. With effective products, a unique business model and a powerful community of Independent Consultants, Rodan + Fields has disrupted the skincare category to become a leading skincare brand in North America. The company has grown its innovative line of products and expanded into Canada, Australia and Japan. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, R+F now employs 500+ people, has more than 300,000 enrolled Independent Consultants and over two million Preferred Customers.

At Rodan + Fields, you will be challenged to make an impact, inspired to do more, and rewarded for your contributions. We are transforming skincare, and we welcome your big ideas to fuel our ambitious growth plans! If you are looking for a life-changing career opportunity, we've got your prescription. You’ll become part of a positive, passionate movement that celebrates greatness and encourages employees to be catalysts for change. We provide a creative, vibrant workplace outfitted with all of the technology, tools and training you'll need to learn, grow and thrive! We create life-changing impact in our communities through our non-profit, Prescription for Change®, the heart of Rodan + Fields. By funding empowerment programs for students, we teach them how to use their skills to make life-changing differences in their lives and the lives of others. Join us and share your talents as we develop innovative solutions for your skin and empower entrepreneurs. In addition to working arm-in-arm with industry leaders, employees at Rodan + Fields enjoy rich benefits plans and perks.

Rodan + Fields is an equal opportunity employer that champions diversity, inclusion and equality for all. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status.

We welcome employees to be their true, authentic selves, without exception and believe individual differences add value to our team. Join our team; we know it will be a life- changing experience!

Our primary concern is for the health and well-being of our employees as well as candidates. We have transitioned all interviews and new hire onboarding to be conducted virtually via Zoom video conferencing.

Northrop Grumman Technology Services is seeking an Associate Program Cost Control Analyst to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position is located in Lake Charles, LA.

Work Responsibilities:
Set up cost control system, monitor, and control costs and schedules on contracts requiring validated cost schedule control system.
Perform analysis and prepare reports to ensure contracts are within negotiated and agreed-upon parameters and meet government cost control guidelines.
Prepare budgets and schedules for contract work and perform and/or assist with financial analysis (e.g., funding profiles and variance analysis).
Run weekly reports of actual cost incurred and prepare reports to compare the variance between budgeted work and actual cost incurred.
Work with control account managers, business managers, and program managers to maintain accurate records of expenditures.
Maintain earned value compliance including cost/schedule integration.
Create financial charts in support of program management and program reviews.

Pattern Energy Group is an independent, fully integrated energy company that develops, constructs, owns and operates renewable energy projects and transmission assets across North America, Japan, and parts of Latin America. The company focuses primarily on wind, solar and transmission. The Pattern Energy Group team has a history as one of the top North American renewable energy and transmission providers in the industry. The team is dedicated to delivering the highest value for its customers, partners, financial supporters and the communities in which it works, while exhibiting a strong commitment to promoting environmental stewardship and corporate responsibility.
Pattern Energy Group operates in the United States, Canada, Japan, Netherlands and Mexico with offices in San Francisco, Houston, San Diego, New York, Amsterdam, Tokyo, and Toronto. Pattern Energy Group’s corporate headquarters is in San Francisco.

JOB PURPOSE
Provide a comprehensive overview of Pattern’s fleet of operating assets using key performance indicators to the Operations Management team and the Asset Management department. Additionally, provide key project management oversight for budgeting and forecasting of our operating business. Additionally, provide key oversight of our revenue performance, including the market performance of our energy management business
Key Accountabilities
Performance Management
Support the group in the design, preparation and analysis of fleet performance for Operations team performance reviews, Executive Management reviews and other reporting activities.
Understand key drivers of performance variance and support the group in identifying and implementing performance improvement strategies.
Identify for Management key budget and forecast drivers and variances period-over-period; prepare materials as required to report on revenue performance.
Perform analysis as required to support Asset Management in performing revenue analysis and optimization.
Provide support to the organization in energy market risk management responsibilities including maintaining the market risk exposure model, reporting market risk metrics and understanding risk drivers, and supporting key compliance activities.
Project Manage the annual budget process for revenue including assisting in budget planning and logistics, incorporating inputs from SMEs (e.g. production, energy loss, market price, etc), and facilitating budget reviews.
Be primary responsible party for entering revenue budgets and forecasts into relevant corporate data systems.
Execute the reforecasting process for revenue including planning and logistics, incorporating inputs from SMEs, and facilitating reviews.

Experience/Qualifications/Education Required
Required Work Experience
Relevant project management skills and experience
Advanced computer proficiency including Microsoft product suite
Proficient in the use of Power BI and design and maintenance or reports
Experience in the financial analysis or management of energy assets
Intermediate to Advanced analytical, statistical, and financial modelling skills
Educational Requirements
A bachelor’s degree in business, finance, engineering or a related field is recommended
Additional Requirements
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Strong motivation and ability to be self-directed and work with little supervision or guidance
Strong learning skills and the ability to independently research, understand, and implement knowledge in new areas
Ability to work seamlessly across a wide range of disciplines both within and outside the group and the company to achieve project objectives
Ability to understand technical operational matters and translate them to commercial and financial analyses used for decision making
Understanding of power market operations inside and outside of organized markets
PATTERN ENERGY GROUP IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

Job Description:

Distributed Solutions, Inc. “We are innovators who make purpose-built gear for life's most demanding missions.”

Our ethos defines our culture– Trusted, Responsive, Accountable and Committed.

5.11 Tactical has established itself as the fastest-growing and most well-known brand of tactical apparel, gear and functional products in the world. Through a commitment to operator-led product innovation, quality and compelling value, 5.11 has developed a loyal following among some of the most demanding and discerning end-users of apparel and gear.

At our Operations Center in Manteca and Development Center in Irvine, we leverage our deep relationships with Law Enforcement, Special Forces Operators and First Responders to gain unique insights. The results are products that break new ground combining ruggedness, speed, range of motion and ultimate comfort in professional duty, tactical training, adventure, women’s tactical, fitness and industrial professionals.

POSITION SUMMARY:

Responsible for effectively leading efforts to implement and support information technology solutions for business critical processes. The Business Systems Analyst acts as a liaison for the Information Technology team with both internal and external business partners. The position will work within the business to define business requirements, facilitate discussion and agreement on process design amongst stakeholders, develop business processes, validate business processes against the system(s) and conduct feasibility assessments of process and technologies within the Microsoft D365 implementation project.

The Business Systems Analyst will be the“subject matter expert” both from a business perspective and a system / process functionality perspective for all D365 Finance Modules. * Experience with Dynamics 365 or AX 2012 R3 are required.

This role will also be required to take some trips Internationally.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Oversee the development of specifications related to changes in the business functions or new functionality.
Review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solutions.
Participate in the definition, implementation and distribution of operating procedures.
Hold design review sessions with cross-functional team members to review requirements.
Coordinate and execute user acceptance testing sessions.
Provide in-depth knowledge of the Microsoft Dynamics application and evaluate financial processes against the standard Microsoft Dynamics functionality.
Conduct acceptance testing and training to Accounting and Finance Teams to successfully use and maintain the Microsoft Dynamics application.
Gather important data necessary for troubleshooting.
Obtain sign off of functional specification(s) from all cross functional project team members.
Develop functional specifications and system design specifications for project engagements.
Interact with the Business community and IT resources to identify required changes.
Perform systems analyst activities and make recommendations in areas that require a high level of technical competency.
Review all user documentation and monitor testing.
Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on, escalated and resolved in a timely manner.
Assist in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.
Manage resources in accordance with project schedules.
Consistently deliver high-quality services.
QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform the job successfully, an individual should have the following credentials:
Bachelor’s Degree in related area
5+ years experience supporting IT projects and applications, preferably Finance applications
3+ years experience working with Dynamics D365 in a Technical Business Analyst role
Significant experience drafting, developing and implementing core business processes
Ability to draft operations reports to satisfy the data and analytical needs across all Finance functions
Familiar with principles of application programming, database and system design
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to coordinate and work effectively with business stakeholders and other specialists
Ability to demonstrate strong leadership and to manage and resolve conflict
Strong organizational skills, written and verbal skills, ability to understand and explain issues to colleagues and users from both a technical and a business functional point of view
Must have strong problem solving skills and be capable of breaking down complex problems to identify and resolve root causes; this applies to both technical issues and process issues
Facilitates effective team interaction
Experience with implementing and/or supporting Microsoft D365
Experience with Microsoft D365 Finance modules
Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio
Ability to work at a detailed level while maintaining an overall project perspective
Ability to travel Internationally
ETHOS:

At 5.11 Tactical, everyone has the opportunity to be a leader and perform in an exceptional manner. We strive to uphold ourEthos which defines our culture–Trusted,Responsive,Accountable andCommitted.
Trusted
Strive to create trust in everything we do, starting with self-trust and relationship trust. We work on the components of integrity, intent, capability and results.
Responsive
Listen to the needs of our end-user Professionals, then develop, produce and deliver solutions to their problems. Each of us chooses to be a leader and takes charge of what is within our circle of influence.
Accountable
Seek to achieve results with a bias for action. We like to compete and be measured against the most demanding standards to ensure our continued success.
Committed
Overcome obstacles to accomplish our goals and support our team members when challenges arise. We complete commitments and seek to‘over-deliver” relative to expectations.
5.11’s practice is to hire at 18 years of age and older only
